college_info.college_name: AIT Pune: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Army Institute of Technology, also known as AIT Pune, is located in Pune, Maharashtra. Established in 1994, it is a private institute approved by AICTE. AIT Pune provides 5 UG and PG courses in 4 specialisations, namely Computer Science Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Information Technology and Mechanical Engineering. Theses programmes are offered in both Full Time mode. B.E. / B.Tech and M.E./M.Tech are some of the courses offered at AIT Pune. Some of the stream in which these courses are offered include Engineering. The total fee at AIT Pune ranges between INR 2,52,890 and 6,76,000. AIT Pune has a student intake of 384 for all the courses. The average median package at AIT Pune is INR 9,92,000. AIT Pune offers all the infrastructural facilities to students.

AIT Pune Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall good facilities, opportunities and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost all the students got placed in the course I have taken. The highest package is like 52 LPA or 56 LPA from Google and Microsoft, and Amazon hired 6 students last year with a 46 LPA package. Other than this, Barclays, Deutsche Bank, Flipkart, cred, and ZS associate also hire. Many students got internships in the 2nd and 3rd year, but I don't know the percentage.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have good facilities of Wi-Fi, classrooms, and a library. The library is open till midnight 12:00 AM. Classrooms are renovated. Food served is of a variety, and hygienic food is served. We have an MI room on the campus. All kinds of sports and games available, including lawn tennis, boxing, squash, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers teach very well, as the batch size is small, so they give attention to most of the students. But some teachers don't teach that well, they just show PPTs. In the CSE branch, we have subjects like Chemistry and Mechanical, which are not relevant to me. Almost all students pass the exams, exam difficulties are average.
detailed_review.Other: I think new subjects like web development and AI should be taught from the 1st semester instead of Chemistry, etc. There are a lot of rules, regulations, and restrictions in college, most students don't like them, but these rules make students very disciplined in their careers. A lot of competition is always going on with cash prizes and all.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Worth it in this percentile.

detailed_review.Placements: About 90% of our seniors are placed in this year's top recruiting companies for our course, including Deutsche Bank, Citibank, Mastercard, Barclays, and many more. They are maximum for SDE and many for SWE, and also data analytics, and all those good 70% of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department is full of Wi-Fi, all the classes are smart classes with a smart board, labs are fully air-conditioned, and computers are individual. Classrooms are modern with high-quality fans, tubelights, and comfortable chairs. The mess is so clean, and there are a total of 13 sports.
detailed_review.Faculty:
They are very helpful, educated, and knowledgeable. They teach from the basics. They help us to be industry-ready, and they hold workshops in need. Exams are moderate. The pass percentage varies every year, on average, it is about 90%.
.
detailed_review.Other: I have a keen interest in coding, computers, and the software part of the computer, so I have selected this as my career.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Amazing infrastructure and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are kind of good, with 90% of students placed every year. Their median package is around 9 to 11 LPA. The highest package offered is 52 LPA, and the lowest is 4 LPA. Top companies appearing are Microsoft, Barclays, ZS, etc. The main roles given to students are SDE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is okay. The mess is way better than all the colleges in Pune combined. Labs and classrooms are well-equipped, and hostel rooms are well maintained. However, the internet is a problem. Medical facilities are too good, with a direct connection to MH available. There is a gymnasium for students' fitness and several sports arenas.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many of the teachers are experienced and qualified. However, some of them are not as helpful as a student requires. The course curriculum is relevant. However, the college is non-autonomous as far as our batch is concerned. The semester exams are easy to moderate, depending on preparation.
detailed_review.Other: Variety of events throughout the year and good connectivity.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Great campus and placements. Average teachers. 90-95% placed. Amazing infrastructure, fests, clubs.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement scenario is above average at our college as there is over 95% people placed in CSE and IT departments. The average package is around 14 LPA. Placement of other departments is also good like ENTC and mechanical department. Major companies are ZS, Deloitte, Mastercard, Deutsche Bank, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is nice for my department. We have over 7 and 8 labs in IT department, all having rich facilities of Wi-Fi, smartboards, and PCs. We have a library, having wide range of both fictional as well as our department books. We have a reading hall where students come and study in a peaceful environment with electricity and Wi-Fi facilities 24X7.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty members are nice and really wonderful at their subjects while some of the newer ones are not so nice. They are not so very skilled at teaching their subjects, leading to students losing interest in that subject. Exams are SPPU-based which are not that compelling. Most of the stuff comes from previous year papers, making it much easier to score. The course structure is really nice, and I am sure it makes students industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: It has great campus. It has great sporting facilities. Fests conducted are awesome. Various clubs to choose from student's interests. Senior and junior bond is great. Only wards of army personnel can apply for admission at this college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good environment, helpful peers, decent placements, and good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Most students, around 85–90%, are still getting placed in the current scenario. The highest package is around 53 LPA, and the lowest is 3 LPA. Companies like Mastercard, UBS, ZS, and many others visit for placements. A good number of students, around 40–50%, get internships at companies like Mastercard, EQ, and others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are decent as per the college. However, the number of hostels is not sufficient with respect to the intake. There are facilities for sports, medical care, and indoor games. Labs are high-tech, and if you want to work on any of your projects, the college also provides funding.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and experts in their fields. The curriculum I am in is under SPPU, so the role of the college is less and over by the university, which I think is very good. The new autonomous syllabus is designed with a strong focus on the ongoing trends in the industry.
detailed_review.Other: The campus environment is very healthy, with a good senior-junior bond, and the clubs are the key to that interaction. They organize numerous events throughout the year.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied because of placements, facilities, and faculty, but not satisfied with the campus.

detailed_review.Placements: About 95% of students got placed, and some students have opted for higher studies. 12 LPA is the average package offered in my course, and the lowest is around 4 LPA by Solytics, but the highest packages are many, like 46 LPA and 64 LPA by Amazon and 51 LPA by Google. Top recruiting companies are Deutsche Bank, ZS, UBS, EQ, Tarana, etc. About 10% of students got internships in a renowned company. Top roles are data analyst, SDE 1, market analyst, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities, according to Pune city, are quite good for a nominal price of 1 lac. The facilities like Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, library, mess, dressing, medical assistant, etc., are available. Food quality is good for a healthy stomach, but one can get bored while eating the same menu for months, but this is preferred. Sports and games are supported, like boxing, volleyball, football, cricket, etc. We have a canteen named OAC, which changes every year, which is good. Overall, the mess and hostel are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers can be a nightmare, but if you cooperate with them, they are very helpful. Permanent teachers are the best and knowledgeable, but the quality of temporary teaching may vary. The course curriculum is very good according to Pune University, which covers all the main subjects for placement. The semester exams are not that hard one can clear them in a day itself, but they need smart work. Pass percentage is 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of the placements in computer engineering. The best things are that the syllabus is easy and the teachers in our department are qualified and competent. Things that could be improved are the hands-on experience with the industry and also the practical knowledge, because currently it focuses on theoretical knowledge. There are many events conducted in the college, like Amethyst, Aakriti, Pace, sports, etc. Fest is the amethyst which has many events like a battle of bands, dance groups, etc. From various colleges like AFMC, MIT, COEP, etc.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Decent college for army brats.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90-91% of our batch got placed, with a median package of about 12 LPA. Top recruiters included Microsoft, Oracle, UdChalo, and many more. Many students also got internships in similar top companies. Roles like software developer, data analyst, and cloud engineer are most common.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the things except the Wi-Fi and internet connectivity are good. The food served in the mess is better in comparison to other private colleges both quality and hygiene-wise. Various sports facilities are also provided including volleyball, cricket, football, and many more.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are quite helpful and knowledgeable. Most teachers explain concepts clearly and concisely. The curriculum is mostly relevant and does help in building industry-level skills. Exams are moderate in difficulty, and the pass percentage is quite good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose IT because I have always been interested in tech and problem-solving. The course has great faculty members, labs, and projects, which help me learn a lot. I wish there were more internships and soft-skill sessions. Campus life is fun with fests, events, and active student clubs that keep things lively.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Dissatisfied with the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is not honesty very good, to be honest. Sales companies are coming for placement. Only girls are getting a good placement. Their average is nearly 12 LPA - 13 LPA. For boys, the condition isn't very good. The average package is 7 to 8 LPA. Some are getting placed at even at 5 - 6 LPA. Students even if getting a 6-month internship are not able to do an internship due to university policies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college and the feels taken by the college have a phase of 180. Not sufficient facilities in this college. Mess food ranges from good to worse depending on the dishes. The Wi-Fi connection is not up to the mark. Often speed is very slow and we have to depend on our internet.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum from a student's point of view is not great. Some subjects have no values and are implied on us for no use like CCS, PCS, etc. Semester exams to be honest not very difficult but universities often don't check the papers properly leading to less CGPA of students.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with the college because of its army nature, faculty, and good placement ratio.

detailed_review.Placements: In the 2023-24 batch, almost all students get placed. The best companies that come here are Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and some others. The highest package is 60 LPA, the average is 16 LPA, and the lowest package is 10 LPA. Students from all branches get placed in top companies. The placement culture is very good at the Army Institute of Technology.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a Bachelor's in Engineering (BE) course which has 5 branches, CSE, IT, E&TC, Mechanical, and ARE. All branches have separate labs and classrooms, and the condition of labs and classrooms is good. Students get Wi-Fi in hostels, which is quite fast, and the condition of the hostel is good. The security in hostels is quite tight.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is quite friendly with students. They are highly qualified, with 4 to 5 years of experience in teaching. Most faculty are from an IIT background. The exam schedule is quite different. We are provided with preparatory leave before the exam, unlike IITs, which give semester leave after exams.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is fine and has a good coding culture, but restrictions are for first-year students.

detailed_review.Placements: In comp branch, 98.8% of students were placed, and the overall percentage of students placed with an average package of 11 LPA, and the highest package was 51 LPA. Also, this college will be autonomous soon, so it will be compared to top NITs. The campus size is small, but you will enjoy it.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good facilities for students and also marking new hostels and grounds. Teaching faculty is nice and helpful for students. They motivate students to participate in hackathons and also help in research. This college is going to be autonomous soon. Mess food is awesome.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, all teachers are well qualified and knowledgeable, and course curriculum is good. Generally, first-year exams are easy, so students can explore the college and various domains in technology. Also, good resources are available in the library, and a variety of clubs are in college.
detailed_review.Other: Students get opportunities throughout the year. Various activities took place throughout the year.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: AIT Pune is too good to take if you are not getting IIT not and hour father has army background.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is too good for our college as about 96% of students of previous year are placed. The average package in this college is 14 lkh, and the highest package is 54 lkh. Due to discipline and army background, company prefer more to come in the college. We have an excellent too department which is too good in availing opportunity for students. Microsoft, Delloite are some company which visit our college along with 63 others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is present inside the college and compulsory for first year student to live in the hostel. Hostel has one study table, one chair, one charpai with one cupboard and common bathroom in one floor. Hostel menu is weekly decided as pav bhaji on Monday breakfast, idli on Wed and others. The food quality is good. For boys, hostel are provided on the basis of merit and attendance, and for girls hostels are available for all. There is a nearby market Vishntwadi and Dighi.
detailed_review.Faculty: There is 1 counselor provided on every 20 student for sharing there personal problem and mental health. All faculty members are also good in teaching and are polite. Especially Ketan sir, he is too sweet and polite towards every student. Exams are conducted according to the new SPPU 2024 pattern with two internal exam of 30 marks and 1 end sem of 70 marks. A preparatory leave is given before the endsem exam of 1 month.
detailed_review.Other: There are two gym, one for boys and a separate for girls in girls hostel having all required items. There are two cafeteria, one night canteen and one library name Aryabhata centre. Main gate closing time is 8:30 for first year and 10 pm for senior students. Hostel in time is 10pm for all. Famous hangout places inside hostel are Gazeebo, MG Road.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: AIT Pune - The reality.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 96% of students get placed in the 4th year of college. The highest salary package offered this year is 51 LPA by Microsoft to an electronic and telecommunication student. The average salary package offered in the college is 12 LPA. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Deloitte, Walmart, etc. On-campus internships are not that much taken. Most of the students prefer off-campus internships. This college is very good for girls. Due to a few number of girls, they get more job opportunities than boys.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are smart with projectors. There is a library named Aryabhtta Centre. It has nearly 12,000 books and many journals. Wi-Fi is available 24/7 in hostels. Labs are well-maintained and furnished. Sports facilities are very good. The college focuses more on physical health. It is not like other colleges.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, polite, and well-qualified. The curriculum not only involves academic subjects but also includes some subjects like DTIL that grow our thinking to get better startup plans and many more. Semester exams are not very hard. It depends on what type of preparation we have done. Around 1 month of preparatory leave is given before the exam.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: A place where discipline meets opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 95% of students are placed in the computer engineering course. The average salary package offered is 12 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Mastercard, Google, Microsoft, etc. The internship rate is 60%-80%. Top roles offered are data analyst, SDE, ML engineer, cybersecurity, cloud engineer, and web developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, library, and all other facilities are available for students. Mess and canteens are available. Various sports grounds like football, basketball, and volleyball. Various courts like badminton, squash, tennis (both lawn and table), and MI room facilities are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and knowledgeable and teaching quality is also good. Semester exams are easy if students already studied before the exams and pass percentage is 40% in final exams. Practical knowledge is given more importance.
detailed_review.Other: Computer engineering is the most demanding course, so I chose it. There are many events organized in the college and one can become a part of them. Various fests are also organised and crowd is also good enough. Connectivity is the best thing I found here.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is value for money.

detailed_review.Placements: A total of 94 percent of students were placed with the highest package of 74 Lacs per year, the lowest package of 3 Lacs per year, and an average package of 12 Lacs per year with companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and TCS. Out of 137, 93 got internships with the highest package of 4 Lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are good. They are regularly cleaned and contain Wi-Fi with high speed, but we can use Wi-Fi only on laptops, not on mobile. On laptops, limited sites can be used by Wi-Fi. In the mess, food is nutritious and healthy. There are 3 types of rooms in our hostel: single, double, and triplets.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good. They provide the best facilities for doubt-solving and ensure that we understand a topic completely. Teachers also take tests to ensure that students are studying or not. The exams taken by the college are moderate and almost every student passes except a few.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: A review of the curriculum, faculty, and campus resources.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year, the percentage of students that got placed in our course was 98 percent. The average package offered in my course is around 14 LPA. The top recruiting companies that visit our college are Microsoft, Amazon, Barclays, ION Trading, Avalara, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Talking about the labs and classrooms of our department, they are good. A separate building is present other than the academic block that is used as a library, and all the required books are available there. The quality of the hostels is good. Mess food is also good. For medical purposes, an MI room is present on the campus in which a doctor is available every time.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are highly qualified, with most holding Ph. D.s in their respective fields. The faculty uses a mix of traditional methods, including lectures, discussions, and multimedia presentations. The curriculum is well-structured and relevant to the industry, with a focus on practical skills and real-world applications.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was getting only this course according to my rank. Some best things about my course are that, in the coming time, there can be more requirements for this course. Many events are organized in our college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good College on a Steep Decline Downwards.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60% of students get placed in the first semester, and the rest are left to be recruited by mass recruiters in the second semester. Since the one-job policy applies to most people who get placed, they are not allowed to sit again for the examination, giving more chances to the rest of the batch. Early companies have an average of about 12 LPA but decrease as time passes.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel buildings and academic buildings are well constructed, but most of the college is always under construction, with new hostels and multi-purpose rooms being created every day, while also keeping up with the sports infrastructure maintenance. Cleaning is done daily, and fines are imposed for any problems created against this well-keeping.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty, curriculum, and exams are collectively dependent on Savitribai Phule Pune University, which is responsible for setting the curriculum (which is rarely changed and has content that has been running for decades). The faculty is average and helps only if you approach them out of the classroom. Most of the grading is done on the basis of attendance.
detailed_review.Other: My batch joined in 2021 with an annual fee of 2.97 Lacs, and it has now grown to 3.64 Lacs. The fests and competitions are very frequent and provide necessary exposure to the students. However, through our tenure, we have seen a trend of growing fines and disciplinary cases.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: All about Army Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: My batch is the 2025 batch. Till November 2024, almost 95 percent from Comp, 90 percent from IT, 85 percent from Entc, and 88 percent from Mechanical are placed. Companies like ZS, Microsoft, Barclays, Mastercard, Deloitte, and Tata Technologies are the main highlights.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are 8 hostels, 1 for girls and 7 for boys. The hostels are very neat and clean, with daily sanitation. Every week, sweepers clean the rooms of students. Every hostel is Cisco connected. The library has a reading hall for giving tests and studying.
detailed_review.Faculty: Army Institute of Technology has very qualified professors in their respective fields, with 20+ staff members in each branch. The curriculum for the first year is the same irrespective of the branch. In the second year, the curriculum changes and has 100 marks per subject—30 marks for in-semester and 70 marks for end-semester exams.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Decent place to study. This is the place where only you can study.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are quite decent. Not very low and not very good. Last year, around 95 percent got placed, including both on-campus and off-campus placements. The majority were off-campus placements. This year, there is a certain drop in placements from the last few years. On campus, the highest was 14 LPA only. Top recruiting companies are Mastercard, Tata Teach, JP Morgan, etc. Eighty percent got internships, including paid and unpaid.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi facility is quite good; sometimes it doesn't work, but overall it's very good. Lab facilities are also good and informative. Library and reading hall areas are very spacious, and there is always an environment to study. Hostel rooms are quite airy, and the mess food is above average. Medical and sports facilities are up to par. There is 24/7 medical assistance on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: The majority of the teachers are helpful and qualified, and the teaching quality is okay. The course curriculum is relevant and makes us industry-ready. Semester exams are quite difficult, but the majority of students pass; maybe the percentage of passing students is around 90 percent or more.
detailed_review.Other: Events, fests, all of these happen from time to time. Sports aakriti and cultural aakriti are very interesting.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements, not very good crowd, average infrastructure and amazing facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: About 90% of students are placed well after graduation. The highest salary offered on campus was 52 LPA by Microsoft, and the lowest was 3 LPA. The average salary is around 10–12 LPA. For my course, the top recruiting companies are Tata, Oracle, and ZS ASSOCIATE. About 70% of students in my course do an internship with companies such as Tata, Oceaneering, and TVS.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms have smart boards and well-manufactured benches, and the overall look of the classrooms is nice. The labs are well maintained and have updated PCs. The library is very large and has books in almost every genre. The hostel quality is average, but we get coolers, a bed, and a study table. The mess food is above average, and the hygiene is great. We have all sorts of sports facilities and a great sports environment for all sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well qualified and knowledgeable, but they are not very helpful. The teaching quality is not up to the mark, but the course curriculum is relevant and prepares students for the industry. The semester exams are easy to pass, with a pass percentage of 80%. The pass percentage varies depending on the subject.
detailed_review.Other: I like this college because of its diverse student body. Students come from all over the country, and often form groups based on their home states. This can be annoying for students who don't belong to one of the majority groups. However, the fests are well funded, there are lots of scholarships, and the extracurricular activities are awesome.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It’s a good college only for army wards providing good placement opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 98% students got placed. L&T, Sarvatra, MSD, Tata Technologies, Oceaneering, Technific, Quantify, Barclays, TCS and many other companies visit for hiring offering Consultant, SDE and Data analytics roles. Many companies become mass recruiters like ZS, Deloitte, MasterCard, Detchbank, UBS, HSBC bank, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
The college has amazing sports facilities. Hostel, mess, laundry, etc. are the facilities available. There is a barber shop and it’s fee is included in the total fee we pay. There is a medical room for emergency along with a food court, a pizza shop, gym, Atm and boxing club.
Squash court, supporting teachers for every sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college is going to be autonomous next year. Mid sem exams consist of 30 marks and end sem are of 70 marks. We have viva and internals too. The college is under SPPU currently following the 2019 pattern. Good quality of education is provided here. Scoring good marks is not difficult. There are a few subjects in each semester which you may find difficult.
detailed_review.Other: Many co curricular activities along with amazing fests are held.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission to B.Tech at Army Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Getting direct admission to the B.Tech programs at the Army Institute of Technology (AIT) is not availaible apart from some exceptions. Usually, they fill their seats through entrance exams like the JEE Main. Sometimes, if there are seats left after the regular admission or if a candidate falls into a special category like being a child of defense personal or maybe an outstanding athlete, then they might get direct admission. You can check AIT website for the latest information on admission procedures and criteria.

faqs.question: How can I get into Army Institute of Technology for UG/PG courses? Am I eligible for admission?
faqs.answer: Army Institute of Technology has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility B.E. / B.Tech Candidate who have passed Diploma in Engineering & Technology & obtained at least 45% marks (40% marks for Backward class, EWS & PWD candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only) can also apply. M.E./M.Tech Sponsored candidate must have minimum of two years of full time work experience in a registered firm/ company/ industry/ educational and/ or research institute/ any Government Department or Government Autonomous Organization in the relevant field in which admission is being sought. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: Library comprises a rich collection of titles of the books around 8887, total number of volumes 29096, number of National Journals are 57 and International Journals are 17.Separate Digital Section is provided. IEL online journals are also available. E-Library facility is also available. Provides facility of Inter library borrowing facility with ARAI and Jaikar Library SPPU, MCCIA. Facilitates Wi-Fi connectivity in reading hall.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Separate Hostels are provided and rooms are available on single and sharing basis (Double, Triple & Quadruple) with Mess facility (serves Vegetarian food only). Rooms are furnished and geyser is provided in each bathroom. Recreational facility such as TV with dish connection, indoor Pool table games and a well-equipped gymnasium is also incorporated. Basic amenities like water-cooler with water-purifier are provided in each floor. Medical and internet facility through physical and wireless mode are available round the clock.

college_info.college_name: BIT Sindri: Courses, Fees, Admissions 2025, Scholarships, Placements

highlights.summary:
BIT Sindri, formerly the Bihar Institute of Technology, Sindri, began as a subsidiary of Ranchi College. It later became the affiliated engineering college of Vinoba Bhave University, Hazaribagh, and is now affiliated with the Jharkhand University of Technology (JUT), Ranchi—so degrees are awarded by JUT. BIT Sindri offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and PhD programs, with durations that vary by course. Admissions to all programs at BIT Sindri Dhanbad are based on entrance exams.
Dhanbad Road, Sindri Dhanbad (Jharkhand)
Check out more on BIT Sindri Highlights in the below video:

college_info_program.intro:
The popular programmes offered at BIT Sindri are BTech and MTech. In the case of BTech course, students must have passed class 12 with Mathematics and Physics as compulsory subjects, and Chemistry or biology as optional, with at least 45% marks in total.
On the other hand, for MTech, students must have a BTech degree or equivalent in the respective discipline with a minimum of 60% marks or equal in CPGA ( 55% aggregate for the SC/ ST students).
Students can check the popular programmes at BIT Sindri from the table below:
Check out more details about Birsa Institute of Technology, Sindri in the below video:
