college_info.college_name: BIT Sindri Fees 2026
BIT Sindri Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: A good state government college for core branches like mechanical and mental mining.

detailed_review.Placements: My branch of electrical is having a decent placement as per 2025 report, with a median of around 6.5 LPA. Placement percentage is around 75 percent. Around 90 percent placement for its core branch like mechanical, mental mining, and for tech branch mass recruiters are major hiring MNCs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: For the first year, hostels are good. It has 2 sharing but from second year onwards, it would be 4 sharing. Infrastructure is decent but it needs to be upgraded. There are two libraries, one is central library and other is GRS library present on the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course is well-designed and run in coordination with JUT. Professors are polite and are always helpful. Teachers also help in our GATE preparation, guide us on the right path. Exams are held regularly. We will not be able to even recognise when 1st semester ended.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am not dissatisfied with the faculty because the faculty in our college is very good.

detailed_review.Placements: 80 percent of students are placed in our course. The highest package in our course is 16LPA, the lowest package offered is 4LPA and the average package in our course is 8LPA. The top recruitment companies in our course are L&T, JSW, Adani, etc. 50 percent of students get internship in our course in Adani JSPL L&T. The top roles in our course are designing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good in our department, such as Wi-Fi, a classroom, and a library. The quality of the hostel in our college is very good and the mess food is also good. Canteens are also available in our college, and the food in the canteen is also very good, such as aloo paratha.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified and knowledgeable in our course. The quality of teaching is also very good. The semester exams in our college are very difficult and the passing percentage is 33 percentile. The semester exams are randomly held in our college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mining Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college is good for students for their overall development.

detailed_review.Placements: 60–70 percent of students are placed. The highest package is 16.5 LPA by Vedanta, and the lowest is 7–8 LPA by JSW. Top recruiters include Aditya Birla Group, JSW, Vedanta, etc. Till now, no one else. Vedanta is also in mining, so many students focused on the GATE exam because in mining, the syllabus is easier compared to other courses.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs, classrooms, and libraries are average. Food quality is average but good. Hostel facilities are below average. Hostels are not maintained regularly. Upgradation is needed in this college, especially in labs, as many equipments are not working properly. They should upgrade them.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are highly qualified and very helpful. They guide us like children. The difficulty level is medium. The passing percentage is 80–90 percent. Some issues arise while taking exams, like the syllabus not being completed. We have to complete our syllabus by ourselves.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because the mining branch is famous in BIT for placements, and the GATE syllabus is easier compared to other courses. I wish the classrooms and auditorium would be upgraded. Events are very few.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mining Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has absolutely amazing faculty members and good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 92.6 percent of students are approximately placed in my course. The highest package offered in my course is 18 LPA. The average package is 10 LPA. The lowest package is 6 LPA. The top recruiting companies in my course are Aditya Birla, Adani Power Plant, JSW, etc. 100 percent of students get internships in my course in companies like BCCL, NCL, CMPDI, etc. Roles offered in my course are manager, assistant manager, executive engineer, safety officer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is not available, but labs, classrooms, and libraries are very good. All facilities in my hostel are good. The quality of food available in my mess and canteen is very nice and well-cooked. Medical facilities are okay. Sports and games are too good at my college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and kind as well. They are highly qualified and knowledgeable, and because of this, the teaching quality is very good. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. Semester exams in my college are neither too easy nor too difficult. The pass percentage is approximately 94 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Value for money college, placements are good, and the campus is satisfactory.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70 percent of students got placed in the previous batch. Many opted for on-campus placement, and some cracked GATE and are doing M.Tech/PSU. Some also went for off-campus placement. The highest package was around 15 LPA in my course, and the average is 7 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Aditya Birla Group, Inox Aur Solutions and Reliance and many more cement companies. Around 90 percent of students got internships, but most were unpaid. Paid internships are hard to get. Many got paid internships in reliance and ABG. Companies generally offer us roles like a graduate engineering trainee or an engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is old, many departments have not been maintained for years, but new departments have good infrastructure. Core branches have old labs and infrastructure, but the IT and CS departments are in good condition. The library is good, you can find almost any books of your department, and Wi-Fi is also available. Hostels are of average condition. In 1st year, there were 4 room-sharing partners per room, but in 3rd and final year, most students got a small private room. The canteen is good, the food is average, though, and the mess condition is also slightly above average. Campus grounds/ gym is also provided.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good and qualified, professors are of good teaching experience and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is relevant according to the branches, but in the first year, every branch has to study the same subjects. Semester exams are a little bit difficult, but if you are attentive in class, they are not too difficult.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course since BIT is only for its core branches. The course is good and helps to excel in the GATE and other exams. I would improve the old syllabus and replace it with some new subjects and some changes. There are many events in a year since there are many clubs at our college. The campus crowd is good, and the students here are bright. The campus surroundings are not that good for movies or malls, we have to go to Dhanbad. Many students avail scholarship at places like eKalyan and the Reliance scholarship.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements, helpful faculty, and decent campus life with scope for improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80-90% students get placed. The highest package is about 16.5 LPA. The lowest is approximately 4.5 LPA, and the average is about 7.5 LPA. Top recruiters include Tata Steel, Vedanta, JSW, Capgemini, and L&T. Nearly 70% students get internships in firms like Tata Steel, DRDO, and Microsoft. Roles offered are engineer, analyst, and developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: BIT, Sindri offers Wi-Fi, well-equipped labs, classrooms with projects, and a large library. Hostels are basic but functional, the mess food is hygienic, and the canteens are affordable. Medical care is available, and sports facilities include cricket, football, volleyball, and indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at Bit Sindri are very qualified, helpful, and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is decent with a theory and practical focus. The curriculum is relevant and industry-oriented. Semester exams are moderately difficult with a pass percentage of around 90 to 95%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose cybersecurity for its demand and role in protecting data. The best part is learning ethical hacking, cryptography, and network security. Needs better labs and tools. Campus has fests, clubs, scholarships, sports, and a family crowd.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely value for money college, with a good alumni network.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has one of the best placements in the core sector. Many top companies, such as AMNS, TATA Steel, ITC, Delloite, and JSL, visit our college regularly. Our college has maintained an average package of around 7.5 LPA. The mechanical and electrical engineering branches are two of the best branches of our college, with a record of 90% placements for decades.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has state-of-the-art infrastructure as it is the top college under the Government of Jharkhand. Our college has 31 hostels till now, and a new lecture hall complex and auditorium are being made on the campus. The work is almost done; it will be completed in just one more year, and these two will also continue working. The college doesn't provide any sort of Wi-Fi in the hostels, but there are many private operators like Jio and Airtel on campus. You can contact them, but you have to pay for it on your own.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good, and most of them are Ph.D. holders, but they will only help you if you show some eagerness for the work. They will help you, but you first have to fight for it and grab their attention. For each semester, you have to give three exams, mid-semester 1 and 2, and end-of-semester, along with VIVA and practical. The curriculum is very new, according to the NEP 2020.
detailed_review.Other: The crowd is pretty good, almost everyone on the campus scored in the good percentile in their JEE exam, and after that, they entered this college. There are more than 15 clubs on the campus. They organize some fests, but that is not that good, pretty good for a tier 2 state government college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: BITians are second to none.

detailed_review.Placements: We had a total of around 40-45 students in the final year this time. In which 24-25 students got placed. The placement percentage of my branch is 55 percent. The software scenario is not that good in this college, but for the core, it's magnificent. In the metallurgy branch, the placement report was 100 percent.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Actually, we have a lecture hall, but from this year onwards, the classes will be held in the new lecture hall, which is going to be inaugurated this year, only for the new students. As BIT is one of the oldest colleges in India, its infrastructure is a bit old. About the hostel, it's average, I would say. The food quality is good ( not like the way Hostel food is described), it's genuinely good enough that you can survive. We have a central library in the centre of the college, with a lot of books for every domain and field.
detailed_review.Faculty: The exam is conducted by the University JUT, so sometimes it's too late and sometimes it's too early. About the paper, you can literally study for two days before the exam and score above 90 percent. Here, two mid semesters are conducted, each of 10 marks, and then end semester is conducted.
detailed_review.Other: Around college, there are very few spots to explore. Not even more cafes. So those things bother me. But other than that, the BIT is the best.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good for your personal studies. You will get enough time to prepare for competition.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement scenario at BIT Sindri is decent. Average package is around 7 LPA - 8 LPA. But the placement of civil branch is very poor. Not half of the batch got placed. Mining branch has a good package. Cyber security was added in the year 2024.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All branches have separate departments. Bit Sindri has a huge library but the staffs are not that much cooperative. You can take a book for 15 days, and after that, 10 paise/day will be charged. There is no Wi-Fi zone on the campus. Hostel is decent, you have to stay with 4-5 students in the 1st and 2nd year. In 3rd year, you will get separate room.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are very helpful and cooperative. All teachers are highly qualified and knowledgeable. But they don't use their potential fully. Exams are not so tough. You can pass the exams by studying the day before the exams. You can neither expect too much from a government college.
detailed_review.Other: Civil branch has poor placement but has a bright future. You can apply for many government jobs. Fests are rare at the college. There are clubs and NGOs where you can join and organise events and do social work.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: BIT Sindri: Good faculty, labs, placements; old infrastructure; proactive students thrive here.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90% of Civil students secure campus placements annually. The highest package is up to 13 LPA, with recruiters like JSW, Vedanta, Aditya Birla, and Unacademy. The average package is approximately 6.5 LPA for Civil Engineering. Over 100 internship offers to Civil students in 2024. Comparable to other core branches.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus has decent labs, especially in Civil Engineering. Surveying, Concrete, Soil Mechanics, and Environment labs are well-equipped but sometimes face maintenance delays. The Central Library offers good resources, including textbooks and past papers. Hostels are basic, mostly shared rooms, moderately clean, and old in infrastructure, though some renovations have occurred. Mess food is average with limited variety; canteens provide basic meals. Medical facilities include a dispensary with a doctor; serious cases require Dhanbad hospital. Sports grounds for cricket, football, and athletics are available, with some indoor games. Annual sports meets and cultural fests are active and well-attended.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are generally approachable and supportive, with most holding M.Tech or Ph.D. degrees. Teaching quality ranges from average to excellent, though methods are mostly traditional. The curriculum covers core civil engineering areas but feels slightly outdated; students often self-learn modern tools like AutoCAD and STAAD Pro. Practical exposure is limited, so internships and certification are recommended for skill development. Semester exams are moderately difficult and largely theory-based, with an 85-90% pass rate. Internal assessment and attendance significantly impact final grades. Overall, the programme builds strong fundamentals but requires extra effort to achieve full industry readiness.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Civil Engineering because of my interest in infrastructure and design. BIT Sindri offers experienced faculty, strong core placements (JSW, Vedanta, Aditya Birla), and affordable fees. Labs for structures, soil mechanics, and concrete technology provide practical exposure, along with software training in AutoCAD and STAAD Pro. Active student societies like the Civil Engineering Society and ISTE enrich learning. The popular annual fest SRIJAN features technical and cultural events. The campus is peaceful and green, mainly with students from Jharkhand and Bihar. Connectivity to Dhanbad (28 km) is good. Many scholarships, including E-Kalyan, support deserving students financially.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Metallurgical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Metallurgical branch is a good career option.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement of the metallurgical branch is too good. 100% of students are placed (who fulfill company criteria: 7+ CGPA, max 2 passive backlogs, more than 70% in board exams). The highest package is 14 LPA offered by Vedanta. The lowest package is 5 LPA. The average package is 7.5-8 LPA. JSW, JSPL, Aditya Birla Group, Adani Ltd, L&T, Vedanta, Tata Steel, Shyam Metallics, Reliance, etc., recruit. B.I.T. Sindri offers 3rd-year internships of 2 types: Paid and Unpaid. Those who couldn't crack a Paid internship find it necessary to do an Unpaid Internship (no stipend). 10-15 students can crack a paid internship out of 55 students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The 1st-year hostel is clean and spacious, with two students per room, but from 2nd to 3rd year, 3-4 students share a room, and only final-year students get single rooms. Hostel quality declines after the first year. There's no Wi-Fi in hostels or classrooms, only in the library. Labs have old but functional instruments. The mess food is good, offering non-veg meals five days a week. Sports facilities are excellent, with events like SPARDHA, inter-branch football, and intra-branch cricket matches. Grounds are spacious. However, medical facilities are below average and need improvement for better student support.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified, mostly from reputed institutes like IITs, and are very supportive, especially for students aiming for GATE and PSUs. The course is industry-relevant and prepares students well for future careers. Exams are relatively tough, requiring consistent effort to secure 8 CGPA or more. Very few students reach or exceed 9 CGPA, with most falling between 7 to 8. However, students scoring above 8 CGPA have better chances of securing good placements, making academic focus essential for career success.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of its low fees and 100% placement opportunities. The best part is that it's a prestigious branch not offered in every college. Unlike Computer Science, which is available everywhere (Government, GFTIs, and Private colleges) and has rising competition every year, this branch is offered only in reputed institutions. With less competition, it offers better career prospects. Only around 3000 students appear for GATE in this branch, so with a little extra effort, you can achieve what CS students work extremely hard for.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you can't get any of the IIT and NIT also your finance not so good.

detailed_review.Placements: BIT Sindri has good placement records, particularly for core branches like electrical, mechanical, and metallurgy. While the placement rate varies by branch, with some branches like CSE and IT. Bit Sindri's placement is good for the core branch.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: BIT Sindri's infrastructure has mixed reviews. The college has a large, lush green campus, and separate buildings for its 10 departments. The infrastructure of BIT Sindri is good to moderate but labs are very old, so overall infrastructure is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: BIT Sindri faculty reviews are positive, with students highlighting their knowledge and helpfulness. Faculty is also well-experienced in teaching and also guides overall development in terms of interest like sports and other activities.
detailed_review.Other: The best college according to rank and fee in Jharkhand.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good faculty members, placements, and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: A maximum of 90% of students are getting placed. The highest package is 50 LPA, the average is 14 to 17 LPA, and the lowest is, I think, 4 to 7 LPA. Top companies like Tata Steel, JSW Steel, Vedanta, L&T, Aditya Birla Group, and Adani come for placement. Around 40-50% of students are securing opportunities in various companies for internships like Tata Steel, Mahindra, Tata Motors, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are available like labs, classrooms, and library, and Wi-Fi is in the library. Food in the mess and canteen are good with varieties of menu available, and medical facilities are also there. Sports and games are also prioritized, with a sports club where sports and games are conducted.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and classes are taken regularly. They are well-educated and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is relevant and makes students ready for companies. Semester exams are a little bit tough because students have to study well for their best future.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has an average placement record and good infrastructure for the B.Tech students.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate generally can be considered to be good. It is about 70-90 % in my course. The highest package offered has been around 13 LPA, with the average package around 6.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Tata, JSW Steel, L&T, Vedanta, and Aditya Birla.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure here is good enough.The classroom and library facilities are good, but you are not provided with Wi-Fi facilities. If I talk about the hostel, it is good for the students, but the mess food is not so good enough. The canteen is really good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well-educated and qualified. Their teaching quality is really good. The course curriculum is vast and old, I don't think it will make students industry-ready, but the curriculum is good. The semester exams are generally moderate, with a pass percentage generally above 85%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the faculty and all staff members. Placement varies here.

detailed_review.Placements: In B.Tech, 75% of students get placed. Although it varies from branch to branch. In some branches, it is 100%. In the mechanical engineering branch, it is 100%. If students get admission in the mechanical engineering branch, then it would be best because placements in mechanical engineering are very good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Food is normal and the same as the other colleges. The mess staff members are good. They all are very helpful. If our health is not good, then they also help us. At night or if we go late, then they keep our food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and supportive. Semester exams are moderate, not that difficult, and help us in every aspect. Some teachers also provide values of life and what to do in different situations. They will provide us with the necessary important topics of exams, so it is very easy for us to pass exams. They try to make us understand every topic more than once. Practice questions are also provided by teachers, which help us to score good results in the exam.
detailed_review.Other: Events are organised, but very few. It conducts extracurricular activities like football, cricket, and badminton. There are also inter-branch competitions.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has low fees, good placements, a nice ROI, good faculty members but no campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate at BIT SNDRI is very good compared to its fees. Approximately 80-90 percent of students find jobs in core branches, excluding Civil. The average package is around 7-8 LPA. Top recruiters include Tata Steel, Wipro, TCS, Adani, and Vedanta. Almost all students receive internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is average.Still, the new hostel (Hostel 29) is quite nice. The construction of a new lecture hall is underway, but currently, the infrastructure is quite old. In the hostel, there is no Wi-Fi, so students must purchase their own. The quality of the mess food is decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and supportive. Their teaching quality is good, and the college organizes various helpful sessions. Questions in semester exams vary from easy to moderate levels. You can pass the exam with just one night of studying, but to achieve good marks, you need to focus on your studies.
detailed_review.Other: The college fee is around Rs. 60,000 to Rs. 70,000. The alumni network is strong, aiding students in securing internships at reputable companies. A significant issue is the old infrastructure and the fact that much of the lab equipment is unused. There are no major events but various small events do occur. There are no big events.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: BIT Sindri - Review by Nitish Kumar Singh.

detailed_review.Placements: Now, we have almost 1 month left in our college. Currently, only 10-12 students are unplaced and the remaining are placed. Most of them are placed on-campus and some of them are placed off-campus. The highest package is 12 LPA from Tata Steel. The average package is 7 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are big enough to accommodate 40-50 students. Every classroom has a whiteboard, smart board, and a green board. Wi-Fi is there but not supportive. Library is very huge and has almost all relevant books that are necessary for students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are very strict and internationally fail the students if they don't attend their classes. But some teachers are also very supportive. They are always ready to help us. Semester exams are not so tough. One can easily pass his/her exams by completing past year papers.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen this course as I have an interest in it.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Grateful for the guidance by seniors and the way they support us.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60%-70% of the students from my batch got placed. The highest offered is about 10 LPA, the lowest 3 LPA, and the average is closer to 4 LPA-5 LPA. Limited numbers of spots are for core placements, and the majority are from IT and consulting companies such as TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and Capgemini. The majority of the top positions offered are for a software developer, system engineer, and business analyst. Placements overall are enhancing but need more company diversity and presence from the core sector.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure at BIT Sindri is average. Classrooms and labs are functional but typically lack contemporary equipment and maintenance. Wi-Fi is available but not consistently reliable. There is a good collection of academic textbooks in the library, though digital material is lacking. Hostel infrastructure is planned, with shared rooms and shared washrooms. Cleanliness and water supply are an issue at times. The mess is tolerable but lacks quality and diversity. There are sports facilities in the form of grounds and basic indoor games, though equipment and maintenance are subpar.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching faculty at BIT Sindri are knowledgeable for the most part, though the teaching style is pretty conventional and not very interactive. Some of the faculty members are cooperative, or else the teaching quality is not up to the mark. The curriculum is average and a bit outdated, with not much practical exposure and industry focus. The semester exams are fairly tough, and the pass percentage is reasonable, i.e., 70%. Students would be hugely benefited by the focus on updated course material and practical learning.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for civil engineering at BIT Sindri (2024-2028 batch) for its sound academic curriculum and qualified faculty. The course material in the required subjects is covered well, with adequate facilities in the labs. However for civil, there are not many placements, and there is a desire for increased industry exposure and technical workshops. Campus life is ordinary. Bitotsav, Techfest, and FOYC events do occur, though there needs to be more involvement from the students. Hostel and mess facilities are simple yet functional. Overall, it is a good value-for-money institution, particularly for government exam students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Birsa Institute of Technology, Sindri.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement opportunities for the Electrical, Mechanical, and Mining branches are good. However, placements for Computer Science, Information Technology, and Electronics and Communication are not as strong. The average package for core branches is around 7-8 LPA, while the average package for IT sector companies is 4-5 LPA, with the highest package in core branches being 14.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The bad condition of the hostel for 1st and 2nd year. In 1st and 2nd-year boys hostel - 4 to 5 people in 1 room. In 3rd and 4th years - 1 people in 1 room branches have their buildings like electrical, mechanical, and mining Some department share their department buildings like CSE, IT, ECE, and cybersecurity.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is good as it is a government college but the attitude of the faculty is bad. The curriculum is old and irrelevant to modern standards and contains way more useless subjects like history. Exams are good not hard nor easy, we have 2 midsem and 1 endsem every semester.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Very affordable, decent college, with decent infrastructure, good opportunities, and good faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 500 students were placed in the academic year of 2023-24, and 28 students from ECE were placed. The placement percentage in ECE was 46% and many students decided to do higher studies. A lot of alumni from here are in respectable positions from the civil services exam of the whole country as well as the state. The highest package offered was Rs.16.50 LPA whereas the top 10% of the class bagged an average salary package of 13 LPA. The top recruiting companies were Vedanta Resources, TCE, Tata Group, etc. 84 of the students got internships in companies like Microsoft, Google, Reliance, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department facilities are very good, with various required air-conditioned labs and lecture rooms. Even a 3-storey library has been provided at the campus with a huge number of book collections in various genres. The hostel quality is pretty decent too with quite spacious rooms, especially for the fresher year, the food quality is good. Gym for the fresher and final year girls hostel and solar-powered hostels are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are extremely qualified and very helpful with all the academic related problems and also if anyone decides to develop a skill of their own. The teaching quality is also very decent and makes it way more efficient due to the availability of books in the library. The course curriculum is pretty relevant and the internships and training help the students to be industry-ready. The semester exams are of good level and can be paced if studied properly. The pass percentage is above 85% (approximately and rough).
detailed_review.Other: The feels included below is the tuition fee (excluding exam fees and mess/hostel charges) for girls for the session 2024-25.

college_info.college_name: BIT Sindri Admission 2025: Eligibility, Selection Process, Application Form, Dates

admission.title: BIT Sindri Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: BIT Sindri admissions are entrance-based. The institute accepts JEE Main score for BTech admission while MTech admission is based on the institute's entrance test as well as GATE scores. For doctoral programmes, the institute conducts its entrance examination. BIT Sindri affiliated to Jharkhand University of Technology offers 10 BTech and five MTech programmes across 15 departments at UG and PG levels.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri offers admission to BTech course through Jharkhand Combined Entrance Competitive Examination (JCECE). The selection for M.Tech programme is based on GATE score of the aspirants. Besides, the institute conducts a written test/ interview to shortlist aspirants for PhD programmes. Hence, direct admission is not possible at BIT Sindri. Aspirants need to pass selection rounds to get a seat in the institute.

faqs.question: Is BIT Sindri good for CSE?
faqs.answer: Computer Science Engineering is one of the specialisations offered in BTech by BIT Sindri. It is one of the popular specialisations. Students pursuing BTech CSE from BIT can participate in the placement drive conducted by the institute. Birsa Institute of Technology (BIT) Sindri has concluded its placement process for its BTech batch passing out in 2024. As per the latest report, the the highest package and average package offered during placements in 2024 stood at INR 16.50 LPA and INR 7.57 LPA , respectively.

faqs.question: Which exam is required for BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri accepts national-level entrance exam as well as conducts written test for providing admission to UG and PG courses. Below is course-wise accepted entrance exam for BIT Sindri:

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for B.Tech at Birla Institute of Technology Sindri?
faqs.answer: The minimum eligibility is 50% in 12th or equivalent standard and JEECE rank. But the seats are limited and the candidates with High rank will have the better chance to get it. The safe side would be a rank of 1L or less in JEE Main or they can attend the JEECE the state entrance exam of Jharkhand for Engineering. The percentile needed in JEECE are not mentioned.

faqs.question: Is entrance exam required for BTech (lateral entry) at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri offers lateral entry in the BTech programme to Diploma holders in Engineering and Technology streams. The selection is based on score of the candidates in competitive examination conducted separately for them. The number of seats via lateral entry in all branches are 10% of the normal seats.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for PhD at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: Aspirants who have completed ME/ M.Tech or equivalent degree in respective discipline with at least 60% aggregate or equivalent CGPA (55% aggregate or equivalent CGPA for SC/ ST) from recognised university/ institute are eligible to apply for the PhD programme at BIT Sindri. Besides, candidates need to appear for written test/ interview conducted by the institute for admission to PhD programme.

faqs.question: Is GATE compulsory at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates need to have a valid GATE score for admission to MTech courses. Aspirants must also pass BE/ BTech or equivalent in respective discipline with at least 60% aggregate or equivalent CGPA (55% aggregate or equivalent CGPA for SC/ ST candidates) for admission in the MTech courses.

faqs.question: What is the latest cutoff information for B.Tech at Birla Institute of Technology Sindri?
faqs.answer: The latest cutoff was JEE Main rank of 181000 which is the maximum Rank they accepted last year. Last year this number was 185000 + which means that in upcoming time the maximum rank would be even lesser so it is recommend to try to secure 100000 rank or less in JEE Main to get a Secure Seat. Even though if you wish to get CSE or IT you have to secure around 40000 or less Rank in JEE Main.

faqs.question: What is the admission procedure of BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri admissions begin with registration. For MTech and PhD, candidates can fill out the application form on the official website of the institute. Candidates are shortlisted for BTech based on JEE Main score. Aspirants applying for BTech have to fill JEECE counselling form. Once the registration is done, aspirants need to appear for JEECE Counselling. GATE score is considered for admission to M.Tech programme. Aspirants applying for M.Tech can also appear for the entrance exam conducted by the institute. BIT conducts a written test for PhD admission.

faqs.question: When will JEECE counselling start?
faqs.answer: JEECE 2024 counselling process has started. The candidates listed out in the state merit list will have to partcipate in the counselling process. For every round of JEECE counselling, fresh registrations will be accepted. During the JEECE counselling, the candidates will have to fill out their choice of courses and colleges in the order of preference. The allotment of seats will be announced online.

faqs.question: How many marks are necessary for B.Tech. in Civil Engineering at Birsa Institute of Technology, Sindri?
faqs.answer: You need to get more than 95 percentile in JEE-mains. Also, Candidate must have passed 10+2 examination with Physics, Mathematics as compulsory subjects and Chemistry/ Computer Science/ Electronics/ Information Technology/ Biology/ Information Practice/ Biotechnology/ Technical Vocational subjects/ Agricultutre/ Engineering Graphics/ Business Studies/ Entrepreneurship as optional subjects and obtained atleast 45% marks (40% marks in case of candidate belonging to reserved category) in the subjects taken together. For Lateral Entry-Candidate must have passed diploma in relevant field from a recognized board.

faqs.question: Can I get Birla Institute of Technology Sindri, B.Tech with 88% in JEE Main?
faqs.answer: The main thing that matters the most here is the rank. If you have a good rank then of course you can. Eligibility: The minimum eligibility is 50% in 12th and JEECE rank or JEE Main rank. Cutoff: Cutoff in BIT Sindri is quite competitive, and it gets more competitive with time. Last year the maximum rank which they accepted was 181000 wherein previous year of that maximum was 185000. Recommendation: The safer side will be 1lakh or less rank in JEE Main. If you got that congratulations but if you didn't get it still try to contact and talk to them. If they have extra seat in any quota then they can manage.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for B.Tech at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to fulfil the eligibility criteria to apply for the BIT Sindri BTech programme. It defines the education qualifications required for course admission. Below is a detailed eligibility for BTech: NOTE: The above eligibility is taken as per JCECE.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to BTech at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri admission to BTech programme is based on JEE Main score. Candidates selected based on JEE Main score have to come for JEECE Counselling. JEECE counselling is held online. Registered and eligible candidates will have to participate in the JEECE counselling process for admissions into the BTech courses offered by the participating institutes of the state. Since there is no entrance exam, the admissions will be done based on the candidate's JEE Main scores.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for B.Tech at Birla Institute of Technology Sindri?
faqs.answer: The minimum eligibility is 50% in 12th or equivalent standard and JEECE rank. But the seats are limited and the candidates with High rank will have the better chance to get it. The safe side would be a rank of 1L or less in JEE Main or they can attend the JEECE the state entrance exam of Jharkhand for Engineering. The percentile needed in JEECE are not mentioned.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for MTech at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to complete BE/ BTech or equivalent in their respective discipline with a minimum of 60% aggregate or equivalent CGPA (55% aggregate for SC/ ST) can apply for BIT Sindri MTech programme. Candidates must hold the documents proving their eligibility for verification at later stages of admission. Besides, aspirants must also qualify GATE or appear for a written exam conducted by BIT.

faqs.question: What is the JEECE application fee?
faqs.answer: During the JEECE application process, the candidates will have to pay the required application fee. For the General/EWS/BC-1/BC-2 category candidates, the JEECE application fee is INR 500. However, for SC/ST/Female candidates of all categories, the application fee is INR 250. Candidates will have to pay the application fee online i.e., through net banking/credit card/debit card. No other mode of application will be accepted.

faqs.question: What is the course fees for four years BTech in BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri BTech fee varies for the regular and lateral entry courses. The total tuition fee for the BTech (lateral) is INR 87,040 . Moreover, the tuition fee for other BTech courses is INR 16,900 . There are multiple components included in the course fee structure. It must be noted that the mentioned fee is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is however, still subject to changes and hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: Does BIT Sindri offer seat reservation in the BTech course?
faqs.answer: Yes, BIT Sindri offer seat reservation in the BTech course to some of the category candidates. In order to avail a reserved seat, candidates have to submit a valid caste certificate or EWS certificate . The claims of reservation may be refunded if the submitted certificate is not valid or in proper format. Moreover, there are a total of 968 seats for BTech and BTech (lateral) at the institute. This seat count is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is still subject to changes and hence, is indicative. Also, the mentioned reservation details are as per multiple unofficial sources and hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: How many students can do MTech at Birla Institute of Technology Sindri?
faqs.answer: There are 211 seats divided in 13 Various Courses in M.Tech in BIT Sindri. The minimum requirements are 60% in BTech and GATE rank.

faqs.question: Does BIT Sindri offer scholarships?
faqs.answer: Yes, BIT Sindri provides scholarships based on merit of the candidates. It is awarded to only the students who meet the prescribed critetria. Below are the scholarships offered by BIT:

faqs.question: What is the scholarship amount at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount varies with the scholarship selected by the students. Below are the scholarsips along with the amount at BIT Sindri:

faqs.question: Is B.Tech. in Civil Engineering offered at Birsa Institute of Technology, Sindri?
faqs.answer: Yes, Birla Institute of Technology, Sindri offers B.Tech in civil engineering course. The duration of the course is four years. The total tuition Fee for B.Tech in Civil Engineering is INR 30,928 (for 4 years). Candidate must have passed 10+2 examination with Physics, Mathematics as compulsory subjects and Chemistry/ Computer Science/ Electronics/ Information Technology/ Biology/ Information Practice/ Biotechnology/ Technical Vocational subjects/ Agricultutre/ Engineering Graphics/ Business Studies/ Entrepreneurship as optional subjects and obtained atleast 45% marks (40% marks in case of candidate belonging to reserved category) in the subjects taken together.

faqs.question: Which specialisations are offered in the BTech course of BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri offers four-year BTech course in 10 different specialisations. In addition, a lateral entry BTech course is also offered by the institute. The admission criteria is entrance-based for the UG-level programmes. Mentioned below are the offered BTech course specialisations:

admission_eligibility.title: BIT Sindri Eligibility & Selection 2025
admission_eligibility.intro_text: BIT Sindri offers UG, PG and PhD programmes. The duration of these programmes varies from course to course. Admission to all the courses is based on entrance exam. Below are BIT Sindri courses along with their eligibility and selection criteria:

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri offers admission to BTech course through Jharkhand Combined Entrance Competitive Examination (JCECE). The selection for M.Tech programme is based on GATE score of the aspirants. Besides, the institute conducts a written test/ interview to shortlist aspirants for PhD programmes. Hence, direct admission is not possible at BIT Sindri. Aspirants need to pass selection rounds to get a seat in the institute. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Is BIT Sindri good for CSE?
faqs.answer: Computer Science Engineering is one of the specialisations offered in BTech by BIT Sindri. It is one of the popular specialisations. Students pursuing BTech CSE from BIT can participate in the placement drive conducted by the institute. Birsa Institute of Technology (BIT) Sindri has concluded its placement process for its BTech batch passing out in 2024. As per the latest report, the the highest package and average package offered during placements in 2024 stood at INR 16.50 LPA and INR 7.57 LPA , respectively. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Which exam is required for BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri accepts national-level entrance exam as well as conducts written test for providing admission to UG and PG courses. Below is course-wise accepted entrance exam for BIT Sindri: Course Selection Criteria BTech JEE Main MTech GATE/ BIT Entrance Exam PhD BIT Written Test Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for B.Tech at Birla Institute of Technology Sindri?
faqs.answer: The minimum eligibility is 50% in 12th or equivalent standard and JEECE rank. But the seats are limited and the candidates with High rank will have the better chance to get it. The safe side would be a rank of 1L or less in JEE Main or they can attend the JEECE the state entrance exam of Jharkhand for Engineering. The percentile needed in JEECE are not mentioned. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Is entrance exam required for BTech (lateral entry) at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri offers lateral entry in the BTech programme to Diploma holders in Engineering and Technology streams. The selection is based on score of the candidates in competitive examination conducted separately for them. The number of seats via lateral entry in all branches are 10% of the normal seats. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Who is eligible for PhD at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: Aspirants who have completed ME/ M.Tech or equivalent degree in respective discipline with at least 60% aggregate or equivalent CGPA (55% aggregate or equivalent CGPA for SC/ ST) from recognised university/ institute are eligible to apply for the PhD programme at BIT Sindri. Besides, candidates need to appear for written test/ interview conducted by the institute for admission to PhD programme. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Is GATE compulsory at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates need to have a valid GATE score for admission to MTech courses. Aspirants must also pass BE/ BTech or equivalent in respective discipline with at least 60% aggregate or equivalent CGPA (55% aggregate or equivalent CGPA for SC/ ST candidates) for admission in the MTech courses. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the latest cutoff information for B.Tech at Birla Institute of Technology Sindri?
faqs.answer: The latest cutoff was JEE Main rank of 181000 which is the maximum Rank they accepted last year. Last year this number was 185000 + which means that in upcoming time the maximum rank would be even lesser so it is recommend to try to secure 100000 rank or less in JEE Main to get a Secure Seat. Even though if you wish to get CSE or IT you have to secure around 40000 or less Rank in JEE Main. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the admission procedure of BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri admissions begin with registration. For MTech and PhD, candidates can fill out the application form on the official website of the institute. Candidates are shortlisted for BTech based on JEE Main score. Aspirants applying for BTech have to fill JEECE counselling form. Once the registration is done, aspirants need to appear for JEECE Counselling. GATE score is considered for admission to M.Tech programme. Aspirants applying for M.Tech can also appear for the entrance exam conducted by the institute. BIT conducts a written test for PhD admission. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: When will JEECE counselling start?
faqs.answer: JEECE 2024 counselling process has started. The candidates listed out in the state merit list will have to partcipate in the counselling process. For every round of JEECE counselling, fresh registrations will be accepted. During the JEECE counselling, the candidates will have to fill out their choice of courses and colleges in the order of preference. The allotment of seats will be announced online. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How many marks are necessary for B.Tech. in Civil Engineering at Birsa Institute of Technology, Sindri?
faqs.answer: You need to get more than 95 percentile in JEE-mains. Also, Candidate must have passed 10+2 examination with Physics, Mathematics as compulsory subjects and Chemistry/ Computer Science/ Electronics/ Information Technology/ Biology/ Information Practice/ Biotechnology/ Technical Vocational subjects/ Agricultutre/ Engineering Graphics/ Business Studies/ Entrepreneurship as optional subjects and obtained atleast 45% marks (40% marks in case of candidate belonging to reserved category) in the subjects taken together. For Lateral Entry-Candidate must have passed diploma in relevant field from a recognized board. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Can I get Birla Institute of Technology Sindri, B.Tech with 88% in JEE Main?
faqs.answer: The main thing that matters the most here is the rank. If you have a good rank then of course you can. Eligibility: The minimum eligibility is 50% in 12th and JEECE rank or JEE Main rank. Cutoff: Cutoff in BIT Sindri is quite competitive, and it gets more competitive with time. Last year the maximum rank which they accepted was 181000 wherein previous year of that maximum was 185000. Recommendation: The safer side will be 1lakh or less rank in JEE Main. If you got that congratulations but if you didn't get it still try to contact and talk to them. If they have extra seat in any quota then they can manage. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for B.Tech at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to fulfil the eligibility criteria to apply for the BIT Sindri BTech programme. It defines the education qualifications required for course admission. Below is a detailed eligibility for BTech: Candidates need to pass Class 12 standard or equivalent examination from a recognised board. Have studied Mathematics and Physics as compulsory subjects as well as Chemistry or Biology as optional subjects. Have secured a minimum aggregate of 45% in their qualifying exam if they are from the general category. However, reserved category candidates have to secure a minimum aggregate of 40%. NOTE: The above eligibility is taken as per JCECE. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How can I get admission to BTech at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri admission to BTech programme is based on JEE Main score. Candidates selected based on JEE Main score have to come for JEECE Counselling. JEECE counselling is held online. Registered and eligible candidates will have to participate in the JEECE counselling process for admissions into the BTech courses offered by the participating institutes of the state. Since there is no entrance exam, the admissions will be done based on the candidate's JEE Main scores. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for B.Tech at Birla Institute of Technology Sindri?
faqs.answer: The minimum eligibility is 50% in 12th or equivalent standard and JEECE rank. But the seats are limited and the candidates with High rank will have the better chance to get it. The safe side would be a rank of 1L or less in JEE Main or they can attend the JEECE the state entrance exam of Jharkhand for Engineering. The percentile needed in JEECE are not mentioned. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for MTech at BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to complete BE/ BTech or equivalent in their respective discipline with a minimum of 60% aggregate or equivalent CGPA (55% aggregate for SC/ ST) can apply for BIT Sindri MTech programme. Candidates must hold the documents proving their eligibility for verification at later stages of admission. Besides, aspirants must also qualify GATE or appear for a written exam conducted by BIT. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the JEECE application fee?
faqs.answer: During the JEECE application process, the candidates will have to pay the required application fee. For the General/EWS/BC-1/BC-2 category candidates, the JEECE application fee is INR 500. However, for SC/ST/Female candidates of all categories, the application fee is INR 250. Candidates will have to pay the application fee online i.e., through net banking/credit card/debit card. No other mode of application will be accepted. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the course fees for four years BTech in BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: BIT Sindri BTech fee varies for the regular and lateral entry courses. The total tuition fee for the BTech (lateral) is INR 87,040 . Moreover, the tuition fee for other BTech courses is INR 16,900 . There are multiple components included in the course fee structure. It must be noted that the mentioned fee is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is however, still subject to changes and hence, is indicative. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Does BIT Sindri offer seat reservation in the BTech course?
faqs.answer: Yes, BIT Sindri offer seat reservation in the BTech course to some of the category candidates. In order to avail a reserved seat, candidates have to submit a valid caste certificate or EWS certificate . The claims of reservation may be refunded if the submitted certificate is not valid or in proper format. Moreover, there are a total of 968 seats for BTech and BTech (lateral) at the institute. This seat count is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is still subject to changes and hence, is indicative. Also, the mentioned reservation details are as per multiple unofficial sources and hence, is indicative. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

data.title: BIT Sindri Placement Report 2025
summary: The BIT Sindri placement drive for 2025 recorded a highest package of INR 16.5 LPA . Over 120 companies made more than 560 placement offers .

Earlier, the BIT Sindri BTech placement report 2024 stated that the highest package stood at INR 16.50 LPA while, the average package remained at INR 7.57 LPA. The placement season 2024 saw 50 companies taking part in BIT Sindri recruitments. Moreover, 537 offers were made and 484 students have been placed as of 2024 placements. Earlier, the highest package stood at INR 50 LPA and an average package of INR 7 LPA during the BIT Sindri placements 2023. Further, 901 offers were made and more than 51 top companies participated in the BTech placements 2023.

faqs.question: How many students were placed during the recent BIT Sindri placement?
faqs.answer: The placement report of BIT Sindri for 2025 is yet to be released. As per the BTech placement report 2024, a total of 467 students are placed in BIT Sindri placements 2024. faqs.question: What are the placement activities in BIT Sindri?
faqs.answer: The Career Development Centre (CDC) at BIT Sindri sharpens students' interest and helps in planning for a satisfying future. Several Career Assessments such as - Interpretation of career and psychometric assessments tools such as DAT, Strong Interest Inventory, etc. are carried out as part of career counselling. Career Counseling programs consist of Group Counseling, Personal Counseling and Drop-In Advising. Moreover, webinars, mock interviews, Mock GDs, resume preparation are conducted as part of training programs. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

text: For more information about Birsa Institute of Technology, Sindri check out the below videos:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The Institute has over 1,00,000 text and reference books of various disciplines of science, engineering and technology. In addition, many departments such as metallurgy, chemical, production, etc. have their own departmental library.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 683 published reviews , 581 reviews are verified.

highlights.summary:
Currently, the institute offers a BTech programme in various specialisations of Engineering. The institute also offers an International Immersion Programme for UG students under BMU. Apart from this, the institute is linked with various top organisations such as Siemens, Microsoft, IBM, KPMG and more as their industry partners to provide students an industry exposure. These industry partners are establishing Centres of Excellence at the BMU campus. Siemens has set up a centre for PLM software, and IBM has set up an IBM Business Analytics Lab to provide students the hands-on training in recent software.
SOET BML Munjal University offers scholarships to meritorious and deserving students. The university appoints well-trained and expert faculty members. SOET BML Munjal University admission is based on merit and entrance exams. The institute accepts national entrance exams such as CUET, SAT, JEE Main, and others. The below-mentioned are SOET BML Munjal University highlights are tabulated below:
SOET BML Munjal University Highlights 2025

college_info_program.intro:
SOET BML Munjal University offers UG and PG courses across Engineering, Law, and others. BTech and BBA LLB are the popular programmes offered at BML Munjal University. The institute offers a full-time, four-year programme across various specialisations. The institute offers BTech specialisation in Computer Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Electronics & Computer Engineering.
BML Munjal University offers a three-year LLB programme which is recognized by the UGC. The institute has a comprehensive curriculum that prepares with dynamic and rewarding careers in various legal professions. The below-mentioned are SOET BML Munjal University popular programmes:
