college_info.college_name: DSCE Bangalore Fees 2026
DSCE Bangalore Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Honest review of my college.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from DSC Bangalore. Placements are around 80 to 90 percent of eligible students have been placed. Opportunities are good, especially for CS branches, other branches are fewer. Students have done internships in companies like Bosch, Toyota, and Infosys. This is a decent college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are decent. I do not go to a hostel because I am a day scholar, college infrastructure is good and well maintained. Rules are strict though. A hostel is available for males and females. Mess food when heard by students its bad just average, classrooms are decent below average.
detailed_review.Faculty: In the EEE department classes are strict, I do not like the head, the rules are more and attendance is just outrageous. Compulsory attendance, mandatory presence. Exams are kind of manageable, a lot of AAT quizzes and assignments. Internals are difficult but okay.
detailed_review.Other: The course is the hardest part, it is so difficult to understand. Teachers are helpful but equipments do not always work.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's good for CSE, I would say, and if you need a good campus life, then also it's good to join.

detailed_review.Placements: 80%of students get placed, including all the branches. In my branch, CSE 90% students get placed. The average overall is 8 to 9 LPA, but the CSE average is around 10 to 12 LPA, which is good but not the best. The highest last year was more than 55 LPA. The placement % is increasing every year, with many companies like Google, Accenture, Infosys, etc, are recruiting every year with a good package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college campus is really good, and the infrastructure is also good. It has all facilities like labs, Wi-Fi, canteen, and on-campus hostel. The food in the mess is not good, as I have heard, that the food in the canteen, is the food good;, it's like average. Some dishes are good, and some are not.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum, I would say, is the same as other engineering colleges, a little backward, not up to, but the faculty members, I would say, are supportive and approachable. You can talk to them personally if you feel like it. The exams are not tough. They are moderate. The attendance criteria are quite strict, especially in your 1st year.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is quite lively. There is something else happening inside the campus. There are plenty of clubs that are quite active. College life is fun if you join.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Digital Communications and Networking
reviews.review_title: Review of Dayanand Sagar College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement in our course is approximately 80-85 percent of the eligible students. The highest package offered in our course is 12 LPA. The average package is around 6 LPA-7 LPA. Top Recruiting companies were Qualcomm, Tata Technologies, BHEL, BEL, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available for our course are extremely good. Wi-Fi facility is available. Labs are well-equipped with instruments and machinery. There are modern computer labs. VLSI lab is also present. Hostel quality is also good. All essential facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The professor of our course is good. The teaching quality of our faculty members is good. They are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is relevant. Students got trained and became industry-ready. The semester examinations are moderate.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: College is amazing due to its extracurricular activities and amazing coding clubs at a high rate.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80-85 % students got placed. The lowest package ranges from 9-10 LPA. The highest package ranges from 30-40 LPA. NTT Data, Microsoft, TCS, and Google are the top recruiting companies. About 85% of students got internships in different companies like Microsoft, NTT Data, and JP Morgan. Data analyst and AI/ML engineer roles are offered to students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good. It is just like a new techno park. The hostel food and living are also good. It feels more like home to me. The hostel timings are quite amazing on the campus. Hostel guards are quite friendly and helpful to everyone.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching methods are quite impressive, which makes students industry-ready. The pass percentage is about 95%. The exam methods are very easy, understandable, and practical, which makes us more industry-ready and job-ready. The placement preparation is quite good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering is good for placements.

detailed_review.Placements: It is an old college and good for placements. About 60% of students are placed in our college, but I do not know exactly. 7 lakhs is the average package in our college for EC students. The maximum package is 30 lakhs per year in Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering for EC.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, they have good facilities, and all courses are available. The hostel infrastructure is good, and food is provided in the hostel mess. The fee for the hostel is around Rs. 2,00,000. Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and a library are available in this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering has teachers who are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. We have three mid exams for each semester, and we have 50 as the average of the mid exams. 21 marks are required out of 50 marks to write the semester exam at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Business Systems
reviews.review_title: It is an old college and good for placements.

detailed_review.Placements: My course is CB (Computer Science and Business Systems). It is the first batch to pass out from our college in 2025. I think 20%-30% of students were placed in campus placements, not exactly. One got a 19 Lacs package from Computer Science and Business Systems.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel infrastructure is good at the same college, too. They conduct games between courses and also provide gifts for winning. Conducted games like cricket, kabaddi, volleyball, choo-choo, and throw ball. They have commitments to conduct events, functions, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good. Before the semester exam, they conduct three mid-exams and take the average of 50 and add it to the semester. They make the students study computer languages like C and C++ from the first year to make them industry-ready. On average, mid-exams must maintain 21 marks out of 50 to write the semester exam.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: COMEDK people will not be satisfied because they pay a high fee.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good for computer science students, and it's related branches. I can say it's upto 80 to 90%, and for other branches, it is only 30 to 40%. If you are interested in coding, you can opt computer science and engineering.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I can say that classrooms infrastructure is average. Labs are good with AC facility. Coming to hostel, I want to give minus (the worst) but they collect more fees that too it is also in the name of trust. Food is also not upto to the fee we pay. I only stayed there for one year and shifted to PG.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty teach very well and some don't know anything. Curriculum they follow VTU Belgaum, Karnataka curriculum. But still, this is autonomous. Exams are conducted 3 times. You will write internals and after that you will write semester-end examination.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is amazing. It has a good campus and good placements. Everything is amazing.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good in this college. In my branch, 70% of students get placements. The minimum package is 3 LPA, and the highest package is 8 LPA in my department. In the CS department, the highest package is 25 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Google, Wipro, BSNL, etc. The percentage of students who get internships in my course is 100% because many companies offer internships. The top roles offered are from web developer to senior web developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good. Our college has labs, classrooms, Wi-Fi, and digital boards. The quality of faculty in my hostel is very good. The food is amazing. It has a hospital on the campus. Every kind of sport and game is available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are PhD holders. They have good knowledge. Their teaching quality is good. The material they provide is actually good. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes us industry-ready. Semester exams are not that difficult, but easy. Many students get above 7 CGPA in each semester. Faculty members are good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it is cheap for the management quota, and it allows me to apply for any kind of job in the engineering field. I wish it would improve the building of my department. Events and fests are amazing. The campus is crowded, and surroundings are actually very good. It offers scholarships. It also conducts extracurricular activities. There are different kinds of cultural groups.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (IOT and Cyber Security including Block Chain Technology)
reviews.review_title: Finally, I conclude it is worth to join.

detailed_review.Placements: The overall placement and offers are good. The highest package is 52 LPA , the medium package is 10 LPA, and the lowest package is 6 LPA, I like my college. The overall placement is not bad, about 55% of students have received a placement offer, I appreciate my college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have good campus with a big garden. I like a hill we have to climb a hill daily. If you want to join our college, we have a rock garden. Good sophisticated library with all facilities, a wide variety of books from school to master's degree, all of them in a bite.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is good, not bad. All of them clarify your doubts with good interests. All of them help a lot. Pass percentage is about 85% but difficult to score as it is an autonomous college affiliated with VTU, Belgaum, Karnataka, India.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with college, good placements in ECE department, and fee is little bit higher side.

detailed_review.Placements: Percentage of students placed this year is 80%. The highest package is 56 LPA, average package is 6.5 LPA, and the lowest is 5 LPA. Top recruiting companies for ECE are Texas Instruments, Qualcomm, Robert Bosch, NXP Semiconductors, TCS, Capgemini, Infosys, Cognizant, Wipro, Accenture, etc. Percentage of students get internships are about 65-70% at Bosch, TCS, etc. Top roles offered by companies are embedded system engineer, VLSI design engineer, firmware developer, IoT developer, automation engineer, and software developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs in ECE blocks are well-equipped with all the required instruments, classrooms are spacious and well-ventilated. DSCE campus has two hostels NRI and Indian hostels. Food is served four times a day with well-maintained hygiene in mess. Library of DSCE is one of the biggest libraries in Bangalore. All books are available for your interest. Sports and gym facilities are there at the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are well-qualified and knowledgeable. Most faculty members have a doctorate degree as their qualification. Course curriculum is up-to-date. Teachers are always available to solve your doubts. All faculty members are cooperative. Semester exams are moderate level, and pass percentage is 80%.
detailed_review.Other: Main fest of DSCE is Furore, and other fest is Vibrations, etc.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: All about Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Since it is a core branch, the placements are not as good as in branches like Computer Science, and also very few people are chosen for campus interviews. The average package is around 4-5 LPA. It is important to develop skills to get placed in a good company. Not only your CGPA but skills also matter.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is very old and not well maintained for the fee they are collecting from students. It is old and not worth the whooping fee of 180,000 per year. The food is also very bad according to my friends who stay there. It is better to choose a PG near the campus, as they are cheaper and student-friendly.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are good and friendly; some faculty members are a little strict, but overall, good faculty with experience and understanding of the subject. There are 3 internal exams and 1 semester-end exam along with labs. The pass percentage is decent, and you can easily score an 8 SGPA by studying one night before exams.
detailed_review.Other: There are many clubs and fests in our college like NBS, Aaroha, Trinaada, etc. Fests like Furore and Vibrations are popular among students.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Dissatisfied a lot because of the faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements aren't that great in the Electrical and Electronics Engineering department. Most of the students end up getting into the IT fields as very few core companies come to the college. Hardly 10 people get into core companies out of around 120. The highest package is 19 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs have old equipment. Some don't work properly. Even the computers are out of date. Some classrooms don't have proper ventilation. Fans though present, don't work that well. Hostel is quite expensive so many prefer staying in PGs. Hostel Food is decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very strict. Everything is in their hands so we should always be behind them. They make us run behind them. Some are okay. They are qualified and knowledgeable but they don't know everything e. g. in labs. The curriculum is relevant. Semester exams again depend on the teachers. Sometimes it's very hard but otherwise, it's okay. The pass percentage in the worst cases is 70%.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college with good facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: It's a good placement here. The average package offered is 10 LPA. The highest salary was 51 LPA last year. If you are good at studying, you can easily get upto 7 LPA - 8 LPA packages here. Top companies visit for recruitment like Google and Microsoft, you should be good at coding.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It's a good infrastructure with all the facilities like smart classes. All the equipments in labs are available. It is not a big college. It has only 28 acres of land. You will get many food shops nearby but you won't get any sports opportunities here. There is only one ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful here and a good curriculum is maintained. Semester exams are not that difficult. If you study well, you can maintain a good CGPA. Overall, it's a good college to look for a great experience and good workplace. Teachers are good and helpful.
detailed_review.Other: The main problem of the college is the language barrier like most of the people speak Kannada which will be difficult for north people.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Campus is green and big but not the knowledge provided by lectures.

detailed_review.Placements: About 65% of students got placed. The highest package is 45 LPA and the lowest is 3 LPA. Finacle and Edgeverve Dassault Systems are the top recruiting companies. 35% of students got internships in companies like Google and Amazon. Full stack developer, data analyst, software engineer, and cloud engineer are the roles offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Wi-Fi is not available in the college but Wi-Fi is available in the hostel 
All labs are not good. Library is good and the availability of some books is limited. Only some classrooms are facilitated with projectors. Hostel is good and it has washing machines. Food is also good. Canteen food is too expensive compared to outside hotels, sports and games are encouraged.
detailed_review.Faculty: I think this is a considerable issue if one teacher takes more than 4 subjects. I don't know how they have done specification in all those subjects. Some teachers knowledge is also not satisfying. Syllabus framing is also bad. Exams are moderately difficult. Pass percentage is 35%.
detailed_review.Other: The course is good and offers us many opportunities but it would save one's money and time if they come after doing diploma, provided they are very serious about becoming engineer. Events and fests are frequently conducted in the college. There are separate clubs for every activity interested one can join and participate.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Most underrated college in Bangalore.

detailed_review.Placements: Spoken to some seniors, they have been placed in decent companies but they had to do extra courses on the side to land those jobs. About 70% of students get placed in top companies depending on their CGPA. Google has been to DSCE to recruit. There is a computer science club and the members are placed 100%.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College campus is really beautiful and peaceful. You can study anywhere on the campus. Canteen food is good. Sports here might feel under appreciated. College has a wide spectrum of clubs and associations for students with various interests to join. This will help you to connect and communicate with many people.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly skilled professionals. They know what they are doing. Teachers teach very well, and they stick to the curriculum and help get through the exams. Students have to do courses or be part of workshops on the side to be industry-ready and land their desired jobs.
detailed_review.Other: Crowd in this college is crazy.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: There is good infrastructure in the college.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in my first year but our seniors got placed with a salary that ranges from 8-12 LPA. The average package is 8 LPA. The highest package is 50 LPA. There are many placement and internship opportunities in college. Computer Science and related branches get good placements. The average package is 10 LPA. Mechanical and civil course placements are not very good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is excellent. There is Wi-Fi everywhere on the college campus and in the hostel. Classrooms are also good and with a projector. The library is very good. There are all types of books in the library. A digital library is also available, but the ground is small.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good and friendly. They are well-qualified PhD holders from well-known institutes. They are very helpful but some are not from that good college. The course curriculum is very hectic and stressful. There are three internal exams in each semester and internal lab assessments. Semester-end exams are normal.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the data science course because it has a good scope for the future. Many fests are organised in the college. It also conducts extracurricular activities. The campus crowd is very good. There are students from all over India.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering - The 5th best college in Bangalore.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a CSE student. There is so much demand for CSE engineers. The packages are also quite decent. The average is 10 LPA. Top companies like Amazon, Wipro, TCS, and IBM visit the college. The highest package last year was about 51 LPA. Internship opportunities are also good as Bangalore is a tech hub.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is very good. Many buildings are newly made or renovated. Each classroom has a projector installed in it for the visual learning of students. The library is well-equipped with the latest books in it. The hostel is also good but the fee is high. The mess food is average. There is a big sports ground in the college. Tennis and basketball courts are also there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified. Some of them are also Ph.D. holders. Sometimes, they start speaking in Kannada which makes it difficult for other state students. There are 3 internals and 1 semester-end examination in each semester. The passing percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: There are 2 fests conducted every year in the college namely Furore and Vibration. The college is decent for extracurricular activities. The coding culture of the college is very good. The campus is full of greenery.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Dayananda Sagar College Of Engineering, Bangalore.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement status of DSCE is quite good in comparison to other colleges. For the CS and Electronics branches, the highest salary package offered is around 11 LPA, and for all the branches it drops down to 5 LPA. For the year 2024, the placement percentage was 97.8%. Internship opportunities are also great for us. This college has a dedicated cell for placements and internships to help students get their placements and internships at various companies and areas.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of DSCE is good with beautiful department buildings and a park. The campus has a total area of 29 acres and it is green. Each of the department is well-equipped with the equipment required for their field. There is no shortage of any form of equipment or opportunities for performing our desired task in that field. There are two types of hostels for boys and only one type for girls. Boys hostel is quite good and clean. For the NRI hostel, the total fee is Rs 2,20,000 and for the Indian hostel, it is 1,80,000.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members for the first year which I have got are good. They help with our doubts and follow the method of writing on the board for teaching. Each of the faculty member is well qualified in their respective fields/subjects. Overall the teaching quality is good in comparison to other colleges of the same levels. Semester exams are between moderate to slightly hard. Studying the subject at least 3 days before the exams is more than enough to score full marks in our final semester exams. The questions are quite easy and are not complicated.
detailed_review.Other: The crowd of DSCE is vibrant and lively all the time due to a huge number of students from various branches, domains, and courses.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Dayananda Sagar College Of Engineering is one of the most reputed colleges in Bangalore.

detailed_review.Placements: DSCE offers a very good placements almost 85 out of 100 students got placed in DSCE. The minimum salary package offered is 4.5 LPA and the maximum salary package offered is 23 LPA in Mech and 53 LPA in ECE. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Accenture, Infosys, Microsoft, Google, Amazon, PhonePe, Bosch, Mercedes Benz, etc. Overall, DSCE is good at placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Mechanical engineering is one of the oldest engineering branches in DSCE with well installed labs for CADE, boiler lab, mechanical lab, 3D printing lab, robotics lab, EV operation lab, etc. All faculty members are well-qualified and very supportive and cooperative with students. There are two boys hostels and one girls hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching faculty members of DSCE are well-qualified and supportive in all the aspects. Course curriculum is very relative to industry requirement with well-installed EV operation lab, etc. Exams in DSCE are conducted very strictly. There are three CIA (continuous internal assessment) and one SEE (semester end examination).
detailed_review.Other: DSCE is one the most reputed colleges in Bangalore. Campus size of DSCE is small but has all the basic equipment of a top-class college

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (IOT and Cyber Security including Block Chain Technology)
reviews.review_title: I have written everything based on my understanding.

detailed_review.Placements: My course is new in this college. It has happened just 2 years to this branch in this college so students did not get placed now. After 2 years, placements of this branch will be done. Top recruiting companies for this course are not selected now but for CSE core, it is Google.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library of this college is very good. It is the biggest library in Bangalore. The infrastructure is very large. It consists of 5 floors. This college has a digital library. The hostel fee of this college is too much. There are 2 hostels in this college. One is Indian Hostel, and the other is NRI Hostel. The yearly price of NRI Hostel is Rs. 2,15,000. The fee of Indian Hostel is Rs. 1,80,000. Hostels are not so good. The food quality is very bad. Indian Hostel is a little better but NRI Hostel is the worst. In the mess, insects are there. I don't recommend NRI Hostel. Games are not allowed in the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable, but some are not. Our computer teacher does not know much. She teaches us by mugging. This course is very relevant because, in the coming years, this branch will be on top. Our incoming world is totally shifting towards IoT. Semester exams are easy only. They are not so tough. The pass percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: Our batch is nice. Teachers are also good. She explains us topic nicely. The best thing about this course is that we can learn IoT and cyber security together. I wish that teachers would avoid teaching by PPTs because they just open and read. They do not try to make us understand. They should explain the topic by themselves. There are 2 fests on this campus. One is Furoura and the other is Vibration. They are the big fests of Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering. There are no scholarships for non-Karnataka students. Surroundings of this college are nice.

college_info.college_name: DSCE Bangalore Course Admissions 2025: Application Process, Eligibility, Courses & Fee

admission.title: DSCE Bangalore Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text:
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering offers three courses, namely a Bachelor of Engineering (BE), Master of Technology (MTech), Master of Business Administration (MBA), Master of Computer Applications (MCA), PhD, and MSc (Research). The college offers entrance exam-based admission to all the courses. Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering offers a range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral courses in Engineering, Basic Science, and Humanities. The mode of application at the institute is online. Admission to various courses is entrance exam.

In the Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE) undergraduate (UG) system of admission, those seeking entry must first appear in an entrance test such as KCET, COMEDK UGET, or JEE (non-Karnataka applicants) , then undergo a merit ranking, according to the results of such tests, and must have completed the class 12 qualification with Physics and Mathematics as mandatory subjects. These entrance tests are merit based and the admissions may be management quota based.

1. Eligibility Check: You must have a minimum of 45% aggregate marks in Physics and Mathematics and pass the class 12 or its equivalent examination and one of the following: Chemistry, Biology, Computer Science or Electronics . In the case of Karnataka SC/ST/OBC , the total is 40% .

2. Entrance Exam: Enrol in and take one of the qualification entrance examinations. KCET: Karnataka Common Entrance Test, which is administered by the Karnataka Examinations Authority (KEA). COMEDK UGET: Karnataka consortium of medical, engineering and dental college entrance examination. JEE: Joint Entrance Examination.

3. Merit-Based Admission: Admissions are made on the basis of the meritorious ranking received in the entrance exams.

4. College Application: Once you have passed the entrance examination, submit your applications on the official site of Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering using your eligible grades.

5. Counseling/Seat Allotment: Take up the seat allocation process.

Management Quota: The college has had admissions based on a management quota , besides the merit based admissions. In the case of management quota admissions, a donation in addition to the fees may usually be a requirement.

faqs.question: How to register for COMEDK Counselling?
faqs.answer: Candidates seeking admission to BTech course through COMEDK 2024 scores must follow the below-mentioned steps to register for COMEDK Counselling 2024: Step 1 : Visit the official website of COMEDK at comedk.org. Step 2 : Login to Applicant Login ID using the application number and password. Step 3 :  On the next page, click on the 'Counselling Registration' Tab Step 4 : Verify the mentioned details and pay the registration fee to participate in COMEDK Counselling 2023 Step 5 : On the successful payment message, close the tab and go back to your application form. Step 6 : Click on the ‘Document Upload' Tab and upload all the required documents. Step 7 : Frequently check the application form and email to keep a track of the verification status of uploaded document.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria to get admission into MCA course at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: The eligibility criteria for admission to the MCA course at Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering include the basic eligibility criterion and primary eligibility criterion . The basic eligibility requires a Bachelor's degree featuring a minimum aggregate of 50% (45% for SC/ST/other reserved categories) across all degree examinations. Additionally, candidates must have specific electives in their degree , including subjects like Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Sciences, Computer Programming, Computer Application, Business Mathematics, or Business Statistics. Primary eligibility criteria require students to secure a valid score in any of the following entrance exams- PGCET / KMAT . Then, the college releases the merit list and conducts the counselling on the basis of scores applicants secured in the entrance exam.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam does Dayanand Sagar College of Engineering accept for BTech/ BE courses?
faqs.answer: Dayanand Sagar College of Engineering BE admission is completely entrance-based. The college accepts the scores of KCET and COMEDK UGET. Both entrance exams are state-based-entrance-exam , candidates with a valid score in any of the following entrance exams, followed by counselling can get admission to the DSCE BE course . KCET is conducted by the Karnataka Examinations Authority (KEA), and COMEDK UGET is conducted by the Consortium of Medical, Engineering, and Dental Colleges of Karnataka (COMEDK).

faqs.question: Does Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering (DSCE) provide scholarships?
faqs.answer: Yes, DSCE Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering offers a number of scholarship programs to its students. Scholarships are provided in collaboration with organizations such as NITI Aayog, Government of India, Dayananda Sagar University, and Innovation labs supported by MNCs. Contributions are also received from the governmental departments. These are - Ministry of Minority Affairs, Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, and Ministry of Labour & Employment. The scholarship offered by DSCE caters to a broader spectrum of scholarships under different heads so that eligible students receive financial help. They are set up to assist students from all kinds of socio-economic backgrounds with both central and state options.

faqs.answer: At Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, students can benefit from scholarships supported by the National Institution for Transforming India (NITI Aayog), the Government of India, the Dayananda Sagar University, as well as Innovation Labs backed by major multinational companies. Ministries like Minority Affairs, Labour & Employment and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities grant scholarships as well. With these financial aids, more students can participate in education.

college_info.college_name: Dhirubhai Ambani University (formerly DA-IICT): Courses, Fees, Admissions 2025, Placements, Ranking, Cutoff

highlights.summary:
Established in 2001, Dhirubhai Ambani University formerly DA-IICT is named after the founder of Reliance Group, late Dhirubhai Ambani. The university offers UG, PG, and PhD courses Engineering, Science, and other streams and the flagship courses are BTech, and MSc.
DA-IICT admission is made on merit and entrance exams. The university accepts JEE Main, CEED, GATE, etc. DA-IICT is spread over 50 acres of area and has top-notch infrastructure, which is surrounded by lush green gardens with equipped classrooms, a library, a sports complex, a cafeteria, a hostel, and others. It is accredited with A+ grade by NAAC and has approval of UGC and AIU. The key highlights of Dhirubhai Ambani University are below- mentioned below in the table provided below:

college_info.college_name: Dhirubhai Ambani University (formerly DA-IICT) Fees 2026
Dhirubhai Ambani University (formerly DA-IICT) Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing
reviews.review_title: College tour of DAIICT by a first semester guy.

detailed_review.Placements: The college placement seems to be going down with time, similar to the placement of CS engineering students as the college has almost all branches related to computer Science and programming. The companies visiting for internships are better than the ones visiting for actual placement. 35 percent of the batch is placed, top recruiting company is Unified Apps, and the top roles for MNC are Software Development Engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The mess is just compulsory for the first year as of now. The food at the mess is not that great, sports are good, though you have to bring your own equipment, and there are medical facilities available throughout the year. There is Wi-Fi for all students with a limit of 20 GB a day.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is very good, especially for the first sem. There is a special course offered by this college in the Mathematics and Computing programme, in which you get experience with algorithms and mathematics. Teachers are mostly qualified, educated from top institutes like IIT.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and VLSI Design (EVD)
reviews.review_title: I think our college is very good, especially for our course.

detailed_review.Placements: This is a new course, DAIICT, and the first batch will be passing in 2029, but other branches like ICT and Master's placements are good. I think the semiconductor industry is being established near Gandhinagar, so they want good engineers for so many companies, so placements will be very good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, all types of labs, classrooms, a library and many facilities are on our campus, and these things are very good. Hostels are also good. There is a mess and a canteen for first-year students, the mess is compulsory after completion of the first year. You have a choice if you want to eat in a mess, you can, and canteens are always open. The mess has an average quality of food, while the canteen has good quality food. Medical facilities will be provided by the college, and they are good. It has a particular time for doctors. There's a huge sports complex.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, well-qualified, knowledgeable, and have very good teaching quality. Our course provides you with added courses like semiconductor fabrication in Sirsi Pilani after the first year. Our course is very good. Semester exams are difficult, but there are students with merit who are capable of passing, while others are not.
detailed_review.Other: I am from Gujarat, so this is the best college in Gujarat. I think this is a very good opportunity for me regarding my result. Also, this is the first college in Gujarat by ranking, and placements in the course are very good because I think the semiconductor industry will boom in Gujarat in the future. Many events are held here. Scholarships and all those activities have special courses for attending these, and very good scholarship assistance will be provided by our college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Information and Communication Technology with minor in Computational Science
reviews.review_title: Good environment. Good college structure. Around 18 LPA is the average package.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% plus students got placed. Average salary package is 18 LPA. The highest is 53 LPA. Apple, Google, Goldman Sachs recruit. Around 20% students got internships in good companies. Unfiapp hired so many students this year. And so many companies are coming to campus. Students do competitive coding.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure. Non-AC classrooms. Laboratory buildings have AC and are open 24/7. Library is really good. Hostel is also good. Two-sharing and three-sharing rooms are available. Eco-friendly campus. There are so many birds. But sometimes monkeys come into hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are helpful, and they can teach well. Professors are really helpful if you are interested in research. All professors are doing research in their areas and are generally available at the laboratory. Curriculum is relevant. Exams are tough, but not helpful for placement. There is always one subject, like language and literature.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Where teach dreams meet top-tier placements.

detailed_review.Placements: This college maintains a placement rate of 90% for its B.Teach and M.Teach programs. Companies like Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Goldman Sachs, Oracle, etc. Frequently recruit from this college. The average package for B.Teach students ranges from Rs. 12-18 LPA while the highest package can go up to 50 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This college has 50 acres of area in total with well-maintained lawns, a garden, and open space. Equipped with smart classrooms, seminar halls, and lecture theatres with modern audio-visual facilities. Boys and girls have different hostel blocks with decent living conditions.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are student-friendly and provide guidance for projects. The B.Teach curriculum covers AI/ML, cybersecurity, cloud computing, IoT, and VLSI keeping pace with industry trends. Students can choose from a wide range of electives. Honesty some semesters has back-to-back assignments, quizzes, and lab submissions leads to stress.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was interested in coding and want to pursue it at one of the best colleges in India.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing
reviews.review_title: It is a great place for good exposure. I have a great college experience.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 75% of students got placed this term. The highest package is around 1 crore per annum. The average package is 17 LPA and the lowest package is 8 LPA. Companies like Apple, Google, and Goldman Sachs visit the college for placements. Around 80% of students got internships. SDE and other tech-related roles are offered. Placements are good here. Apple is the new company to come to campus to hire students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has good hostels. Labs and classrooms are well-equipped. The lecture theatre is good. A mess facility is available and mandatory for freshers. The canteen service is good. The annual sports fest is awesome.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are easy to communicate with, and they are available on campus, so it is easy to approach them. The course curriculum is relevant. The current demand for MNC graduates is high in the industry as they are well-trained in mathematics and problem-solving. Each semester has 3 exams, 2 in the semester and 1 at the end of the semester. Each exam has its own weightage and the curriculum is divided in that manner.
detailed_review.Other: Lots of events and activities are going on.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing
reviews.review_title: Engineering heaven of Gujarat.

detailed_review.Placements: Here, placements at DAIICT are very awesome. Although there is a lack of tech jobs. There are also 90% of placements. Companies are JP Morgan, Morgan Stanley, TCS, Reliance, and so on. If we want to go into such huge MNCs then of course take admission in DAIICT.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members at DAIICT have played a pivotal role in shaping my academic and personal growth. Their dedication to teaching, passion for their subjects, and willingness to support and guide students are truly commendable. The learning environment they foster encourages curiosity, critical thinking, and a deeper understanding of complex concepts. Beyond just imparting knowledge, they inspire us to challenge ourselves, think innovative, and stay committed to excellence. Their mentorship extends far beyond the classroom, making a lasting impact on our future. I am truly grateful for the continuous encouragement and invaluable guidance provided by the faculty members at DAIICT.
detailed_review.Other: Currently, I am pursuing B.Tech in Mathematics and Computing at this college. There are many degrees in B.Tech as well as in M.Tech and Ph.Ds like information and communication technology and minor in computational science also courses for electronics and very large scale integrated courses. No more advice, just join and feel.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Good enough to start here!

detailed_review.Placements: 70-80% are placed, with the highest being 50 LPA, mostly by Google. The lowest is TCS at 4 LPA. Top recruiters include UnifyApps, Amazon, and Sears. Most of the offers come with chances of getting a job later. Top roles include Software Engineer, Data Analyst, Software Developer, Web Developer, and Designer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel rooms, Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and the library are all good. Hostel rooms are non-AC, but Wi-Fi is really good. The canteen food is average, but around the college, there are lots of options to eat. Medical facilities are also good. The gym is not that great, and the game facilities are average.
detailed_review.Faculty: 80% of faculty members are helpful. All are well-qualified and knowledgeable in their particular areas. The teaching quality is fine and depends on your interest and patterns. The electives offered are good, but choosing by first-come-first-serve (FCFS) is not ideal. Exams are not that difficult if you are prepared, but comparatively, exams here are hard.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Really very good infrastructure and the placements are very good.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2023, 99% placement was done, and in 2024, due to the recession, only 58% to 60% of students were placed. Our top recruiting companies are Amazon, Morgan Stanley, Sprinkler, and Microsoft. This year, Apple also recruited 7 or 8 people from our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are excellent, like the best college in Gujarat. The hostels of DAIICT are amazing, and the ground is very big, giving a feel like we are in a real cricket ground. The medical facilities are also good; 2 or 3 doctors come from other hospitals.
detailed_review.Faculty: One star I am deducting because of the faculty; they are not as good as they must be. And here, getting CPI is very hard because of the relative grading, and all the top students of Gujarat and from other states gather here. Yes, the course is very relevant to me, as it provides a wide range of opportunities.
detailed_review.Other: My course is ICT, and it is a very good course as we can pursue our career in Information and Technology as well as Electronics and Communication. The fests are just awesome, and Synapse is the best event in our college, with about 15 thousand people gathering for this auspicious event.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: A state of the art infrastructure with average placement opportunity and a high fees.

detailed_review.Placements: In the years 2022-2024, approximately 370 students out of 430 (approx.) were placed through on-campus placements. The median package was nearly 12-13 LPA. The average package was around 17 LPA. The highest package was 84 LPA offered to 2 students from Atlassian. Top recruiting companies were Microsoft, Sprinklr, Amazon, Goldman Sachs, Google, and Bank of New York.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for the ICT course is top-notch. There are state-of-the-art lab facilities and a library containing around 30,000 books with a reading room that is open until 12 am, and for exam days, the timing is until 2 am. All the professors are well qualified and experts in their field.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the professors are well qualified and experts in their respective fields; they are also very friendly and helpful. For exams, there are a total of 3 exams in one semester: 2 mid-semester exams and an end-semester examination. To score a good GPA is a little bit tough.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in ICT (Software Systems)
reviews.review_title: Value for money college.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 90–95% of students get campus placements at our college. In my batch of 121 students all the students gets campus placements. The highest package was 36 lpa, and the lowest package was 6 lpa. The average package for our course is 8–12 LPA. Around 100% of students get internships with the stipend. The top companies are Paytm, Amazon, Wordpress, Flipkart, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has a very wide campus. The infrastructure of our college is well developed. The college has all the facilities, including Wi-Fi, canteen, mess, hostel, labs, library, swimming pool, medical facility, sports facility, etc. The college computer labs are working properly. The college also focuses on sports activities. There are all sports facilities available in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of the college are excellent. All the teachers are focused on students development. Teachers are highly qualified and are masters in their respective fields of study. The exams at our college are tough and to pass them, we have to study properly. Teachers used to conduct various competitions for skill development.
detailed_review.Other: Our college is one of the best colleges. All the facilities are top-class. There are various festivals and events organized at our college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: From the 7th semester, students are eligible to attend placement interviews. Companies like Google, Microsoft, Atlassian, Sprinklr, Amazon, etc., visit our campus for placements. The highest salary package offered is 82 LPA. The lowest salary package is 7 LPA and 16.06 LPA is the average salary package. Around 100% of students get placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: At DAIICT, the hostel has two types of rooms: double occupancy and triple occupancy rooms. In every room for each student, there is a bed, a cupboard, a table, and a chair. It provides Wi-Fi facilities to students. There are 5 canteens. You can choose from where you want to buy. Overall, the food quality is good. Doctors visit our campus twice a day.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors have expertise in their fields. Most of the faculty have done Ph.D.s from IITs and abroad universities. The lectures happen in the lecture theatre and CEP. There are 3 exams per semester. Two in-semester exams and one end-semester exams are held. On average, about 99% of students pass.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Our college is good in terms of placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college provides the best placements. Almost 90% of students got placed in our college. Many companies visit our college to recruit students. Top recruiting companies are Microsoft, Google, and Amazon. The highest salary package offered is 90 LPA. The average salary package offered is 19 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college and the hostel is good. Our college provides us with all the facilities. They provide sufficient facilities. The mess facility is not available in our college. We have many food courts where we can get anything at any time.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are highly educated. They are Ph.D. holders. They have been educated by well-known institutes and universities. Semester exams are a bit difficult. It is a bit difficult to pass. Many students fail.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Our college has excellent placements and a good hostel.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has good placements. Top recruiting companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Techno Sprinkle, etc., visit our campus. Almost 80-90% of students get internships. The highest salary package offered is 90 LPA and the average salary package offered is 20 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel life is good. Our college provides good infrastructure. Sports activities are done very often. Mess facilities are not available.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are well qualified. All teachers are Ph.D. holders. We have midterm exams and an end-term exam. Midterm exams are easy, but the end-semester exams are difficult. The pass percentage is 90%. The teaching quality is good.
detailed_review.Other: Extracurricular activities are held. The campus life is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Our college has a perfect coding culture and competition.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest salary package offered is 82 LPA. The average salary package offered is 26 LPA. Many renowned companies visit our college. Top recruiting companies are Microsoft, Google, Amazon, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides 24X7 Wi-Fi. Classrooms are huge and comfortable. There is a resource center in our college where we can read after study hours. It also has a library in it. There are many labs. They are in good condition with all equipment. There are canteens for vegetarian and non-vegetarian food items. They provide a variety of food items. There are grounds for football, cricket, volleyball, badminton, basketball, table tennis, etc. Our college has a gymnasium. It is in perfect condition. Hostels are cleaned regularly. Our college provides medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are supportive and qualified. They teach all the necessary things to shape us as an engineer. The academics are set like considering every single thing in mind about our course. Exams are moderate. We have relative grading. It depends on professors.
detailed_review.Other: There are around 180 seats in ICT.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Information and Communication Technology with minor in Computational Science
reviews.review_title: Our college provides good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 95% of students are placed at DAIICT. The highest salary package offered was around 54.22 LPA by Google, the lowest was around 7 LPA, and the average was around 18 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Google, D.E. Shaw, Microsoft, Sprinklr, Goldman Sachs, LinkedIn, Wells Fargo, etc. Around 25% of students got internships from our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is average. Some of the labs are good, but some need to be improved. Classrooms are average. The hostel is average. The mess and canteen facilities are, as usual, below average. Medical facilities are fine here. You don't need to spend money on simple medical checkups.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some professors are good, but some are boring. The grading policies are bad. Students are under lots of stress and anxiety. The schedules are also very hectic. Exam patterns are not good. You can hardly get any time for extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing
reviews.review_title: Our campus is not so good.

detailed_review.Placements: Maximum number of students get placed in our branch because our course structure is good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facility is good but there are many mosquitoes and insects during monsoon. Infrastructure of our course is very good. Hostels have common washrooms.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in our college are good but few are not good. There are 3-semester exams, 2-semester exams, and one end-semester exam. Some professors are very helpful with studies and extracurricular activities. The course curriculum is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Our college provides good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students who got placed is above 95%. The highest package offered is 81 LPA, the lowest package is 7 LPA, and the average package is 16.06 LPA. Top recruiting companies like DE Shaw, Microsoft, Google, Goldman Sachs, Barclays and more than 150 other companies come here. On-campus internships are low. SDE and many other roles are offered in our course. Overall, the college is good in terms of placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available everywhere on campus. The infrastructure is good, but the labs are not so good. There are 3 lecture theaters. Hostels are good. DAIICT has a library where you can borrow books for 14 days. DAIICT does not have a mess. There are 4 canteens on campus. There is a medical centre. DAIICT has football, basketball and volleyball and badminton grounds. The canteen food quality is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are helpful, qualified and knowledgeable, but not all professors are good at teaching. The course curriculum is good. Semester exams are very difficult in DAIICT. Scoring more than 8 CGPA is tough. The pass percentage is 4.5 CGPA. Not all professors help you with your problems.
detailed_review.Other: Events and fests are amazing. The campus is huge. DAIICT provides scholarships to students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Our college is very good for future.

detailed_review.Placements: The top recruiters are Google, Microsoft, and Sprinkler. The highest salary package offered is 52 LPA. Around 95% of students are placed. The average salary package offered is 20 LPA. Many popular companies visit our campus to hire students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is very good. Our campus is green. Laboratories have good computers, and an electronic laboratory is also available. Wi-Fi is enabled on campus, and we can use a maximum of 10 GB. The hostel is good with all facilities. A sports ground is available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are moderate, and our course curriculum is not good. If students are interested in electronics, then they will find it interesting. If students want to do research, then this college provides many opportunities. Our professors are good. The difficulty level of semester exams depend on the professors.
detailed_review.Other: There are two fests in our college, i.e., one is a technical fest called I-fest, and the other is a non-technical fest is Synapse. Many events are conducted in this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: It is really the best college in Gujarat for placements.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements in DAIICT are the best all over Gujarat. The highest package offered is 52 LPA this year by Google. More than 95% of students get placed every year. The average package is around 15 LPA. Most of the companies offer software engineer roles. This year, 66 students got PPOs through internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Overall, the infrastructure and facilities of the institute are good. The institute has three lecture theaters, one lab building, a CEP building, a resource center, a huge playground, a hostel, and a cafeteria. The institute provides free Wi-Fi on campus. Medical facilities are good. The hostel is good, but the cleaning is not maintained properly. They don't provide a laundry facility on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the faculty members are PhD holders from IITs and NITs. They have good knowledge of their research area. But they don't have good teaching skills. The course curriculum has many humanities and social science courses that are just a waste of time. Semester exams are difficult. Grading is based on many parameters like quizzes, assignments, labs, exams, projects etc. There is relative grading, which is not good.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is huge and beautiful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information and Communication Technology
reviews.review_title: Some faculty should improve their teaching method but it's okay for us.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college's placement percentage is about 90-95%. The highest salary package offered is around 53 LPA. The average salary package offered is around 20 LPA and the lowest salary package offered is around 15 LPA. Top recruitments are from Google, TCS, Microsoft, Goldman Sachs, Sprinkle, Amazon, etc. I think 60-70% of students got internships in the 3rd year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have free Wi-Fi available on campus. There are air-conditioned classrooms and labs. It has the best infrastructure. It is not a huge campus but it's okay because of less number of students. In the hostel, 3 people per room are allotted. Fewer charges for the hostel. In the canteen, the best food quality is offered at less price. We have 8 hours of medical facility every day. There is a huge sports ground to play any games you want.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are well qualified but they should improve their teaching methods. We also have TA ( Ph.D. and M.Tech) facilities to solve our doubts. We will go anytime to meet faculty members and solve our doubts. They are useful. All exam papers are very difficult.
detailed_review.Other: This course has better placement opportunities other than others.

admission.title: Dhirubhai  Ambani University (formerly DA-IICT) Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: Dhirubhai  Ambani University (formerly DA-IICT) admission 2025 is open . Dhirubhai  Ambani University (formerly DA-IICT) course admissions are entirely entrance-based. Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral-level programmes such as BTech, MTech, MSc, MDes, and PhD under various disciplines. The admissions are based on national-level entrance tests, like JEE Main , GATE , CEED , etc. DAIICT has 330 seats around in all, half of which are reserved for residents of Gujarat.

faqs.question: What is the fees of Dhirubhai  Ambani University engineering?
faqs.answer: Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology (DAIICT) offers undergraduate degree in engineering, BTech with an overall fees of INR 8.2 lakh. BTech fees also includes registration, caution deposits, exams fees, etc. The caution fee is around INR 25,000 which is refundable. Also candidates must pay an application fee of INR 1,200 . This information is sourced from the official website/ sanctioning body and is subject to change.

faqs.question: Does Dhirubhai  Ambani University  offer BTech?
faqs.answer: Yes, Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology does offers BTech at undergraduate level. Find below important details related to the BTech course: BTech Eligibility Crciteria: Class 12 from a recognised board with Mathematics, Physics and any one of Chemistry/Bio-technology/Computer Science/Biology. BTech Selection Criteria: Joint Entrance Examination 2024 (JEE-2024) Main BTech Cousre duration: Four Years BTech Specialisations: Information & Communication Technology , ICT with a minor in Computational Science , Mathematics & Computing , and Electronics & VLSI Design . BTech Fees: INR 8.2 lakh BTech Average Package: INR 17LPA BTech Top Recruiters: Orcale, Linkedin, Hike, etc.

faqs.question: What is the GUJCET cutoff for DAIICT BTech course?
faqs.answer: Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology accepts GUJCET scores, followed by the ACPC Counselling process. During the DAIICT Gandhinagar cutoff 2023, GUJCET last round closing ranks ranged between 900069 and 900320 for the General All India category students. Candidates seeking admission can refer to the table given below to check out the last round closing ranks for all the BTech specialisations offered at DAIICT.

faqs.question: What is the fees of To get into Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology candidates must follow the for MSC?
faqs.answer: The overall fee of DAIICT for MSc is around INR 2.6 Lacs - INR 5 lakh . The mentioned fee is for two years MSc cousrse. The tuition fee might include multiple components such as registration fee, exam fees, caution deposits, etc. The registration fee must be paid once candidates submit their application form, which is around INR 2,500 . This information is sourced from the official website/ sanctioning body and is subject to change. DAIICT offers educational loan and financial loan for students to help them financially. The instiotute aslo has refund policy for the withdrawing candidates which will be in accordance with the UGC/AICTE rules.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for MSc at DAIICT Gandhinagar?
faqs.answer: In order to get admission to MSc at DAIICT Gandhinagar, students need to pass Class 12 with 60% in respective subjects from a recognised board.

faqs.question: What are the specialisations offered for the M.Tech course at Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology ?
faqs.answer: The specialisations offered for the M.Tech course at DAIICT Gandhinagar are mentioned below: (ICT) with specialisation in (a) Machine Learning, (b) Software Systems, and (c) VLSI and Embedded Systems Electronics and Communication (EC) with specialisation in Wireless Communications and Signal Processing IT

faqs.question: What is the seat intake for M.Tech at DAIICT Gandhinagar?
faqs.answer: The seat intake for M.Tech course at DAIICT Gandhinagar is 74, inclusive of the seat intake for all the major and minor specialisations.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for PhD admission at DAIICT?
faqs.answer: For admission to PhD programme at Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology, candidates must fulfill the following eligibility criteria: MTech / ME/ MCA/ MSc/ MPhil/ BTech/ BE or equivalent degree in ICT /CS /EC /IT /EE /IN /Mathematics /Statistics /Physics /Bioinformatics /Electronics or other appropriate disciplines with 60% aggregate or its equivalent in the qualifying degree as per the norms set by degree awarding Institute/University.

sections.heading: Introduction
text: Check out more on Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology Infrastructure in the below video:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The library of DAIICT connects the user to its relevant information resources. It has a rich and diverse collection of about 31020 books, 11230 e-books, 5674  e-journals, 78 print journals, 10 databases, 663 theses and 3913 audiovisual material in the ICT, social science, and humanities. This collection can be searched by a web-enabled online catalog. The students can also browse and access the various electronic resources such as e-journals, e-books, and databases using the dedicated terminals in the reading zones. The library has resource sharing a collaboration with Information and Library Network (INFLIBNET) and National Digital Library of India (NDLI).

facilities.name: Cafeteria
facilities.description: DA-IICT campus has 7 food courts offering a wide variety of food covering almost all the cuisine and taste from North India to South India and in addition, two food courts serve South Indian food, one special breakfast, snacks and pastries and one fruit and fruit juices. There is a special arrangement with Amul to make Amul products available at the food court and a separate food court which serves non-vegetarian food including egg dishes.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Dhirubhai Ambani Institute of Information and Communication Technology has two halls of residence, one for men and the other for women. The rooms are furnished with a bed, table, chair and a cupboard for each occupant. For students using their own computers in the room, internet facility is provided at a very nominal per semester charge. Hot water (using solar panels), Laundry and TV Rooms with Dish TV are available in both halls of residence. Residence at the Halls is compulsory for all B.Tech. students.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 158 published reviews , 141 reviews are verified.

college_info.college_name: Dr. Shyama Prasad Mukherjee International Institute of Information Technology, Naya Raipur: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Cutoff, Reviews

highlights.summary: Founded in 2014, Dr. Shyama Prasad Mukherjee International Institute of Information Technology, Naya Raipur is a public university. It is located in Raipur, Chhattisgarh. The institute is accredited with AICTE. Dr. Shyama Prasad Mukherjee International Institute of Information Technology, Naya Raipur provides UG and PG courses in Full Time mode. It provides 7 courses across specialisations such as Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Computer Science Engineering and Electronics & Communication Engineering. Some of the courses offered at this institute include B.E. / B.Tech and M.E./M.Tech. Dr. Shyama Prasad Mukherjee International Institute of Information Technology, Naya Raipur fees ranges between INR 2,73,850 to 3,84,000. The student intake for these courses is 175. Dr. Shyama Prasad Mukherjee International Institute of Information Technology, Naya Raipur offers these course across fields such as Engineering. Dr. Shyama Prasad Mukherjee International Institute of Information Technology, Naya Raipur offers all the campus facilities to students.
