GH Raisoni College of Engineering Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (IoT)
reviews.review_title: The reality of good college. It has a good culture and crowd.

detailed_review.Placements: Many companies came last year for the batch of 2025, including IBM, Deloitte, and Accenture. Many came, and mass recruiters like Capgemini also hired many students. Placements look promising, even in a down period. Packages were not fully disclosed, but according to some, the highest was above 12 LPA, but I am not sure.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is one of a kind. The campus is not big, but the building is very efficient and relatively large. The hostel is also relatively okay; the biggest advantage is that it is very near the college, so travel is easy. The library is very big and fully supports studying. Labs are fully equipped, and classrooms have full technology and comfortable seats but lack AC.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching is good. Teachers actually try to teach. Exams are also justifiable and come from the syllabus. There is no cheating in exams, and grading is good. Course subjects are relevant to their branch, and other course subjects are also added. Exams are normal not that hard, not that easy.
detailed_review.Other: I got the course because it was the best course I could get with my percentile. I would like a better classroom environment, like AC, because in summer it gets very hard. Events happen very frequently. The biggest non-academic event occurs 3-4 times a year, and academic events keep happening every month.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Average placements in 2026, many opportunities to explore, and the infrastructure is average.

detailed_review.Placements: In the 2026 batch, almost 60% of students from the CSE Department got placed in their 7th semester, and most of them are placed in the mass recruiters like Capgemini, Accenture, Cognizant, HCL, Infosys. The average package is 4 to 5 LPA, and the highest in our course is 8 LPA. Most of the students got the internship as part of the training at the companies where they are hired. Some students got internships at Moil Nagpur.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library in GHRCE is quite vacant and a perfect place for group studies. The college also provides many labs with well-equipped desktops. Wi-Fi is provided only during seminars or hackathons. The sports room is also very cosy and provides ample opportunities for sports enthusiasts.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at GHRCE are really helpful and supportive, and the teaching quality is quite good compared to other colleges in Nagpur. The course curriculum keeps updating as per the industry requirements, but this is not enough for students to survive in the industry. We need to do some coding courses on an online platform to gain real-world insights. The passing percentage is quite good. It's nearly above 85%, and the exam pattern is also as per the education standards.
detailed_review.Other: The placements are the best in Computer Science. The curriculum should be updated as per the company's requirements. Girl students should definitely take advantage of the EBC Scholarship as it helps a lot. The events are really good, like we get a lot to explore. The college has a lot of clubs in every domain, ranging from Social Service like NSS, Cultural, Forums and Technical Clubs like IEEE, GDSC, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good college, if you can take admission, if you are left with no other option.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80 percent of students got placed, and the other 15 percent went for higher studies. The highest package is 16 LPA, the average is about 5 LPA, and the lowest is 3.5 LPA. Companies like TCS, Infosys, IBM, and Deloitte often visit our college, and around 50 percent of students got an internship.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Very good facilities and well-maintained infrastructure, well-equipped labs with Mac OS high-speed Wi-Fi at the library, projectors in classrooms with great seating arrangement, great food quality according to the price, has many stalls and a food truck, and indoor sports facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful and well-qualified from top institutions like IIT'S, VNIT, etc. Some teachers are very good, but some are unable to clarify topics to students. The curriculum is relevant, but old as all colleges, but it makes it industry-ready with skills.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good college. You can definitely take admission if you are left with no other options.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80 percent of the students were placed in the IT sector. The highest package was about 16 LPA, the average was about 8 LPA, and the lowest package was 3.5 LPA. Companies like TCS, Infosys, Deloitte, and IBM are always all-time recruiters, with roles like manager and developer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Great facilities, but the campus lacks in size. It’s a very small campus with only one building for all years and all departments. The library is great, with high-end PCs like macOS, decent Wi-Fi speed, well-projected classrooms, and good food at the canteen with great taste.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college has good faculty with high knowledge. Some are from top institutions like IIT and NIT, and some are foreign-returned. Some faculty are unable to express or explain, but have great subject knowledge. As always, the curriculum is so old, but the students are industry-ready with skills.
detailed_review.Other: I was left with no option, so I had to take admission.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Slightly satisfied with the college. It’s worth it, you can definitely take admission in the college

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70 percent of students from the Information Technology branch are placed. The highest package was 18 LPA, the average was 8 LPA, and the lowest was about 3 LPA. Companies included TCS, Infosys, Deloitte, IBM, Amazon, etc. The top recruiter was TCS, with around 80 percent of students getting internships from the college at TCS, IBM, and Infosys.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Excellent facilities, good labs with Macs, and average or no Wi-Fi. Classrooms are equipped with smart boards or TVs. The labs are well-equipped with all necessary equipment, a quiet and well-maintained library, a big auditorium, and many events, including Google-developed groups. The same case applies to the hostel, which is well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some good faculty members, some are average, but they are well qualified from good colleges like VNIT, IITs, and have great knowledge about the subject. The curriculum is very relevant compared to other colleges, and the college believes in practical knowledge; it is industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: Good college, you can take admission undoubtedly, but it lacks a campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Really good infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70 to 80 per cent of students are placed in my course. The lowest package is of 3 LPA, and the highest package was of 12 LPA in my course of B.Tech in information technology. Top recruiting companies are IBM, TCS, Capgemini, Mahindra and Infosys.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: G.H. Raisoni College of Engineering provides good facilities to its students as well as the staff. There are so many computer labs, Physics lab, Chemistry lab. They also provide Wi-Fi facilities. There is a big Library and so many books provided there, and sitting facilities along with AC. Good quality food is available in the canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very good and supportive. They are so helpful and qualified in their specific subject that they teach, teaching quality is so good. They also guide us about placement and make students industry-ready. They teach very well, and pass percentage is 80 to 90 per cent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am interested in software studies and coding. There are so many extracurricular activities and events. Also, a scholarship is provided.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Immensely dissatisfied because of the faculty, below par infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed through the placement cell is around 70%. The highest and the lowest packages are about 11 LPA and 3 to 4 LPA. The top recruiting companies in our college are TCS, Infosys, Persistent, etc. The college also provides internships for students who are qualified with their exceptional technical skills. The top offered role in my course is Machine Learning Engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of my college is not so good. There is only one building for the whole college, so the departments are all clustered under one building. Wi-Fi and air conditioning are not available in the classrooms, but these amenities are available in the labs. The library is good compared to other things, as it is the only place where you can sit, as this college does not have space. The quality of the hostel and canteen is quite nice. The food is freshly made daily, and it is also healthy. The medical facilities are good, but the games section is not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are qualified, some are freshers, so they are not that knowledgeable, and the teaching quality is questionable. The college does nothing to make the students industry ready, and they do not help in developing the skills in students. The course curriculum is surprisingly similar for all branches. The semester exams are moderately difficult. I think the passing percentage is above 90%.
detailed_review.Other: They chose this course as it seemed most appealing, and the best thing about this course is the high demand in the future. The events are okay but not great.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Well-structured academics with good placements and supportive faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the computer science engineering batch of 2022-2026. In previous year around 80 percent of students in our course got placed. The highest package offered is 12 LPA, the lowest is 3 LPA and the average is around 4.5 LPA to 5 LPA. Top recruiters included TCS, Wipro, Capgemini, Accenture, and Cognizant. Around 70-75 percent of students got internships mostly in TCS, Capgemini, and startups. Roles offered are software developer, QA engineer, web developer and data analyst depending on individual skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has well-equipped labs with updated systems, table Wi-Fi, and smart classrooms with projectors for interactive learning. Library is spacious, digitally enabled, and accessible during long hours, which helps during exams and projects. Hostel rooms are decent and maintained regularly. Mess food is average, simple and hygienic, but lacks variety. The canteen offers better options. Basic medical facilities are available on campus. Sports grounds and indoor game facilities are also provided for recreation.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in my course are well-qualified and supportive. Most professors have strong academic backgrounds and explain concepts clearly using PPTs, discussions, and practical examples. The curriculum is updated regularly and aligned with industry trends, especially in CS-related subjects, which helps in building relevant skills. Semester exams are moderately difficult but manageable with regular study. Internal assessment and assignments also carry weight. The pass percentage is quite high, as long as students attend classes and complete their work on time.
detailed_review.Other: I am from 2022-2026 batch of computer science engineering. I chose this course because I have always been interested in coding and new technologies. The best part about the course is its updated curriculum, hands-on labs, and supportive faculty members. One thing that could improve is more exposure to product-based companies during placements. College conducts events like Technorion and Antaragni, which are really fun. The campus crowd is diverse and friendly. Connectivity is good, and the area around the campus is safe. Scholarships are available for reserved and merit-based categories. Extracurricular activities and clubs also help in overall development.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good at studies. Exams are good. Placement is average. All is good. All is best.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement depends mostly on the marks. Also, if you have a network and a high CGPA, you will get a good placement. There are many famous companies that hire at our college. Also, there are some multinational teams and companies like Amazon, Google, and many more, and some Indian companies like TCS, Wipro, Reliance, Zepto, Blinkit, Zomato, Bigbasket, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is pretty good. Hostel building and classes building are also on top. Only issue is that some classes are not good enough as per the fees. Hostel, ground, food, and overall are good. There is a gym also, and canteen has good food. Everything is good. All is best.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty and lecturers are good, friendly, and helpful. Curriculum is also good. The only issue is that the exam and assignment have less of a gap, so it becomes harsh for students to do it properly, and also, everything is good.  In short, exams are tough, and teachers are friendly.
detailed_review.Other: Crowd is overall good. But there are also less serious people. Also, there is a Tech club, which is good. All is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best college for middle class students who want to have a good education.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a student still studying at G.H. Raisoni College of Engineering, Nagpur. But I have talked to my senior they have been placed in the good companies through college. The companies are Infosys and Wipro. They give good average package of 5 LPA. Most companies placed students from Raisoni.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am still living in hostel with the best cleanliness and good and well-maintained hygiene. They give free Wi-Fi, and they also provide many games to play. They have many indoor and outdoor games facilities. They provide chess, carrom, and pool. They also have badminton court, football court, and a big ground for cricket.
detailed_review.Faculty: The exams are conducted very strictly, and the students get passed with good points. The college course provides an upgraded like industrial program. They provide many subjects that help students to gain good communication skills which is so important for jobs.
detailed_review.Other: One of the best colleges for engineering and middle-class families.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of G.H. Raisoni College of Engineering, Nagpur.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good enough if you are eager to grab every chance. Packages are good enough for a first job. You can get recruited by companies on campus and off campus. About 80% of students get placed. Many companies, including Capgemini, come for recruitment. However, one must be well-prepared for the interview.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college hostel food is not worth the money, so I do not suggest taking admission to the college hostel. However, the college infrastructure is pretty well. One must consider this college for engineering, but the food is not good. The hostel campus is on the Wadi campus and is surrounded by nature.
detailed_review.Faculty: It is all good. All faculty members are very down-to-earth and always provide the best solution in every possible way. The curriculum is very student-friendly, and you can adapt to it quickly. Exams are strict. You must take CAE seriously, attend the practical lectures, and perform them properly. It helps boost your CGPA.
detailed_review.Other: Overall, it's a good choice.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: G.H. Raisoni College: A place to get educated and be industry-ready.

detailed_review.Placements: From my course, more than 50% of students got placed. Many MNCs and startup companies visited our college for on campus placement drive. Top recruiting companies are Capgemini and Cognizant. Almost everybody got internships through the college and many students also received PPO.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The course is well-designed for students to get them industry-ready, many sub courses and subjects are designed with help of industry experts so that students will be able to enter the market easily. The college provide free Wi-Fi, great labs, good classrooms, and a wide collection of books in the library. The quality of facilities in hostel is decent, average food, good medical facilities, and gaming and sports room.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and helpful, they are well-knowledgeable in their respective fields. Course curriculum is relevant and provides every knowledge required to be learned by the students. The semester exams are not that difficult and can be cleared easily, almost everybody passes.
detailed_review.Other: This course is well-designed to make the students industry-ready. The best things about the course are it makes us technology that are used in the industry and industry-experts lecture are also given to students. There can be improvement in practical knowledge. Events, fests, and crowd are pretty good, many students visit and enjoy the fests.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Transportation Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of G.H. Raisoni College of Engineering, Nagpur.

detailed_review.Placements: A high percentage of students get placed in college. The highest package offered to this course students is 20 LPA and the lowest package is 3 LPA. Many recruiting companies hire students from my course. The placement percentage in my course is 70%.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities available in my college are good. The infrastructure is so beautiful. Wi-Fi is not available in this course. Other labs, classrooms, and the library are also available. Medical facilities are not present. Sports and games facilities are present here.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in my college are very helpful. They all are very qualified. They have great teaching qualities. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. Semester exams in my course are very difficult. The pass percentage is only 90% in this course.
detailed_review.Other: There is no way to improve my course. Events are good. Scholarships are available in my course. Extracurricular activities do not happen in college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I suggest students choose the course based on their percentage. The faculty members are good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements for my batch are not that satisfying because most of the students in my course are placed in non-technical roles. Very few students got offer letters for technical roles. Core companies for our course do not visit our campus. Most of the students who got placed in technical roles are either placed at Capgemini, Cognizant, or Infosys with a package that ranges from 3.5-5.5 LPA. We have a compulsory internship program for 6 months, so all students have to do internships in the core or IT domain.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities available for our department are good. Most of the instruments required for practical study of the course are available but some of the instruments are not in working condition. Classrooms and labs are available for all courses. There is a separate library for departments only which has department-specific books. The hostel is good and all facilities are available including medical, sports and games. The food in the mess is not good, and that's the only reason most of the students leave the hostel after the first year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in my department throughout my 4 years of course have been very helpful. They are supportive of new ideas and they are also knowledgeable of all subjects. Except for some teachers, all others are very specific and strict regarding studies and submissions. Our department teachers are experienced and qualified, so their teaching quality is very good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because till 2021 placements in this course were very good in our college but not now. The best thing about my course is that our teachers are very supportive and also qualified. I wish the college would focus on bringing more companies to our course. The college organises lots of technical and cultural events which are organised at a very large scale.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Those who are considering it for good placement and campus, please don’t consider it.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package offered for the 2025 batch is 12 LPA by IBM, but it is just for girls. The lowest package is 2.5 LPA for a teleservices executive role. The top recruiters are Infosys, Capgemini, and Cognizant. I don’t have a real idea regarding students who got internships, but Capgemini and Cognizant are offering internships, and most other students got internships on their own. The top roles are Advanced Software Engineer by Accenture, and other software roles from companies like IBM, PwC, Panasonic, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels have Wi-Fi, but sometimes it doesn’t work. Labs, classrooms, and the library are fine, but all our labs have Mac systems that don’t run macOS they run Windows, and sometimes they are very laggy. About the mess, I am in the boys’ hostel for one year. That’s all from my experience. The menu remains the same for months. Initially, the food is nice, but then the quality becomes bad. At first, the breakfast and evening snacks are good, but then they become the worst. I don’t know the current status, but they say the cook has changed.
detailed_review.Faculty: Beside some staff, all the staff is helpful and tries to provide students the best they can. The semester exams are not too difficult. If you study just for an hour, you can pass the exam just fine. The passing percentage generally depends on the top-performing student in the batch for that subject. It is usually 40% of that.
detailed_review.Other: I am selected as a TFW candidate, and according to my research, the IT department is the best among all. If you are planning to be in Raisoni, my suggestion is to choose IT. The staff is very supportive.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is okay but there is no campus life there. You are going to sacrifice that one thing.

detailed_review.Placements: 40 to 50% of students were placed. The highest package is 10 LPA. The lowest is 3 to 4 LPA. Capgemini most probably come to our college. Overall, 60-70% of students got internships. This is all about my college. You can take the admission.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is good. I resided there for a year. The hostel is good but sometimes the mess can mess up the issue regarding food quality. It can be the worst sometimes. Overall, the mess of the hostel is not okay. The infrastructure of the hostel is okay.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are okay. Remember one thing you have to do your study, curriculum, academics, and other activities on your own. It can't be always entertained by the faculty. Teachers never approach us on a regularl basis.
detailed_review.Other: There is no ground. The campus is bad.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: GS Raisoni Institute of Engineering and Technology in MBA course admission process and information.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year, 40% of students from this course are placed in companies. One requirement to secure the best packages and competitive salaries is a minimum CGPA of 7. Some of the companies that recruit from this college include TNS, Anudip, and Accenture. These types of companies show a strong interest in our students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In this course, the infrastructure is very good and uses high-quality material like a classroom, Wi-Fi, labs, bathroom, fast Wi-Fi connection, library, etc. The college has a sports committee, and game tournaments are organised.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum is relevant and good. Teachers are good. They have good teaching knowledge. Teachers have very high degree qualifications. This course is not difficult because there are no used stuff questions in the exam.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: We can create and narrate the future with GHRCE.

detailed_review.Placements: This college provides great opportunities for placements, and many students get placed in their dream companies. Almost 80% of students get placed. The highest package is 15 LPA. The average package is 5 LPA. Almost every student gets internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hotels are very good and we have 5-star hostels. The food is also very good as compared to other colleges. We have an indoor sports room where the pool, chess, table tennis and carron are available there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. Many teachers are PhD holders in their specific fields. Teachers are knowledgeable and their teaching qualities are also very good as compared to other colleges. In my opinion, this college gives very high opportunities. Faculty members are very good and behavior is also very good as compared to other colleges.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course electrical engineering because I have an interest in electrical engineering. I want to go to the power sector and this college gives me the opportunity to go wherever I want.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied as it helps me build a network.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students got placed in my batch. The highest package is 18 LPA, and the lowest is around 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies are TCS and Tech Mahindra. About 80% of students got internships in various companies. Top role offered is a programmer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure is overall good. There are multiple labs, a good Wi-Fi connection, and a well-maintained library containing thousand of books. Hostel facility is also good but it can be improved more. Food and sports are also fine but need improvement.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified and helpful. The teaching quality is good but can be improved by interaction sessions. The college curriculum is overall fine and provides a base for industry-ready. Semester exams are overall average. The passing criteria is in percentile.
detailed_review.Other: There are many events held. It is the best college in terms of events and halls.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best college for engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: There is no percentage criteria in college, only 60% in HSC. The highest package is 12 LPA and the lowest is 4 LPA. There are more than 7 companies that offer placements, with a maximum of 6 to 7 branches, like Computer Science, Cyber Security, Civil Engineering, Data Science, and Internet of Things.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, library, labs, classrooms, projector classrooms, auditorium, boys' hostel, girls' hostel, hospital, banks, two canteens, senior facilities, sports room, and gaming area. Functions like Antragini, hackathons, events, and outdoor sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and provide guidance for students, helping them gain knowledge. The best teachers specialize in Computer Science core branches like AI, ML, and Cybersecurity. Students gain industry experience through internships, and technical knowledge and practical experience are available through teaching.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Computer Science and Engineering because I experience many languages and software development. In this branch, I also experience most of the technical and digital communities, along with making many connections through hackathons and events.

college_info.college_name: G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science, is located in Hyderabad, Telangana. Established in 1997, it is a private institute approved by AICTE. G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science provides 13 UG and PG courses in 6 specialisations, namely Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Computer Science Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering and Electronics Engineering. Theses programmes are offered in Full Time mode. B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech and BBA are some of the courses offered at G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science. Some of the streams in which these courses are offered include Engineering and Business & Management Studies. The total fee at G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science ranges between INR 2,00,000 to 4,00,000. G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science has a student intake of 1080 for all the courses. The average median package at G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science is INR 5,22,833. G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science offers all the infrastructural facilities to students.

college_info_program.intro:
GNITS offers BTech course at UG level, in which student can choose from seven different specialisations available at the institute. Following are the list of specialisations students can choose from:
Eligibility criteria for students who want to apply for BTech programme at GNITS: Candidates should have passes 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry and Maths from a recognized board. Students need to appear for TS-EAMCET entrance exam conducted by Gov. of Telangana. Students can choose GNITS and specialisation as per availability during the counselling.
GNITS also offers MTech programme at PG level. Students can choose from five following specialisations offered at GNITS:
Eligibility criteria for MTech programme:
Admission criteria for General and SC/ST category will be based on their performance in GATE. Second priority will be given to non-GATE students with TS-PGECET score.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: CSE experiences at GNITS placements, campus life, and hostel life.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements for 2021 to 2025 are very good for CSE students. Out of 195 students from CSE,158 got placed which gives a placement percentage of 81 percent. The highest package offered is 51 LPA, the lowest is 8 LPA while the average is around 12 LPA. Most students got roles in software, data or AI/ML with companies like Microsoft, Amazon and Deloitte.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: GNITS college has three hostels which are H1, H2, and H3 with 4 and 6 member rooms and big beds. The mess serves only vegetarian food, but you can order non veg on holidays. Food is generally good most of the items. Wi-Fi works well. The computer labs are okay, even though they can definitely be improved. Sports facilities are excellent, recommended especially for hostellers. While cultural events are few like hardly two persons a year but there are many technical events like hackathons and also most of the student clubs are quite active. The campus is beautiful too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful during exams and always ready to clarify doubts. Coming to exams, the mid terms are fairly easy and semester exams are a little tougher. The faculty also guides students beyond academics, helping with career advice and projects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is absolutely satisfactory, and the overall experience is good.

detailed_review.Placements: 75 to 80 percent of people get placed. The highest package at our college is 58 LPA, and the lowest is 3.6 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Microsoft, Adobe, and Silicon Labs. Almost 50 percent of people get internships, and the top company is Silicon Labs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The overall college facilities are good. Coming to the classrooms, each and every classroom is equipped with a digital board or projector. The hostel maintains hygiene, and the food quality is also good. The college also encourages sports and games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified and have good expertise in their respective subjects. The course curriculum helps us to be aware of different areas. The difficulty level is moderate to high. It is 90 percent for our batch. The overall curriculum is good.
detailed_review.Other: I have a huge passion for chips, and I want to know how the communication works. It needs a more practical approach.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with this college.

detailed_review.Placements: My college provides the best placements and in my department, the placement percentage is 75 percent which is a good count. The highest package offered is 53LPA. The placement department provides training and access to various sources. The Median package offered is nearly 7LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure provided by the college are good and the department also encourages participation in various hackathons and events. The hostel food here is delicious and hygienic. The hostlers will have trips regularly. The management is so friendly and is easily approachable.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are all qualified and we will have regular feedback where we can report if we have any issues. The course curriculum matches the industry expectations, and the difficulty of exams is moderate. The pass percentage is never less than 75 percent. Teachers help us with our projects and encourage us to do research.
detailed_review.Other: I have a huge passion to learn and exploring new technologies, so I opted for Computer Science. Everything the college provides is good, but I feel we need more practical knowledge rather than theory.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: This is only a women’s college, but it is equal to other colleges in every activity.

detailed_review.Placements: 81 percent of students were placed in courses with 30 LPA, 50 LPA, and many more packages were offered in these courses. Companies like Deloitte, Amazon, Microsoft, Google, Meta, Infosys, IBM, etc., offered jobs. Many students got internships from this course in the companies mentioned above.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All classrooms and the library are very good, and so are the labs. The facilities provided are excellent. The mess is good and provides very hygienic food. Medical facilities are also good. Every day from 4:30 to 6:00, there are sports. The infrastructure of the college is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, well-qualified, and knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is excellent. The course curriculum is relevant and helps make students industry-ready. No, semester exams will not be difficult because teachers teach very well, and everyone can understand.
detailed_review.Other: I got this course in seat allotment. Coding scholarships are provided, and extracurricular activities are also held.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best college for women engineers. Telangana's top 1st women's engineering college.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, 95 percent of the students are placed in different top MNC companies like Microsoft, Deloitte, Aveva, Salesforce, Adobe, Infosys, Deutsche Bank, Capgemini, Wells Fargo, Service Now, Cisco, JPMC and more. At least 100+ companies have visited our GNITS and recruited 600+ students for internships and full-time jobs. The highest package offered is 54 LPA, the lowest package offered is 4 LPA, and the average package offered is 7.5 LPA. Students are placed in various intern roles like Technical intern, software developer intern, AIML intern, etc. When it comes to full-time jobs, students are hired for roles like SWE 1, software engineer, data analyst, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our campus is a Wi-Fi-enabled campus. Our college has different blocks for different departments, and each department has its own labs. The labs are having good quality working computers, and the other instruments or equipment that are needed for students. The college has a ground and a basketball court. Volleyball court and the kho kho ground. The college also has a canteen on the campus itself. In the canteen, all kinds of snacks, breakfast and lunch are available at affordable prices. Three hotel blocks are inside the campus with security. Hostels are as safe as home.
detailed_review.Faculty: The professors here are awesome. They cover each topic with the correct importance. They will provide us with extra resources. They will support us and motivate us for our goals. The curriculum is also good, and it makes students industry-ready. Our college also runs pre-placement training for students. Makes student skills stronger. The semester exams are moderate to tough. The pass percentage is 96 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE because I love Technology. Nowadays, everything is related to technology. I want to solve real-world technical problems. The solution is CSE. In our college, events, hackathons, workshops and extracurricular activities are always going on in parallel with academics. In our college, the Nexora event, Arohini event and women leadership conclaves event and many technical and non-technical events are organised.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: GNITS is full of trees and plants.

detailed_review.Placements: 90 percent placements according to my knowledge. The highest package is 53 LPA, and median is 13 LPA. Microsoft is top-most recruiting company. GNITS is very well known for the placements and for women it's mostly preferred. The placement opportunities in GNITS are very good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: ECE course is very popular from the start, and it's an evergreen branch. GNITS is a great option for studying the ECE course, and you will get placed in a good company after completion of the course. The hostel facilities in GNITS are also good but not excellent, they need to be improved.
detailed_review.Faculty: GNITS facutly members are very good. The lecturers are friendly and very good at their profession. The course curriculum is also good and relevant. It does make the students industry-ready. Semester exams in GNITS are difficult enough to examine the students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: The placements are good and the faculty is supportive.

detailed_review.Placements: I am Poornitha, currently a 2nd year B.Tech student in IT. In our IT course, the previous batch saw around 85-90 percent of students placed. The highest package offered is about 18 LPA, the lowest around 3.5 LPA, and the average package is nearly 6-7 LPA. I am happy with this.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms are spacious, with smart boards and projectors. High-speed Wi-Fi is available across the department. The library is great, with Wi-Fi, excellent books to learn from and daily newspapers from different publications. It's great to be on campus but the hostel warden is the worst I've ever had. She is so rude, quite rubbish and unbearable.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified, supportive, and approachable. They are knowledgeable in their subject and encourage practical learning. Teaching quality is good, with a mix of theory and hands-on sessions. The exams are too tough to write, and no men are seen on campus except girls, so it is very boring to be on a campus seeing only girls every day. There is no ragging and no interaction between anyone.
detailed_review.Other: I have an interest in programming, software development, and emerging technologies. This field offers wide career opportunities in IT across various industries and provides a strong base for future growth in AI, data science, and cybersecurity. There is a good placement opportunity with reputed companies, and the college encourages internships, coding contests, and workshops. The faculty is helpful and the curriculum is up to date.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: GNITS - Your heart in the city's heart.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 75% of the students are placed on the campus before graduation. The highest package is 51 LPA which is from Microsoft and off-campus. Companies like Deutsche Bank, Cisco, Microsoft, S&P Global, CBRE, ServiceNow, Verizon, Adobe, Well Fargo, etc., are few of the companies that visit and recruit. The internship exams start from the 3rd year. So at present people from my course i.e., CSM allied branch, have been placed in Microsoft, Google, CBRE, Service Now, Cisco, and many more. This is the top branch here. Roles like analyst, software developer, quality checker, etc., are offered. Placement training is provided.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College is Wi-Fi enabled campus but only for laptops. Labs are good enough. Classrooms are good. In library, all kinds of books are available and learning is present too. In hostel, there are AC and non-AC rooms spread across 3 hostel blocks. The whole college is 12 acres. Medical facilities available for students like first aid and emergencies are deal with nearby hospital. Canteen food is very average. Hostel food is like home food. Hot food is available most of the time. Fruits are provided every day. Only vegetarian food is available, and food orders are only on Sunday.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and qualified. Since it's a professional course, self-study is most important. The curriculum is up-to-date and makes us industry with self-study to extend topics. Pass percentage is 85% easily. Semester exams contain a mixture of all levels of difficulty questions.
detailed_review.Other: It is a girls' college. It's peaceful in the heart of the city. Even amongst the busy software hub, it is a green and peaceful place. The thing that I wish to improve is that everybody should be provided with their own place. Due to space constraints, time is wasted sometimes. Fests are conducted yearly. WLC is a 3-day event conducted here which is very lively. There are clubs of all kinds for personal development. Sports are good. Our campus has friendly environment and a beautiful place. Government scholarships are eligible here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good cleanliness, strict and friendly faculty, overall good for women interested in CSE and IT.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year, among EEE, 40% of students were placed in top companies. The remaining are placed with less LPA. I suggest it is the best and top college for placements for IT and CSE courses. The lowest placement percentage is included in 2025. Hope it will be good and efficient in 2026.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are very good as compared to many other colleges for women. It is a good and the best college as per my intention. Hostel food is much better than outside hostels, they supply milk tea, snacks, tiffin lunch, and dinner with different menus. Supplies sweets are from Pulla Reddy.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, but sometimes some members follow PPTs. They cleared out doubt thoughtfully with confidence. But some members take time to clear by learning. For every month, there is feedback on faculty that was good, and after feedback, they improve themselves.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I'm actually an LE student who did a diploma in EEE, so in that view it takes EEE. After coming to this campus, I realised that I didn't take IT courses. Even for core students, they are supposed to and encouraged to learn coding. It is good, but those who are interested in it lose their interest in learning coding.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: It has good faculty members and facilities. It is really a boring college.

detailed_review.Placements: 89% of students get placed in the course, i.e., information technology. The highest package in my course is 53 LPA, and the average package ranges from 10-12 LPA. Some of the top recruiting companies at GNITS are Infosys, Goldman Sachs, Google, and JP Morgan. Around 70% of students have received internship offers, mostly from Infosys.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library is always calm, and there's a lot of greenery. At the same time, the canteen food is really good but not very hygienic. Plates are not washed properly. The hostel is also really good, according to my hostel friends, but sometimes they don't get water. It is not allowed to bring day scholars inside. There is a huge ground, a badminton court, throwball court, volleyball court, kho-kho court, and a basketball court.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are a few faculty members who I feel are very misogynistic, and they talk more nonsense than actually teach in class. Overall, there are so many amazing teachers. They are so lovely and make it easier for us during exam season. They give us practice questions, worksheets, and explain all the important and difficult topics, no matter how many times we ask. Semester exams are difficult, but if we study properly and understand the subjects, then it's easy. Nothing is out of the syllabus. 21 out of 60 is the pass mark in semester exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Completely satisfied with facilities and education provided by my college.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students get placed. The average package is around 6–7 LPA. Mostly CS-related branches do internships in the 3rd year, and some of them get converted to full-time employees. In the fourth year, most students get placed by the end of the graduation year. The placement team is good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is good Wi-Fi, labs, and a good library. The quality of the food is good. They provide medical facilities and also have a nearby canteen for hostel students. The library is available at all times, and our college encourages sports a lot. Every year, sports events are conducted, and we also participate in events at other colleges.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers explain well, motivate students, and also guide them to achieve their goals. They teach all the subjects related to our course and focus more on the core subjects. Teachers prefer students to read textbooks. We also do practical implementations like projects based on our course.
detailed_review.Other: The college conducts technical and cultural events, flash mobs, moonlight dinners, and festival celebrations. Along with these, they also conduct technical events to showcase our programming and innovative skills.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Excellent experience with new innovation.

detailed_review.Placements: 80 of students got placed from our college. The highest package offered till now is 52 LPA and the average package is around 10 LPA-15 LPA. Companies that recruit are Amazon, Wipro, JPMorgan, and Flipkart. Internships are also offered to many students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are good. Our college provides extracurricular activities, technically and non-technically. Sports and games are also provided. Hostel food is very good, but it provides only vegetarian food. Every time medical facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are helpful, and every faculty member is well-qualified with a doctorate. Our faculty teaches all the subjects and also outside knowledge, which helps us very much. Semester exams are held once every 6 months. The pass percentage of the students is above 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose computer science because it is one of the leading technologies in society. Through this course, we can also move abroad for higher studies.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Top 1 women's college in Telangana.

detailed_review.Placements: Most students get placements here. Multiple opportunities are there for students in terms of choosing companies, as many companies come here for recruitment. Top recruitment and internship opportunities are also there.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs and hostel are really good, but they only serve veg food. The quality of food is maintained properly. Wi-Fi is available on the campus for all students and faculty. The thing you need to register first to get Wi-Fi access. The library contains many books that help us study well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers share their knowledge and help us in learning new things and exploring them. The curriculum is also helpful to know the history and present knowledge of particular subjects. The course curriculum is relevant to the course we are studying.
detailed_review.Other: We do have fests like the annual day for 3 days. We also have special events for Women's Day. The above-mentioned are the main events held.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: GNITS is a top women's engineering college offering quality education, faculty, and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% of the students placed in our course. 52 LPA is the highest offered by Microsoft. 2-4 LPA is the lowest package in our course. Top recruiting companies are Microsoft, JPMC, Infosys, ServiceNow, Paypal, Deloitte Accenture, and Cisco. Top roles offered are software engineer, software developed, and data analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides us with labs for practical knowledge and there is a computer system for each student in the lab. The canteen is available in the college. The hostel is available for AC and non-AC room sharing and some other facilities are available. Sports and games are supported in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-trained. They have completed their Ph.Ds from universities. They are also so much more knowledgeable. Faculty always supports students to participate in various activities to gain practical knowledge. The curriculum is related to industry. The subjects that we learned are applied in industry directly. The pass percentage is 86%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, our college provides good placement offers.

detailed_review.Placements: Our CSE course has good number of placements. The percentage of placements is high in our college. The highest package is 51 LPA and the lowest package is ranges from 4-5 LPA. Students get internships in top tech companies like Amazon, Microsoft, etc. Overall, the college provides good placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is good. The food of the hostel is really good compared to the other hostels. It provides many advantages for students such as we have a library open till 7:30 PM, so students can go and read. Hostel students are taken on some trips. Overall, the hostel is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in our college are really very good and supportive, which makes students understand. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes stindustry-readyy-ready. The difficulty level of semester exams is 5 out of 5. Overall, teachers are helpful and well-qualified.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: The college is best in placements, clubs, sports, and hackathons.

detailed_review.Placements: 60-75% of my seniors got placed in top companies like Adobe, Deloitte, Infosys and ServiceNow. The highest package is 52 LPA and the lowest package is 5 LPA. Students also get placed in Microsoft. 75% of students got internships from Deloitte and ServiceNow.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the hostel, they provide hygienic food and snacks in the evening with a clean mess. It provides Wi-Fi, canteen, gym and sports room. It provides full security. There is also a library with a Wi-Fi facility.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They make us ask queries without any hesitation because they are that friendly to us. They are highly qualified and knowledgeable. They always teach us the concept of how it works in our real world, and how the technology is implemented in our real world. The course curriculum is perfect, which covers all the credit subjects. It provides all the stuff required for a fresher in this current technical world. The pass percentage is above 75%. Exams are of moderate level. It also conducts 1 industrial trip for students each month.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telematics Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best college for women in Hyderabad.

detailed_review.Placements: 94% of students received placement offers, with the highest package being 50 LPA and the lowest at 6.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Amazon, Google, Flipkart, Deloitte, Salesforce, JPMorgan Chase, TCS, Infosys, Uber, HCL, Tech Mahindra, Cisco, and IBM, among others. Many companies visit our college for placements, and 60% of students secured internships with these organizations. The most common roles offered include data analyst, software engineer, software developer, data engineer, and system engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructures available for our course/department are nothing but Wi-Fi, labs, classroom, and library are well and good. The quality of the facilities in our hostel. The quality of food available in the mess and canteen, medical facilities, sports, and games are very good can give a five star for the facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good. This course curriculum is relevant and it makes the students industry-ready. The difficulty of the semester is high but our faculty makes us understand the concepts more easily.
detailed_review.Other: I think my course is the best choice for me as my course includes the subjects of electronics, telecommunication, and subjects related to IT and human value ethics.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Top women's engineering college in Telangana.

detailed_review.Placements: 85% of students will get internships in ServiceNow, Adobe, Google, Amazon, Deloitte, etc. Roles are Software engineer, Software Developer, and Data Analyst. 90% of students are placed in our course. 52 LPA is the highest package offered by Microsoft, and 2-4 LPA is the lowest package. Companies like Microsoft, JPMC, Infosys, ServiceNow, PayPal, Deloitte, Micron, Cisco, and Accenture.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides us with labs for practical knowledge. Each student is provided with a computer system in labs. A LAN is also there in our college, and we can access it within the college premises. All kinds of resources needed for a student are provided in our GNITS. A canteen is available. Hostels are also available with washing machines, AC and non-AC room sharing and some facilities are also available. A medical hall is also present in our college with two nurses at all times. Sports and games are also supported in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are well-trained, and they have all completed their PhDs from universities. They are so much knowledgeable. Faculty always support students in participating in various activities to gain practical knowledge. The curriculum is related to the industry. The subjects we learn are applied in the industry directly. The semesters are moderate to hard. The pass percentage is up to 86% or more for CSE. The course is so popular nowadays and is evolving course. So everyone chooses this course.
detailed_review.Other: Most students from CSE are placed. Every day, many events like hackathons and workshops are conducted for students. Extracurricular clubs are also there, and students can join these clubs and participate in extracurricular activities. Fests are also conducted, like Nexora, Annual Day, Technical Fest, Non-Technical Fests, etc. It is a really good college for students, especially for women who want to make their future bright in the engineering stream. The great college provides all facilities to students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with it, and it has good facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: 92% of students get placed in our course. The highest package is 52 LPA. Companies like Amazon, Deloitte, etc., visit the college for placements. Around 60% of students got internships from our course in different companies like Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Flipkart, etc. We are satisfied with it.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has a poor Wi-Fi signal and some classrooms are not clean. The quality of food is good in the hostel and canteen. Our college hostel is purely veg, and no non-veg is allowed into college premises. The canteen also consists of veg items only with a variety of dishes.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. Faculty members have a lot of experience and many of them are researchers. They guide us and help us to do different hackathons, ideathons, etc. Faculty members try hard to help us.
detailed_review.Other: Events, fests, etc., are held frequently.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has good infrastructure and the faculty is also good.

detailed_review.Placements: The average package of our college is 8 LPA and the companies recruitment is very often and also students can express their talents. Internship is mostly from JPmorgon, Deloitte, and also many other companies. The highest package in our college is 50 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The availability of the lab and the classrooms are also good. It is also Wi-Fi enabled campus. The library has almost all the books and they can also borrow books. If students are interested in fictional stories they are also available. The food at the hostel is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The pass percentage is also great almost everyone passes the semester with 70%. Teachers help every student in their academics also they are so friendly. Students can express their ideas and explore them. Teachers help them with ideas and suggest them.
detailed_review.Other: I am doing AIML where the future is AI now so it is good to do.

college_info.college_name: G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science Admission 2025: Fees, Courses, Eligibility and Selection

faqs.question: How can I get seat in GNITS?
faqs.answer: There are two ways to get admission to GNITS. The institute offers admission in "A" and "B" categories for its respective UG & PG courses. Admission in category "A" is done through a valid score obtained by candidates in state/ national-level entrance exams, followed by the online counselling process. Whereas, for category "B", the admission is offered under Management quota. Eligible candidates need to apply online on the official website to apply for the course of their choice.

faqs.question: Which courses does G.Narayanamma Institute of Technology and Science offer?
faqs.answer: In a full-time mode, GNITS offers UG & PG level for women candidates in the stream of Engineering. Candidates can pursue BTech or M.Tech course as per their requirements and educational background. All the courses at GNITS is offered across various specialisations. To know about the GNITS admission process in detail, click here .

faqs.question: What are different specialisations offered at PG level in Mtech course at GNITS?
faqs.answer: GNITS offers AICTE approved Mtech programme at PG level. Course is offered in 5 different specialisations from which students can choose from. Following are the specialisations students can choose from: Computer Science Engineering (CSE), Computer Networks and Information Security (CNIS-IT), Digital Electronics and Communication Engineering (DECE), Power Electronics and Electrical Drives (PEED) and Wireless and Mobile Communications (WMC)

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission at GNITS?
faqs.answer: Direct admission at GNITS is only possible through Management quota, which is categorised under Category "B" admission on the official website. Candidates can pursue BTech and M.Tech courses in a full-time mode. The admission to this category is subjective as per the college norms and done as per the guidelines mentioned by TSCHE, Hyderabad.

faqs.question: How to get admission to BTech at GNITS?
faqs.answer: To get admission to a four-year BTech course at GNITS , the minimum eligibility criteria is to pass Class 12 with PCM as subjects from a recognised board. Futher, the selection criteria is strictly based on TS EAMCET scores. Candidates have to qualify for the exam with a valid score. Later on, the final seat allotment will be done through a counselling process.

faqs.question: Does GNITS offers scholarship to BTech students at the institute?
faqs.answer: No. students pursuing BTech cannot avail scholarship benefits at GNITS. However, students of Mtech will get stipend for their GATE score as per AICTE norms. Students who got admission in Mtech programme at G Narayanamma without GATE score will not be eligible for any stipend.

faqs.question: What is the fee for BTech at GNITS?
faqs.answer: As per the unofficial sources, GNITS BTech fee is INR 4 lakh, which is inclusive of the tuition fee amount for all BTech specialisations. This fee is taken from unofficial sources. Hence, is indicative. Students are requested to visit the official website to know more about GNIST BTech fee.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for M.Tech at GNITS?
faqs.answer: GNITS offers a PG leve M.Tech course for a duation of two years. To apply for this course, candidates have to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria in the first place. Candidates seeking for admission to MBA at GNITS must hold a UG degree from a recognised university. Without passing the basic educational requirements, the application will be rejected.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam is accepted for M.Tech at GNITS?
faqs.answer: Admission to a two-year M.Tech course at GNITS is entirely entrance-based. Candidates can either qualify for national-level GATE entrance exam or a state-level PGCET exam. Any one of the entrance exam score will be required to get admission to M.Tech at GNITS. Later on, a counselling process is conducted for the final seat allotment.

faqs.question: How is GNITS as a college to do Masters in MTech?
faqs.answer: GNITS also known as Narayanamma Engineering College  is well-established and renowned institute. The institute offers five different specialisation for Mtech programme. Students get awarded master’s degree from JNTU-H university as institute is affiliated to same. Mtech programme at GNITS is approved by AICTE.

faqs.question: What is the TS EAMCET Counselling fees?
faqs.answer: TS EAMCET Counselling fee for OBC category candidates is INR 1200 and for Scheduled Caste (SC)/ Scheduled Tribe (ST) Category is INR 600. CMR College of Engineering and Technology admission to the BTech course is done through TS EAMCET exam followed by TS EAMCET Counselling which is to be conducted in three phases namely, Phase 1, Phase 2 and Final Phase. Spot Round will also be conducted for Private Unaided Engineering Colleges. Candidates eligible to appear for the counselling process can refer to the table given below to check out the categories-wise TS EAMCET counselling fees: Categories Counselling Fee (in INR) Other Backward Classes (OBC) 1200 Scheduled Caste (SC)/ Scheduled Tribe (ST) Category 600

faqs.question: What are the steps to apply for GNITS?
faqs.answer: The application process for admission to GNITS is conducted in an online mode. Candiates can refer to the following basic steps to apply at GNITS for the courses of their choice:

faqs.question: What documents are needed to fill the Karnataka PGCET application form?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to keep the following details/ things handy before they proceed to fill Karnataka PGCET application form for a hassle-free registration process Class 10 mark sheet Class 12 mark sheet Scanned copy of passport-sized photograph Scanned copy of signature Scanned copy of left thumb impression Government-approved ID proof Active email ID Active mobile number Bank details to pay Karnataka PGCET application fee Category certificates Graduation degree details Choice of examination city A printer connected with the system to print the application confirmation page Good quality internet connection The online application form for Karnataka PGCET is best viewed in Internet Explorer 9 or above and the latest versions of Google Chrome & Mozilla Firefox.

faqs.question: What is the application fee for BTech at GNITS?
faqs.answer: Applications for admission to BTech and Mtech course are accepted in offline mode. Interested candidates can download the application form from the official website of the institute. Candidates need to pay INR 1000 as application fee. The fee can be paid in form of cash or DD in the favor of Principal, GNITS.

college_info.college_name: Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology: Admission 2024, Placements, Ranking, Courses, Fees, Cutoff

highlights.summary: Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology was established in the year 2000. It is located in Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh, and is established as a private institute. The institute owns several approved and recognised courses from nationally renowned institutions such as AICTE. The institute offers UG and PG courses in Full Time. It offers 18 courses in total including specialisations in Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering. Furthermore, the institute offers courses such as B.E. / B.Tech, MBA/PGDM and MCA. Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology offers these courses spread across streams such as Engineering, Business & Management Studies and IT & Software. The Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology fee structure for these courses ranges from INR 1,22,400-2,44,800. Furthermore, the Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology offers an annual intake of 1680 students. Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology placement stats recorded an average median package of INR 4,24,707.
