summary.college_name: Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is the best private college in terms of ROI.

detailed_review.Placements: My batch is Computer Science Engineering 2026 passing out. Almost 70% of students got placed in my batch. The highest package till now is 22 LPA, and the lowest is 3.5 LPA by Infosys. Top recruiting companies are Cognizant, Infosys, Capgemini, and Coding Ninja.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are too good and clean, having both AC and non-AC rooms. The hostel fees are also less than those of the other college hostels. The hostel mess, I can say, in the beginning, they provide very tasty food, but after some time, the quality is not so good, but a student can manage it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and highly qualified, studied from top institutes like IITs and NITs, with more than 6 years of experience, and some have more than 10 years as well. My HOD was very supportive in every aspect regarding study as well as management.
detailed_review.Other: I always wanted to pursue Engineering in CS with low fees. The best thing is the ROI of my college. There are a lot of fests that take place in my college, and connectivity is very good just in front of the metro station and highway.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: What galgotias offers and what it doesn't.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package is 1.3 crores that I have heard, and the average package is 6 LPA. A senior from the EEE branch told me that about 80% of students in his batch were placed, and the highest package from his batch till now was 27 LPA. Students can start applying for internships and get placed in the 3rd semester itself.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is Wi-Fi in almost every 3-4 classrooms on each floor. Labs have every necessary working equipment, and there are smartboards in every class. The library is massive, with a 350 seating capacity and a huge collection of books for knowledge in any field.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-versed in their subjects and they clear your doubts absolutely, except for some. The course curriculum is a bit outdated, as is the case for every AKTU-affiliated college. The exams are moderate, which prepares students for the final university exams.
detailed_review.Other: The best things about my course are the ISC language which is taught for building our basics. Every branch should have a different syllabus and subjects tailored according to them. There are many events and fests, and connectivity is also good, as Knowledge Park 2 metro station is right in front of the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: My experience at Galgotias College of Engineering and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Average package at Galgotia is 5.5 LPA, and the highest is 60 LPA. Companies that visit include Infosys, TCS, Wipro, HCL, and sometimes Zomato. The lowest package is around 4 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are equipped with smartboards and Wi-Fi. It makes learning easy and understandable. The library offers a huge collection of books, journals, and resources. They provide students with an excellent learning environment. Overall, the experience is really good. The hostel is good. The building is quite old, but the rooms are manageable. Food is good, provided by Sodexo. The canteen, sports, and games facilities are very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are highly qualified Ph.D. holders who teach with great clarity. The curriculum is well-structured and focused on relevant topics. Semesters are not very tough. The pass percentage remains around 80–90%. Overall, everything is well-maintained.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because this field is trending and has the scope of becoming a data engineer. It includes coding. Fests are not frequent, which allows us to focus on studies. This is the best thing about Galgotia, which makes it the best in Greater Noida, because the return on investment is very good. Fees are very low compared to other colleges in Greater Noida.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: In 460,000, you can get an average salary package of 5 LPA, so it is a pretty decent college.

detailed_review.Placements: In my class specifically, 90% of the students get placed, and the highest salary offered was 22 LPA, while the lowest salary offered was 3.5 LPA by Infosys. Top recruiting companies include Josh Technology, Cred, Infosys, Accenture, Capgemini, and Cognizant.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college labs are quite good, with i7 computers, and Wi-Fi is also good. The classrooms are of new modern architecture, and hostel facilities are specifically good. The toilets are modern, and the mess food is excellent. I would say that despite having less space, my college is very good in the field of sports as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Specifically for the CSE branch, teachers have almost 15 years of experience, and they are very helpful. As they are experienced, they put in a lot of effort to get engineers and students placed. The curriculum was a little bit old and designed by AICTE.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Campus life is very good and one of the best colleges in terms of infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 85 percent of students are placed every year in Galgotia College of Engineering and Technology, with the highest package at 44 LPA, the lowest at 4 LPA, an average of 5 LPA, 30 percent getting internships, and top roles offered in the IT sector as software engineer and sales.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available in every class, classrooms have air conditioning, labs are modern with all required equipment, the huge library provides a good environment and many books, sports facilities are available for athletes, the canteen is average but good, and one block is reserved for medical emergencies.
detailed_review.Faculty: Curriculum is affiliated to AKTU, and the college conducts exams three times in a semester: CAE1, CAE2, and PUT. After these three exams, the AKTU main exams are conducted. This course is relevant for modern industries as it is related to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, which are booming nowadays. Semester exams are not very difficult, if we are prepared for the exams very well, then we can easily handle these exams.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is good, and the sports provide me Artificial Intelligence, that’s why I am into this course. Being in 1st year, I don’t know very much about what to improve, but till now it’s good, and Galgotia is famous. Galgotia is famous for its dear first campus and campus life, although movie promotions happen, many events take place throughout the year, so campus life is very good in this college. UP government scholarships are provided.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Really, GCET is a value-for-money college with affordable fees and good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60% students are placed. Recently, the highest package of 60 LPA was offered to a student in the 2027 batch at Microsoft, the average package is 5 LPA. Infosys, Wipro, coding ninja recruit. I don't know about the internship. Roles are software, Prompt engineer, frontend and backend developers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I'm a Data Science branch student, which is separate from the Computer Science department. Infrastructure is all good, having proper ground, court and equipment for Volleyball, basketball, table tennis, cricket and badminton. Food is average, but there are many canteens on the campus. The library is best as advanced computers are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teacher are well qualified as they have a PhD in their subject. They don't waste time in waste talks. These things depend on student how he/she is serious. They do their duty very well. Not more, they are just a ready base. The semester exam is taken by AKTU, which is average, but the checking is tough.
detailed_review.Other: This is the value for money college for 1 year B.Tech, fees are around 1,15,603, which is better than other colleges and placement and events are all good. This is best for both studying and exploring.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: I think the best reasonable college for B. Tech in CSE that gives the best ROI.

detailed_review.Placements: This is the 2nd college in terms of placements in Greater Noida after GL Bajaj. You should definitely get a higher placement if you work hard for this four-year course by learning all those given skills related to your branch. College placement cell provides almost 1500 companies, which are generally mass recruiters and some top IT MNCs. You have the chance to grab the average package of 6-7 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good, but campus is decent, not too big like 18 acres you get, and best given laboratory according to your branch. Like I have the CSE core branch, so we get the best labs in the college for our classes in the CSE department. Mess is decent, but food quality and menu is awesome as I think it gives the best food in comparison to other private hostels and PG food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are supportive and well-qualified, like everyone has done Ph.D. in their given fields. Curriculum is basically normal, not too strict. Exams are scheduled only when AKTU planned and not that much peer pressure of exams are in the surrounding of college.
detailed_review.Other: Value for money as the fees for B. Tech CSE is 1,15,603. It is the best affordable college for B. Tech as compared to other colleges and has a good ROI (Return of Investment). You can complete your degree in a hill atmosphere; the college is cool, not much strict, and does not have that many rules and regulations.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has great infrastructure, positive experience, satisfying placement, and growth opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: I would rate 4 out of 5 for placements. In my course, many students receive opportunities. The average package ranges from 5-9 LPA, depending on skill and profile. Many companies visit the campus for recruitment and offer roles across different domains. Placement opportunities are decent for students who are consistent, skill-focused, and actively participate in projects or internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is spread across 15-18 acres of land with a modern look and well-planned buildings. Classrooms are spacious. Wi-Fi facilities work well. Labs are updated to support practical learning. The grounds are large. Sports facilities are good, which adds a positive environment to campus life. The experience has been good in terms of available space, maintenance, and college atmosphere.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are helpful and supportive. Most teachers put effort into clearing doubts. The course structure is relevant to industry requirements and encourages skills, projects, and practical exposure. Semester exams are of a moderate difficulty level and not very easy. They are manageable with regular study.
detailed_review.Other: I recommend this college to students looking for good infrastructure, decent placements, and a balanced campus environment.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science (Hindi)
reviews.review_title: Greater Noida's best college of AKTU.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, approximately 90% of students were placed. The highest package is 22 LPA, and the lowest package is 8 LPA. Top recruiters include TCS, Wipro, Infosys, Tech Mahindra, and many more. Many students in my batch got internships in various companies, like Infosys.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure of our college are great. It is a fully Wi-Fi campus, and the classrooms are digital. The library is too small but okay. Hostel facilities are good, and the mess food is hygienic, though less in taste, but okay for eating. The canteen, medical facilities, and sports are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of my college, especially in my batch, is good. Most teachers hold M.Tech degrees and PhDs. Their teaching methods are very good and knowledgeable regarding our industrial area. The course curriculum is good for industrial visits. Semester exams happen, but you have to study to avoid backlogs.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college because I think it is the best college of AKTU in Greater Noida. Currently, I think they should improve their infrastructure. Yes, events and fests happen from time to time, creating a good crowd and connectivity. Government scholarships are available, and there are many clubs you can join.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good. The cafe area is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is getting easier, 80 percent of students have been placed. 9 LPA is the average package. GCET placement is decent. Many companies visit, mostly for IT and software roles. Average packages are moderate. Training and support from faculty help a lot. If you have good skills, you can get a good opportunity.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is awesome. The hostel is good. I am currently in a hostel. There is no problem. GCET has a clean and well-maintained campus. Classrooms, labs, and libraries are good and updated. The sports area and common space are decent. Overall, the infrastructure is solid and supports academics well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Monthly exam, 40 marks scored before end-semester. The GCET faculty is supportive and knowledgeable. Most teachers explain topics clearly and help with doubts. Some are strict, but overall, the teaching quality is good. They guide well in projects and placements. GCET exams are moderate in difficulty. If you attend classes and revise regularly, it's manageable. Internal assessment and practical also matter. Overall, the exam pattern is fair, and scoring is possible with consistent study.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and 2 sports grounds here. And the faculty is too supportive.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good, seniors said, if you work hard, then you will definitely get a good job from the college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is too good, like 13 to 14 acres approximately. And I enjoyed my college life.
detailed_review.Faculty: Saturday and Sunday are off from college. So you can get more time for your self-study. And exams are at a moderate level. If you perform well in the exams, then you will definitely get more marks in AKTU end-term exams. This college is good because its faculty members are very supportive. Many of the events are organised in the college.
detailed_review.Other: This college is good because its faculty members are very supportive. Many of the events are organised in the college. Recently, our college hosted the AKTU state-level sports event.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good campus with supportive faculty and decent placement.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, around 70-80% students get placed. The highest package offered is around 8 LPA, and the average package stays around 4.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and many students also get internships in brands like Byjus and HCL.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college provides good facilities like high-speed Wi-Fi, projectors, classrooms, computer labs, and a well-maintained library. Hostel rooms are decent and clean. Mess food quality is average but hygienic. Medical facilities and sports grounds are available on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is supportive and well qualified in their subjects. Teaching method is mostly practical with PPTs and live examples. The course curriculum is updated according to industry needs. Internal exams, assignments, and practical labs are conducted regularly.
detailed_review.Other: I chose B.Tech Civil because the construction and infrastructure field always interests me and the future scope is wide. The best thing about the course is that we get knowledge of structural design.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and supportive faculty with decent campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: The overall students' placement rate is 86 percent for 2024, with the highest package of 44 LPA, and the average package offered is 6 LPA. CSE Data Science students at GCET mostly get placed in software & analytics roles with strong participation from IT companies like Accenture, Wipro, Infosys, HCL, Amazon, Airtel, Tech Mahindra, TCS, etc. Around 70 percent+ students secure Internships, and 70 to 86 percent get placed, which varies by year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: GCET has strong academic facilities with good Wi-Fi, AC-enabled smart classrooms and modern computer labs. Hostels are well-maintained, and vending machines are available on campus, though the mess food is average. Sports facilities and medical support are available, but they are not a major highlight of the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are generally qualified, helpful and knowledgeable, though teaching quality may vary between faculty members. The course curriculum is relevant and supports industry skills, but students need extra practical learning on their own for better readiness. Semester exams are of moderate difficulty, and the pass percentage is around 90 percent, so regular study is enough to score well.
detailed_review.Other: I chose B.Tech CSE as I am passionate about coding and technology, and it offers great career opportunities. The course has good placements, supportive faculty and many practical learning opportunities like hackathons and teach fests. Lab facilities and industry exposure can be improved. The campus has a friendly crowd, enjoyable events, excellent connectivity, scholarships and active clubs and sports, making the college experience enjoyable and balanced.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: I am getting satisfied with the quality according to fees, really good facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: 60 to 70 percent of students are placed in CSE AI. 44 LPA is the highest placement, and the lowest package is 4.5 LPA. TCS and Amazon are top recruiting companies in CSE AI. 40 percent of students got internship. You must qualify for the criteria.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure available for CSE AI like coding room, good Wi-Fi, well-equipped labs, library, coding culture, etc. There is a good quality of facilities in hostel like sports, canteen, and mess facilities, etc. The quality of food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful in nature, well-qualified, and very knowledgeable. The teaching quality is very good. Its relevant, but some courses are irrelevant like Chemistry, maybe it's my opinion. Its the middle of the semester exam in my college. 33 percent is the pass percentage.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with this college.

detailed_review.Placements: There are 200 students in the first year of the Data Science programme. The average salary is between 4 and 5 LPA per annum. Mass recruiter companies like Capgemini, Cognizant, and TCS are coming to the college. You work hard to get a placement. Around 80 per cent of students are placed this year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the basic facilities are provided in the college. All classrooms are fully AC and all are in good condition. All types of labs are present in college, and all the labs have equipment. There are many computer labs in the college. And I am not in the hostel, so I don't know the hostel very well.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are well-qualified and experienced, and they are very helpful. And you study the syllabus of AKTU. The sessional exams are not very tough if you study, and you can easily pass. The sessional exam is 40 marks and is held twice in one semester.
detailed_review.Other: There are many clubs in our college. If fresher want to join, they contact seniors, and many sports activities are held in college. There are many events happening in the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Infrastructure is good and engaged with amenities.

detailed_review.Placements: Galgotia’s College of Engineering and Technology provides good placements, with most students receiving above average packages. If you are engaging and hardworking, you are not going to miss the placement opportunities. The main task of the college is to bring companies to the campus, the rest is up to you.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Galgotia’s College of Engineering and Technology has newly upgraded labs, systems, and much more. The library is filled with a lot of useful books related to the university curriculum as well as other self-learning materials. The campus is connected with a high-speed Wi-Fi connection.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good, understanding, and have strong knowledge of their subjects and courses. The semester exams are not very tough if you study accordingly, they are quite easy to manage, as people say, AKTU is quite tough, and sometimes the evaluation process can be unpredictable.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied by the college facilities and enjoying the best 4 years of my life.

detailed_review.Placements: Recently, Microsoft and Deloitte came to our campus for the internship process. Many mock interviews are conducted by our college to help us in our placement practices. It is also guided by classes for aptitude and soft skills, which are important when it comes to communication and also during our placement drives. Recently, our college conducted an industrial visit to give students a chance to experience the industry.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is really good. Classrooms have smart boards which provide video lectures and notes during a lecture, which helps in guiding students for visualizing and understanding the concepts. Classrooms have AC cooling and provide charging ports in multiple places for the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is helpful, provides enough study materials, notes, and guidance for the academics. Teaching style is different as it is guided by smart boards with video lectures and PDFs. The faculty try their best to guide us with the exam syllabus but also often in personal projects and concepts related to it. They are really helpful.
detailed_review.Other: Campus is loaded with multiple events, festivals, and many more happening things if you are a part of any club.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied due to low attendance.

detailed_review.Placements: It's average like private colleges with about 7 LPA and placement rate last year is 68%. The highest package is 18 LPA and top recruiting companies are Microsoft, HCL, TCS, and Infosys. Internship rates are not great, but off-campus there are a lot of opportunities. Top roles provided by companies are mostly senior analyst and developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is advanced and the campus is lush green. Classrooms have smart boards and ACs. Labs are well maintained with Wi-Fi connections. Hostel is as usual average. Sports ground is vast but there is no proper management of sports authority. AKTU zonal is the only major event in a year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are quite supportive and qualified, however, course curriculum is not updated and according to industry standards. Semester exams are of moderate level, most students get good marks with 90% pass rate. But AKTU copy checking is unpredictable so students have to fill rechecking form.
detailed_review.Other: Major 2 or 3 cultural events are arranged in college, UP scholarship is available for eligible candidates.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: I feel the college gives you enough opportunities if you are hardworking.

detailed_review.Placements: I think the placements are quite good. More than half of the boys are placed, with Infosys being the top recruiting company. Not many get internships, but some get internships at Microsoft, Google, and Oracle. Software developer and data analyst are the top roles offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs, classrooms, and library are good. The only problems are with the Wi-Fi, and the library is a bit small. Sports and games are available, but are not given much importance. There are canteens and mess facilities for everyone. Cleanliness is weakly maintained. Medical facilities are available too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good and helpful with good teaching quality as you progress higher in your course. The curriculum is bad. 8 hours of class really tire you. Semester exams are held by AKTU, which is good. The college holds CAE and PUT. The course curriculum is relevant.
detailed_review.Other: Events are there but not very frequent. The campus surroundings are good, and it is near the metro, which is convenient.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: Good college, infrastructure, and location.

detailed_review.Placements: Students at Galgotias University become eligible for campus placements starting from the 6th semester. Companies also visit during the 6th semester for internships, which often convert into full-time job offers. At Galgotias, internships are considered an important part of the B.Tech program. Most students start getting internship opportunities from the 3rd year (6th semester). Some companies also offer short-term internships after the 3rd year. Many companies like Wipro, TCS, and Infosys visit frequently. The average package for TCS is 4 to 6 LPA.  Around 30% of students get placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is small compared to the number of students in the university, but campus life is awesome. There are many clubs, such as singing, acting, dancing, sports, and fancy dress. The library facilities are good, with three libraries. It includes one specifically for engineering. Galgotias University focuses on delivering holistic education. It covers all aspects of an individual’s personality across various spheres. There are many sports activities available, with both indoor and outdoor sports facilities, as well as a fully equipped gymnasium.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty-to-student ratio in my program is around 1:30 to 1:35. Most classes have a manageable number of students. It allows professors to give personal attention when needed. They are approachable outside of class hours and willing to help with doubts if you reach out politely. In my opinion, the course curriculum is excellent in terms of relevance and comprehensiveness. The university organizes activities based on real-world applications. It helps strengthen students’ skills. The teaching methods are consistent across all departments. However, the frequency and timing of exams are not very systematic.

college_info.college_name: Gandhi Engineering College: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Cutoff

highlights.summary:
Gandhi Engineering College is also known as GEC is affiliated with the Biju Patnaik University of Technology. It was founded in 2006 within the city of Bhubaneswar. The college is accredited by the NAAC as an 'A' Grade institution and is AICTE-approved. The 25 acres GEC campus has a well-equipped infrastructure with all the necessary amenities such as labs, library, auditorium, sports complex, cafeteria, etc.
Gandhi Engineering College offers UG, PG, and diploma courses across Engineering, Computer Applications, and Management. The flagship courses offered at GEC are BTech, BCA, and MCA. The college offers a scholarship to deserving candidates. Gandhi Engineering College admission is based on merit and entrance exams. The college accepts national entrance exams such as OJEE, JEE, CAT, ATMA, MAT, etc. Seen below are the Gandhi Engineering College highlights:
Check out more on Gandhi Engineering College Highlights in the below videos:

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is good, and it is comfortable for students.

detailed_review.Placements: This college does not give good placement. Most of the students studied for the certificate because good companies are not coming to this college. The placement is not good in this college. 30 percent of the students get placed in this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This college does not give good facilities like good hostel and the classes are non AC room. The hostels are not maintained neat and clean. Canteen food is not good because it is fully oily food and not good for health. Lab has no Wi-Fi coverage.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exam is very strict. Faculty members are very strict. The exam mode is offline and paper-based. If a student is found to be doing copy, then the invigilator gets the student Madhya Pradesh and should not be allowed to attain the exam. Attendance is mandatory to sit in the examination hall.
detailed_review.Other: Computer science gives a better future and we should get a job in 4 years so we choose the course.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is best for a low-budget college.

detailed_review.Placements: Gandhi Engineering College have decent placement record with various campus visits for recruitment. The highest packages are 8 to 10 LPA, and average package is 4.5 LPA in our college. Placement ratio is 89% companies that require students of this are BYJU's Technokool Smart, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
College hostel can vary greatly in terms of facilities, food quality and overall experience. There are five hostels on the campus of College 4 for boys and one for girls. In college library facility, students also get to stay in a hostel. 
The electricity facility is available 24 hours a day. Food is good, according to other college students.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Faculty are helpful and highly qualified, and they also help most in their subject, but some teachers are not able to teach better. 
In course curriculum, students are at least trained on how to face the problems from the industry. Our college is an autonomous college, so students are more helped by teachers. 
40% is the passing percentage in the semester.
detailed_review.Other: This college provides all state scholarships.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: This college is good for low-budget students for a better education.

detailed_review.Placements: Gandhi Engineering College has a decent placement record with various campus costs for recruitment. The college offers the highest package of 8-10 LPA, and the average package is 4.5 LPA. Our college placement ratio is 89%. Companies that recruit GEC students are Byju's, TCS TechBook, SmartEd, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College hostels can vary greatly in terms of facilities, quality, and overall experience. There are 5 hostels in the college campus, 4 for boys and 1 for girls. In the college infrastructure, there is a library, gym, campus bank, and canteen facility on campus, and a cafeteria for evening snacks.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are more helpful in studies. They are highly qualified, and they help most in examinations. They trained students how to interact and face problems in the industry. There are 2 semesters and 8 internal. 4 for 1 semester in 1 year. The college's passing percent for the semester is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: The college provides the Eklayan facility.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: All things have improved from before I joined, and very much satisfied with my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Above 75% of students are placed in our course. Top recruiting companies from various Gandhi Engineering Colleges (GEC) include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Tech Mahindra, and L&T. Roles in branches like computer science, ECE, and mechanical engineering are offered by our college. The highest package is 5 LPA, the lowest is 1 LPA, and average is 3 LPA. 20 to 30% of students get internships from our college in companies like Cognizant and Infosys.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the facilities and infrastructure are available like classroom, lab, library, Wi-Fi, playground, entertainment zone, gym, etc. Quality of the food is average. All facilities are provided in hostel like gym area, sports area, canteen, and indoor game zone. Medical facilities are also provided by the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are qualified and provide good teaching. They help clear our doubts. Somehow, this course curriculum is nice, making students job-ready. Semester papers are pretty hard until you don't read but the exam environment is strict. The passing mark is 35%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I wanted to become a software developer. The best thing about this course is that there is very much competition in here so that we won't feel bored. Some things that are more practical from 1st semester should be points of improvement. Events and fests are done occasionally. Campus crowd is a little high. Connectivity is good, and campus surroundings are also good. Scholarships are used once a year, and extracurricular activities are also done mostly.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: As much as our college is the best for budget study.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% plus students were placed in our course. The highest package is 7.5 LPA, the lowest package is 3.5 LPA, and the average package is 4 LPA. Our college recruit company with Infosys, TVS, and Tata. Above 9 CGPA got placement in Huawei, TCS, and NTT Data, etc. 80 percent of people get an internship from this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a library facility, 24/7 medical facilities, banking services, a canteen, and a cafeteria. On our campus, there are 5 hostels, 4 for boys and 1 for girls. Hostel has a 24/7 electricity facility and 24/7 water available. Hostel students have a sports ground where we play what we want to play.
detailed_review.Faculty: The helpfulness, qualification, knowledge of teachers, teaching quality, curriculum relevance, industry readiness, exam difficulty, and pass percentage vary significantly by college. Curriculum makes students industry-ready. Exam is difficult, but after practicing so many questions, the exam does not feel hard.
detailed_review.Other: Our college provides all state scholarship facilities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Gandhi Engineering College Bhubaneswar is best for hostel people.

detailed_review.Placements: I saw that 100%, 89% of students selected from B.Tech course among all CSE departments. In AIML among most students get placed in companies. The lowest package offered in this course is 3 LPA, and the highest package is 9 LPA, according to my view and research I found.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus spans approximately 25 acres, thoughtfully landscaped with garden and fountain, creating a greenery mindset. There are modern five-storey buildings that have spacious classrooms equipped with fan, AC, digital boards, and Wi-Fi plus facilities. Hostel building has 5 total, 4 boys and 1 for girl, all located on campus within 5-minute walk.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty-to-student ratio is approximately 1:50 with PhD-qualified professors, especially in the CSE and ECE departments. Students report that faculty provide through lecture notes and conduct two internal exams along with final semester exam. B.Tech program spans 8 semesters (4 years). The final year focuses on a project and internship, along with electives.
detailed_review.Other: I am choosing this course today, all work is done by computer, and today is internet generation. All world members engaged with the internet to connect with each other. College organizes tech fest every semester. There is always a function for hostel people. This college engaged with scholarship Eklayan for Jharkhand students and also Odisha people for Odisha scholarship.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Better college, nice to be here.

detailed_review.Placements: Good college with high placement, the highest package is around 20 LPA, and the average is 4 LPA. Top companies like Microsoft come here to choose talented candidates. Students got internships from the best places. Passing batches is nice in behavior.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is nice with all facilities like big classrooms with smart rooms, a big library, and Wi-Fi facilities. Mess is also there with the best food served here. Sports and games are available. Regular sports and games are played here; it's a nice college. Gyms and parks are there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are nice and well-qualified, with the best teaching experience and knowledge. Semester exams are held on time and in a proper way, with no cheating. Teachers are supportive and behave well with all students. Teaching skills are good with the best knowledge. Exams are going well.
detailed_review.Other: Big campus with a large crowd, students learn better. Wish to improve the infrastructure to be better; otherwise, it’s a good college. Definitely take admission here. Regular events and festivals take place.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: From missed dreams to better opportunities – my journey to GEC.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students get placed at GEC Autonomous College is nearly 90%. The highest package is 10 LPA, the lowest package is 2.4 LPA, and the average package is 3.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Hireme, Amphosis, and others. The college only provides the link for internships. As a Computer Science and Engineering student, I have expertise in frontend development and backend development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a full Wi-F connection in the library as well as in other places like the seminar hall. Every classroom has a separate projector. The library has thousands of books, and online reading facilities are also available. The hostel and the mess food are decent. The medical facilities are also decent. The college organizes various sports and games inside the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful to everyone who needs help. They are well-qualified, and their mode of teaching is also great. They are experienced faculty members. Semester exams are very easy. If a student studies one month before the exam, they can clear it with good marks.
detailed_review.Other: I have been interested in Computer Science and Engineering since my childhood. I love to play with computers and code. Computer Science and Engineering has a bright future. The old curriculum should be replaced with the new education system, as nowadays we need to develop skills. Our college organizes Kalaustav every year in the month of March.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: The college is not excellent but it is good.

detailed_review.Placements: 1) 80% of students were successfully placed, though I don't know the exact rate. 2) The highest package to my knowledge is 6 Lacs, with an average of 3 Lacs. 3) Top companies include TCS, Infosys, Deloitte, among others. 4) 90% of students received opportunities with reputed companies offering internships, and websites like NPTEL and Coursera provide courses.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Some facilities are available, such as labs, classrooms, and a library, which are good. The hostel is also good, providing strictness, but the rooms are okay, and mess food is average. The college offers facilities for sports and a gym but does not arrange competitions.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good, helpful, and have the required qualifications. They encourage us to develop our skills on our own and do not provide the best courses in offline mode. While the course curriculum covers basic concepts, semester exam questions are good and the pass rate is around 5 CGPA.
detailed_review.Other: I wish our college would be improved like Silicon College.

reviews.course: Diploma in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The placement opportunities are good, with the average placement rate being decent.

detailed_review.Placements: I received many offers, such as for a CNC operation programmer and a maintenance engineer at different companies. There were several offers from various companies during campus recruitment. One company offered me a position for wiring in their construction vehicles and managing electrical maintenance.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The quality of the hostel is very good. The rooms and floors are clean, and there is a water cooler on every floor. The cleaning staff comes regularly to clean the washrooms and rooms. There are various facilities for students, including free Wi-Fi, sports areas, a garden, a walking area, and an open gym.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are excellent and supportive. They assist students in all areas and possess vast experience and knowledge in their respective fields. They encourage research and help students perform well in exams and secure placements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am fully satisfied with this college, and the fee is good.

detailed_review.Placements: 95% of students get placed in our college. 33 LPA is the highest package offered in our college, the lowest is approximately 3 LPA, and the average package is 6 LPA. Many companies come to our college, like TCS, Wipro, and others. I don't know more about it because I am in my first year. Approximately 16-70% of students get internships from our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our infrastructure is very good. It looks like the Taj Mahal. Let's talk about our Wi-Fi on campus. There is Wi-Fi everywhere, in our hostel, labs, and classrooms. In classrooms, we have projectors. As for our laptops, we have Lenovo laptops. We have everything we can take the example of Physics has everything for the Physics lab. We have our own medical facilities on college, so if anyone is serious, they don't have to go from our campus. We have a medical shop in the college. The quality of food is good, and we have a canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are very helpful. If any student has a past problem, like not paying the fee, they give us time to pay. They are highly qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is very good. The course curriculum is good, and it makes students to be industry-ready. In my previous semester, exams were pretty hard, but not too much. If you study, don't think difficult. But, if you don’t study, then it feels very hard. Our faculty is good.
detailed_review.Other: I say this because I like our college. Our college holds DJ nights, and they last for 2 days. They give us scholarships, extracurricular activities, and many more things.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Soumya's review on Gandhi Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college offers 100% of placements based on academic performance. Last academic year, almost 90% of students got placements in top MNCs like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, etc. Our college offers summer internships to every student. Last year, the highest package offered was 11 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Honestly, hostels are quite average and food is not good at all. Classrooms are quite good and every room is equipped with digital projectors, hostels, and library are equipped with 24/7 Wi-Fi. College organizes annual sports every year and also has sports clubs for every sport.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members here are highly qualified in their fields. Teachers are very helpful to students. Our college is an autonomous college, and has its own curriculum. It also provides extra courses like full-stack development. The semester exams are a bit difficult.
detailed_review.Other: College organises many events throughout the year for the entertainment of the students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Pros are tech fests, good quality food, average placements and cons are hostel rooms.

detailed_review.Placements: In GEC, almost 75-80% of students were placed in 2025 batch. The minimum salary package offered is 2 LPA. The maximum depends on students because many companies with high packages come. None of our students were capable to crack that interview. Companies are mostly startups but some big companies like TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Deloitte, and Flipkart visit our college for recruitment. Our college is it's developing phase, and they are trying a lot to do better.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities and infrastructure are available for any course. We will get library (named as knowledge center) access from Monday to Saturday, and the timing is from 9:00 AM - 8:00 PM. We will be given facilities like computer labs, high-speed internet, and classrooms with smart boards when we will be needed. For hostel, there is a downgrade that we may feel because rooms allotted in the first year will be in the best condition with yearly fees of Rs 75,000 according to our batch. When we will get a holder, we may face lack of facilities like cleanliness and room condition.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are always helpful. Their teaching quality is fabulous. We will love to study there if we really want to study. GEC has gone autonomous now so we will be getting the best. Course curriculum is relevant to industries needs. Semester examination will be 100% fair. We can not expect malpractice because teachers are very strict during examinations. We can easily pass if we study a week before exams because we have to score atleast 35 out of 100 marks.
detailed_review.Other: We will never feel down in GEC because every week we will be taken for an outing. In a year 2 grand tech fests and more than 200 events and activities are held every month. As a reward, we will get cash prizes, certificates, medals, and awards. In 2024, the college distributed approximately 3 lakhs as cash prizes among technical fest winners. If we want to really enjoy college life, we have a heart welcome. If we need any more information about the college, we can connect on my WhatsApp and will be happy to connect.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college experience 2024.

detailed_review.Placements: Basically, 80-85% of students are placed in our course. The highest package goes up to 10 LPA, and the lowest is 2 LPA. Companies like TCS, Infosys, Wipro, etc., come, and some normal startup companies also visit. Again, 80-85% of students take placements because nowadays, it is tough to crack an interview.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good environment, but the hostel is not so good, to be honest. The food is not good, like in every college. Teachers are good, but the exam schedule is too fast, like 3-4 months, so it is hard to cover all the syllabus. But it's also a part of life, so we have to manage it. The lab and classrooms are honestly not that great, but they're okay.
detailed_review.Faculty: Honestly, no one cares about what you did in the examination. Teachers are good; some of them have come from IIT, IIIT, etc. As you know, every coin has two sides, so there are some perks, but you have to complete everything within a specific time period. Yes, the course is good, and honestly, you can do it.
detailed_review.Other: The course is good if teachers teach it properly, but there are major problems regarding the timetable for the syllabus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Gandhi Engineering College review.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2024, about 96% of students were placed. The highest package was 18 LPA, the minimum was 2 LPA and the average was 4-5 LPA. The top recruiting companies were Hindustan, Mahindra, Tata, and many more. If you are skilled enough, you can also become a software engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college gives you many facilities, like labs where you can do many lab experiments. In the hostel, you have Wi-Fi for using the internet. They also give you a library in which you can use Wi-Fi to study with your laptop or mobile phone. There are also gym facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very friendly and helpful to the students. They can easily clear your doubts, and they are highly qualified from IITs like universities. Semester exams are held every 3-4 months gap, which is a little difficult. After the exam, they give you a long vacation.
detailed_review.Other: I chose B. Teach CSE because of future aspects and because the CSE branch has a 100% placement rate.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Gandhi Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: College claims 100% placement, but most of the students are getting placed. TCS, WIPRO, TECH MAHINDRA, and some startup companies are coming to give the campus placement. The highest package is 10 lpa, and the average package is 6 lpa. Overall, it seems to be good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is not very big but good enough to explore. Infrastructure is decent. Hostel rooms are good. The library is present on the college campus, and it is open till 10 pm. Wi-Fi is available in the hostel each floor, and the speed is decent. Canteen food is not good. Sports such as cricket, badminton, basketball, and volleyball facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are very experienced, and some are really very good and have a friendly nature with students. Course curriculum is very vast. Exams are very strictly done. Every day you have 5 hours of classes. Fewer holidays are given by college. Very much focused on academics.

faqs.question: Can I get admission to Gandhi Engineering College with 60% in Class 12th?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can I get admission to Gandhi Engineering College with 60% in Class 12 The candidates who have achieved 50% marks in their Class 12 exams from various boards. They merely need to pay the application cost and submit an application form to get started the 12-grade marks alone have become qualifying conditions for various courses.

faqs.question: What is the admission process of Gandhi Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Gandhi engineering college B.Tech admission is based on a candidates performance in JEE main. 2.for taking admission in Mtech, candidate with a valid GATE score are given prefrence. Non GATE  candidates are required to appear for an online test. 3.MBA aspirants must qualify OJEE in order to seek admission to GEC.

faqs.question: How many seats are available for the B.Tech programme at Gandhi Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Seats available for the B.Tech program at Gandhi Engineering College are seats available for B.Tech. in civil engineering are 60. Seats for a B.Tech. in computer Science and engineering are about 180. B.Tech. in data science: 120 seats are available. B.Tech. on mechanical engineering 60s seats are available. data.title: Gandhi Engineering College Placement Report 2024
summary: As per the NIRF report 2025, the Gandhi Engineering College placement recorded a total of 746 students securing placements out of which 665 belonged to BTech and 81 belonged to MTech program. The median packages recorded for Gandhi Engineering College placements 2024 for BTech and MTech programs were INR 5.3 LPA and INR 5.2 LPA , respectively.

Earlier, in 2023, the median packages for BTech and MTech stood at INR 4.5 LPA and INR 5.1 LPA , respectively. A total of 476 students got placed during the Gandhi Engineering College placement in 2023.

college_info.college_name: GITA - Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement: Admissions 2025, Courses, Fees

highlights.summary:
GITA (Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement) is a private institute established in 2004. GITA is approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) under the Ministry of HRD, Govt. of India, recognised by Govt. of Odisha. The institute is affiliated with Biju Patnaik University of Technology (BPUT), Rourkela. It is accredited by NAAC (National Assessment and Accreditation Council) at "A" grade with 3.30 CGPA( Highest in Odisha) and the National Board of Accreditation (NBA) and approved by DSIR as SIRO (Scientific and Industrial Research Organization).
Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement provides various undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programmes. The courses include BTech, MTech, MBA, MCA, and PhD. Below are the major highlights of the Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement:
Biju Patnaik University of Technology (BPUT), Rourkela
BTech, MTech, MBA, MCA, and PhD

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Beyond books and towards success.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% of students got placed last year with this course. The highest average package is 8 LPA, and the lowest average package is 3 LPA. Internships are also provided to the students. So many companies are visiting here for hiring such as TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and some startup companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Every department has a separate lab and classrooms. Wi-Fi is given to every student. A world-class library is also available. Hostel facility is so good and comfortable. Food is very tasty and healthy. Sports facilities are also available for both boys and girls.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and very helpful. They solve everyone's problem easily. Teaching quality is also good. This course is curriculum relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are easy to pass, and we are provided with question banks for practice.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I always wanted to become a successful engineer. So many extracurricular activities are happening here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good college in technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. Mostly in IT, the placements are good than in other branches. This year Tech Mahindra, TCS, Infosys, etc., visited our college. Tech Mahindra is the top recruiter. The highest package offered is 3.2 LPA. The lowest package offered is 1.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good. The campus is big. There is a garden inside. There are 8 boys hostels and 6 girls hostels for students. Library is good and all types of technology books and other magazines are available. Classrooms are spacious and digitally updated. Labs are spacious and have all chemicals and apparatus used in industry. There is a cricket ground. Volleyball court, badminton court, etc., are present in this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good. They are highly qualified and experienced. They all have done their postgraduate and masters. They use simple language which is easy to understand. They clear our doubts through discussion. There are two semesters in a year conducted by the university. Each semester has two sessionals. Questions are moderate level.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: To grow, you need to read and analyse first.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement cell of GITA Autonomous College is very active. Almost 70% students are being placed. The starting CTC per month ranges from twenty-five to thirty thousand and can exceed as per the company norms and the employee's work. Companies like TCS, EESPL, Capgemini, and Accenture visit the college for the placement. The placement includes all off-campus, on-campus, and pool drives.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is such appealing to the eye, but the hostel is of very poor quality. The infrastructure of the hostel is good, but the food quality is unbearable. The food is of such quality that even the students with the strongest immunity will not be able to survive. The college has a canteen, a medical room, multiple sports grounds multiple in number, a basketball court, a football ground, a table tennis court, etc. It also has Wi-Fi and a well-stocked library.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum, knowledge provided, way of teaching, and behavior of teachers everything is good. But there are some teachers who are very arrogant, they don't even answer genuine doubts properly. The placement cell, sports department, cultural department, and other departments everything and everyone is very student-friendly.
detailed_review.Other: The college hosts multiple number of events and festivals which keep the students' minds fresh and engaged in good activities. The only thing I wish could be better is the food quality at the hostel.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Before paying lakhs, do check the reviews.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement this college offers with the fee structure is incredible. Almost 75% of students are being placed in good companies. Companies like EESPL, Capgemini, and TCS come as recruiters for placement. The starting package is around thirty thousand per month if done in Bhubaneswar, and can increase if done in any metro city.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is so appealing that the students don't wish to go outside the campus. It has canteens, libraries, sports grounds, clubhouses, and all the rest of the refreshment facilities, which help the students get their minds refreshed from the academic stress. The hostel is okay, but the food quality is poor; hence, it is not worth it. Even the healthiest can get sick by eating hostel food.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course is good, and the knowledge provided is good and top-notch, but some of the teachers are arrogant. Even if you ask a genuine question, they tend to reply arrogantly, which is not appealing, but the rest is good. The coordinator, placement cell teachers, and other teachers are also very helpful. The curriculum does make students industry-ready, as it provides projects and industry visits along with academics.
detailed_review.Other: The college hosts multiple events and fests, which also help students develop their personalities. The hostel's food quality can be improved. My interest in developing software made me choose this course at this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: To grow, need to research first.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement provided by the college in this fee structure is awesome. There are off-campus, on-campus, and pool drive, all types of placement opportunities being offered. Almost 75% of the students are being placed in every course, and those are good companies, some even in core companies. Companies like ESSPL, TCS, Infosys, and Capgemini visit the college for placement drives.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The most attractive part is the infrastructure. The infrastructure is so pleasing and mesmerizing that you tend to get greedy to take admission in this college. The library, classes, and labs are all top-notch. I took the hostel facility for three years. Last year, I stayed in a shared PG (flat). The hostel is okay, but the food quality is the worst. You cannot survive on hostel food at all. That was the only reason I left the college hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course is good, and the knowledge provided is also good, but some of the teachers are rude and unapproachable. They are very annoying and arrogant. Even if you ask genuine questions, they will not answer nicely. The rest is good. The course does make students industry-ready, as there are different projects, internships, and industry visits conducted by the college, which are very helpful for the students to get market-ready. The semester exams are not very difficult. They can be cleared by studying one or two nights before the exams.
detailed_review.Other: Being interested in software and hardware, I was very sure to choose B. Tech in Computer Science, and choosing this college was due to the fees and placements. The college does not charge much in fees compared to any other tier-1 colleges, and also provides placements and projects. The thing that can be improved is the hostel and its food. The food quality is so poor that even the healthiest person can get sick. The college hosts multiple events on every national and special day. Ganesh Chaturthi is celebrated for 10 days, which brings refreshment and spirituality among students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Read, go through, then enter.

detailed_review.Placements: College provides good number of placements. Companies like ESSPL, Capgemini, and Infosys come as recruiters. Almost 70% of the students in my batch are placed in good companies. Roles like software developer, tester, and coder are the roles being offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The only thing that attracted me to this college is the infrastructure. College has beautiful infrastructure with spacious library, labs, sports room, and other facilities. The worst hostel experience of mine is the college hostel. The food is something I have never experienced. The only thing I will not recommend is the hostel food and hostel inside the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good. Teachers are supportive, some are arrogant, and some are very friendly. In the examination department, the placement coordinator and everyone are approachable. College conducts two semesters in a year with some tests in between which helps the students to get a reality check of their academic performance.
detailed_review.Other: There is no specific reason for me to choose this course, it is just as everyone has guided. Hostel is the only thing I wish to improve as students are not healthy, they can't study.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good for education and hostel, but placements are weak. Not recommended for jobs.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the B.Tech 2024 batch (CSE). Placements are not very strong here. Hardly 20-30% of students get placed, mostly in marketing and sales roles rather than core technical jobs. The highest package is around 4 LPA, the lowest is 2 LPA, and the average is close to 3 LPA. Very few companies visit the campus. Most of them are small or local firms. Internships are also limited and usually provided in startups or marketing-based companies. Core technical roles are very rare.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus has basic facilities like Wi-Fi, classrooms with projectors, computer labs, a decent library, and some sports facilities. However, labs and equipment are not updated regularly. Hostel facilities are average. Rooms are okay but a bit crowded. The mess food is manageable but not very hygienic. Medical support is limited. Sports and extracurricular facilities exist but are not very well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers are helpful and qualified. But the teaching quality depends on the individual faculty. The curriculum is more theoretical and less industry-oriented, so students need to learn extra skills on their own to become job-ready. Semester exams are moderate in difficulty. The pass percentage is generally high as long as you study regularly.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life is decent with a mixture of students from different regions. There are some fests, cultural events, and technical activities, but not on a very large scale. Crowd is friendly, and connectivity to nearby town is manageable. Extracurricular activities happen but are limited.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good for education and hostel, but placements are weak. Not recommended for jobs.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from B.Tech 2024 batch (CSE). Placements are not very strong here. Hardly 20-30% of students get placed, mostly in marketing and sales roles rather than core technical jobs. The highest package is aroaund 4 LPA, the lowest is 2 LPA, and the average is close to 3 LPA. Very few companies visit the campus. Most of them are small or local firms. Internships are also limited and usually provided in startups or marketing based companies. Core technical roles are very rare.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus has basic facilities like Wi-Fi, classrooms with projectors, computer labs, a decent library, and some sports facilities. However, labs and equipment are not updated regularly. Hostel facilities are average. Rooms are okay but a bit crowded. The mess food is manageable but not very hygienic. Medical support is limited. Sports and extracurricular facilities exist but are not very well maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers are helpful and qualified. But the teaching quality depends on the individual faculty. The curriculum is more theoretical and less industry-oriented, so students need to learn extra skills on their own to become job-ready. Semester exams are moderate in difficulty. The pass percentage is generally high as long as you study regularly.
detailed_review.Other: The total fee for the course is around Rs 2,00,000, which is low compared to other colleges. Considering the weak placement opportunities, the return on investment is not very high. The value for money is average. It is good for affordable education but not great for career growth.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of GITA Autonomous College.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students are placed from GITA Autonomous College. The highest salary offered is 7.5 LPA, and the lowest salary is 3.5 LPA. The recruiting companies are Cognizant, Argusoft, etc. 60% of students get internships. The roles offered are software developer, software analyst, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure and hostel facilities are the best, with an AC hostel and a non-AC hostel. The CSE department has the best facilities, with advanced lab systems and well-structured classrooms with digital TV class boards. The library is one of the best in Odisha, with the best facilities for reading and a silent environment. The food quality and menu are also the best.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are the most friendly and the best, with IIT and NIT professor degrees. Their teaching technique and way of explaining are superb. In CSE, it covers all AI, Data Science, and Networking because it is a core subject. The semester and mid-semester exams are conducted in a proper way with the best teacher guidance.
detailed_review.Other: The fests, cultural programmes, and sports always take place in the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Read, analyze, review, and then enter.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement system at GITA Autonomous College is excellent. In my batch, almost 70% of students got placed. Companies like Capgemini, ESPL, TCS, and others visit the college to recruit qualified students. Internship opportunities are also available. Companies offer roles such as programmer, coder, and consultant. Placements sometimes happen on campus and sometimes off campus. The selection process varies by company, some conduct exams and interviews, while others have exams, group discussions, and interviews.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Being an autonomous college, this college does not provide very good hostel facilities. The food quality is poor. However, the rooms are good, Wi-Fi is available, water coolers are provided, and all necessary amenities are present. The boys’ and girls’ hostels are in separate buildings with different rules and regulations. Girls need to obtain a pass to leave the hostel, which is issued twice a week.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty of the course I chose (B.Teach) is good. The teachers are well-educated and student-friendly. They teach with dedication, which helps us understand and grasp the concepts. The placement coordinator and exam coordinator are very friendly and approachable. The faculty also trains students for placements and internship opportunities and provides guidance regarding placements.
detailed_review.Other: B.Teach course in Computer Science is highly in demand and has great growth potential in today’s tech world. Everyone needs software or websites developed, which was the main reason I chose this course and college. The hostel facilities could be improved, but everything else is satisfactory. The college organizes several festivals, including a four-day celebration of Ganesh Chaturthi, which brings joy to students and gives them a break from academics.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Technology
reviews.review_title: Overall, good college with decent placements, good teaching, and pretty good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 50% of students got placed in our course. The highest salary is 10 LPA. The lowest salary is 5 LPA, and the average salary is 7 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Infosys, Wipro, TCS, Capgemini, Accenture, etc. 70% of students got internships at Infosys, Byjus, TCS, etc. Top roles are software engineer and data analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is pretty good. Labs are good and mordenised. Classrooms are good too with digital boards. Library is best. Wi-Fi is available everywhere. Hostel rooms are good with good water. Wi-Fi is available. But the food quality is kind of little adjusting in the canteen. There's also food court available in which students can get good quality food by buying. Medical facilities are good. Sports and games facilities are also super.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and well knowledgeable. The teaching quality is pretty good. This course curriculum is relevant. Most students become industry-ready with proper studies and practice. The semester exams' difficulty level is about average. Enough for an ideal student. The pass percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: I actually wanted to choose computer science engineering. But chose this course due to the unavailability of seats because I was late for admission. Although computer science and technology is pretty similar to CSE too. The course gives us strong knowledge and skills in programming, computer architecture, and algorithms. Everything is good in courses as per the price so if it gets more improved then it will be better too. Events like sports, or external events are also done in college. Campus is well averagely crowded not too high, not too low, and well sustained. Connectivity is pretty good and fest is done every year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: GITA is an autonomous college.

detailed_review.Placements: I joined this college in 2024 and am currently in my 1st year. This year, 2-3 mass recurring companies like TCS visit our campus after a long gap. I think till my year of graduation, more companies will come and visit our campus. I hope everything turns out well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library is the best thing about our college as it provides good faculty support. It also has a wide range of facilities. For the infrastructure of the college, I would not rate it 10. Labs do not have all the desktops working.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are supportive, but the problem is we have regular classes from 8 AM to 2:30 PM and have 2 breaks, one of 10 minutes and the other one is of 20 minutes. We are pretty exhausted by the study routine that the college follows. Further, the issue with the college is about the last-moment assignment submission, as they ask to submit the assignments a week before the exams.
detailed_review.Other: We have a fest once a year, but it is good.

faqs.question: How can I join BTech course after Class 12 at Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement?
faqs.answer: To enrol for BTech course admission at Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement after Class 12, the basic eligibility is Class 12. Candidates must pass Class 12 with a 45% aggregate with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the subjects from Chemistry / Biology / Biotechnology / Technical Vocational Subject / Electronics / Computer Science / Information Technology / Geology / Statistics. Apart from the eligibility, the selection criteria for the course are JEE Main, and OJEE.

faqs.question: What is the MBA course duration at Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement?
faqs.answer: It is a two-year course spread over four semesters at Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement. The MBA course degree is offered through BPUT. It is a specialised course which provides the quickest entry to the Business Administration industry. It also caters for the needs of Business Administration-enabled services, banks, BPOS, KPOS and various requirements of the public and private sector.

faqs.question: What is the selection criteria for MBA course at Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement?
faqs.answer: Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement shortlists candidates for MBA programme based on MAT, XAT, CAT, ATMA, OJEE. Candidate whi have completed Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering/Technology/ Architecture / Pharmacy examination of minimum four/five years duration in any discipline from any University of Odisha can also enrol for MBA admission.

faqs.question: Is there any entrance exam for admission to M.Tech at Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates must have valid entrance scores which are OJEE, CUET-PG, and GATE. For admission to an M.Tech course at GITA, students need to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria in the first place. The eligibility criteria for the course is BTech/MSc with a 50% aggregate (45% for SC/ST).

faqs.question: Is M.Tech course available at Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement?
faqs.answer: Yes, MTech course is available at the Gandhi Institute for Technological Advancement. The institute offers MTech through BPUT. To be eligible for the award of the degree the candidate shall complete the course in a maximum period of two years from the date of enrolment for the first semester of the course.

college_info.college_name: GIET University: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Scholarships

highlights.summary:
Gandhi Institute of Engineering and Technology (GIET) University was founded in 1997 by Vidya Bharati Educational Trust and is located at Gunupur, Odisha. The University is recognised by the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (DSIR) and offers courses with the approval of ICAR-Delhi. GIET Gunupur also offers courses in approval with Indian Nursing Council (INC).
Accreditations: GIET Gunupur is known to be accredited under the Government of Odisha Act 2018. The University offers courses as a member of Association of Indian Universities (AIU)
Recognition and Accreditations: Approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), the National Board of Accreditation (NBA) and University Grants Commission (UGC), GIET has received the “Best University award for Innovation and Campus Placement" in the International Education Pride Awards 2021 Ceremony.
Academics: This private University has 6 schools, such as Engineering and Technology, Management Studies, Agriculture, Sciences, Humanities and Social Sciences, and Nursing that offer various undergraduate and postgraduate programmes such as BTech, MBA, BSc, BBA and MTech among others.
Admissions: GIET University admissions are offered through an entrance. The University offers admission on the basis of various entrance exams such as CMAT/ CAT/ MAT/ XAT/ GIETEE/ OJEE and other equivalent examinations.
Scholarships: GIET University scholarships are offered to meritorious students on the basis of need and merit. The University has introduced various schemes to provide financial aid to the students.
Placements: GIET Gunupur placement stats of 2024 reflects a placement record of 950 students with the highest package worth INR 26.5 LPA.
Infrastructure: GIET University infrastructure includes technologically advanced premises for students. equipped with every basic amenity required during the course of study.
The major highlights of GIET University are tabulated below:
GIETEE/ JEE Main/ OJEE/ CAT/ MAT/ XAT/ GATE
Check out more on GIET University Highlights in the below videos:
