summary.college_name: Godavari Institute of Engineering and Technology

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The infrastructure is beautiful, and the faculty is student-friendly.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students got placed from our course is above 80 percent. The highest package is 25 LPA, and the lowest package is 3 LPA are offered in our course. The top recruiting companies are IBM, Tata, Tech Mahindra, KPMG, Dell, etc. The percentage of students who got internships from our course is above 75 percent, and the main companies are IBM, KPMG, Dell, etc. The top roles offered in our course are web development, frontend, backend, full stack, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and their infrastructure of our course are beautiful and more attractive, and the Wi-Fi signal is good. The labs have excellent equipment, and the classrooms are clean and good. The libraries are filled with knowledge books and technology books, and the games and sports are conducted by the college management.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are really helpful for our semester examination. Teachers are really knowledgeable and qualified. The teaching quality is really good. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. There is no difficulty in the semester examination of our college because of the friendly faculty and good subject explanation, and the pass percentage of the semester is above 90 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is really good to join because of the friendly faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed in our course is above 90 percent. The highest package is 25 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA offered in our course. The top recruiting companies are IBM, Tata, Tech Mahindra, KPMG, etc. The percentage of students who got internships from our course is above 90 percent, and companies are IBM, Tata, Tech Mahindra, KPMG, etc. The top roles offered in your course are web development, frontend, backend, full-stack AI agent, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure are good and attractive. The Wi-Fi signal is really fast and good. The labs have good equipment, and the classrooms are clean and neat. Every class has digital boards, and the libraries are filled with technology books and knowledge books. The facilities of the hostel are really good and peaceful for students, and the quality of food in the hostel is really good and tasty. The medical facilities are really great, and the sports and games are organized by our college management to participate in every sport.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are really helpful for semester examinations, and they are well-qualified and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is really good and student-friendly. The course is relevant, and it makes the student industry-ready. It is not difficult to clear the semester examinations because of our faculty's explanation. It is easy to pass all subjects, and the pass percentage is above 90 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Faculty and infrastructure are good.

detailed_review.Placements: Renowned for its exceptional placement opportunities. In the previous batch, nearly 75 percent of the students got campus placements. This year we have already achieved a 36 percent placements. Prominent companies like DXC Solutions actively recruit from our college. The highest package offered is 8 LPA. The lowest package is 3.6 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is wonderful with a vast amount of space and greenery, well-built infrastructure, and a Wi-Fi-surrounded campus. The library is technologically advanced, provided with systems with the internet along with books. The quality of food in the college hostel is decent with a healthy menu. In adequate times, sports are conducted mainly in festive seasons.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers are well-trained and has a minimum of teaching experience in the particular field of study. They are knowledgeable with an ample amount of ideas. Not so sure, but it helps most of the students at the average level, who are barely ready for industry. Semester exams are not so tough, but preparation is required to clear without any backlogs.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because the present generation is about software, and I want to become a software engineer.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I hope it improves for next year's students.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed last year is 50%. The package offered in our course varies. Few companies visit for recruitment, and the packages differ. The college provides some internships, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS). The top roles in the course are software-related.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are not so good, and not so bad. It is average. Classroom infrastructure is good. The college has two libraries that provide textbooks. There are canteens, and mess food is good. Sports facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: College teachers are very helpful, friendly, and well-qualified. They share their knowledge. B.Tech is a four-year course. Each year has two semesters. Every six months, there are two mid-exams, total eight semesters.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because of my interest. Events and fests occur occasionally.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A review of my college about the courses, placements, and cultural events.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are looking over all the students' futures, so they are trying to include every student on the campus to actively participate in each and every recruitment drive. More than 50 percent of the students are getting placed with a CTC of 3.5 to 12 in top MNCs like Accenture, Tech Mahindra, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the campus is very neat and good. They design the curriculum according to the respective departments to enhance student productivity. They provide hostels with different types of rooms for both Indian and international students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Since it is an autonomous college, exams will be held in the college itself, and the faculty who are teaching should have at least completed their post-graduation. Some of them are from other states, and we have representatives from international collaborations like IBM and other business courses.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the CSE department, and I chose it because of the boom in the future in the AI field. Since we are going to use AI in every aspect of individual life, there are various levels at which tasks can be automated and suggestions made for difficult conditions that one cannot handle.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely dissatisfied with placements in 2025 and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: In some companies, a minimum of 7.5 CGPA is required. In some companies, an 8 CGPA is required to enter the recruitment exam. Only 4 to 5 companies visit the campus, and among them, some companies recruit only girls. If anyone is selected, boarding facilities depend on the company. I am absolutely dissatisfied with the placements in 2025. Faculty also help us move forward in life and grab opportunities in reality.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi speed is not very fast. In the hostel, there are only two routers per floor. There is no Wi-Fi in classrooms. The overall infrastructure is better compared to other colleges. The hostel food is not very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty members teach well and care about whether students are learning or just listening. The curriculum is mostly related to the course. The semester exams are a little difficult, and sometimes it feels hard to write the exams, but students generally pass.
detailed_review.Other: For the fee charged, the course is reasonably priced and affordable for middle-class students. Events are conducted regularly, mainly technical events. The main fest is Maha Telugu Sabhalu, which is boring for single students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It will become a university in 2025, and it is attracting companies to hire the students.

detailed_review.Placements: Above 60 or 70 percent of students got placed from my course. 15 LPA to 30 LPA is the average package offered in my course. IBM, Google, and other top companies are ready to recruit for my course. Above 50 percent of students got internships from my course, such as IBM, etc., companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are very good, it has a greenery college and it is very pleasant, full of trees. Wi-Fi facilities are also available, and labs are very attractive to get interested in doing work. Classrooms are very good and the library contains lots of programming and core subjects books which can be used to score marks and crack interviews.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified and knowledgeable, and help students to clear their doubts. As to teaching quality, they put their maximum efforts on giving quality teaching. The course curriculum is relevant, and it also gives practical knowledge through labs and prepares students to be industry-ready. Coming to semester exams, the pass percentage is 70 to 85 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in computer Science and engineering, so I took this course. I like coding, and the improvements require getting some more practical knowledge and events and fests are commonly conducted, so they are enjoyable.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Godavari Institute of Engineering and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: 65 percent of students are placed, and the highest package is approximately 35 LPA, while the lowest is 3 LPA, with a minimum package of 6 LPA offered in my course. The top recruiting companies are Microsoft, Tesla, and Google. 30 percent of students received internships in my course, with companies like Google, Microsoft, and opportunities for HR managers, product managers, and sometimes even CEOs, also offering positions in my course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are good, not bad, but the food quality in the hostel is not good. The mess food is acceptable, and the infrastructure is good, but the hostel rooms are not very good. The library is centrally air-conditioned, and the Wi-Fi signal is okay. The quality of food is not too good in this college, and medical facilities are available 24/7, with a hospital very near the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and knowledgeable, and the teaching quality is average. The course curriculum is relevant and makes students for the industry. The exams are very easy. I mean, the exam structure is neither too bad nor too good. It is satisfactory for semester exams, and it is very easy to pass, with a pass percentage of 75 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Not good and not bad depends up

detailed_review.Placements: SEE, it's a Tier 2 college. Companies will come very rarely, but this college is trying very hard to get companies to the campus. If you have good skills and communication, then you may get a job, but it is not confirmed because companies are going to Tier 1 colleges.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: 1st-year campus is nice, but the 2nd-year campus is not that good looking because of old boards, classrooms, and benches. When it comes to the electronics lab, some kits will work, some won't, but the faculty will teach you how to do it with that kit.
detailed_review.Faculty: When it comes to my branch ECE, some faculty teach very nicely and you will understand the subject, and they are friendly too. Some will teach by showing PPTs on the projector. The curriculum is the old one under JNTUK, and exams are conducted in our college.
detailed_review.Other: My batch is the last batch of that campus because now it has changed to GGU University, electronics and Communication Engineering is a difficult branch, you need patience and hard work to get success.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Godavari Institute of Engineering and Technology

detailed_review.Placements: 95% of students were placed in my course. The highest package offered in Data Science at Godavari Global University is 24 LPA, while the lowest package is 8 LPA, and the average package ranges between 12 to 15 LPA. TCS, Wipro, Infosys, Cognizant, Virtusa, Accenture, Capgemini, Hyundai, DXC Technology, L&T, NCC Limited, Micro Plastics, Tata Steel, Hexaware, IMC, VPG, Bajaj, Lincoln Electric Pvt. Ltd., Avaasa Realtors, BSCPL Infrastructure Limited, and Tech Mahindra are the recruiters. 60% of roles are for data scientist and data analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure in my course/department are above average. Classes are good and the lab is well-equipped. The library spans almost two floors, and we can see one canteen per block. Every working alternative day has one sports period.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teachers are graduates from notable colleges and IITs. The teaching quality is good. Lately, our college is tying up with notable companies to make students industry ready. I can definitely say that semester exams are tough, and you can expect questions like from IITs, but the pass percentage is good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it is an evergreen course and has job security. You can bet on freshers, scholarship, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is too bad and no proper classes, faculty, and equipments.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, 50% of students are getting placed. The highest package is 14 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA. Top recurring companies are TCS, Wipro, AWP, Cognizant, etc. The internship provided is low, only some students are doing internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are very poor in our college. Infrastructure is poor, no proper classes and benches are there. There is no Wi-Fi and no proper books in the library. There is no proper interaction between the teacher and student.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are not helpful to the students, only some teachers care about the students. There are quality issues weekly. Other teachers are only for showcasing that they have 0 knowledge of subjects. There are no industry visits in second year, and no companies are coming to our college for placements. They don't have any knowledge of their teaching subjects.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because we can go into software and hardware.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am totally disappointed with this college regarding placements, infrastructure, and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: As per the information for the last few years, the percentage of students who passed is below 5% from my branch (ECE). No internships are provided, and there is no proper guidance for a career. It is just built to give a B.Tech certificate without any proper skills or placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is also too poor. When you start from labs to washrooms, nothing is in a proper way. Especially in our course, there is no proper laboratory equipment for study. I had asked my friends about the food in the mess, and they said it is below average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty are not updated on the new things in the world. And the faculty is to be friendly with the students. The exams are average. But if we put minimal effort, there is a chance to pass. But the problem with the college is that they simply fail to just pay the re-evaluation fee, and then they pass the student.
detailed_review.Other: Presently, I am in 3rd year of ECE. Everyone will expect many fests and programs from a B.Tech institution, but this college is poor in that regard. I personally took this course to become a good engineer and serve my nation, but due to a lack of money and proper guidance, I got a seat in this institution.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Our college is better. There is no satisfaction because our facility is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 1800 to 2500 students may be placed in this college. The highest package is 22 LPA, and the lowest package is 3 LPA. Recruiting companies are TCS, Wipro, etc. Almost 60% of people will get internships from the top companies, such as AWS devOps, AWS full-stack, and GenAi. These courses are offered using Techwing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am not from hostel but by knowing the experience from our friends they used to say that the food in the hostel is better but not that much. They provide sports and games for the hostel students. Canteen is okay but, the medical facilities are not that much good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are more friendly and they used to help us as students to gain knowledge. The course in the curriculum is useful but not that much. According to my experience, I suggest increasing the number of coding subjects in the courses. The semester exams are really done successfully. Our branch pass percentage is 93%.
detailed_review.Other: My course is data science. I think that this branch is more useful in software engineering to analyse the data and other software uses to gain more knowledge about data analysis and data pipelines. Our college hosts more events. There is full crowd on campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a good college with the best faculty and campus life. The infrastructure is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college placements are good. Many MNCs conduct campus drives like Tech Mahindra, Wipro, Cognizant, Capgemini, and Cisco in the final year. 80% of students get placed every year. There is a good placement record every year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: GIET College is spread over 300 acres. The campus has good infrastructure. It is clean. Seminar halls are good. Many food courts are available in our college. Sports activities are also good in our college. Labs are very good for gaining more knowledge.
detailed_review.Faculty: It has good faculty members. The course curriculum is good. It provides both practical and theoretical knowledge for students to build projects. In semester exams, students gain a CGPA of above 8.
detailed_review.Other: The computer science and electronics branches are good at our GIET college, and more than 80% of students get placements. It has the best campus life. Every year, it conducts a fresher party and fests like Mirthri and Medha celebrations. Final year students, after graduation, celebrate the graduation day to get lifetime memories.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements, supportive faculty & balanced campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70-80% of students got placed. The highest package offered was around 12 LPA, the lowest was 3 LPA, and the average package stood near 5 LPA. Top recruiters included Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Capgemini, and Tech Mahindra. Many students also received internships in reputed companies. The most common roles offered were Software Engineer, Analyst, and Developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has good infrastructure with Wi-Fi enabled campus, well-maintained classrooms, computer labs, and a library with a wide collection of books. Hostel facilities are decent with proper security and medical support. The mess food is average but hygienic, and sports facilities like a cricket ground, badminton court, and indoor games, are available. Overall, the facilities support both academics and recreation.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are qualified and approachable. Most of them have M.Teach or Ph.D. degrees. Teaching quality is good, with practical exposure given through labs and projects. The curriculum is relevant to industry standards, although adding more emerging technologies would be useful. Semester exams are moderately tough but manageable with preparation. The pass percentage is fairly high, showing a supportive academic culture.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in technology and career opportunities. The best part of the course is the balance between academics and extracurricular activities. One area that could be improved is increasing industry tie-ups and internships. Overall, the campus provides a positive environment for learning and personal growth.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: All the things are better.

detailed_review.Placements: Overall, the highest pass percentage of the year goes to the Data Science department for the last 3 years. In this college, there are almost 10+ branches, including CSE, AI/ML, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Electrical and Electronics Engineering, ECE, Mechanical, and Civil.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the labs and libraries are good. The food in the canteen is better compared to the hostel mess. There are some sports periods in college. Ragging is prohibited in our college, and the education is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very friendly with students, and they always help students to achieve good marks in the exam, and they teach well. The way of teaching is good. There is no difficulty in the semester exams to pass, as we are regular in college. My pass percentage is 78% in CGPA.
detailed_review.Other: The Data Science course is newly started, and it has a high range in the market. It tells about the importance of the data, and I am interested in joining this department.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am dissatisfied with the college hostel and the food in the hostel.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement percentage of our college in Computer Science and Engineering B.Tech witnessed a good placement session with approximately 60% of students successfully placed through the campus recruit drives. The highest package offered is 20 LPA, the average package is 4 to 6 LPA, and the lowest is 3 to 3.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is available for our department. In our college classrooms with good infrastructure, projectors or digital boards, white boards, and well maintained labs with updated software and hardware, but some systems lag slightly. The hostel is good, clean, and secure with cc cameras, and the food is not maintained properly, but it is good to eat.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are well qualified and experienced. Most professors hold high level degrees and have research and industrial exposure. The semester exams are slightly difficult. They test the conceptual understanding more than written learning and consistent study.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good labs and placements are improving.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60% of civil engineering students got placed, with packages ranging from 2.5 LPA to 6 LPA, and an average of 3.2 LPA. Top recruiters L&T, MEIL, NCC, and Shapoorji Pallonji. Nearly 50% of students secured internships in companies like L&T and local construction firms.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The civil engineering department offers well-equipped labs, smart classrooms, department-specific library access, and campus-wide Wi-Fi to support learning. Hostel facilities are decent with clean rooms, the mess food is average, and canteen options are limited.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and supportive with good teaching quality, though some subjects lack practical exposure. The curriculum is mostly relevant and exams are moderately difficult with an 85% pass rate, but real-time project work and tougher subjects need more focus.
detailed_review.Other: I chose civil engineering for my interest in construction and design, the course offers strong lab work and field exposure to build practical skills. It could improve with more software training and industry projects, while the campus is lively with good extracurriculars, nearby development, and scholarships are limited in B.Ed.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college will create more opportunities for students.

detailed_review.Placements: The college will provide more opportunities for students. The college has recently combined with the IBM company for future purposes.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: At Godavari Global University, the infrastructure is very good for my course/department. The food served in the canteen is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: At Godavari Global University, teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Semester exams are a bit difficult.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Supportive faculty, good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 60% of students were placed with packages ranging from 2.25 to 12 LPA. Top recruiters included Accenture, Amazon, and Infosys. 80% of students secured internships at companies like Capgemini, Wipro, Virtusa, Reliance, and Infosys. The roles offered were diverse and in demand.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department offers smart classrooms, high-speed Wi-Fi, well-equipped labs, and a rich library. Hostels are clean with good amenities. The mess and canteen provide hygienic food. Medical facilities are available on campus. Sports and games are actively encouraged.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is good with a mix of theory and practical. The curriculum is industry-relevant. Semester exams are moderately tough, with an 85–90% pass rate. Consistent effort ensures success. They are very supportive.

faqs.question: What entrance exam scores are accepted by Godavari Global University?
faqs.answer: Godavari Global University accepts students on the basis of several entrance exams. Students are offered UG and PG degress in courses such as BTech, MTech, MBA, etc. Aspirants can find out the course-wise accepted exams in the following table:

faqs.question: What kind of courses does Godavari Global University offer for students?
faqs.answer: Godavari Global University offers degrees at undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD levels. These programmes are offered across several specialisations in the fields of Technology, Management, etc. Students can refer to the following list to know about the popular courses offered at GGU :

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission at Godavari Global University?
faqs.answer: Godavari Global University offers admissions based on entrance exams. The university does not accept direct admission for its courses. Students are required to secure a valid score in the accepted exams i.e., Andhra Pradesh EAMCET, APICET, Andhra Pradesh POLYCET, GATE, UGC-NET, etc. However, there's always a chance that the university may accept students direcly if it deems fit. highlights.summary:
Guru Jambheshwar University of Science & Technology, Hisar, known as Guru Jambheshwar University. It was established in 1995. GJU Hisar is approved by UGC and AICTE, accredited by NBA, and with A+ Grade by NAAC. The university is ranked 49 under the Pharmacy category by NIRF 2023. The university also provides distance education that are approved by the Distance Education Bureau, UGC, New Delhi.
GJU University offers UG, PG, and PhD courses to students in various streams such as Engineering, Management, Science, Commerce, and others. The flagship courses offered at GJUST are BTech and MBA. GJU Hissar admission is based on merit and entrance-based. The institute accepts entrance exams such as JEE Main, MAT, CAT. The institute offers scholarships to students. The institute was spread over 327 acres of area. It includes classrooms, a library, a sports complex, a cafeteria, and other facilities offered to the students. The highlights of GJUST:

GJUST Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: Bachelor of Physiotherapy (BPT)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely dissatisfied because of the infrastructure. The faculty is supportive and caring.

detailed_review.Placements: No placements are available in my course at my college. But it gives placements in internships, which are very few. They are given to about 2-3 students in a full batch only, which is a very bad thing. I am absolutely dissatisfied with it, and it should give placements for jobs also.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Benches in classrooms are bad and broken. Fans are not working properly. Hostels are average, and the food is average. The good thing about the college is that it has a very large sports complex, which has many indoor game courts and outdoor sports as well. There is a good library which is very large, and seats are available in very good condition.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. All teachers are qualified, and a maximum of teachers are PhD holders in their subject. The pass percentage in the semester exam is 60-70 percent. The course curriculum is relevant to us and very helpful. Semester exams are average, which is good, as students who have the ability can be promoted.
detailed_review.Other: Work should be done on the infrastructure. Events are organised, but there are few events.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: GJU, Hisar, college life review.

detailed_review.Placements: In our university, almost 50 percent of the students are placed on the campus. The average package is 4 LPA, and the highest package is 23 LPA. Some of the companies that are enrolled in our university are Wipro, Infosys, TVS, etc. Data scientist, data analytics, and AI engineering are the top courses seen in placement and internship.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is very good infrastructure that helps us to learn easily. Very good classrooms and smart classes with Wi-Fi for each student are provided in the hostel. The food quality is not very good, but it has good medical facilities and a good sports ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are almost PhD scholars and have good knowledge about their subjects. There are curricular activities that encourage us to do many activities. The exams in this university are moderate, not very hard, and almost half of the students in my class passed in all the subjects, and some got fails in 1 subject.
detailed_review.Other: My course is AI and Data Science. I chose this because there is a future scope in AI.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Packaging Technology
reviews.review_title: A great place for practical learning in printing & packaging.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in the printing & packaging technology course are decent but still improving. Around 60-70% students get placed every year. Top recruiting companies include ITC, Parksons Packaging, Zircon, TCPL, and Natraj. The highest package goes around 7-8 LPA, the average is around 3-4 LPA, and the lowest can be 2-2.5 LPA. Many students also get internships in corrugation, label printing and flexible packaging companies, which helps in gaining industry exposure. More core printing companies are expected to come in future.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The university has a large campus with greenery and well-maintained buildings. The printing department is equipped with modern labs, offset and flexographic printing machines, computer labs, and a good library. Wi-Fi is available, and classrooms are clean and spacious. Hostel facilities are good, rooms are maintained properly, and the mess food is average but hygienic. Sports facilities, medical centre, canteen and stationery shops are available on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are experienced, supportive & knowledgeable. They focus on both theoretical and practical learning. The curriculum is updated with the latest industry needs like packaging materials, designing, quality control, and printing technologies, which makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are moderate, regular assignments and practicals help in clearing easily. The pass percentage is usually high if you study regularly.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because the packaging industry is growing fast, offering great career opportunities in food, pharma, printing and manufacturing sectors. The best thing about the course is the practical exposure through labs, machines and internships. One improvement needed is that more companies should visit for placements, and the hostel mess food quality can be improved. Overall, the university gives a balanced experience of academics, skills and campus life.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Sc. in Life Science - M.Sc. in Biotechnology/Microbiology/Botany/Zoology/Chemistry
reviews.review_title: Guru Jambheshwar University of Science and Technology is an overall good university.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements at my university are good across all fields. If we talk about the specific biotech department, then it's far better than the other departments. Students have more options in the research field in companies. There are many departments where placements are very good. The university offers companies the opportunity to organize job fairs on campus, where opportunities and competition increase.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Basically, there are 4 hostels. Each hostel has Wi-Fi, a canteen, a mess, and TV rooms. There are grounds for playing as well. There are study rooms that are as good as libraries. Medical facilities are also available, as the health center is not far from the hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and highly qualified. The teaching quality is also good. The course is relevant but not as good. It prepares students to be industry-ready. Semester exams are both medium and tough. If your preparation is good, then you don't need to worry about exams.
detailed_review.Other: Students in need are sponsored by various scholarships. Events and fests are good, but there are many restrictions for outsiders who want to attend the events. The campus crowd is very good on weekends and weekdays.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Our campus is very good in every field, with lots of greenery and best studies.

detailed_review.Placements: 75 percent of students are placed in this course. The highest package for our course is mostly between 6.5 LPA to 8 LPA. Companies include Infosys and others. Internships depend on students’ marks and their capabilities, but overall the college provides the best opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are very good on our campus, including fully AC labs for new ideas, coding practice, Chemistry lab, AutoCAD lab, and more. Hostels have luxurious rooms and clean washrooms. Mess food is average in hostels, and there are four hostels for girls and four hostels for boys.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are of good behavior, helpful to students, and well educated and experienced. College events like hackathon and SIH are very helpful to prepare students and make them industry ready. Semester exams are easy for students who are well prepared and difficult for those who are not prepared.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest and dedication.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Infrastructure is so well. Placement and crowd need to improve if a student is serious about them.

detailed_review.Placements: Alright so coming back to the placement thing, around 60 percent of students got placed in my passing out batch. The highest is around 12 LPA, the lowest is around 3 LPA, and average is 4 LPA to 5 LPA. Recruiting companies are TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Cognizant, and IBM. Around 30 percent of students got internships. Roles offered are software engineer, developer, analyst, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good. Wi-Fi is decent like we get separate Wi-Fi and pass so like you can do your basic work easily. Labs are well-equipped and fully running condition. Library is also AC equipped and fully running well cleaned and big. Quality of students is fine only, like for the first student who got the new hostel, else they will get the old wing that is just average. Quality of food varies to change our meals according to taste. Canteen is available. Medical facility is top notch but it's far. Sports and games are also average and all.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are friendly and helpful. Teaching quality is just fine. Curriculum will not make one ready for the industry. Semester exams are not hard if someone studies well. Pass percentage is just up 40. Quality of teaching needs to be improved also the network of college.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this beacuse beggars can't be choose well, jokes aside. Infrastructure is good and very budget-friendly. Best thing about my course is that I am still figuring it out. In my course increase the teaching quality and style, more content and practice oriented not just syllabus compilation. Events are full on recently we had youth fest. Campus crowd is below average. Connectivity is less. Surroundings are greenery, scholarships are available, and extracurricular activities are full on if someone is disciplined.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: GJU lifestyle of students.

detailed_review.Placements: Very good placement here. This year Infosys company took 120 students of all CSE department out of 150 students, which is according to me very good. Placements are increasing day by day, and very good students are here also as they have 9 CGPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Very neat and clean rooms. I like to spend time with my friends in these classrooms. We talk for hours sitting here, and we always miss this time when we all together sit here and talk to each other and make each other laugh. Sitting in canteen etc. I like it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Excellent professors. They teach very well and they also have friendly nature. Every semester 1 or 2 teachers become a good friend of me and my whole class, that's why I love being a student of this university and also refer others to take admission in this university.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as I want to get connected with hacking also.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Arts (B.A.)
reviews.review_title: Good institute of the city.

detailed_review.Placements: There are many students in the college, but more of the students are in the arts stream. 3 years of the Bachelor's degree. I have completed my studies in the subjects of history, English, and Hindi. After 3 years, you can complete your internship. After getting the degree, you can continue a master degree.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are many facilities on the campus. And all the services provided by the college are the best. The college department is very gentle. There are many facilities like Wi-Fi, Science lab, computer lab, playground, NCC, classroom, off-course, and a big library.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are good faculty, very gentle and helpful, around 250 staff members of the college. The environment is very positive. There are moderate levels of the semester exam, and the pass percentage is 36 percent. There are many students who fulfill their dreams with the institute.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Arts (B.A.)
reviews.review_title: The best college in Haryana

detailed_review.Placements: 59 percent students in my course are placed. In my course, the highest package is 50,000, the lowest package is 25,000, and the average package is 35,000. My course has top recruiting companies. All college students got an internship at each company. In my course, the top role is offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My college facilities and infrastructure are very good, and the department is very neat and clean. The classroom is very big and the air facilities are very good. My college hostel facilities and infrastructure are very good, and the food quality is very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: All my college teachers are very helpful to students, and their knowledge is very good. Their teaching quality is very good. My course curriculum is relevant. All students are ready for the industry. My college semester exam is very easy, and passing marks are 33 percent only.
detailed_review.Other: My course is the best in my knowledge. Studying things is very easy. My wish is better in my course in other course. Events, fest, campus crowd and scholarship are all facilities in my course.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: College is moderate with decent campus.

detailed_review.Placements: There is no placement at all in this college for B.Com course and for other courses too. Only 0.01 percent of students get internships but their efforts, not from college campus. Top roles that can be offered in my course are basic accounting work and managerial functions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no Wi-Fi at all. It is only available in computer labs and library. Labs are well furnished and equipped with all the required equipments and materials. Hostel facility is not available for boys but available for girls. There is only a first aid kit in medical facility terms. Sports and games are encouraged. We have dedicated ground and field for specific sports like cricket, football, tennis, handball, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and cooperative. They are well qualified and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is 6/10. Course curriculum is relevant but it does not make students industry-ready. Semester exams are not too easy and not too difficult. The level of exams is moderate. Passing percentage is around 50 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course in order to build roots in commerce. This course will help me to clear my basics of commerce. It provides practical exposure to internships. There are dedicated workshops for particular subjects. Events and fests are not encouraged but only happen twice a year. There are scholarships and extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Arts (B.A.)
reviews.review_title: Best college in Haryana.

detailed_review.Placements: 57 percent of students in my course are placed. The highest package is 50,000, the lowest package is 25,000, and the average package is 35,000 in my course. My course has top recruiting companies, and all students got internships in each company. The top roles in my course are offered on both sides.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college facilities and infrastructure are good and the best. The department is very neat and clean. The rooms, labs, library, and classrooms and the hostel facilities are very good, and the food quality is very good. The mess, canteen, medical, and sports facilities are also very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in my course are helpful for students, and their teaching quality is good and the best. The course curriculum is relevant, and all students are ready for the industry. The semester exams in my course are very easy, and the passing marks are 33 percent.
detailed_review.Other: In my opinion, my course is the best, and the study material is very low and easy. I wish my course would become better than other courses. The college provides events, fests, a crowded campus, and scholarship facilities.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Arts (B.A.)
reviews.review_title: Best college in Punjab and Haryana.

detailed_review.Placements:
Many students in my course are placed. The highest package is 50,000, the lowest package is 25,000, and the average package is 35,000 in my course. My course has top recruiting companies. All the students from my college got an internship in each company, e.g., Jindal Steel Company. 
My course's top roles are on all sides.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My college facility and infrastructure are very good and the best. Class, library, and labs are very great and air-free rooms, all rooms are neat and clean. My college hostel facilities are very good, and the food quality is very good. My college hostel mess and canteen, medical facilities, sports and games facilities are the best.
detailed_review.Faculty: My college teacher is very helpful, and their knowledge level is very good, all teachers are Ph.D. qualified. Their teaching quality is very high. My course curriculum is relevant. All students are ready for the industry. My college semester exam is very easy, and passing mark is 33% only.
detailed_review.Other: My course is best in my knowledge, and its study is very low. My wish is to better another course. Events, fest, campus crowd, campus, and scholarship are all facilities in my course and college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Dissatisfied because of placement and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Electronics in this college is lacking in regards to placement because limited companies are interested in picking students from this college. The scope in electronics is very good, but in this college, it is not at all. The lowest package was 3 LPA, and the highest was 6-7 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure in this college is very good, but it is only the infrastructure, not the study or courses. There is no space in hostels for students, and there is no generator to support electricity after a cut. No one is interested in listening to your problems. You have to buy your light for the room.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are rude and give maximum assignments. They are not interested in teaching. They want you to know everything. Exams are tough, and invigilators are rude. DMC will be bound if you are caught cheating in exams. You should complete attendance.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's not a good placement. It's a useless university.

detailed_review.Placements: There was a placement of a few students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Sports facility was useless. There was no game, and no coach was available at the university. Everything was broken for the students. Hostel facilities were also useless, only 1-year-old people got hostel. Hostel rooms were also useless. Electricity hostel warden also did not do any work. 50% of the campus hostels gave only 1 year. The food at the mess was useless. The warden also did not listen to anyone, nor did it work. Even in the CSE department, no one agrees, makes useless rules, and had to make grounds again and again to work.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were not available. They never allowed classes to be held, and no one takes classes according to the timetable. They did not teach the students well. They did not take exams well, even if you gave them exams well, they received a re-entry. The results were also late, and they did not give good results.
detailed_review.Other: I got admission in computer science engineering B.Tech because I liked it. The scope was very good in this college. The best thing was that my course had very good teacher. I studied more well for my improvement and cleared all my back. There were no events. There were hardly 2 events a year. There were no fests. The campus was a bit good. Scholarships were also available to only 40% of students. There was not much activity.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Everything is so good and properly maintained. But campus placement is so satisfying.

detailed_review.Placements: There is no placement in computer science branch. Mostly students seek off-campus placement. There is a compulsory project after the 2nd year. You have to do your training or internship, that's mandatory.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good at both college and hostel. Rooms are available for most of the students. Mess food is okay. Medical facilities are not available in case of emergency in both hostels. Girls hostel is very safe. In hostel, there is no Wi-Fi. Network speed is also low in most of the rooms.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very good. All the classes are on proper time, and syllabus is also covered in all semesters. Extra classes are also available at the end of semester. Teachers are strict. 75% attendance criteria is strictly maintained. You will have to remain sincere throughout the whole semester to get good marks. In computer science branch, there is good faculty for all the subjects like data structures, database management system, and computer graphic.
detailed_review.Other: In extracurricular activities, there are clubs like tech beats. There are sports meets, farewell, freshers, and fests in every semester.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: I give 5 out of 10. No mobile network. Very bad hostel and mess food.

detailed_review.Placements: Students are not placed in college. 20% of students are placed. Very bad condition of placement at this college. Many students do not get a job after completing their graduation from this college. The highest package is 8 LPA. TCS is the recruiting company. There are no companies that come to hire the students. 0% internships are offered. No students get internships. No roles are offered in this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no facility for students. Classroom conditions are bad. No computer is there in computer lab. Wi-Fi is not working in college. The number of books in library is very low. Hostel facilities are very good. There is bad hostel room. The internet is not working in the hostel. There is no Wi-Fi and mobile network. Food quality is very bad. We do not have medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are not helpful. Teachers' behavior is not good for students. This course curriculum is not relevant. This does not make the students industry-ready. They do not give any experience in the companies or industries. The checking system for exam is very bad. Exam is average but checking system is very bad.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it is new for students and unique. There are no events and fests.

reviews.course: B.A. LL.B.
reviews.review_title: Colleges are very good for students. That's why students get a good education from college.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% students are going to a good company and a hub. In my college, the highest package is above 1.39 cr, and the lowest is 8.9 LPA. Many companies are interested in my course, and 89% are internships in low forms. Mout court is in charge, and they have a dream job from the company.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In my course, many facilities are available, like digital learning and digital libraries, and are covered with high-quality Wi-Fi. Classrooms are also very good. In the hostel, anytime support for wardan and hospital emergency, and the college is also a family. Mess is very clear and good hostels have facilities to play games and many more.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very kind and friendly, and their teaching experience is also good. Curriculum is very relevant, and college is making students industry-ready to work anywhere. Many students are going to many companies, like digital marketing companies and hubs, and they are getting good jobs.
detailed_review.Other: Because I'm interested in how to Indian judiciary works and how to help innocent people. High-quality education and technology. In my college, events are led by students for pure student leadership. College also helps poor students to get a good quality of education.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Com. + M.Com.
reviews.review_title: This university is better than a government college, but the placement is not so good.

detailed_review.Placements: My percentage is 79.8% and I do not like my college very much. My senior has the highest package in around 5 LPA, and there is no minimum package. My seniors who are good at studies got Rs. 45,000, the highest, but to my knowledge, many are unemployed. About 60% of students can get a job.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Tera are labs but no one use then tera are like show piece infrastructure is okay not so good not so bad hostel feels is less because gju Unvercity is the semi government Unvercity but mess food is not so good and 40rs per time is not worth for that type of food but they have sport facility but you have to bring you own thing to play .
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, they have proper knowledge, but this college is like a school, not like a college we see in movies or web series. We have to wear a uniform like we wear in school. Teachers force us to wear. Semester exams are not very difficult, it is easy, but teachers are like no.
detailed_review.Other: After 12, I have 2 options, first is B.Com, which I am doing right now, and second is BBA I love accounting, that's why I chose B.Com.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: Great campus, supportive faculty, good placements, vibrant student life, and modern facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: About 30 to 40% of students get placement through the college in this university. The highest and the lowest package in the college of my course starts from Rs. 13,000 and end at Rs. 17,000 with an honors degree. This college is mainly for middle and lower-class students who can't pay the higher fees at other colleges.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Canteen food is very good and of better quality, and I've liked the canteen's coffee, which is much better. Classrooms are well-maintained, but one problem is that some fans in the classrooms are not working properly or are getting very old. The college campus provides free NSS and NCC to students who are interested, and also sponsors kabaddi-like games inside the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are very helpful to students. They also provide recorded classes to students after college hours. This college university has exams in semesters, which are 6 semesters, 2 per year, but some exams are very hard to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to enter the business sector, and this course is very helpful for me to reach my goals.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Placements and ambiance of the college need to be strongly improved.

detailed_review.Placements: Not many companies came for placements, and many IT companies that offered placements either phased out or gave jobs after two years due to the 2008 recession.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel Is also of good standard and decent feels for mess and hostel was nominal around rupees 40000 per year Marine students well place in good IT companies earning really well at good position any travel frequently avoid from work related assignment you have started their on business.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is average. Students just after passing college are used to a localized exam pattern as per Guru Jambheshwar University of Technology. In addition, there used to be a fuse conductor in one semester for a subject. The lab work is well-maintained with qualified instructors.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life is cool. Extracurricular activities are also there, like cultural fests, sports tournaments, and technical quizzes, but there used to be many fights in the college between students as well as with local security.

admission.title: GJUST Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: GJUST admissions are both merit and entrance-based. The university conducts an entrance exam to shortlist candidates for various UG and PG courses. Apart from this, GJUST accepts national-level entrance exams like JEE Main , CAT , etc. for admission to specific courses. The university offers more than 50 courses at UG and PG levels in multiple streams such as Engineering, Management, Science, Arts, etc. in campus and through affiliated colleges. GJUST also has a Directorate of Distance Education to offer UG and PG courses in distance education mode.

faqs.question: What are the courses offered at GJUST
faqs.answer: The modes of Guru Jambheshwar University of Science & Technology course admissions are offline & online. Admission to various undergraduate & postgraduate courses is based on merit & scores of entrance examinations. At the undergraduate level, the university offers BTech, BSc, BBA, & various other courses to students. At the postgraduate level, the university offers MBA, MSc, MCA, & various other courses to students. Guru Jambheshwar University of Science & Technology also provides PhD & various other courses to students.

faqs.question: What is the application fee for GJUST BA (Hons) admission?
faqs.answer: The mode of application is online. Candidates need to pay an application fee of INR 1,500 for General Category (INR 750 for EWS candidates of Haryana and INR 375 for SC, Deprived SC and BC Category candidates of Haryana). Check below the steps to apply for GJUST BA (Hons) admission: 1 : Visit the official site. 2 : Click on 'Admission tab on the Home page. 3 : Register with the basic details to generate login credentials. 4 : Login to fill out the application form and upload the docs. 5 : Pay the application fee and submit the form. Docs required at the time of application

faqs.answer: The application mode is online. Students must ensure they fulfil the eligibility requirement before applying for the course. Follow the below steps to apply for GJUST BA admission: 1: Visit the official site of GJUST. 2: Click on admission home page. 3: Register with the basic details to generate login credentials. 4: Login to fill out the application form & upload the docs. 5: Pay the application fee & submit the form.

faqs.question: How many seats are there in GJUST for BSc courses?
faqs.answer: GJUST has a total of 395 seats for the BSc programmes at its campus. Candidates are admitted as per the course-specific selection criteria. Additionally, at its affiliated colleges, there are over 3,000 seats. The university has some seat reservation for candidates belonging to reserved categories. It must be taken into account that the given seat intake is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is subject to change and hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: When can I apply for GJUST admission?
faqs.answer: GJUST admissions usually begin in June for UG and PG courses with the opening of registration portal. The applications open online and continue till July . For PhD courses, the application forms are usually released in the first week of August . The university concludes the admission within a month.

faqs.answer: BTech is a four-year course divided into eight semesters. GJUST offers BTech in 11 specialisations and in four specialisations in Hindi medium through its seven affiliated colleges. Check below GJUST BTech specialisations: Computer Science & Engineering Packaging Technology Information Technology Food Technology CSE Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Civil Engineering Electronics & Communication Engineering Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Electronics & Biomedical Engineering Printing Technology -  Electronics & Communication Engineering Computer Science & Engineering Mechanical Engineering Information Technology Mechanical Engineering Computer Science & Engineering

faqs.question: Does GJUST offer lateral entry to BTech course?
faqs.answer: Yes, Guru Jambheshwar University of Science & Technology offers lateral entry to BTech course. Candidates shortlisted are offered direct admission to the second year of the BTech degree. Candidates will be admitted in the BTech (LE) through online counseling conducted by Haryana State Technical Education Society (HSTES).

faqs.question: What is the BTech fee at GJUST?
faqs.answer: The total fee for GJUST BTech course ranges between INR 90,600 and INR 2.9 lakh . The fee is calculated based on annual fee and excludes university charges. Check below GJUST BTech fee breakup: NOTE: The given fee amount is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is subject to change. Hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: Does GJUST accept CAT for admission to MBA course?
faqs.answer: Yes, Guru Jambheshwar University of Science And Technology accepts CAT score for MBA admission. The university considers the CAT result for providing admission. GJUST also conducts an entrance test for candidates who have not appeared for CAT exam. GJUST Entrance Test comprises 100 questions of one mark each. It is a 1.5 hour test which will include multiple-choice questions. The shortlisted aspirants are further called for a GDPI round. GJUST releases a merit list on the official website of the university. The shortlisted candidates are further called for a counselling round.

faqs.question: Which are the MBA specialisations offered at GJUST?
faqs.answer: GJUST offers MBA for a duration of two-years at the PG level. The university offers MBA in 11 specialisations. Check below GJUST MBA specialisations:

faqs.question: How to get admission to MBA course at GJUST?
faqs.answer: GJUST admission to MBA course is based on GJUST Entrance Exam score or CAT followed by a group discussion and a personal interview round. Check below GJUST MBA selection criteria:

faqs.question: Is MBA expensive at GJUST?
faqs.answer: The total fee for GJUST MBA course is 1.37 lakh. The fee is calculated based on annual fee and excludes university charges. Check below the fee break-up for GJUST MBA:

faqs.question: Is BA available at GJUST?
faqs.answer: Yes, BA (Hons) and BA (Hons) Research Mass Communication is a four-year course offered by GJUST. The university offers BA (Hons) at the UG level. After completing Class 12, candidates can apply for BA (Hons) course. The university shortlist candidates for BA (Hons) based on GJUST Entrance Test. Additionally,  Directorate of Distance Education, GJU offers BA and BA Mass Communication for a duration of three years. Candidates who have completed Class 12 with at least 50% aggregate can apply for BA course in distance education mode.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to GJUST BA?
faqs.answer: GJUST admission to BA (Hons) course is based on an entrance exam conducted by the university. The university will announce the entrance test result on the official website of the university. After the release of the result, GJUST releases a merit list announcing the names of shortlisted candidates. Further, a counselling round is conducted for document verification and final selection. The candidates will be required to present herself/ himself before the Counseling Board/ Admission Committee of respective department and mark her/ his presence and then she/ he will need to produce all original certificates for verification and checking of eligibility for the programmes for which she/ he is eligible.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for GJUST BA (Hons) admission?
faqs.answer: A pass in Class 12 with at least 50% aggregate (47.5% aggregate for SC candidates for Haryana) is required to apply for GJUST BA (Hons) course. Candidates must hold the documents proving their eligibility for admission. Additionally, aspirants also need to qualify GJUST Entrance Test for admission to BA (Hons) course. The university releases a merit list announcing the names of the shortlisted candidates. Selected aspirants are further called for a counselling round.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to B.Ed at GJUST?
faqs.answer: GJUST shortlists candidates for B.Ed programme based on merit in the last qualifying exam . Candidates must hold the proof of their eligibility for verification at later stages of admission. Once the selection rounds are completed, shortlisted candidates are called for counselling. Aspirants are required to lock their preferences. The list of seat allotment will be available on the official website of the university. Selected candidates need to pay programme fee to confirm their seat in the university.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for B.Ed at GJUST?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to complete their bachelor's degree and/ or master's degree in Science/ Social Sciences/ Humanity with at least 50% aggregate can apply for GJUST B.Ed programme. Aspirants with Bachelor's in Engineering or Technology with specialisation in Science or Mathematics with a minimum of 55% aggregate can also apply.

faqs.question: Is entrance exam required for GJUST B.Ed admission?
faqs.answer: No, GJUST admission is entirely merit-based for B.Ed course. In case, a candidate has also passed the master’s degree examination after the bachelor’s degree, the higher percentage of marks obtained either in UG or PG degree will be taken into consideration while determining the merit. However, if two or more candidates have obtained equal marks, the following procedure will be used for the preparation of their merit.

faqs.question: Does GJUST offer fee concession to SC students?
faqs.answer: Yes, GJUST does not charge fee from SC students with parental income from all sources up to INR 2.50 Lacs per annum subject to producing the caste and income certificate issued by the competent authority. faqs.question: What are the essential qualifications for admission to BTech course at GJUST?
faqs.answer: It is necessary that all the aspirants meet the course-specific eligibility criteria. Hence, it must be checked out before the form filling. Aspirants need to pass Class 12 to apply for BTech course. Check below detailed GJUST BTech eligibility requirements: An applicant should have passed Class 12 examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with Chemistry/ Bio-Technology/ Biology/ Technical Vocational subject. For admission to BE/ BTech (Bio-Technology), a candidate should be a pass in Class 12 examination with Physics and Mathematics or Biology as compulsory subjects along with Chemistry/ Bio-Technology/ Computer Science. A candidate who is passed in Diploma in Engineering and Technology from a recognised institute/ university. Candidates should have obtained 45% marks (40% in case of reserved category candidates). Note: In the absence of information, the above eligibility is taken from HSTES Counselling. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for BTech at GJUST for other than general categories?
faqs.answer: The last year 2023 cutoff ranks for BTech courses ranged between 135587 and 262201 . Out of all the specialisations, the most competitive cutoff was for BTech in Computer Science and Engineering branch. Observing the last three years cutoff trend, a huge decline appears in the closing rank of the last round for General-All India category candidates. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How can I apply for BA at GJUST?
faqs.answer: The application mode is online. Students must ensure they fulfil the eligibility requirement before applying for the course. Follow the below steps to apply for GJUST BA admission: 1: Visit the official site of GJUST. 2: Click on admission home page. 3: Register with the basic details to generate login credentials. 4: Login to fill out the application form & upload the docs. 5: Pay the application fee & submit the form. Docs required at the time of application Scanned photograph & signature Category Certificate (if applicable) DMCs, Degree, Certificate of weightage (s) of Sports & NSS, if any Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How many seats are there in GJUST for BSc courses?
faqs.answer: GJUST has a total of 395 seats for the BSc programmes at its campus. Candidates are admitted as per the course-specific selection criteria. Additionally, at its affiliated colleges, there are over 3,000 seats. The university has some seat reservation for candidates belonging to reserved categories. It must be taken into account that the given seat intake is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is subject to change and hence, is indicative. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Which entrance exam is accepted by GJUST?
faqs.answer: Yes, GJUST conducts an entrance exam for UG and PG courses. Apart from the university-level entrance exam, the university also accepts national-level entrance exams such as CAT, JEE Main, etc. Check below the GJUST Entrance Exam details: Particulars Details No. of questions 90 for UG and 100 for PG Marks per question 1 Duration 1.5 hours Type of questions Multiple-choice Not satisfied with answer? faqs.question: When can I apply for GJUST admission?
faqs.answer: GJUST admissions usually begin in June for UG and PG courses with the opening of registration portal. The applications open online and continue till July . For PhD courses, the application forms are usually released in the first week of August . The university concludes the admission within a month. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What documents are required for GJU Counselling?
faqs.answer: Once the candidates are shortlisted for UG or PG course based on merit or entrance exam, candidates are required to come for GJUST Counselling. The university verifies the documents of the candidates during the counselling process for final admission. Below are the documents required during GJUST Counselling: Result of qualifying exam Certificates of Class 10 and Class 12 Reservation Certificate (if applicable) Proper Sports certificate, if weightage claimed, issued by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Govt. of Haryana Character Certificate Submission of proof of qualifying examination Not satisfied with answer? faqs.question: What is the selection criteria for BTech at GJUST?
faqs.answer: Candidates are admitted to the course based on merit in last qualifying exam or JEE Main scores. Apart from this, it is also crucial that the aspirants fulfil the course-specific eligibility requirements. Check below the selection criteria for GJUST BTech course : GJUST admission to BTech course is based on JEE Main score or merit-basis. Candidates who have secured marks equal to qualifying JEE Main cutoff are eligible for admission to GJUST BTech course. Click here to predict your chance of getting into GJUST BTech course. Admission to BTech course will also be based on Haryana State Technical Education Society Department of Technical Education (HSTES) Counselling. The university will consider the merit of the candidates followed by counselling for granting admission to BTech course. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Which are the BTech specialisations offered at GJUST?
faqs.answer: BTech is a four-year course divided into eight semesters. GJUST offers BTech in 11 specialisations and in four specialisations in Hindi medium through its seven affiliated colleges. Check below GJUST BTech specialisations: GJUST BTech Specialisations Computer Science & Engineering Packaging Technology Information Technology Food Technology CSE Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Civil Engineering Electronics & Communication Engineering Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Electronics & Biomedical Engineering Printing Technology - GJUST BTech Specialisations (Hindi Medium) Electronics & Communication Engineering Computer Science & Engineering Mechanical Engineering Information Technology GJUST BTech Specialisations for Working Professionals Mechanical Engineering Computer Science & Engineering Not satisfied with answer? faqs.question: How can I get admission in GJUST BTech?
faqs.answer: Check below the selection criteria for GJUST BTech course: GJUST admission to BTechcourse is based on JEE Main score.
