Admission to BTech course will also be based on Haryana State Technical Education Society Department of Technical Education (HSTES) Counselling. The university will consider the merit of the candidates followed by counselling for granting admission to BTech course. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Does GJUST offer lateral entry to BTech course?
faqs.answer: Yes, Guru Jambheshwar University of Science & Technology offers lateral entry to BTech course. Candidates shortlisted are offered direct admission to the second year of the BTech degree. Candidates will be admitted in the BTech (LE) through online counseling conducted by Haryana State Technical Education Society (HSTES). Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the BTech fee at GJUST?
faqs.answer: The total fee for GJUST BTech course ranges between INR 90,600 and INR 2.9 lakh . The fee is calculated based on annual fee and excludes university charges. Check below GJUST BTech fee breakup: Particulars Fee Admission/ continuation fee INR 1,800 Development fund INR 5,800 Tuition fee INR 90,400 - INR 2.9 lakh Exam fee INR 2,600 Maintenance/ charges/ fee INR 22,600 Total fee per annum INR 68,800 NOTE: The given fee amount is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is subject to change. Hence, is indicative. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Does GJUST accept CAT for admission to MBA course?
faqs.answer: Yes, Guru Jambheshwar University of Science And Technology accepts CAT score for MBA admission. The university considers the CAT result for providing admission. GJUST also conducts an entrance test for candidates who have not appeared for CAT exam. GJUST Entrance Test comprises 100 questions of one mark each. It is a 1.5 hour test which will include multiple-choice questions. The shortlisted aspirants are further called for a GDPI round. GJUST releases a merit list on the official website of the university. The shortlisted candidates are further called for a counselling round.

faqs.question: Which are the MBA specialisations offered at GJUST?
faqs.answer: GJUST offers MBA for a duration of two-years at the PG level. The university offers MBA in 11 specialisations. Check below GJUST MBA specialisations: GJUST MBA Specialisations Finance Marketing International Business Business Analytics General Healthcare

faqs.question: How to get admission to MBA course at GJUST?
faqs.answer: GJUST admission to MBA course is based on GJUST Entrance Exam score or CAT followed by a group discussion and a personal interview round. Check below GJUST MBA selection criteria:

faqs.question: Is MBA expensive at GJUST?
faqs.answer: The total fee for GJUST MBA course is 1.37 lakh. The fee is calculated based on annual fee and excludes university charges. Check below the fee break-up for GJUST MB Particulars Fee Admission/ continuation fee 1,800 Development fund 5,800 Tuition fee 29,000 Examination fee 2,600 Other charges 29,600 Total fee per annum 68,800

faqs.question: Is BA available at GJUST?
faqs.answer: Yes, BA (Hons) and BA (Hons) Research Mass Communication is a four-year course offered by GJUST. The university offers BA (Hons) at the UG level. After completing Class 12, candidates can apply for BA (Hons) course. The university shortlist candidates for BA (Hons) based on GJUST Entrance Test. Additionally,  Directorate of Distance Education, GJU offers BA and BA Mass Communication for a duration of three years. Candidates who have completed Class 12 with at least 50% aggregate can apply for BA course in distance education mode.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to GJUST BA?
faqs.answer: GJUST admission to BA (Hons) course is based on an entrance exam conducted by the university. The university will announce the entrance test result on the official website of the university. After the release of the result, GJUST releases a merit list announcing the names of shortlisted candidates. Further, a counselling round is conducted for document verification and final selection. The candidates will be required to present herself/ himself before the Counseling Board/ Admission Committee of respective department and mark her/ his presence and then she/ he will need to produce all original certificates for verification and checking of eligibility for the programmes for which she/ he is eligible.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for GJUST BA (Hons) admission?
faqs.answer: A pass in Class 12 with at least 50% aggregate (47.5% aggregate for SC candidates for Haryana) is required to apply for GJUST BA (Hons) course. Candidates must hold the documents proving their eligibility for admission. Additionally, aspirants also need to qualify GJUST Entrance Test for admission to BA (Hons) course. The university releases a merit list announcing the names of the shortlisted candidates. Selected aspirants are further called for a counselling round.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to B.Ed at GJUST?
faqs.answer: GJUST shortlists candidates for B.Ed programme based on merit in the last qualifying exam . Candidates must hold the proof of their eligibility for verification at later stages of admission. Once the selection rounds are completed, shortlisted candidates are called for counselling. Aspirants are required to lock their preferences. The list of seat allotment will be available on the official website of the university. Selected candidates need to pay programme fee to confirm their seat in the university.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for B.Ed at GJUST?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to complete their bachelor's degree and/ or master's degree in Science/ Social Sciences/ Humanity with at least 50% aggregate can apply for GJUST B.Ed programme. Aspirants with Bachelor's in Engineering or Technology with specialisation in Science or Mathematics with a minimum of 55% aggregate can also apply.

faqs.question: Is entrance exam required for GJUST B.Ed admission?
faqs.answer: No, GJUST admission is entirely merit-based for B.Ed course. In case, a candidate has also passed the master’s degree examination after the bachelor’s degree, the higher percentage of marks obtained either in UG or PG degree will be taken into consideration while determining the merit. However, if two or more candidates have obtained equal marks, the following procedure will be used for the preparation of their merit. Candidate senior in age will be given first preference If tie still persists, then marks obtained in Class 12 will be considered If tie still persists, then marks in Class 10 will be considered to break the tie

faqs.question: What is the application fee at GJUST for B.Ed admission?
faqs.answer: Candidates are required to pay the application fee during the registration process. Aspirants can pay the application fee as mentioned below via any of the online payment modes: Category Application Fee General INR 1,000 (INR 500 for registration + INR 500 for Counselling) EWS candidates of Haryana INR 750 (INR 250 for registration + INR 500 for Counselling) SC/ SB candidates of Haryana State INR 625 (INR 125 for registration + INR 500 for Counselling) Not satisfied with answer? college_info.college_name: HBTU Kanpur: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Rankings, Cutoff

highlights.summary:
Located in Kanpur, Harcourt Butler Technical University, popularly referred to as HBTU, is one of the government universities established in the year 2016 by the Government of Uttar Pradesh. HBTU is associated with AKTU which provides courses approved by the AICTE. In addition to receiving a recognition from the UGC, HBTU also has an ‘A+’ grade from NAAC. These approved programs within Harcourt Butler Technical University include from the streams of Engineering, Technology, Management, Architecture, and a few others.
At the undergraduate and postgraduate levels, the university also offers courses in partnerships with numerous renowned American universities. Some of these universities include the University of Florida, Florida Polytechnic University, and the Technical University of Kosice. In addition, HBTU had partnerships with IIT Kanpur for the implementation of the Design Innovation Center Scheme. The university primarily bases admission on the scores from various entrance examinations. Some of these examinations include the JEE Main, CUET, NIMCET, CAT, and GATE.
HBTU Kanpur partners with recruiting companies such as Samsung, Amazon, and Wipro for the placements of its students. HBTU Kanpur campus has a library, Wi-Fi, hostels, a canteen, and many other facilities. Candidates can refer to the highlights table below.
BTech, MTech, MCA, MSc, MBA, PhD
Merit scholarship, Merit-cum-means based scholarship
For more information about Harcourt Butler Technical University, Kanpur check out the below video:

college_info_program.intro:
HBTU Kanpur has 10+ courses with 15+ streams. HBTU Kanpur has its flagship programmes of MBA, PGPM and -PGDM. The course takes between 1 year and 5 years, depending on the course that the candidate has picked. HBTU Kanpur provides postgraduates like MBA, MTech, MSc and many others in the fields of Engineering, Chemical Technology, Basic and Applied Sciences, Humanities and Social Sciences, Entrepreneurship and Management.
A total of 484 jobs were offered during HBTU placements 2023. HBTU's overall highest package and average package offered to batch 2023 stood at INR 36 LPA and INR 9.3 LPA, respectively. A total of 150+ companies participated during the placement process 2023. The top recruiters of HBTU Kanpur in 2023 included Adani Wilmar, Cognizant, and Aarti Industries Limited, among others. Below mentioned are some of the courses offered by HBTU Kanpur, their respective eligibility and HBTU fees:
For more information about Harcourt Butler Technical University, Kanpur check out the below video:

college_info.college_name: HBTU Kanpur Fees 2026
HBTU Kanpur Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is very good and has a powerful alumni network.

detailed_review.Placements: As of 2025, 59 students were eligible out of which 56 got placed in my branch in mechanical engineering. Placement percentage is 107%. Top recruitment companies are Samsung Electronics and TCS which often pick students in bulk. Almost 70% of students got internships from the campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: As we know, the college is very old thus the infrastructure is also very old but it gives chills too. The hostel is in bad condition. The mess food is below average for the first-year students. Water quality is bad as of now. Wi-Fi is available, which gives 8 GB per student per day but it is very slow.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty as we know are mostly from good colleges, such as IIT and NIT. Some of them have taught in foreign universities also. They are all very qualified, and most are Ph.Ds. Now about curriculum, it is as per NEP but it still lacks practical aspects.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in mechanical field and campus events. The crowd is all good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Average campus. Placements are excellent for technology & core branches, but average for CS and IT.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement for core and technology branches is excellent. No college of this rank can compete with it. This college is a savior for students with ranks below 60,000- 65,000. For CS/IT, the placement is average. If you are in the top 50%–60% of your class, you will get a minimum placement of 8–9 LPA, a maximum of 18 LPA or more, and the lowest around 3–6 LPA. Most students get jobs as the placement rate is above 90%.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Currently, IT does not have its own department. First-year classes are held in the lecture hall complex. While second- and third-year classes are in the main building. Classroom infrastructure is average, with some air-conditioned rooms. Fourth-year classes are held in the Computer Science department, whose infrastructure is below average. A new extension for the CS department is being built, which will also accommodate IT students. Overall, the college infrastructure is average, similar to most state government universities.
detailed_review.Faculty: CSE and IT are the chillest courses in the college currently. Professors assign marks based on projects and give plenty of time for independent work. The curriculum is outdated. In the first year, students study irrelevant topics like paint and food technology. However, only the first year is difficult. Senior students say the other years are easy if you study regularly.
detailed_review.Other: This course is comparatively easier than others, but students must learn from other sources and cannot rely solely on the college. Teachers allow time for independent learning, which students should utilize. College events exist but are not very grand. Overall, they are above average. Fests such as the cultural fest Adhyay, the sports fest Agaz, and the technical fest are good and more than average.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is decent best.

detailed_review.Placements: The core jobs are not very high because, if you are someone wanting to work in the core field, that will be quite difficult, as the company pattern shows that they hire more students from M.Tech. But if you learn coding through the four years of B.Tech, then the chances for placements are quite high, as you would have the choice of going to the IT sector and other software jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: HBTU has two campuses: East Campus and West Campus. The East Campus has two boys’ hostels for first-year students and a girls’ hostel for each year. The West Campus has hostels only for boys of 2nd, 3rd, and final year, Shatabdi Bhavan for cultural events, a cricket ground, a gymnasium, and other facilities. However, the condition of the hostel rooms is not of a very high standard. The hostels accommodate single, double, and three-seater rooms.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers and professors of each department are quite experienced and highly educated, but if you are thinking that the professors are going to teach you everything, that is not going to be the case. You have to take the initiative for learning new things. You need to ask the teachers to take extra classes and help with other things.
detailed_review.Other: The number of students in the Electronics Engineering batch for the year 2025–2029 is 69. The faculty is good and experienced and helps the students according to their problems, both academically and personally.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: The underrated college with a great scope of improvement and decent placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The number of students getting placed is dicey as the placement season is still going on, but on average, out of 100, 75 students get placed. The highest package off-campus is 44 LPA, and the lowest is somewhat around 5 LPA, and the average is between 9 and 12 LPA. Companies come here for various roles, including marketing, SDE, and fact-related roles in the chem tech branch. And if we talk about internship, they are not that good but not that bad either, the top role for which the offer was made was SDE, to my knowledge.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classes are spacious and well-ventilated with ACs. The library is huge, with over 1 lakh books. HBTU also has multiple canteens across the campus, offering plenty of spots to explore and hang out, making the overall campus experience lively and enjoyable.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are highly qualified and have experience in teaching, though some teachers might not be that great, the faculty members are usually good. The curriculum is outdated, but still, amendments are being made to make the course industry-ready, and for the exams, it's usual that if you study, you'll be able to maintain a good gpa.
detailed_review.Other: The overall college is good. I joined this one because of its legacy of 105 years, and the placements are pretty decent too.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good in academics and also in extracurricular activities.

detailed_review.Placements: About 85 percent of students are placed every year. The highest package in my branch is 19 LPA, and the average package is about 8 LPA. Also, many companies came to the college. The highest package of college is 34 LPA on campus, so it is good and okay.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs and classrooms are so good, while the campus is fine, and libraries are so good. About 1 lakh books are available in the college, which is a good facility in the hostel, and the seniors are very supportive in the college, so the academics are going smoothly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and involved in studies. They provide the best notes possible, so teachers are very nice. They are much more qualified, and the curriculum of the college is very good. Semester exams are easy if we learn small things, the pass percentage is about 50 percent.
detailed_review.Other: Fests are not so good, but we can adjust according to the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Technology (Paint Technology)
reviews.review_title: Good college like in placements, course, alumni network.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements of my course is excellent. Some of high paying recruiters are Asian Paint, Hero, Suzuki. The average package is around 8–9 LPA and placement is 100 percent. In my course, almost 50 percent students got their internships in 5th or 6th semester, which is on campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus life is not that much good as compared to other colleges, and the location of the college is also a negative side. Hostel life is good until unless you are in East campus (where all the academic and administrative buildings are present). According to me, it’s better to take private hostel than choosing West campus hostel like Ambedkar and Aryabhatt in 1st year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly qualified and helping except few. After every month there will be an exam, so you have to prepare according. Curriculum is good, almost same as that of AKTU in first year. Exams are not that difficult; anyone can score 8+ CGPA in first year.
detailed_review.Other: If you are getting this college, you can choose, but hostel of West campus is main problem because it is 7 km from East campus, and your life will be same as that of a day scholar.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Absolutely worthy to join this college as it has a nice network.

detailed_review.Placements: ThisThis branch is new, so the first placement will be there in 2028. Professors are trying their best for our placements as our college is also organising national meetings with other IITs and colleges in the department of pharmaceutical and biological sciences.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is good and present all over campus. Food is good, and we can decide the menu by talking to our mess secretary. We can also add or subtract food items from the menu if people agree with us. The canteen is average, as we get normal things like samosas and parathas.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are always there to help us. The course curriculum is old, as we are studying the same things studied by our seniors for more than 20 years, which is not a good thing. Semester exams are hard for those who do not study because mostly students study 1 night before exams, which is not good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it is new but has big opportunities in the future, as science is developing faster than anyone can think.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Chemical/CT at HBTU is worth it, strong academics and consistently solid placements.

detailed_review.Placements: According to the placement data provided by the college, this year almost 75–80 percent of students are placed in Electrical Engineering, with an average package of 6–9 LPA. So, placements are decent in the electrical batch. The highest on-campus placement is 10 LPA, and 2 students received offers from Meesho (18 LPA). Top recruiting companies include Reliance Industries Ltd, etc. Around 60–70 percent of students in the electrical batch got internships. Top roles offered are core engineering jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is decent but mostly old. Buildings are functional, not modern. Labs are mixed, some are updated, while some are outdated. The hostel is basic with average maintenance; rooms are simple, and the mess food is consistent. Overall, it is a workable environment, but don’t expect premium facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is average. Some teachers are good, while many are just okay. The curriculum feels outdated and doesn’t fully match current industry needs. Exams happen very frequently, so you’re almost always preparing for some test or assessment. Overall, the academic load is constant but not always meaningful. Semester exams are not very difficult; you can easily score good marks if you study even a week before.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it offers strong fundamentals and decent placement security. The best parts are the practical exposure, flexibility to shift into different career paths, and the overall learning environment. The curriculum needs a major update to match current industry skills. Faculty quality is consistent, but the teaching style is outdated. More hands-on training and modern labs would make the course far better. Events and fests are a big plus, there’s always something happening on campus. The crowd is mixed but generally active.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best college in Uttar Pradesh after the IIT.

detailed_review.Placements: The college is best for the lower branch and core branches also because it offers a very high placement in the lower branches like Leather, Civil, Textile, and Engineering. The preparing companies like Google and Microsoft are highly top-notch companies that come here for the requirement of the students who are highly skilled. The average package last year is 30 LPA and the highest package is 69 LPA (off campus), both were recorded as off campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are several facilities in the hostels. There are separate hostels for girls and boys, in which facilities of mess and very variety of food and cultural diversity are also seen. Many students in Kanpur are from Kanpur itself as it offers a very good rate of interest to students.
detailed_review.Faculty: When the course started from the semester starts in July, in which first CTR is held in the month of September or August, and NMM is also held in January and February. The teachers are highly skilled and they have very great knowledge in their industries. They are highly skilled and have a large experience in the department. The teachers are also very helpful and of very kind nature.
detailed_review.Other: The total fees of the college is 1,63,000, in which the students are offered several facilities, including hostel, girls’ life at night, and many programmes, cultural activities, tours and travel, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of HBTU (one of the top state universities).

detailed_review.Placements: Around 76% students were placed last year. The highest package was 36 LPA, and the lowest went around 1.5 LPA, while the average was 8 LPA. The top recruiting companies were TCS, Samsung, IBM, Adani, Cognizant, Nestled, asian paints, HCL, indian oil, Reliance, Wipro, Flipkart, Amazon, Berger Paints, ExxonMobil, Hero Motocorp, Optum, Honeywell and SRF Limited. From my course of CSE, around 20% got internships from companies like Google, Adobe, Amazon, samsung r&d, TCS, IBM, Paytm, Optum, Byju's, etc. The top roles offered in my course (CSE) are software development engineer, design engineer, data analyst, cloud engineer, graduate engineer, project engineer, ui/ux designer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of my department is quite old and needs renovation. Wi-Fi is available with good speed throughout the campus. If I talk about the library, it is well-maintained and you can get almost all books and journals from here. The quality of rooms in the hostel is average, and you'll get double and triply seated rooms in 1st,  2nd and 3rd year, while in the final year, you will get a personal single room for sure. The quality of the mess food is average, but it degrades as time passes.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers in HBTU are highly qualified and helpful, while you'll find a bunch of faculty members in HBTU who are very rude and get offended very easily. Overall, the teaching quality is great. The curriculum needs to be improved as soon as possible. It doesn't actually make you industry-ready. The exams are quite easy here, you can easily score marks and a good CG just by studying the day before the exam.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in CSE, and it was the best possible option at my JEE Main rank. The quality of labs could be improved in my course, as the proper computers and components are not available here. The college has events around March-April, hosting 3 major fests. The campus crowd is overall good, you'll find most Kanpur locals here. It has good connectivity as it is located in the middle of the city. It provides all the scholarships; the only requirement is that you are eligible for them.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Technology (Food Technology)
reviews.review_title: HBTU is a decent college with a long history and also good recognition in Uttar Pradesh.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, food technology, the placement is quite good. There are 19 students in the final, and all are placed, so we can say that placement is 100% this year, and the average package is 6.5 Lacs, and the highest is 9 Lacs. The top recruiting companies are Valency, Patanjali, Adani Wilmar, jk food, Jubilent Food and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Library in HBTU is very nice. Fully air-conditioned and have the best infrastructure. But the infrastructure of hostels on the East Campus is old. It needs yearly maintenance however, the West campus is a perfect example of good infrastructure. There are several auditoriums in college and multiple grounds for sports and physical activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers in HBTU are very knowledgeable and qualified, but interaction between the students and teachers is not very good. Means there is no bonding between students and teachers. They only teach and never give extra knowledge. Except for a few teachers.
detailed_review.Other: Honestly, I didn't know about the course before taking admission in HBTU. After knowing the course, it seems to be quite interesting and not so hard. The best thing about this college is the alumni network because of its old heritage and culture.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Technology (Food Technology)
reviews.review_title: Choose this college if you are not getting good NITs and you are ready for the grind.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year, 100% students were placed, but it varies every year. The highest package was 7 LPA, the lowest 3.36 LPA, and the average package was around 4 LPA. Patanjali Foods Pvt Ltd was the top company. 80% students got internships in companies like HAL, Pepsico, and JK Foods. Roles offered were management trainee and engineering trainee.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, labs and library are available, classrooms are average. Hostel is also average with all basic facilities, a mess, laundry, canteen, and basic equipments for sports. Infrastructure of both departmental and hostel building is average. Medical facilities are provided by a dispensary in college. Students also receive insurance cover from college supported by a company.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified with average teaching quality. The course curriculum is somewhat relevant to industry. Though students are required to gain skills and experiences in order to be industry ready by the completion of their course. Semester exams are of an easy to moderate level with a pass percentage of 70%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A review of so called prestigious college.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement in CSE branch is very low right now. Only 51 students are placed, and the job offers are 59. The placement percentage is 65.4%. The highest number of placements is in TCS. There is also a recession going on so the placement might be low due to this. The placement in the chemical branch is the best right now. It has the highest number of placements right now.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel room I have is very bad. The whole almirah is broken and falling off the wall. Its been over 1 month since I submitted the application for repair but not a single action has been till now. The almirah is changed by a rope so it doesn't fall upon us. The food quality is also not so good most of the time. The computer lab has mostly broken and not working computers.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality is very bad. Teachers are quite rude and not cooperative. The exams are not so hard. You can pass them easily if you study well. Teacher surveillance is very strict so very less chances of cheating happening. If you are caught cheating, you will get UFM which will ultimately lead to yearback.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Our infrastructure is improving day by day. Faculty members are really nice and help us.

detailed_review.Placements: This is our foundation batch so exactly we can not define the package and types of companies. But we really put a hard time getting placed. We use LinkedIn profiles to create contacts and try to reach companies in biotech industry because biotech government puts a good effort and gets funding for a larger amount in biotech industry. Total seats in my batch are 75 of which 64 are occupied, and on the other hand, the craze for biotech increases day by day.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure gets enhanced by our faculty members according to the requirements as new labs are designed for us to get into it deeper and understand the techniques used in biotechnology. We have a central library and classrooms with AC. Wi-Fi is provided all over the campus. My hostel is Vishwakarma, where facilities are really good. Canteen is also available for us. The quality of food is so good. On college campus medical facilities are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching quality is really good as my professors are highly qualified and Ph.D. holders. One of them has completed their studies outside India, and they are very helpful in behavior. Our curriculum is authentic and helps students become industry-ready and get placed. Semester exams are not really tough if you are regularly attending the class, and then the semester exams go easily. Our semester exam is 50, in which 15 marks are passing marks.
detailed_review.Other: I wanted to be a biotechnologist that's why I chose this field.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of B.Tech in Information Technology from Harcourt Butler Technical University, Kanpur.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80% of students are placed. The average package is about 8 to 12 LPA. The median package is about 9.5 LPA. Some of the companies that visited for on-campus placement are Samsung, Josh, TCS, and Accenture. The majority of students get placements. Many companies offer internships to students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel facility is good, and the food tastes and quality are also good. But there is a lack of cleanliness in the hostels. Hostels have a common room and sports facilities like volleyball. The library is also good. It contains lots of books, which can be issued very easily. The infrastructure of the library is good, with good ventilation and AC.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are supportive and good. Generally, in each semester, there are two mid-semester and one end-semester exam. The faculty is very knowledgeable and has experience in teaching. The curriculum is very good, it covers various important subjects, and they are in line with industry standards.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Placements are decreasing with years, but good for chemical related branches.

detailed_review.Placements: Our batch has strong placement rates. Around 85% of students got placed. The highest package is 43 LPA, the average is 7 LPA, and the lowest is 3.5 LPA. Top recruiters are Microsoft, Infosys, TCS, and Wipro. 70% got internships at DRDO, Adobe, and startups. Roles offered are SDE, analyst, and QA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has well-equipped labs, smart classrooms, Wi-Fi, and a rich library. Hostels are decent with 24/7 Wi-Fi, clean rooms, and good security. Mess food is average but hygienic. Sports grounds, gym, and basic medical facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are helpful, well-qualified, and teach with clarity. The curriculum is updated and industry-relevant with good practical exposure. Exams are moderately tough, but manageable. The pass percentage is around 90%, with regular internal assessment.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Legacy of the college is the only word I want to write.

detailed_review.Placements: 94% of the students got placed. For this year, I don't know, but in the previous 2024-2025, I guess 22 LPA was the package offered. I think Valency was the company that gave the highest package last year, as far as I know. 80%-90% of the students got internships as well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is nice except infrastructure of hostels and some other buildings as well. Mess food is also okay, studies are also okay. Senior junior relationship, if you have good communication skills, then it's good for you, you would become an extrovert coming here. Classrooms are nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: The quality of education is good, but sometimes good and sometimes average. Semester exams' difficulty is also okay. The pass percentage is approximately 98%-99% of students from our batch, although we generally study on the last day.
detailed_review.Other: It is the best course in this college. Everything is okay, except the 75% rule of criteria. Everything is nice.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Technology (Leather Technology)
reviews.review_title: HBTU Kanpur’s Leather Technology has good placement with no competition.

detailed_review.Placements: This year, the placement percentage in Leather Technology is 70-80%. The highest package is 12 LPA in different sectors, and the lowest package is 3.6 LPA. Companies like Tata International, Kabir Leather, Jama Enterprises, Smith, and Zones recruit students. 100% of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good, and the hostel is good, but students face Wi-Fi issues. Labs are very good, with everything needed. Classrooms are good and include AC. The library is also very good, with AC and plenty of books. The quality of food in the mess is good, but the canteen and medical facilities are not very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: HBTU has qualified and knowledgeable teachers with high qualifications. The teaching quality is good, and teachers understand students' problems. HBTU has two semesters in one year. The first semester is known as the odd semester, and the second is the even semester. Each semester includes two mid-semester exams. The passing percentage is 4 CGPA.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: As a tier 2 college, it is fantastic due to its alumni network and good placement record.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is quite good. Top recruiting companies are like L&T, Samsung, etc. There are qualifying criteria to sit in the placement cell. Decent placement and a good package are offered. It is good if you are seeking any government exams like GATE, IES, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is not so good. It gives a full government vibe. Buildings are old. The university provides two campuses, East and West. Large campus with too much greenery. Good sports facilities. The hostel is not good, and the mess is also average. Mess and hostel are not value for money. Labs are too old.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is good and experienced, but less supportive. You have to make efforts to seek support from faculty. Curriculum is too complicated. Exams are too strict.
detailed_review.Other: Administration is not so good. Events like cultural Fest, sports fest, and technical fest are organized annually.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall college is good. Average package is around 7 LPA-8 LPA.

detailed_review.Placements: In the chemical engineering branch, about 93% of students got placed. The lowest package is about 5.5 LPA and the highest is about 15 LPA. Top recruiting companies in chemical engineering are Reliance Industries, Asian Paints, Lumus, Varroc, Halide Petrochemical, Aarti Industries, HUL, Himadri, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure is okay and not very good. As the college is more than 100 years old, its infrastructure is not like that of new colleges, but it is improving, as some new departments/buildings have been added, like a new department of chemical engineering and electronics engineering, which are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good, and all of them have a lot of experience. The curriculum is good, but it needs some improvement, some outdated things are still taught. Almost every 1.5 months, you have to give exams, checking is very strict, and the overall exam level is medium to difficult.
detailed_review.Other: Overall college is good. It has good ROI.

faqs.question: Can I get HBTU at 100000 rank?
faqs.answer: Harcourt Butler Technical University accepts JEE Main scores, followed by JoSAA Counselling for admission to the BTech course. In 2024, the cutoff ranged between 38255 and 89966 for BTech. Given below is the specialisation-wise HBTU BTech cutoff 2024 for the General category students:

faqs.question: What are the courses offered by HBTU, Kanpur?
faqs.answer: Harcourt Butler Technical University provides 50+ courses across six streams at undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD levels. These courses are accredited by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA). The admissions to UG, PG, and PhD courses, namely MCA, MTech, MBA, BTech, PhD, and MSc are based on the entrance exam. All the courses at HBTU are offered under its five schools, namely the School of Engineering, School of Chemical Technology, School of Basic and Applied Sciences, School of Enterpreneurship and Management and School of Humanities and Social Sciences.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for HBTU CSE?
faqs.answer: The Harcourt Butler Technical University, Kanpur, cutoff 2025 has been released for different categories of students belonging to the AI and HS quotas. If you belong to the General AI quota, the HBTU CSE cutoff 2025 for Round 1 was 11799. For students belonging to the HS quota, the first-round closing rank stood at 26726. The cutoff ranks vary for different rounds, specialisations, and categories. Candidates can refer to the table below to view the category-wise CSE cutoff ranks for Round 1 for both AI and HS quotas:

faqs.question: What is the HBTU category-wise cutoff?
faqs.answer: HBTU accepts the JEE Main entrance exam for providing admission to its BTech program. The cutoff was released for different categories of students belonging to the AI and HS quotas. For the general category students under the AI quota, the JEE Main Round 2 closing ranks varied between 11799 and 87115 , with CSE being the most competitive specialisation for admission. Candidates can refer to the table below to view the HBTU category-wise cutoff 2025 for across all the BTech specialisations:

faqs.question: Is BTech (Lateral) course offered by HBTU?
faqs.answer: Yes, Harcourt Butler Technical University offer BTech (lateral) programmes . These are three-year courses, wherein students get admission directly in the second-year of the course. To be eligible for BTech (Lateral) course admission, aspirant must fulfil the eligibility requirements.  For BTech Lateral Entry, aspirants need to pass CUET exam and should have a three-year Engineering Diploma with a minimum of 60% aggregate .

faqs.question: Which are the BTech specialisations offered at HBTU Kanpur?
faqs.answer: Harcourt Butler Technical University, Kanpur offers a four-year full-time BTech programme. The university offers BTech at the UG level in over 10 specialisations. Below are some of the BTech specialisations offered at HBTU:

faqs.question: Is it worth joining HBTU for MBA?
faqs.answer: Harcourt Butler Technical University is recognised by the UGC and is approved by the AICTE. It also provides placement support to the candidates. Some of the key highlights of HBTU Kanpur placements in 2023 (as per an overall report) are tabulated below: Particulars Placement Statistics (2023) Highest package INR 36 LPA Popular recruiter Berger Paints, Cognizant (GenC), Acceldata Technology Pvt. Ltd.

faqs.question: What is the selection criteria for MBA in HBTU?
faqs.answer: HBTU Kanpur carries out MBA admission procedure in three phases. In the first phase, applicants with a valid CAT or CUET-PG scores are shortlisted and called for group discussion and personal interview (GD & PI) round. In the second phase, candidates with a score of CMAT/AIMA-MAT/CUET-PG are called for GD & PI. If the seats are left vacant after the two phases, then the university conducts an entrance examination to fill out the vacant seats. The below-mentioned infographic presents weightage of each selection round:

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for MBA at HBTU Kanpur?
faqs.answer: Candidates who meet the course-specific eligibility requirements can apply for this course. Thus, the aspirants with a valid bachelor’s degree in Engineering/Architecture/Medicine/Sciences/Arts/Commerce/Business Administration/Computer Application or other disciplines as approved by with at least 55% aggregate (50% for SC/ST/PD) or a CPI of 6.0 (5.5 for SC/ST/PD) on a scale of 10 from any UGC/AICTE recognised institute/university are eligible.

faqs.question: What is the HBTU seat reservation policy for MBA?
faqs.answer: The university reserve seats for various categories. There are seats under certain quota as well - such as home state and other states. To avail admission under a reserved seat, candidates must meet the prescribed criteria and have the relevant documents as a proof of eligibility. The following table showcases HBTU seat reservation criteria: Vertical Reservation Category Percentage of Reservation ST 02% SC 21% OBC 27% Horizontal Reservation (Sub-categories) Category Percentage of Reservation Dependents of Freedom Fighters 02% Sons/Daughters of Defence Personnel retired (superannuated) or killed/Disabled in action 05% Handicapped/Disabled persons 05% Girls 20%

faqs.question: Is HBTU good for MCA?
faqs.answer: The university faciliate placement support to the graduates. HBTU has not released course-wise placement report as of now. However, as per a consolidates report of placement 2023, 400 students were placed. The highest package offered to the placed candidates stood at INR 36 LPA . Moreover, some of the popular recruiters were Berger Paints, Cognizant (GenC), Acceldata Technology Pvt. Ltd.

faqs.question: What is the selection process for HBTU MCA course?
faqs.answer: Admissions to HBTU Kanpur MCA course is done on the basis of merit in National Institute of Technology Master of Computer Applications Common Entrance Test (NIMCET) or CUET-PG. Hence, the seat allotment process is carried out based on the applicants NIMCET rank. To take this test, candidates need to register online on its official website. Moreover, candidates also need to register on the university official website for this course and submit the application successfully by paying the fee.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for MCA in HBTU?
faqs.answer: Candidates with a valid Bachelor's degree in Mathematics/Statistics/Engineering/Technology or having a BCA degree with a minimum of 60% aggregate (55% aggregate for SC/ST/PwD/OBC-NCL category) from a university recognised by UGC are eligible to apply. Applications of only the eligible candidates are acceptable. Moreover, applicants must hold the mark sheets and other documents during form filling and admission confirmation.

faqs.answer: Aspirants need to complete BE/ BTech degrees in relevant specialisation with required aggregate to apply for the HBTU Kanpur M.Tech programme. Candidates also need to qualify for GATE or CUET-PG for admission to any of the M.Tech specialisations.

faqs.question: What are the courses offered by HBTU, Kanpur?
faqs.answer: Harcourt Butler Technical University provides 50+ courses across six streams at undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD levels. These courses are accredited by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA). The admissions to UG, PG, and PhD courses, namely MCA, MTech, MBA, BTech, PhD, and MSc are based on the entrance exam. All the courses at HBTU are offered under its five schools, namely the School of Engineering, School of Chemical Technology, School of Basic and Applied Sciences, School of Enterpreneurship and Management and School of Humanities and Social Sciences. data.title: Harcourt Butler Technical University Placement Report 2024
summary: The placement report from Harcourt Butler Technical University achieved a highest package of INR 32 LPA in 2024. The average package was INR 7 LPA . A total of 642 offers were made, resulting in a placement rate of 85.6% . Top recruiters such as A mazon, Google, Microsoft and Deloitte among others took part during the HBTK Kanpur placement drive

The highest and the average packages offered during HBTK Kanpur placements 2023 were INR 36 LPA and INR 9.3 LPA , respectively. The lowest package was INR 3.36 LPA . In total, 484 placement offers have been made and 77 recruiters took part during the placement process. The season 2023 placed 84.02% of students .

In contrast, during the placement season in 2022, the highest and average packages recorded stood at INR 44.5 LPA and INR 8.82 LPA , respectively. The lowest package recorded was INR 3.36 LPA. The placement rate stood at 97.34% and a total of 514 offers were made. A total of 106 recruiters took part in the placement drive in the Harcourt Butler Technical University in 2022. The placement trend showed a fluctuation in the past three years.

faqs.question: Does HBTU provide 100% placement rates to its students?
faqs.answer: Harcourt Butler Technical University provided a placement rate of 82% to its students. sections.heading: Introduction
text: Harcourt Butler Technical University provides modern amenities with state-of-the-art infrastructure to its students. The facilities include a central workshop, computer centre, central library, central store and purchase, multipurpose virtual studio, hostel facility, guest house, post office, gymnasium/sport, bank, auditorium/canteen, health centre, incubation centre, maintenance, etc.

college_info.college_name: Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology: Courses, Fees, Admissions 2025, Placements

highlights.summary:
In 2000, industrialist and philanthropist Thiru T.S.R Jgannaiyann, founder Chairman of Hindusthan Educational & Charitable Trust established the Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology. The college currently offers sixtenn UG, six PG, and fourteen research courses. HiCET Coimbatore is AICTE approved and affiliated to Anna University.
As per the NIRF Ranking 2024, the college was in the rank band of 201-300 under the Engineering category and in the rank band of 11-50 under the Innovation category. The college is accredited with an ‘A++’ Grade by NAAC. It is also accredited by the National Board of Accreditation. Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology offers more than 20+ programmes at UG and PG level across the streams of Engineering, Technology and IT covering several specialisations. Spread over 200 acres of land, HICET is situated in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu.
According to the official information available, the highest package offered during Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology placements 2025 stood at INR 44 LPA. The highest package was offered by Amazon to BTech CSE student. Some of the major highlights regarding HICET are tabulated below:
- Ranked in the rank band '201-300' under the 'Engineering' catgeory.
- Ranked in the rank band '11-50' under the 'Innovation' catgeory.
For more information about Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology check out the below videos:

table.details:
- Ranked in the rank band '201-300' under the 'Engineering' catgeory.

- Ranked in the rank band '11-50' under the 'Innovation' catgeory.

college_info_program.intro:
The flagship programmes offered at Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology include BTech and MBA. The college offers BE and BTech via the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. Students can pursue the BE/ BTech courses and secure a Bachelor's degree after completing four years in the course. The BE/BTech programme spans over eight semesters and covers 16 specialisations, including highly sought-after fields such as Mechanical Engineering (BE), Aeronautical Engineering (BE), Information Technology (BTech), Biomedical Engineering, etc.
Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology MBA is a general degree programme offered full-time. The MBA curriculum is spread across four semesters summed up in two academic years. The college accepts TANCET exam scores for admission to the MBA course. Based on the entrance examination, the college will release a merit list of selected students to appear for the TANCET counselling process. Students can check the popular programmes offered at Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology in the table provided below:
Check out more details about Hindusthan College of Engineering and Technology in the below video:
