faqs.question: What is the stipend for PhD students of IIIT Guwahati?
faqs.answer: MHRD Fellowships is a financial assistance for PhD students for a maximum period of five years. PhD students will get INR 37000 as monthly stipend for the first two years at JRF level and then for the next 3 years, they will receive INR 42000 per month at SRF level. Under the Visvesvaraya PhD scheme for Electronics and IT, students will get a fellowship of INR 38,750 per month during first and second year. After that, they will get INR 43,750 per month till 5th year of PhD. They will also get research contingency grant or INR 1.20 lac per year, as per DIC MeitY, Govt. of India guidelines. Stipend related information for other programs is not clearly mentioned on the official website. Prime Minister's Research Fellowship (PMRF) is also offered to PMRF scholars from IIIT Guwahati who receive INR 70,000 per month for the first two years. data.title: IIIT Guwahati Placement Report 2025
summary: A total of 206 BTech students participated during IIIT Guwahati placement 2025 , of which 138 students were selected in reputed companies. 161 job offers were made and the placement percentage recorded was 66.99%. For BTech, the highest salary offered was INR 71 LPA, while, the average package stood at INR 16.75 LPA. The lowest package offered was INR 9 LPA.

INR 52 LPA was the highest package offered during IIT Guwahati 2024 placement drive. The average package was INR 14. 88 LPA . Additionally, placement percentage of 58.23% was recorded as of April 30, 2024 for IIT Guwahati.
A total of 109 job offered were made. Some of top recruiters participated in the placement drive, include Amazon, Atlassian, Cisco, DE Shaw, Deloitte, DeltaX, Flipkart, etc .

Indian Institute of Petroleum and Energy course is provided in stream including Engineering. The institute has a total seat intake of 100 students. The fees at Indian Institute of Petroleum and Energy is INR 6,00,000 for the different courses. The institute has a well-laid infrastructure with multiple facilities.

Indian Institute of Petroleum and Energy Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is the best college if we want to place in PSUs.

detailed_review.Placements: Those who are registered for placements are well successfully placed. Here, criteria is above 6 CGPA to participate in the placements. If we have above 8 CGPA, then we have to sit in placement of PSUs. Placement rate is good especially for PSUs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Here, Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and library are available for all departments and courses. Facilities of hostel are in very good condition. Quality of mess food available in our hostel is average. An inter sports tournament is conducted for all students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are helpful, qualified, and well knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is normal, as other teachers have. This college has relevant course and curriculum, and it is great for students. It has a relatively grading system so it is difficult for us.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, if you are thinking of joining IIPE, you should definitely come.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package at IIPE is around 25 LPA. In Chemical Engineering, placement is almost 100%. All PSUs that recruit for Chemical Engineering visit the campus. 100% of the 2021–2025 batch secures internships in PSUs and energy firms such as ONGC, IOCL, HPCL, and GAIL. IIPE’s core strength lies in its robust placements in the Chemical and Petroleum branches, with a placement rate of around 94%. The average package is around 8.5 LPA, and the highest package is nearly 25 LPA. Internships are universally secured in top PSUs and energy-sector companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The permanent campus is under development. Please do not worry, the temporary campus is also good. All classrooms are fully air-conditioned. The entire campus, including classrooms, labs, hostels, and common areas, features good facilities and high-speed Wi-Fi connectivity.
detailed_review.Faculty: Every faculty member is very nice and helpful. Professors often hold degrees from IITs or IISc and are praised for being supportive and knowledgeable. Frequent lab sessions, projects, and guest lectures from industry professionals reinforce learning.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Petroleum Engineering
reviews.review_title: All about IIPE-by-IIPE students.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement percentage of our college is pretty good, it is about 97%. The average salary is 10 LPA, and the highest salary is 23 LPA. Top recruiting companies of our college are HPCL, ONGC, PSUs, Haliburton, etc. So many companies are there that provide good salaries. About 97% of students got summer internships from the college, and companies like HPCL and ONGC come for the summer internship program.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities of our college are pretty good. We have fully air-conditioned classrooms with one projector and good quality benches are there. Overall, classrooms are pretty good. Wi-Fi facilities are also there. We also have one library and that is also good for us. We also have good labs. Hostels of IIPE are pretty good as compared to any IITs or NITs. We have one shared room with two beds, two study tables, two cupboards, and two windows. Mess is also decent. We get decent quality food. Medical facility is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at IIPE are very helpful in nature and they are very qualified. They have lots of knowledge to share with us and they teach very nicely. The course curriculum is very relevant. We have practical labs in our courses, so it makes us ready for the industry. Semester exams are not that difficult. We can pass the exam with good grades if we actively participate in class and revise it once a week. The pass percentage is good, it is about 50:1.
detailed_review.Other: I always wanted to be an engineer so I gave my JEE exam. I got into this college after clearing JEE advance. The best thing about this course is that it is very relevant at industry-level. I think some subjects should be reduced to overcome students' burdens, and some practical subjects should be added to course. IIPE organises fest every year and also does events on special days like Independence Day or Republic Day, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: All about IIPE Visakhapatnam.

detailed_review.Placements: According to the 2024 placement data, the placement percentage was around 96%. The highest package was 23 LPA, while the lowest package was less than 5 LPA. Many companies recruit at IIPE, but the top recruiting companies include HPCL, ONGC, and various PSUs. Approximately 97% of students secured summer internships in 2024, with project manager being one of the top roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms are quite good, equipped with Wi-Fi, laboratory facilities, and a library that is relatively small for our needs. We also have a sizable sports ground for outdoor games. The IIPE hostel is among the best compared to other government colleges, offering many amenities. We have one table tennis board, two carrom boards, a gym, and water facilities on each floor. Each room is a sharing arrangement with two beds, two cupboards, two study tables, two windows, and a personal washroom.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers at IIPE are very helpful and highly qualified, possessing extensive knowledge. The quality of teaching is excellent, and they address all our doubts during class and office hours. The course curriculum is relevant and prepares students for the industry with practical labs for various experiments. The semester exams are manageable, covering topics discussed in class, and the passing marks are relatively straightforward.
detailed_review.Other: I always wanted to be an engineer, which is why I pursued this course. The best aspect of our program is the practical knowledge we gain, which helps us enter the industry. I believe the course should have fewer subjects but with deeper knowledge. IIPE organizes an annual fest each year, along with cultural events such as those on August 15th and January 26th, among many others. The campus population is around 500, as we don’t have a large number of students. The college provides scholarships based on caste; for SC/ST students, there are no tuition fees, and for OBC students with an income less than 1 lakh, tuition fees are also waived.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am absolutely satisfied with my college placements, especially this year.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 98% of students get placed. The highest package is 25 LPA from ONGC followed by Oil India. The lowest package by Mordor Intelligence India Cements ranges from 3-4 LPA. The average package is 12 LPA. Top recruiting companies are ONGC, HPCL, GAIL, HRRL, and IOCL. 100% of students got internships in the core chemical engineering sector, and we got internships in the above-mentioned PSUs. The top roles offered are process engineer and grade officer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the chemical engineering department, Wi-Fi and labs are there including a lot of special bulk fiber commodity chemicals, XRD labs, etc. Classrooms are AC equipped, including projectors, and a seating capacity of around 50 students. Library contains more than 10,000 books including the latest journals. In hostels, mess food is good by private vendors and mess charges are around Rs. 5,500. Hostels are non-AC and AC both with single sharing and double sharing and charges that range from Rs. 30,000-40,000.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They all have done masters and PhD from IITs. Some of them lack good teaching quality but are very knowledgeable. Most of them are knowledgeable and they teach well. The course curriculum is updated with the latest demands234. Computer simulations like MATLAB, Aspen, and Comsol software are also taught. Object-oriented programming, python, and C programming languages are also taught. This cumulative makes students subject-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have always been interested in core chemical engineering jobs in particular PSU jobs. The best thing about this course is that it simply involves the basic first principles approach and those are used in the construction and operation of these massive process plants. More software could be involved would make it better. Events are conducted annually including the Shashwat techno-cultural competition. The remaining occasional events are also there like from litcom club and robotics club.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Petroleum Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is good but the college is not ready.

detailed_review.Placements: 98% of students got placed. The highest salary is 28 LPA. The lowest salary is 7 LPA. The average salary is 11 LPA. The average package is good but due to government jobs, the highest salary is less compared to others. This is a good college that has certified teachers and good labs. The only problem is that college campus is not ready and it takes some time.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi is not that much good, it is weak. Classrooms are excellent and hostel is good. It has good Wi-Fi and games for playing. Mess is good and sports are also okay but little disappointing.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and well-certified teachers experience in the world. Petroleum engineering is good for me and labs are pretty good. But not enough and semester exams are difficult. Pass percentage is good approximately. They provide good lecture notes and certificate teacher experience and well.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placement and excellent faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: This question determined the placement rate of students in the course. Placement percentage is something 90% in the chemical branch. The highest package offered is 17.5 LPA in IOCL and HPCL. The medium package offered is 8 LPA to 8.5 LPA. The lowest package offered is 4 LPA to 5 LPA. The percentage of internships is 100% in all PSUs like HPCL, IOCL, BPCL HRRL, CPCL, GAIL, ONGC, etc. A list of job titles offered includes roles in companies like IOCL, HPCL, HRRL, etc. There are also niche or unique roles offered, such as AI Researcher for AI-related courses.  n industry-wise breakdown includes IT, consulting, and manufacturing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Now IIPE is in Visakhapatnam but is not a permanent campus. The permanent campus in Anakapalli. It is not fully built. I think in half of 2025 it will be nearly built. Hostel is good and available with all facilities in daily life. Wi-Fi is available in hostel. Labs for all subjects are available. Classrooms and library are good. College provides medical facilities. Mess is very costly now because it is not a permanent campus. Every year sports meets and sports leagues are conducted.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are available for every time for students help. They clear all doubts. All faculty members are excellent and give good opportunities for students like projects and other activities. Faculty members are very helpful. Semester exams are medium. Passing marks is 40 out of 100 in every semester.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in the chemical field because of my curiosity, especially when I see chemical reactors. Every year, the college conducts a fest, and the crowds coming from different places are good. College also provides scholarships for SC/ST, PWD, OBC, and GEN EWS. If OBC and GEN EWS students show an income under 1 lakh, there will be a full fee waiver, if they show an income under 5 lakhs, there will be a one-third fee waiver.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Indian Institute of Petroleum and Energy.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good, as many seniors landed jobs in top PSUs like ONGC, HPCL, IOCL, GAIL, and other big Navratna companies. Almost everyone received a placement offer. Some analytics companies also visit campus to recruit students. College provides internships to every student.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college hostels are excellent, better than any college. We have two sharing rooms with sufficient space and attached washrooms. Wi-Fi is also fabulous. Labs are good as well. In other words, everything is great in this college. Library has a sufficient number of books to read.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. College has less number of students, so we can interact one-on-one with professors if we have any doubts, which is very good. Courses are also part of the GATE syllabus, so if we are sincere in our studies, we can easily secure a good rank in GATE.
detailed_review.Other: College has an annual techno-cultural fest named Shaswat is held every year. There are also many events continuously held in college by various clubs, student chapters, or the student body council.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: What should you consider while taking admission in IIPE!

detailed_review.Placements: Placements for the batch of 2024 have been very good considering the scarcity of opportunities and offers country-wide, with most candidates securing a good placement offer. 14 students from the 2024 batch were recruited by prestigious PSUs (Public Sector Undertakings) like IOCL, HPCL, etc. The highest packages for chemical and petroleum engineering branches were 17.3 LPA and 20.71 LPA. Several other major companies and oil & gas giants also come for recruitment, which include Halliburton, HLS Asian, Reliance BP, Total Energies, etc., to name a few out of the many that recruit IIPE students. Apart from placements, some good and well-known companies, like Halliburton, have also started to offer internships to students presently studying IIPE for good work experience and industrial knowledge. Students from IIPE also often rank well in exams like GATE in their respective field.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Based in the heart of Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, IIPE is temporarily situated inside the campus of Andhra University until the construction work for the permanent campus is completed soon. However, the college keeps students' best interests in mind and does not let education and knowledge be hindered. Students are provided with spacious and air-conditioned classrooms, well-equipped with projectors and other necessary items. There are also good facilities for laboratories for instruments related to coursework applications. Provided with a temporary building to accommodate all students, there are good facilities for conference rooms and computer labs as well. Hostels are on a double-sharing basis with an attached bathroom. There are a total of 4 hostels, with 3 men's hostels and 1 lady hostel. The rooms are well-equipped with basic amenities like light, fans, study tables, beds, cupboards and shelves to house all personal items. Apart from these, facilities like washing machines, a common TV, a gym, hostel sports equipment and an induction stove are also provided on a shared basis. The mess is situated within the hostels and is regularly cleaned and disinfected to maintain a clean environment. Hostel food is on the basis of a set menu that is decided by the students and regular Mess Meetings ensure that all student discrepancies with mess-related issues are addressed for all. The menu is curated keeping in mind all cuisines for the diverse student crowd.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is very knowledgeable and helpful. They encourage students to pursue projects and think outside the box to pursue ideas, in addition to preparing them for the industry and workplace. The professors and teaching staff always keep the best interests of students in mind and address all their concerns and problems patiently. Questions, doubts and inquisitiveness in the course curriculum are always appreciated. The course curriculum is shaped keeping in mind the latest trends in the workplace. Students are taught all the basics of all subjects well and in a way to help with critical thinking. The semester exams also focus on what is taught in class and help students with their thinking and application of their knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: Fests and sports events are taken very seriously at IIPE. Students are encouraged to take part in multiple sports events throughout the academic year. IIPE recently started their Techno-Cultural Fest 'Shaswat' in 2023, which promotes various events and entertainment for students on a large scale. The campus crowd is good and consists of people from all over the country, hence making it very diverse and interesting.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: A Brief Review of my College-IIPE.

detailed_review.Placements: Over 93% students have been placed in various companies. The highest package offered by Halliburton stood at 20.71 LPA. Some of the named recruiters including PSUs are HPCL, HMEL, HRRL, IOCL, L&T Hydrocarbon, Worley, Reliance, Total Energies, and TATA Group.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our own college campus is under construction. Even though we do not have a campus now, we still have fully air conditioned and spacious classrooms with Wi-fi connectivity. S. R Ranganathan Library of our college has numerous books in various domains. As already specified, we do not have college campus. Hostels are private ones. Hostels have double occupancy rooms with attached washrooms. Mess food is pan-India based as there are students across the country. Modern utilities like washing machines, water filter are provided as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are helpful when it comes to doubt resolving. Semester exams are not hard to pass if one gives enough attention during class hours.
detailed_review.Other: I am pursuing chemical engineering. I feel chemical engineering opens up doorways in various domains like petrochemical, pharmaceutical and many more. That's the best thing about my course. We have techno-cult fest named Shaswat. Participants are from various colleges across the country.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: A good research-oriented institute.

detailed_review.Placements:
PLACEMENTS: As IIPE has increased its branches by introducing the B.Tech Mechanical and M.Sc. Geology and Earth Science, it is expecting more placements in the upcoming years. However, for the current batch of 2024, only two branches, B.Tech Petroleum and B.Tech Chemical Engineering, are passing out. As of 31st May 2024, 94% of students are placed, and the placements are still ongoing. The highest package for the petroleum branch is 20.71 LPA CTC, and for the chemical engineering branch, it is 17.3 LPA CTC. The average package for both branches is around 9 LPA. The top recruiting companies include HPCL, ONGC, Shell, Schlumberger, IOCL, HMEL, Jindal, GAIL, HLS Asian, Quantiphi, Halliburton, TATA Group, Oil India, TCS, Reliance BP, Total Energies, Wipro Gas Ltd., Argus Oil and Gas, Worley, Adani Gas, Line, Accenture, Self Drilling, L&T Hydrocarbon, etc. Additionally, this year HRRL, a joint venture of HPCL and the government of Rajasthan, has come for placements for the first time.

INTERNSHIP: All the students at IIPE receive internships in the core industry, like HPCL, ONGC, IOCL, GAIL, HLS, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
HOSTELS: We have 24/7 Wi-Fi and electricity facility at IIPE. As IIPE is currently functioning at its temporary campus, the hostels at IIPE are private hostels that are rented. Hence, the hostels are well-maintained and are of supreme class. Each room is occupied by 2 students max. Each room consists of attached bathrooms. The rooms generally consist of a cot, mattress, bucket, geyser, cupboards, mirror, and other basic amenities.

CLASSROOMS: The classrooms consist of AC, hence it maintains a comfortable environment for studying. Also, Wi-Fi is available for students' use.

LABS: As IIPE is currently functioning on its temporary campus, IIPE is yet to be equipped with a few labs, but IIPE already consists of most of the labs. The instruments in the lab are well-maintained and through the lab experiments, students are mentored by lab assistants, professors, and various Ph.D. scholars. Hence, the labs are very interesting and students have the liberty to try various new things under supervision. In case a lab is not available at the institute, the institute collaborates with other esteemed institutes such as IIT Madras, IMU Visakhapatnam to meet the additional lab requirements.

LIBRARY: They are equipped with 2,973 books and have provided access to various e-resources such as Royal Society Chemistry, SPE, Wiley, etc. Also, computers are available in case students would like to use the internet and books simultaneously for studying. You can regularly issue books from the library to study at your hostels.

MESS: The mess food is very hygienic and students have the liberty to fix the menu by themselves every semester. Hence, students enjoy the vibrant menu.

MEDICAL FACILITIES: Generally, when any student falls ill, the caretaker of the hostel takes the lead to reach out to the hospital and do the necessary requirements. IIPE also has an institute doctor, to whom students can consult regularly in case they fall ill. Also, the institute provides a Health Insurance card to all the students, which could be used during any serious medical emergency.

SPORTS & GAMES: Students can issue various sports equipment like bat, badminton, football, volleyball, basketball, etc. Also, the institute organizes various sports tournaments regularly. The sports culture is pretty decent in the institute.
detailed_review.Faculty:
FACULTY: The faculty at IIPE is highly knowledgeable and skilled. All of them have completed their Ph.D., and most of them have done their post-doctoral studies from many institutes abroad. Also, a few of the professors were pursuing their careers in the core oil and gas industry, hence they sometimes provide real examples and situations during the lecture. Assignments are provided regularly, and most of the professors are very cooperative with the students and also clear doubts after the classes. All of them are very approachable.

CURRICULUM: The curriculum is relevant to the industrial norms and is updated regularly if required. Also, the institute promotes students to visit various industrial visits from the 2nd year itself, hence students get to have a first-hand experience of the industries.

EXAMS: The exams at IIPE are tough; students need to regularly study to maintain a good CGPA. Also, the exams are proctored very well, hence the chances of cheating are very less.
detailed_review.Other:
ABOUT THE COURSE: IIPE is one of the institutes under the MoPNG which focuses primarily on the oil & gas and energy sector. Now we are in the era where EVs and Green hydrogen are common topics of discussion; coming here gives you a better exposure to all of that.

FEST: IIPE has its own techno-cultural fest named "SHASWAT" where many colleges participate, and those days have festive vibes at the institute. Hence, it's a good refreshment from the regular coursework.

EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES: The student gymkhana at IIPE takes care of all such activities. From music, song, dance, tech, coding, poetry debates, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Petroleum Engineering
reviews.review_title: Everything is good and we are happy with our decision.

detailed_review.Placements:
About 70% of the students are placed in 2023–2024. The highest package is 20.70 LPA this year (PE).
The lowest package is 5 LPA (PE).
The average package is 8 LPA (PE).
Top recruiting companies: Halliburton, Wipro, HLS, Asian, Quant Phi, Worley, and Reliance. 
Internship: mostly 80% of the students got internship in ONGC
.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is excellent. Currently, we do not have our own permanent campus so we are staying in private hostels provided by the college and they are excellent, with excellent Wi-Fi and well-equipped labs. Gym facilities and sports equipment are also available in the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Everything is good and the syllabus is according to the GATE exam. Teachers are also helpful. Semester exams are not easy (up to the mark as you have cleared the JEE Advanced exam) and the pass percentage is 80%. The curriculum is good and we are happy with that.
detailed_review.Other: I love petroleum engineering because it is the highest-paying profession in the world. And I also love to work in off-shoe regions. Events are organized from time to time. Our fest is also excellent and has gotten good responses from all parts of India. Scholarship opportunities are good and extracurricular activities are also good.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely good because of the faculty, good placements in 2023 and really good hostels.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, the number of students registered for placement is 38, out of which 37 got placed, which is approximately 97.4 percent in the chemical branch (2023 batch students). 2 students are placed in GAIL, 4 in HPCL, 3 in IOCL, and many more reputed companies visited.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are approximately 2-5 km far from the college. IIPE does not have its permanent campus, so it provides private hostels, which I can say are better than IITs' hostels. As for infrastructure, IIPE generally invests in modern facilities to support academics and research with libraries and laboratories.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and qualified enough to solve our doubts, and their teaching quality is also good. I'll not say excellent because it depends on students. In my case, I will say they are good. IIPE's course curriculum is the same as that of IIT KGP. And if we pay attention in class, then semester exams are also not that much difficult.
detailed_review.Other: Why did I choose chemical engineering here? So, as per career prospects, graduation from IIPE with chemical engineering could open doors to diverse career opportunities in industries like petrochemical, energy production, and many more. IIPE has good connections with PSUs as well, like GAIL, HPCL, IOCL, ONGC, and many more.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Petroleum Engineering
reviews.review_title: Students interested in the fields of petroleum and energy must be looking at this.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement percentage is more than 95%, and the remaining students pursue higher studies at the Indian Institute of Management, with some opting for Masters abroad. Many PSUs recruit students from here. The average package is around 10 lakhs per annum, while the lowest package is around 4 lakhs per annum. All students also secure internships in HPCL, ONGC, and other petroleum-related companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is a bit of a problem because our own campus is under construction and will be completed by June 2025. The current facilities provided are excellent, considering we are still not in our permanent campus. Hostel rooms are 2-seater rooms. Sports are a developing field at our college due to a bit less freedom for sports; we use Andhra University grounds. However, we don't stop playing sports and have an annual inter-IIPE sports meet. We also participate in All India University-level tournaments.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly qualified and knowledgeable. Above all, they are friendly and approachable for both academic and non-academic issues. The curriculum is probably the best part of academics, being the latest and very helpful in making us industry-ready after the 4th year. Semester exams are not too tough if you prepare for at least three weeks in three months.
detailed_review.Other: Fests are conducted, and we are trying more than our level best to make them a huge success. The first fest was a success, and we are planning to make the upcoming ones even more interesting and great. Seniors here are very cool and helpful. You are unlucky if you want to be ragged by seniors because here you cannot hear the word "ragging." Ragging is not even in the slightest form here.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best institute for chemical and petroleum engineering equal to IIT .

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 97% student were placed, the highest package is 24 LPA around for petroleum engineering and 17.5 LPA for chemical engineering students and the lowest package is 4.8 LPA. Average package is around 10 LPA. Top Recruiting companies (PSUs) like ONGC, GAIL, IOCL, HPCL visited our college and many of student got placed in core companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our Library all books are available as related our course. All labs like mechanical, chemical, computer, petroleum are present, also well connectivity Wi-Fi available in college and hostel. Hostels are extremely spacious and Lifts are available in the hostel. There is also a bus system in hostel, we go to college by bus and return from college by bus. Foods quality is good. Caretaker is always present if any student has any medical issues.
detailed_review.Faculty: The exams are tough, as compared to other colleges and focus on basic concepts, which helps with growth. Teachers are helpful and most of them have done their Ph.D. Our college conducts workshops. Almost 85 percentage students pass in each batch.
detailed_review.Other: Now days I see that almost all students have taken computer Science course so I wanted to make a different so I choose this course. Our college has just started 2016 for this reason we have not our own campus. Many of event conducts in our college and "SHASWAT" conducts the "TECHNO CULTURAL FEST". Many types of competition conducts with good amount of prize like BEAT BRAWL, TONE OF TITANS, HEADSHOT HEROES, EMO SPLASH, FASHION FIESTA, FLIMY FRENZY, ENEGRON, TRADING TITANS, KINETIC CODING, HAAL-E-MAUSAM. For EDM NIGHT The celebrity "ollyesse" from italy first time came to IIPE.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college if qualified JEE Advanced should take admission.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2023, about 97% of people will get jobs at our college. The highest pack offer is 26 LPA, and the lowest is 4.8 LPA. ONGC, GAIL, IOCL, and HPCL were some of the top recruiting companies. Almost 100% of students got internships. In oil PSUs and other private companies. Top roles, like senior engineer, were offered at PSUS.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: AC classrooms, high-connectivity Wi-Fi, and a library are available in our college. Labs are okay, but not so good. All rooms have attached bathrooms with B.Ed. and table chairs; mess food is okay; a doctor visits our hostel weekly. We have a sports room and gym that contain table tennis.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, and most of them have done their Ph.D. at foreign universities. The course curriculum is good but needs to keep up with industry. Our colleges take students on site visits to get industry experience. My pass percentage is around 97% in my batch.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course after getting JEE Advanced qualified to get industry experience and get upskilled with a good college degree. It should include a more updated format to align with current industry needs. We have our technical and cultural festival, Shaswat, which is held at the levels of the top nits. Our campus is very well connected to both railway stations and airports within a short distance. Our college is surrounded by mountains and greenery.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Fantastic hostel and college life, campus life is average.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very good here; for placements, you need to develop smart skills. Companies like ONGC, HPCL, IOCL, and HCL recruit every year, and data analytics companies also come. The percentage of placements is very good; students getting above 8SGPA get easily placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The mechanical lab, electrical lab, computer lab, chemical lab, petroleum lab, and library are present. Hostels are extremely spacious, and the location is very good. Lifts are present in the hostel, and each room will have two students, and each floor has two lounges.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are immensely helpful and dedicated to their profession. They hardly ever miss a class and ensure that the classes are both fun and informative. Along with theoretical knowledge, they also provide us with practical knowledge, which is very helpful. The coding culture at our institute is excellent, and we have the opportunity to attend workshops at IIT Madras. Additionally, we also get the chance to visit HPCL factories, which is a great learning experience.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life is enjoyable with annual intra-sports meets and a festival named Shaswat.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: IIPE"Reigning as the energy king in education.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year, 97.25 percent of students were placed, but this year, the placement scenario hasn't been very promising yet. Up until now, only 10 students have secured placements in four companies, one of which is a PSU. Any company that offers a minimum of 5 LPA this year would be somewhat favorable for us. You can consider this if you are seeking placement after your graduation.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I gave a 3-star rating because we still do not have a permanent campus. However, the hostels provided to us are very good. Our mess food is okay if you come from the North, but it is better if you come from the southern side. You have also provided a gym and some indoor games like table tennis and carrom.
detailed_review.Faculty: The Iipe faculty is generally very supportive, although there are a few exceptions. The college offers a wealth of extra-curricular activities such as sports fests, fresher parties, and the techno-cultural fest Shaswat. Exam questions are moderately challenging, focusing on some conceptual aspects. However, paying attention in class will easily enable you to tackle them.
detailed_review.Other: Only a few words: if you secure admission to an IIT, go for it. If your JEE Main percentile is below 96.5 percentile, consider this college. Otherwise, opt for a lower branch in an old NIT. For more information about this college, feel free to contact me on my Instagram account, which is utkarshprajapati_12. Thank you.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Petroleum Engineering
reviews.review_title: Helpful faculty and average placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 95 percent of students are placed in our college's petroleum branch. The highest package was 32 lacs, the minimum was 2 lacs and the average was around 12 lacs. ONGC, HPCL and OIL are some of the biggest recruiters for our college; they offer a high package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The food quality was good, even though it was located in South India. We had North Indian food. The hostel is clean and we have a separate bathroom. A single room is shared by two people but there is enough space. Gyms and sports equipment are also available there for children.
detailed_review.Faculty: 85% is the pass percentage. The exams are moderate and focus on basic concepts, which helps with growth. The course is relevant as it helps students get placements in almost every other industry-based company, even other than petroleum companies. For example, our college promotes CS a lot.
detailed_review.Other: More field experience should be included in our course.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Petroleum Engineering
reviews.review_title: A new generation college making its way towards the eliteness.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 95% of students got placed in recent years with the highest package of 32 LPA offered by ONGC, the lowest being 4 LPA and an average of 10 LPA. Getting an internship is primarily based on your own efforts but college also provides you with opportunities to get one.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: You will have labs like petroleum lab, chemical lab, electrical lab, a mechanical workshop, etc. For your core studies, we have Wi-Fi on all of our campus, and we have a vast collection of the latest books and articles in our library. Classrooms are spacious and can be occupied with 100 students at once. Every student gets free medical insurance as soon as he or she joins the institute. Sports and games fests are also held annually.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty here is well qualified and at a top-notch level, similar to IITs. They are very helpful once you show them that you are willing to learn. The curriculum is to the point and the rest can be covered in the library. Semester exams are not that difficult if you are attentive in class and a regular study of 2 hours will ensure your CGPA is above 8 throughout the course.
detailed_review.Other: Though the academics are comparable to those at IITs, that doesn't mean students here are nerds. We also have various events like annual intra-sports meets, the "IIPE"PL, SHASWAT (our annual fest), and numerous hostel celebrations like ice-cream night, DJ night, new year celebration, Diwali and Holi celebration, etc. Girls get a scholarship of 3000 rupees, and college administration ensures their security and well-being.

faqs.answer: Indian Institute of Petroleum and Energy has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility B.E. / B.Tech Candidates who have passed Diploma in Engineering or any other examination recognised as equivalent there to, from a recognised Institute/ University, Andhra Pradesh/ Telangana are also eligible. Candidates who have appeared in Diploma in Engineering and who are awaiting their results can also apply on provisional basis. Candidates should belong to the state of Andhra Pradesh/ Telangana. Candidate should have completed 16 years of age as of 31st December of the year of admission. There is no upper age limit. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

IGDTUW Delhi students are taught communication, presentation, and various other skills.
Overall, IGDTUW Delhi is one of the best universities offering quality education to students. IGDTUW Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical and Automation Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college campus is small but beautiful, and the placement is very good.

detailed_review.Placements: 70-75 percent of students are placed in my college. The highest placement of my branch is 1 crore, and the lowest is 6-8 LPA. Because it's a women's college, so the companies that require women for completion of ratio come to my college, so many big companies like Google, Amazon, and Microsoft visit my college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My college is very small, but beautiful. Wi-Fi condition is okay. Classroom condition is also okay. The library is very good. The hostel provides me with facilities like a freezer and an oven. The canteen is small, but the food tastes good. Medical facilities are good, and sports and games are okay.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty are very good, and some faculty are not that good. Exams are not that tough. Some teachers have a good helping nature, and their teaching quality is good. Teachers are knowledgeable and qualified. They make students ready for the industries because we do experiments in the lab.
detailed_review.Other: I chose it because I am interested in mechanical and automation engineering. Mechanical engineering is interesting. Events and festivals are held on average, but the main festival, Tarangna, is very good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: My own IGDTUW experience.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70%-80% of students are placed in internships for the third year. The top roles offered are SDE intern, Adapt intern, etc. Top recruiting companies are Wells Fargo and ServiceNow. The highest package, I guess, is 1.5 LPA for an intern, Rs. 45,000 minimum.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a Wi-Fi connection, and it works well. Overall, the classrooms are decent and air-conditioned, and the library is also pretty good. The quality of facilities in the hostel is good. They provide medical facilities, a mess, and everything. My favourite spot is the library.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are pretty helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They are helpful in solving any doubts related to the curriculum. The semester exams are pretty decent, and there is an overall pass percentage of like 90%. The course curriculum is relevant and makes students industry-ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placement, good infrastructure (not as good as other colleges).

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70% students, who were eligible to sit in placements, got placed last year. The highest package is around 50 LPA, and the lowest can be expected as 3 LPA-4 LPA. The off-campus placement has even offered a 1 crore per annum package to a student. Internships are offered only to CSE students most of the time. However, the average stipend is around Rs. 30,000, but not all the students get internships on campus. The role you get solely depends on your skill level and your interview.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college does not have a huge campus area, but it is fine. Washrooms, rooms, ground, and labs are cleaned, proper lighting, AC rooms, titles over the floor and walls. Wi-Fi works well, the library is also well-maintained, and different types of books are available. However, the condition of the hostel is not very good, as the building is old, but the management tries to do everything to make it comfortable for the students. Mess food is also fine, the canteen menu is not too lengthy, but momos and spring rolls are tasty for sure.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and qualified, except for some of the guest faculty members. Most of the teachers are experienced, and their teaching style and knowledge are very impressive. Curriculum is relevant and focuses on making students industry-ready. Semester exams are not very difficult, but you have to give time to academics apart from learning skills. Even if you start 15 days before exams with full dedication, you can ace the exam easily. A CGPA of 5 or 45 marks out of 100 is the passing criteria for each subject.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE because this college provides a good placement rate for the CSE and IT branches. It is better than choosing a lower branch in another college. I think there should be more internship offers on the campus, so students do not have to search for internships. Annual fest Tarangana is held every year. Apart from this fest, many other activities and societies make the environment cheerful throughout the year. There are various sports clubs, dance clubs, singing clubs, and many more available.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Reviewing my college IGDTUW.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement is very good here, and many companies visit this college. Even before placement, all the companies visit this college to guide students and help them to prepare for the interview and the selection process, and it is called pre-placement talks, which definitely gives college students an edge over those students who are appearing from outside the college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is average. They provide basics like AC, decent food, decent water to drink, and basic rooms are small, washing machines are 2 per washroom, but not all of them work, but some do, which teaches you patience. The hostel timings are very strict. You have to be in the hostel till 8:00 PM, but if you want to go to the college computer lab, then you can stay there till 11:00 PM.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are good, kind, and helpful to students. Each teacher has assistant teachers, and if the subject includes a lab, then a lab teacher is also available to help. Mostly, labs are not too luxurious, but they have sufficient equipment. The exams are not so different, but you need to work for around 4-5 hours daily.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: IGDTUW offers a balanced college experience with scope to grow if you use opportunities well.

detailed_review.Placements: For batch 2024, B.Tech CSE at IGDTUW, 77% of students got placed, with the highest package of 56 LPA, and the average package is 25.15 LPA. Internships are secured by most third & fourth-year students via companies like Microsoft, Adobe, JP Morgan, etc., with roles mostly in software dev, backed, cloud, and data analysis.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: IGDTUW has decent Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and a library. The hostel is basic with average mess food, the canteen is okay, medical help is limited, and sports facilities exist but need better upkeep. Overall, the infrastructure is functional but not exceptional.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at IGDTUW are generally good and supportive, with most being knowledgeable in their fields. The curriculum is moderate, covering relevant topics but requiring self-learning for industry readiness. Exams are of moderate difficulty, and pass rates are usually good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communications Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: College has good placements with a decent curriculum. But the infrastructure needs improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements for CS and related branches at IGDTUW are outstanding, while for ECE, ECE AI, and MAE, they are decent. About 50% of students are getting placed. The average package is 18 LPA, with the highest at 1 crore (MotorQ) and the lowest is 4 LPA - 5 LPA. In ECE, the highest is 56 LPA (Adobe). Top recruiters include Google, Microsoft, Adobe, and Morgan Stanley, with internships at Google and BNY Mellon. Top role offered is SDE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure at IGDTUW is satisfactory but has scope for improvement. Wi-Fi works well in the academic blocks but is inconsistent in hostels and some areas. Labs are functional but could be better equipped. Classrooms in ECE and CSE generally lack air-conditioning, which can be challenging during peak summers. Library provides good resources but often falls short on seating capacity during exams. Campus has a spacious ground for sports and activities. Although I haven't stayed in the hostel, friends share that the food quality is decent and the rooms, though slightly small, are manageable.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members at IGDTUW are decent overall. Some professors are highly knowledgeable, supportive, and approachable, while a few are average in their teaching methods. The curriculum for ECE AI is quite relevant and keeps students industry-ready, as it includes computer science-related subjects along with core electronics. Subjects like artificial intelligence and data science are part of the curriculum, which adds great value. Semester exams are moderately difficult and can be managed with regular preparation. The pass percentage in most subjects remains above 95%, ensuring that students perform well with consistent effort.
detailed_review.Other: College is well-connected, with the Kashmere Gate metro station just 5-7 minutes away, making it very convenient for daily travel. IGDTUW hosts Taarangana, its annual cultural fest, which is conducted on a grand scale and draws huge participation. In addition, university supports academic excellence by offering scholarships to branch toppers, which motivates students to perform well.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communications Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you want placement then definitely go for it.

detailed_review.Placements: Above 75% of students got placed. 56 LPA is the highest package, and 20 LPA is the average package. Last year mechanical branch got the highest package so it totally depends on your skills and not on your branch for placements. Top roles offered are DSA, web developer, AI ML, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is like average because only few classes have AC in them. The campus is very small. Hostel is not good at all. Lab classes have AC but others are non-AC. But in 2025 IT block will have AC in all the rooms in which the classes for CS, AI, IT, and AIML take place.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are mostly educated but don't know how to teach. They just want their salary and nothing else. The course curriculum is mostly relevant as it adds very much coding subjects. Its not difficult to secure good CGPA in college but you have to put extra effort, if you are in the branches like ECE or MAE types.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Great placement opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost more than 85% students got placed in B.Tech in Information Technology. The highest package received in my branch was 52 LPA, average package offered was 20 LPA, and the lowest was 5 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Microsoft and Google. Last year, 10 students got placed from CSE and CSEAI at Apple. Most of the students get an internship in the 3rd year in top companies. The top roles offered were those of Software Engineer and Data Analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is average. You don't need to walk a lot to get to your classes like other colleges. Facilities are not up to expectations. You don't have a proper seating arrangement to have your food in the canteen. We do have Nescafé where you can enjoy yourself. The campus is shared by the students of Dr B. R. Ambedkar. The sports societies are active. Most of the computers don't work in the labs, and the library gets crowded most of the time.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are really qualified and always ready to help. The college has a strong research background that needs recognition. The curriculum of the first year is mostly the same for all and becomes relevant according to each branch from the 2nd year. It's quite easy to score a good CGPA if you work for it.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Information Technology because I was always drawn to the field of AI, cybersecurity, and cloud computing. I wish we could be provided with more practical knowledge. You get to meet great people to connect with. The campus surroundings aren't very safe, but it's just a 10-minute walk from the metro station. The college organizes great fests like Taarangana, inviting great artists.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good exposure and opportunities, a supportive environment, and improving placements.

detailed_review.Placements: I belong to the CSE AI batch and placements in our course are quite good. A high percentage of students get placed every year with many securing software development roles. The highest packages exceed the average industry standards while the lowest and average packages are also decent. Almost all top tech companies including FAANG and other reputed recruiters visit the campus. A large number of students also secure internships in these companies which often convert into full time offers. The top roles offered are mainly software development engineer (SDE) along with a few opportunities in research, product and data-related fields.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The overall infrastructure of IGDTUW is average. Wi-Fi is available across the campus but not always reliable. Labs are equipped for basic requirements, though some equipment is outdated. Classrooms are spacious with projectors. The library is useful with good resources. Hostel facilities are manageable, with rooms of decent size and average cleanliness. The mess food is also average, sometimes good, sometimes just okay, with better options available in the canteen. Medical facilities are basic. Sports grounds and courts are present, though student participation and encouragement could be improved.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at IGDTUW are generally helpful, qualified, and supportive. Most of them have good subject knowledge and guide students well, though the teaching quality varies from teacher to teacher. The course curriculum is relevant and keeps updating with industry needs, but still requires extra effort through internships and projects to become fully industry-ready. Semester exams are not very difficult if you attend classes and study regularly. The overall pass percentage remains high, with most students clearing their exams without much trouble.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course mainly because of the good placement opportunities. The best part is the strong technical foundation, exposure through hackathons, projects, and various events that boost confidence. However, more practical industry-level training and stronger company connections would make it better. The campus has fests, cultural and technical events, and a supportive crowd. Being in Delhi, connectivity is good, and the surroundings are safe. Scholarships and extracurricular activities are available but need more encouragement. Overall, facilities and infrastructure are average, but exposure and placement opportunities make this course worth choosing.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Strong placement and supportive faculty, but infrastructure needs improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: 90 percent the students from my course get successfully placed every year with top recruiters like Microsoft and Google. The highest package offered is around 50 LPA while the lowest range between 4 LPA to 5 LPA and the average package is 20 LPA. Almost all third-year students are able to secure internships reflecting the strong industry connections of the course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of the institute is below average when compared to the top government colleges in India. The library often remains overcrowded making it difficult for students to study comfortably. Classrooms are not fully centralized. In addition, Wi-Fi connectivity is restricted to only a few specific labs, limiting accessibility across the campus. The quality of hostel food also falls short of expectations and requires significant improvement.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers are highly qualified, knowledgeable, and supportive. They provide you with notes and assignments to help you with the course. As an IT student, I find the curriculum to be largely relevant, covering important coding and technical subjects that match industry requirements. Semester exams are of moderate difficulty, making it fairly easy for students to score well. With many achieving a CGPA of 9 or above.
detailed_review.Other: I chose IT as my course because of my strong interest in technology, problem-solving skills, and coding. While the curriculum is relevant and placement opportunities are strong. There is still room for improvement in areas such as infrastructure, classroom facilities, hostel food quality, and campus-wide internet connectivity. College also encourages cultural and extracurricular engagement. Tarangana being one of the most vibrant and well-organized fests. Additionally, scholarships are available for students from EWS, OBC, SC, and ST categories, ensuring that financial constraints do not hinder talented students from pursuing their education.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great placements and campus.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement of our course is excellent, with almost 100% students getting placed. The average package for CSE goes up to 22 LPA with the highest one seen as much as 1 crore per annum. Top recruiting companies include Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Adobe and many more. Internship opportunities are also great.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The overall infrastructure of the campus is well maintained and student friendly. The academic facilities include spacious classrooms with modern teaching aids, fully equipped labs and well stocked library with access to online journals. Hostel facilities are quite comfortable providing all the basic needs. The mess food is hygienic and offers a variety of food.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are very helpful, approachable, and knowledgeable, always ready to clear doubts and provide guidance. The curriculum is good but not exactly industry-based, so students need to put in extra effort to grab internships and placements. Semester exams are comparatively easy, with most students managing to get a CGPA of 8 or above.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my strong interest in technology and problem-solving, and also because the curriculum is well-structured and industry-based. The exposure to coding, projects, and research opportunities makes it very appealing. The campus has a very lively and energetic life. Events and fests are well-organized with great vibes. They give students a chance to showcase their talents and bond with peers.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: I am truly satisfied with my faculty, college life, friends, and the new experiences I have gained.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2024, I think approximately 80% got placed in IT. The highest package is always around 50-60 LPA, and the average is around 20 LPA. Top recruiters for CSE, CSE AI, and IT are almost the same: Adobe, MotorQ, Microsoft, Amazon, and many more. 70% internship offers are for SWE, mainly for data analysts.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The IT department is newly built and has smart boards in almost every class. Wi-Fi can only be accessed on the 1st floor of IT and the library. Classrooms are good and spacious, but still sometimes congested. The library is well-managed and has lots of books related to our course. I am not a hosteler, so I don't know about it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified, with most of them having completed M.Techn and Ph.D. degrees, which ensures that they are well-educated and knowledgeable in their respective fields. Their teaching methods are quite similar, as they primarily use PowerPoint presentations and PDFs to deliver lectures. From the second year onwards, students will receive curriculum and course materials that are closely related to their subjects. Semester examinations are generally manageable and not very difficult; however, at times, some exams may seem challenging depending on the topic or preparation level. Overall, the academic environment is structured and supportive, allowing students to grasp concepts effectively.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college to gain deeper knowledge in IT-related fields such as Cybersecurity, Software Engineering, and detailed studies of subjects like DBMS. I feel that the curriculum could introduce DSA (Data Structures and Algorithms) and some core subject knowledge right from the first year, which would give students a stronger foundation. The college fests are well-organized and really enjoyable, providing a great break from academics and an opportunity to participate in fun and cultural activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Overall, this college is really good.

detailed_review.Placements: 80-90% of students get placed in this college. The highest national package was around 80 LPA. The average package is 20 LPA. The lowest package is around 8 LPA. Top companies are Uber, Microsoft, Flipkart, and Google. A total of 180 students got an internship at the start of the 3rd year, for a total of 800 students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: They have AC only in the IT department and in labs. Food quality is average, like any other college. Hostel is not that good, they provide AC only to 1st years, plus you have bunkers bed in first year, like 6 people sharing a room for AC. In others, there are triple, so overall hostel is not that good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty and syllabus are good. We have tech and new subjects. Not that old subject. Sem exams are not that difficult, as you can easily maintain your CG. Subjects are the best, oops, etc. They teach you all the latest subjects, so it's overall really good.
detailed_review.Other: It's only a girls' college. So you get less exposure, and other than that, the campus is small. College life is less exciting. But you will get a good competition there.

reviews.course: Masters of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: My review of this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement and job opportunities at the college are very good. They maintained a placement cell through which they contact good corporates and invite them for college recruitment, leading companies like Aditya Birla, Tata Motors, Facebook, Google, Flipkart, HDFC, ICICI Bank, etc. The average package offered is 3 LPA and the highest package is 15 LPA. Last time in college, some companies came to provide the students with an internship program. But in that they have their own selection process and their own stipend facilities, they also trained the graduation students in their pre-finals for the interviews and group discussion.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facilities are nice, only two students have to share the room. 24/7 Wi-Fi facility in the hostel, as well as water and electricity facility, is also minimal. The hostel mess food is also good and hygienic as it is checked every weekend, and there are timing restrictions from 9:00 PM onwards, nobody is allowed.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum is updated. They made regular changes according to changing requirements. Faculty members also attend various seminars, and if they find some changes, they propose them to the board. In this way, they keep it always updated. It's a good sign of a good curriculum. Faculty members are quite good at their teaching style. Their interactive approach and the way of delivery are very good. I am sure what their qualifications are, but surely that would be at the optimum level. Teachers are very down-to-earth, very helpful in nature, and will bring the best out of you. The exam structure follows a semester system, thus conducting 4 semesters in the MBA. Also, there are 3 internals carrying 60 marks, that is 20 marks each. Out of those, the two best are selected and there is also an external of 60 marks.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communications Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: Good placement in 2025 and in the ECE-AI department. Infrastructure should be improved.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm a final year student from the ECE-AI branch at IGDTUW, 2025 passout. In our batch, approximately 70% to 80% are placed at decent packages, and the highest package is around 50 LPA, the average package is around 16-18 LPA, and the lowest package is about 7-8 LPA. The top recruiters include Amazon, Microsoft, Qualcomm, and Infosys. Approximately 80% of students got internships in companies like Samsung and Deloitte. The common jobs roles offered are software developer, data analyst, and machine learning engineer. Overall, the placements and internships have been very good in the batch. In my batch (2026), we have also got some amazing internship opportunities as well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The ECE-AI department at IGDTUW has an average environment. They provide good and well-equipped labs with Wi-Fi facilities. There is a decent library. Some facilities are a bit outdated. I'm a day scholar, but one of my best friend is a hosteller, she told me about hostel that it is just poor, like the food is so bad and tasteless, rooms are so small, and the rules and regulations are so strict. The medical facilities available are below average. The classrooms are not fully air-conditioned in ECE-AI department compared to IT department.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some of the teachers are helpful, but sometimes, I just feel like they show partiality towards students with their favourite ones. They are well-qualified, no doubt. In the end, everyone studies from a YouTube channel. Because the teacher has knowledge, but they don't know the way of teaching. The curriculum is so underrated, and it does not make students industry-ready. A student has to do it by themselves. Exams are a little bit harder, and the passing mark is 45/100.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course just because of the placement at IGDTUW. The best thing about my course is that we can go for both sectors, hardware as well as software. The curriculum needs to be changed, and include some industry-level things, not only just assignments, files, and reports. Events are beneficial for the students who want to join them. The fest is good, and the campus crowd is okay. The connectivity is better, and the surroundings are good. They provide good scholarships according to fixed criteria. I got a Rs. 50,000 scholarship in my 2nd year. There is no specific sports complex.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical and Automation Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women (IGDTUW).

detailed_review.Placements: The placement ratio in my branch (MAE) is quite impressive, and 60-70% of students are getting placed. Even for core mechanical roles, the minimum package does not go below 5 LPA. In fact, I would say that the placement scenario for the mechanical course here is better than that of the CSE branch in many private colleges.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are quite decent, with well-maintained classrooms equipped with AC. Currently, the only exception is the mechanical branch, which doesn't have AC yet. The hostel food used to be exceptionally tasty. Even though I am a day scholar, I often eat with my friends in the hostel because the food is genuinely delicious.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, well-qualified, and highly knowledgeable. Most of them have completed their PhDs from premier institutes like IITs, so there is no doubt about the depth of their expertise. Semester exams are generally not too difficult to score well on. However, if we are in branches like Mechanical or ECE, we may need to put in a bit more effort compared to other branches. They say that with consistent hard work, even achieving a 10 CGPA is absolutely possible.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life is quite good. Although the campus area is relatively small compared to other JAC colleges. In my branch, there are around 120-130 students. The nearest metro station is near Kashmere Gate, and it takes barely 5 minutes to reach the college from there. The college has a wide range of societies, and we are encouraged to explore and get involved in as many as we would like. Personally, I have not been very active in other societies, as I have primarily focused on contributing to the training and placement cell, which is not categorised as a society.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical and Automation Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has a decent campus and faculty, but limited core opportunities for mechanical students.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, almost everyone got placed. The highest package is 1 crore per annum. The average package is 20 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.5 LPA. Roles like software engineering and software development are offered. Approximately 2% of students got internships at Microsoft, and 36 students at Wells Fargo. Top recruiting companies for our course are Google, Wells Fargo, Infosys, Tata Motors, and Tata Advanced.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are two hostels, Krishna and Kaveri, with accommodation for 300 to 400 students. Rooms are allotted on the basis of distance. There is a facility of Wi-Fi and a common room for study purposes. The food quality is good. A variety of food is served for breakfast. Milk is constant, and cornflakes. There is no foundation.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They explain very well. Lab sessions are also conducted, and they use a board for teaching purposes. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. Some companies allow for an industrial visit. There is no difficulty in college exams. The pass percentage in every subject is 45%.
detailed_review.Other: There are good placements in my course, so I chose it. There is hands-on experience in labs and cutting-edge technologies. Lab equipment is outdated, and the course structure is almost theoretical. Some events are organised by the college. There are 3 fests, i.e., technical, cultural, and sports fest. There is good connectivity 500 meters from the old Delhi railway station. Many scholarships are available.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical and Automation Engineering
reviews.review_title: Prominent very good college with great placements and faculty members are very good and supportive.

detailed_review.Placements: At least 75-80% of students are placed. Rest of the students went for their higher studies. Top recruiting companies are Tata Motors, Hero Honda, Flipkart, Amazon, Microsoft, Mortell, Technip, ITC, and Adobe. Top roles offered are designing, management, production management, and data handling. The highest package is 55 LPA, the lowest is 6 LPA, and average is 10 LPA - 12 LPA. Many students got internships in DRDO, at least 79-75% got internships in the above mentioned companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is average not very luxury but good for the students. It provides free Wi-Fi for the students. Labs are very well maintained. Classrooms are very spacious, not all the classes are air-conditioned but many of them are. Library is very good. We have 24X7 open computer center. I am a day scholar so I can't say anything.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and qualified. They are very supportive in helping students with their doubts, projects, and career related problems. They are very approachable as well. They are very knowledgeable in their respective subjects. They provide students with very good notes as well. Course curriculum is very relevant and makes students industry-ready as well as interesting. Semester exams are quite difficult, one has to prepare very well.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Placement and academics-wise, it's really good.

detailed_review.Placements: The B.Tech IT branch at IGDTUW had around 84.5% placement in 2024. The highest package was 52.89 LPA, and the average was 20.99 LPA. Top recruiters include Microsoft, JP Morgan, Adobe, Cisco, and BNY Mellon. About 330 students secure internships, many leading to PPOs. Roles offered are mainly in software development, backend, data analysis, and cloud.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Although we have labs for everything and they are well-equipped, some systems don’t work properly. Some classes don’t have AC, but it’s quite manageable. The library is good, and Wi-Fi is available. We don’t have a proper canteen. It’s shared, and the food is average. There are some small canteens, and again, the food is average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. They teach well. Some professors are very helpful. They help with research papers and more. They are also easily reachable. I feel our course is very relevant and everything we need to know for good placements. The level of exams is average. They are not too easy, not too tough. Maintaining a GPA above 8 is manageable.
detailed_review.Other: So it is very relevant and has good placements. IGDTUW has a good alumni network, and students get placed in good companies like Microsoft, Adobe, etc. Seniors are also very helpful, providing great exposure to everything. There are many scholarships offered by the college and other sources as well. Events are quite fun, and we have good fests.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Above-par college life with a lot of exposure.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are the highlight of IGDTUW. It provides good placements even in lower branches like Mechanical Engineering. The placement percentage is very consistent throughout. Big companies like Google, Amazon, Microsoft, and Uber also come for hiring.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are not that good. The Wi-Fi doesn't work in most areas. The library is very small, and the canteen facilities are not at par. There is a lot of space for sports and game activities. The classrooms have old benches, and there is no AC in the first-year classrooms.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are helpful, others not so much. The college provides very qualified professors. The course curriculum is very relevant and helps with the placement drive. The semester exams are very easy, but even semesters end in just 4 months, so the exams come quickly.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam is accepted by IGDTUW?
faqs.answer: IGDTUW admission to its UG and PG programme is based on the entrance exam conducted by the state and national level examination bodies. faqs.answer: To get admission in IGDTUW for BTech programme candidates must have a valid score in the JEE Main. IGDTUW a dmission to all the courses is subject to a valid score in the national/state-level entrance exam along with the fulfillment of the minimum eligibility criteria set by the college. Also, candidates must register through Joint Admission Counseling (JAC) by visiting the JAC's official website for admission to BTech. Find below the BTech eligibility criteria as per the IGDTUW admission body:

faqs.question: What is the admission process for BTech at IGDTUW?
faqs.answer: Admission to the BTech course at IGDTUW is through JEE Main scores, followed by counselling of JAC Delhi. The candidates should have passed Class 12 with a minimum of 60% aggregate in Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. Seat allotment is done on the basis of JEE Main rank, category, and availability. Candidates should register on the JAC Delhi website and go through the counselling procedure.

faqs.question: How much does B.Tech at IGDTUW cost?
faqs.answer: Hi.B.Tech. in Information Technology at IGDTUW is a 4 years course at the UG level. The course offers admission to 150 students. The total tuition fee for IGDTUW B.Tech. in Information Technology is INR 5.24 Lakh. Apart from the tuition fee, there is a one-time admission fee of amount INR 17,000, and a hostel fee of amount INR 5.17 Lacs that students are required to pay in addition to the tuition fee. To get admitted to IGDTUW B.Tech. in Information Technology course, applicants must meet the entry requirements - 60% in 12th. Thanks

faqs.question: Does IGDTUW accept any entrance exam for MBA admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women (IGDTUW) accepts CAT scores for MBA admission. While admission to the MBA will strictly be dependent on the candidate's performance in the CAT followed by GD and PI, admission to the MCA is conducted by an entrance test conducted by IGDTUW. Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women (IGDTUW) conducts a Research Aptitude Test (RAT) for doctoral candidates, followed by an interview.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for MBA at IGDTUW?
faqs.answer: IGDTUW offers MBA as a integrated programme with B.Tech in Mechanical and Automation Engineering + MBA. In 2023 the cut off rank was Gen 31246 Obc 62133 SC 186896

faqs.question: How many students can do BBA at IGDTUW?

faqs.question: How can I apply for admission to IGDTUW?
faqs.answer: To apply for admission at Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women (IGDTUW), candidates must first qualify for the course-wise eligibility criteria and then apply for the programme online through the university's official website or other admission bodies. For, the BTech/BArch programme admission is done via the Joint Admission Counseling (JAC). Therefore candidates must visit the official website of JAC and register there by providing all the required details. For, BBA/ MBA candidates must apply through CMAC's official website. Further, for the rest PG and PhD programme candidates must apply via the IGTUW's official website. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Does IGDTUW offers scholarships?
faqs.answer: Yes, Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women ( IGDTUW ) does offers scholarships to its students. The scholarships are offered to students who have officially got admitted to the UG, PG, a and PhD courses offered by the University. Some of the offered scholarships are as follows: GDTUW JRF/SRF (TRF) Scholarship Financial Assistance to M.Tech. and M.Plan. students Financial Assistance to Full Time Ph.D. Scholars Upma Memorial AwardDr. Babuajee Jha Scholarship Post Matric Scholarship schemes for SC on edistrict Delhi Govt portal NSP Portal Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme for Central Armed Police Forces and Assam Rifles Scholarships under AICTE Scholarships under UGC Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT
