data.title: IGDTUW Placement Report 2024
summary: IGDTUW has a placement cell which is committed to providing guidance and support throughout the job search process, helping students prepare for interviews and achieve their career aspirations. The final placements at IGDTUW are a result of very systematic interaction with the industry and continuous career counselling of the students.

Recently, IGDTUW has released the placement stats for the Class of 2024. As per the latest report, IGDTUW recorded 69.3% placements for the Class of 2024. A total of 135 recruiters participated during the IGDTUW placement in 2024 and placed 537 students of the 2024 batch. The MCA batch 2024 comprises of 74 students, of which 49 were placed with handsome packages. The participating recruiters placed 56 CSE AI students, 145 CSE, 125 IT, 95 ECE and 64 MAE students of the BTech batch 2024. The highest and average package offered to the BTech CSE batch 2024 stood at INR 56 LPA and INR 25.15 LPA , respectively. Further, the highest and average package offered to the MCA students during IGDTUW placements 2024 stood at INR 52.89 LPA and INR 14.13 LPA , respectively.

Additionally, IGDTUW also offered internship opportunities to the students of Class 2024. According to the report, 427 students received internship offers from reputed organizations. The top recruiters who participated during IGDTUW placement in 2024 included Google, Adobe, Palo Alto, Microsoft, Uber, Atlassian, BNY Mellon, Deloitte, JP Morgan, Cisco, PWC, Salesforce, Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, British Telecom, etc.

faqs.question: How are the CSE placements at IGDTUW?
faqs.answer: As per the latest report, the BTech batch 2024 comprised of 188 students, of which 145 were placed in reputed companies. The IGDTUW CSE average package offered to the BTech batch 2024 stood at INR 25.15 LPA , whereas the highest package offered stood at INR 56 LPA . placement_faqs.question: How much does B.Tech at IGDTUW cost?
placement_faqs.answer: Hi.B.Tech. in Information Technology at IGDTUW is a 4 years course at the UG level. The course offers admission to 150 students. The total tuition fee for IGDTUW B.Tech. in Information Technology is INR 5.24 Lakh. Apart from the tuition fee, there is a one-time admission fee of amount INR 17,000, and a hostel fee of amount INR 5.17 Lacs that students are required to pay in addition to the tuition fee. To get admitted to IGDTUW B.Tech. in Information Technology course, applicants must meet the entry requirements - 60% in 12th. Thanks

sections.heading: Introduction
text: Check out more on Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women (IGDTUW) Infrastructure in the videos below:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: Learning Resource Centre of IGDTUW, Delhi has a highly selective collection of print, electronic, and audiovisual materials in the areas of science, engineering, technology and management to support the learning and research activities of students.The Digital Library section has e-materials like CDs, DVDs and digital thesis.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: The University has two women hostels - Krishna Hostel and Kaveri Hostel. All rooms are on twin/triple sharing basis and are equipped with individual beds, chairs, built-in cupboards and study tables. In addition to this, IGDTUW Hostels provide purified drinking water, housekeeping services, wi-fi facility, news paper/ magazines, TV, Washing machines, facilities of hot water for residents, paid laundry services etc. The residents use the campus play ground for games

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 308 published reviews , 278 reviews are verified.

review_summarisation.heading: What students say about Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women (IGDTUW)

likes.text: The top companies are Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Uber, Morgan Stanley, Philips, etc., visit our campus for recruitment.
Almost all students get placed and top recruiters are coming like MS atlassian, Adobe and many more for internship as well as placement too.

likes.text: Our college provides us with all facilities like labs, a computer center, Wi-Fi, and a library.
The library and canteen are pretty decent, and the college has two hostels named Krishna and Kaveri.

highlights.summary:
Jamia Hamdard University has been ranked at the 1st position under the Pharmacy category. Jamia Hamdard University Delhi is UGC approved university. JHU Delhi is accredited by NAAC with A+ Grade. It is a government aided deemed to be university. Jamia Hamdard New Delhi has placed students in top companies like KPMG, Accenture, etc. Jamia Hamdard gives UG, PG, PhD and several other courses to students. These Delhi Jamia Hamdard University courses are provided across the Pharmacy, Management, Engineering, and various other streams. Jamia Hamdard New Delhi has two hospitals, modern medicine & Unani medicine, with a capacity of 700 beds & 100 beds respectively. Unani Medical Hospital has been accreditated with the NABH Hospital.
Jamia Hamdard University New Delhi also offers distance learning courses through the Centre for Distance and Online Education. Jamia Hamdard University New Delhi is known for its flagship MBA, BPharma, & BTech courses. New Delhi Jamia Hamdard has 10 schools of study and 2 institutes under it. Delhi Jamia Hamdard University is also ranked 94 by QS WUR Ranking By Subject 2026 for the Pharmacy and Pharmacology. The major highlights of Jamia Hamdard New Delhi are tabulated below:
Jamia Hamdard Delhi Highlights 2026
Hamdard University Delhi (JHU Delhi)
- 87th by NIRF under Management
- 94 by the QS WUR Ranking By Subject for Pharmacy and Pharmacology
- 498 by QS Ranking under the Asian University Rankings category
- 1401+ by the QS World University Rankings

college_info_program.intro: Jamia Hamdard University New Delhi popular programmes are BTech, BPharma, and MBA. For MBA students, the university organises Biz-Quiz, Management Fests, Debates, Ad-mad shows, and others. Hamdard New Delhi also arranges guest lectures & student and faculty exchange programmes for MBA students. MBA students can work as Marketing Managers, Consultants, & also Finance Managers, or can take up several other job opportunities. Jamia Hamdard New Delhi BTech students can work as Software Engineers, Data Scientists, and others. Overall, Hamdard University Delhi is one of the highest-ranked universities present in India. college_info.college_name: Jamia Hamdard UG, PG, Doctorate, Certificate, Advanced Masters Courses 2025
Jamia Hamdard Fees 2026
Jamia Hamdard Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: Bachelor of Physiotherapy (BPT)
reviews.review_title: Faculty members and placements are good every year, and the infrastructure is average.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70–80 percent of students get placed. The highest package is 15 LPA, and the lowest package is 2 LPA. Recruiting organizations include some universities and hospitals. Roles offered are professor and physiotherapist roles in sports, neuro, musculoskeletal, and cardiovascular specializations. Many alumni start working abroad, and we have a wide range of options for how we want to work.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is above average, and we can rate it 4/10. Some cons include lift issues and Wi-Fi speed. Labs have almost all the required equipment. Hostel facilities are average. They charge a high amount, but facilities are not worth it. Mess and canteen are available, and their prices are reasonable. Medical facilities are good, as we have a hospital and a rehabilitation centre. In sports, we have football, volleyball, badminton, basketball, cricket, table tennis, carrom, and chess. We need improvement in all these areas.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful and friendly, with experience. They graduate from Jamia Hamdard and other colleges in Delhi and have completed their Master's in different fields of physiotherapy. The course curriculum is relevant, as they teach practical work, which is very important. We give only final exams like MBBS. The pass percentage is 50%, which becomes harder if we do not take it seriously.
detailed_review.Other: I always wanted to be a doctor, so I chose BPT, through which I can help people who want to live better lives. Things that can be improved include infrastructure, and in our course, we always need improvements, as everything is now modified. Events are organized frequently, and we can join the fests of other departments. The crowd is friendly, and the college is ragging-free. Campus surroundings are manageable for living. Scholarships are available for toppers, SC, ST, and minorities.

reviews.course: BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration)
reviews.review_title: Not the best but not the worst either.

detailed_review.Placements: As much as I have heard, the placement records are not very high. Teachers help in getting you placed, but it is your job to find a good job, and very few students get placed from the college itself. 30 percent of the students get placed maybe much less as specific records aren't mentioned. The highest package is 10 LPA, the lowest is 2.8 LPA, and the average is 3 LPA-4.5 LPA. Several companies such as HCL, Tata, Coca-Cola, and others. From my course 70 percent of students got internships Roles that are offered are data analyst, customer executive, salesforce, managerial roles, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi service is available, but it rarely works, and data services are negligible here. A lot of issues arise because of that. Classrooms are normal college classrooms with no AC and old fans. The library is functional with a huge number of books but most are outdated. The hostel facilities are great with good rooms, AC, and water supply. The curfew time is 9:30 PM, and the food is a bit hygienic, but not that bad. The sports facilities are great with a huge ground available, and other sports equipment is also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: My department has knowledgeable and supportive faculty who help in building a good foundation which is essential. The syllabus is not that up to date but it isn't obsolete either. It has subjects like principles of management, states, indian economy, business economy, etc. If you want to be industry-ready, then you have to seek internships and real-life experiences on your own. Semester exams are manageable if you study properly. The overall pass rate is high with 40 percent being required to pass from both internal and external.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was always intrigued by management and how businesses worked, and all the plethora of things that go on in the background. I would add more skills that I can learn to make students job-ready. Fewer major events are conducted. The crowd is mixed but not very bright. Connectivity is mid, the closest metro station is Govindpuri and Nehru Place, from there you can take an auto. The campus is great it's built on almost 100 acres with fewer scholarship opportunities and moderate activities.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharm.)
reviews.review_title: Poor infrastructure, bad class management, no placements, but good faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very low. Usually, students go abroad. The highest is 5 LPA, the lowest is 2 LPA, and the average is 3 LPA, which is sometimes not sufficient. Companies like Dabur also visit. There are not many internships, but with a referral, you can get internships as an assistant pharmacist.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not good. Wi-Fi works only in specific places. Labs are okay, but water facilities and chemicals are missing, and equipment does not work. The hostel is good overall, and the food is good. Safety is a priority, and the hospital is nearby. There is a sports week, and the main focus is on sports and games too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, but they don’t teach in a way that helps you score good marks in exams, which is not good. Teachers are knowledgeable and clear doubts, but there is no practical approach, so students are not industry-ready. Exams are average, and the majority of students pass.
detailed_review.Other: As it is the medical field, it intrigues me. It is a crucial job in society. I wish they made us industry-ready. Events are good, fests are rare, and the campus crowd is okay. The campus is greenish, and there are good extracurricular activities, but there are not many scholarships.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS)
reviews.review_title: It is a cute college with nice studies.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements depend on marks scored in NEET PG. We had alumni from our college who went to AIIMS as well, and many other reputed colleges. Many have also cleared exams like the USMLE and PLAB. It basically depends on students how well they have studied. HIMSR is considered one of the top private colleges and indeed has a good name.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facilities are not that great. Food is also okay, not very good, and not very bad either. Hostels are clean. College has an AC lecture theatre, library, and computer labs. Washrooms are nice. The college is overall not very big, but it has a cozy vibe.
detailed_review.Faculty: It has excellent academics. Faculty members are very supportive. Professors help a lot if we are interested in studies. They themselves are alumni from reputed colleges. They are highly qualified as well. Exams are moderate. Regular tests are taken after completion of each subject part.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is very beautiful with a lot of trees. It is nice to walk around the campus with friends. It is not well-connected to the metro station. The nearest ones are Govindpuri and Sake. The surrounding area is Tughlaqabad, which is not so safe at night. Extracurricular activities like sports, music, dance, etc., happen here. Fests are also organised here.

reviews.course: B. Sc. Medical Imaging Technology (BMIT)
reviews.review_title: Jamia Hamdard University review.

detailed_review.Placements: 85% of total students get placed. Companies like Max Healthcare and Apollo visit here for hiring. Roles offered during placements include radiography, radiology technologies, X-ray, CT, and MRI technologies. The lowest average package in our course is 3 to 5 Lakhs. Internships are compulsory for every student in their last year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi and labs are available for students, and a maximum of 60 students can be in a classroom. The library is also available to assist students. Safe and separate hostels with good hygienic food quality are available for boys and girls. Majeedia Hospital provides medical facilities, and sports grounds are available for games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Well-qualified teachers with extensive knowledge are available for the welfare of students. The teaching quality is excellent, making it easy for students to understand. The relevant course curriculum prepares students for the field of radiodiagnosis to assist radiologists. The difficulty level of semester exams is moderate, allowing every student to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because imaging technologies help us identify diseases through imaging the area of interest in the patient. Many events and fests are held at our college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review by a CSE day scholar student.

detailed_review.Placements: 300 students got placed in our course. The highest package is 12 LPA and the lowest package is 7 LPA and can be lower. Companies like Infosys, HCL, Flipkart, and Wipro come here for student selection. Roles like CTO, software developer, and full stack developer are offered here. Students do get internships here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities like classrooms are non-AC. Only the ground floor which are the LT classrooms are smart classes with AC and projector. Other classrooms are without AC. The hostel is good with a lot of facilities like laundry, Wi-Fi and electricity all over. The mess is also good. The food is also good there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They are assistant professors who mostly give lectures. There are also guest faculty members who are highly qualified and well-educated. The course curriculum is not relevant as it has an old syllabus, which is quite basic nowadays and can be done by anyone. However, the fact is there is a degree given after that which is really important. Semester exams are not that difficult, and they are easy to pass by just studying the night before the exam.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to explore AI in the curriculum and do cybersecurity which sets the basic foundation for ethical hacking. A core CSE course is a gateway for everything we want to specialize in information technology or this relevant industry. Better faculty interaction and behavior should have been there to create a student-friendly environment. Events and fests are totally optional and depend on if we are in society and clubs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review by student living life on campus.

detailed_review.Placements: 300 students got placed in our course. The highest package is 12 LPA and the lowest package is 7 LPA and can be lower. Companies like Infosys, HCL, Flipkart, and Wipro come here for student selection. Roles like CTO, software developer, and full stack developer are offered here. Students do get internships here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities like classrooms are non-AC. Only the ground floor which are the LT classrooms are smart classes with AC and projector. Other classes also have projectors but without AC. The hostel is good with a lot of facilities like laundry, Wi-Fi and electricity all over. The mess is also good. The food is also good there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable as they were in contact with DU. The syllabus is old-oriented, and many changes have happened, but is good for basic knowledge of CSE. Semester exams are not that hard, and we have to score 50% which includes the sessional exam and external semester, which are the internals.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it has a lot of opportunities and can be used to develop skills and real-time API. Web development, software engineering, and data science are some fields that are in trend right now. These times can be executed by learning CSE and having a degree in CSE. Better education quality and better infrastructure should be improved. Events, fests, and the campus crowd are good. Events keep happening all the way in a month depending on clubs we are in.

reviews.course: B.A. (Honours with Research) in Journalism & Mass Communication
reviews.review_title: Review of the evergreen Jamia Hamdard University.

detailed_review.Placements: It basically goes towards the pharmacy placements. In mass communications, it gives documentary, film production, and anchoring placements in well-reputed companies like BBC, Aaj Tak, TV 9, Republic TV, NDTV, Zee News, etc. It has a well-organised structure and gives good placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the course is well-maintained. It has Wi-Fi, computer labs for doing editing on photoshops, Premiere Pro, Adobe software, and studios for news and radio. It provides a lot of hands-on workshops. The interior of the college where students sit is well-organised and has 99 names of Allah, where everyone feels peace alone at their free time.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are like friends, and they are supportive. They provide a lot of PDFs and notes, which are helpful. Faculty members came from IMC, BHU, and AMU. They are highly educated. We have professional course lectures by professionals, like for radio, we have an AIR anchor for teaching.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: The college has supportive faculty, a room with solid placement, and is industry-ready.

detailed_review.Placements: Jamia Hamdard University records up to 87% placement with a top recruiter like Deloitte, TCS, and Pfizer. The average package is 5.5 LPA. Top roles include software programs and business analysis with internships secured by over 70% of key courses.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Jamia Hamdard offers well-equipped laps, Wi-Fi, modern classrooms, a rich library diverse sports facilities, and so on. The campus has a hygienic mess and canteen, reliable medical services, and a sports complex for indoor and outdoor games ensuring holistic student development.
detailed_review.Faculty: Jamia Hamdard has qualified and supportive faculty members. The curriculum is industry-relevant. Exams are moderately difficult. The passing percentage is 85%. Exams are moderately challenging, with a pass percentage of around 85%, reflecting academic rigor.
detailed_review.Other: It offers great exposure, through industry tie-ups. They could improve- campus life is vibrant with a fast good crowd, scholarships, and strong extracurriculars.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Occupational Therapy (BOT}
reviews.review_title: Campus is so clean and green. It was not good in past 2010 but now it is so good.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently pursuing UG program, and there are 33 other students with me in my batch. The highest package offered to us is 7 LPA. The lowest salary is 5 LPA after this course. Top recruiting companies are Max Health Care, Ability, etc. It is mandatory for everyone to clear internships at different hospitals and clinics in Delhi. We can apply for the fresher's role.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is provided on our campus like Wi-Fi and AC. Classrooms have desks and furniture. Especially every building has its own library. There are certain canteens also with good quality food. Boys and girls have separate hostels and hygiene is also good in hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are top-notch in our course. They are masters in occupational therapy and some of them have even completed their Ph.D. in this course. The curriculum covers all domains of our course and is not so tough. Exams are annual plus teachers help a lot.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the course to help the people who really need our help in their rehabilitation. Occupational therapy needs to be taught in all colleges. Campus organises many fests like food fest, tech fest, and invites many celebrities.

reviews.course: MBA in Public Health Management and Hospital Administration
reviews.review_title: Overall the campus is beautiful teachers are helpful and cooperative, and the placements are okay.

detailed_review.Placements: In my senior batch around 20% of students are currently working in hospitals. The highest salary package offered is 12 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Cipla, Max, etc. Some start-ups like Vidya RX visit our college to recruit students. Mostly students have to find internships on their own or by their own sources.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi does not work properly and the college campus has jammers so cell internet doesn't work. Classrooms are getting better in facilities. There are overpriced snacks and food like coffee around 150ml is for Rs. 40 which is very helpful in summer. The campus events can be good if the management is done properly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are qualified, knowledgeable, and helpful. You'll also come across teachers with too much ego and nosy. Exams are strict and well-managed. Students are only exposed by internships. The passing percentage is 90% but students also have to work hard for that.
detailed_review.Other: More campus placements should be there so that students don't have to struggle in their starting years. Fests are good but the management of these fests is really bad.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Cardiology Laboratory Techniques
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the campus, really good teaching staff and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: About more than 70% of students get placement in our course. Minimum salary can be expected up to 25k per month. The highest package can be 6 LPA. Top hospitals like MAX, PSRI, HIMSAR, and MAJIDIA hospital provide internships and jobs for medical interns.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good. The buildings are old. Well-equipped Labs and Classroom. The central library is the famous building of our college. The campus is very large and vast.  It has a hostel facility for girls. There are so many Pgs nearby. The food is very tasty. More than 6 canteens are there. A very sports complex is there with a Gym, basketball court volleyball, football, badminton, and tennis court.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very good and helpful. The exams are held from time to time. Most of the teachers are Ph.D. scholars and doctors with more than 10 years of experience. I am currently pursuing bsc in cardiology laboratory techniques. It's a paramedical course of 4 years duration. It is the most growing profession in the medical field. Exams are very well conducted. The exam pattern is quite advanced level. The classes are held on time. A minimum of 75% is required to pass.
detailed_review.Other: Our college conducts conferences, events, and festivals. There are lots of societies which we can join according to our hobby. Dance clubs singing clubs acting clubs eco clubs so many exciting things are present.

reviews.course: BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration)
reviews.review_title: Jamia Hamdard University is one of the best university for the medical students.

detailed_review.Placements: 22% of students in my course were placed. The highest package offered in our college placement is 15 lakhs per annum. There are lots of companies that come for hiring, such as Amazon, Mahindra Tech, Accenture, and many more. In our college, almost 70% of students get internships in good companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our department, lots of facilities are available, like labs, Wi-Fi, a library, sports facilities, and many more. The hostels are very good. In our college, hostel facilities are very good, including the environment of the hostel. Medical facilities are always available for the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers clear your every doubt, and they have much experience. Semesters are not too difficult if you concentrate well. In our college, the passing percentage is 40% for the management department students, and we can easily clear our exams.
detailed_review.Other: I chose BBA because I want to become a businessman and improve my communication skills.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Physiotherapy (BPT)
reviews.review_title: The faculty is supportive, but for the hostel, there is a big no.

detailed_review.Placements: A batch consists of 50 students based on their NEET. Around 50 students got posted for internships for 2 years of the course to gain experience. They got posted in the rehabilitation center. After the completion of the course, 6 months of internships are provided.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are pretty spacious. The infrastructure is different department-wise. Students are provided with their own IDs to excess Wi-Fi. Students have free access to rehabilitation centers for their bone-aching problems. The campus provides many opportunities to participate in cricket. In district-level competitions, once you are a part of the team, you can join NCC as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. The department gives us many opportunities such as workshops to improve our clinical skills. It provides valuable information. Our teachers have their clinics where students can practice and gain experience. For every participation in workshops and conferences, we are provided with certificates that help in building our resumes.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life is pretty good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Reality of my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Less than 50 percent of students are placed. The lowest package is 2 LPA, and the highest package is 8 LPA. Deloitte, Big O Notation, etc., are the companies. No internships from the college. Haha, no roles actually. Most of my friends and classmates are doing MBA further or going for further education because the Bachelor's was useless.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi works often, sometimes not. Labs are newly built, so they are fine, but the ACs are broken. The library is fine. It is the only place where you can spend time during the day. Classrooms don't have AC and are not so good. Canteen food is fine but a bit costly. All other facilities are okay too.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum and exams are good as the curriculum is addictive and informative. Exams take place on time, and their difficulty level is medium. Coming to teachers and their knowledge, well, not really good. Some are perfectly fine, but some of them are just there to deliver lectures.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (CSE)  in Artificial Intelligence
reviews.review_title: Enter Jamia Hamdard only for medical courses.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is really pathetic. We got very few job notifications, and those were for sales only. I don't know why they sent the notifications only a day before, and by a day, it's not even 24 hours. The jobs were only at very small, unknown startups.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi was average. Classes didn't have AC. Labs were bad, as the systems were outdated, and some of them needed repair. The teachers conducted very few practical classes. The library was also just average. I was not a hosteller, but the service there was also just fine, not very good or exactly bad.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum was okay, but the teaching method was very bad, as the faculty only provided knowledge in classes and not practical implementation in labs. Though the teachers were qualified, and most of them were PhDs, they just came to class to read the PowerPoint presentations. The course was new and good, as AI and ML are in trend. Exams are not that difficult. The pass percentage is 33%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as I am interested in computer science, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and Python. The course covers all the necessary subjects for its being. The teaching method should definitely be better or be improved. There were events and fests, but I was not interested in them, so I didn't attend them. The campus crowd is also just okay, but sometimes local people do enter and create chaos. Connectivity is a bit difficult, as the metro is far, and then you have to use public transport. The campus is surrounded by the pathetic areas of Sangam Vihar and Tughlakabad.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: I would like to be a part of Jamia Hamdard in the future again.

detailed_review.Placements:
60% students were placed in many companies.
The highest package is 8 Lacs per annum, average package 4 Lacs per annum.
Top recruiting companies are TCL, Capgemini, Cognizant, etc.
Maybe 30 to 40% in tech companies like Cognizant, Deloitte.
Roles offered include computer programmer, software developer, network engineer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the facilities are available in Jamia Hamdard, like hostel, canteen, lab, classrooms, library, and Wi-Fi. There are two types of classrooms in this college: normal classrooms and LT rooms. Facilities in our hostel are good in every aspect. The quality of food is absolutely excellent. Medical facilities are good because our college is more famous in the medical field. Sports and games are available in our college, like cricket, football, badminton, basketball, volleyball. A gym is also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are so helpful and well-qualified and knowledgeable. Most are Ph.D. holders. Teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is mostly relevant to physical industries. It makes the students ready for the industry. Semester exams are not always tough. It always depends on the topic or subjects.
detailed_review.Other:
BCA (Bachelor of Computer Applications) is a Computer Science degree, which is in demand. I also like to go in IT industries.
I would like to improve my coding skills.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Nursing
reviews.review_title: Review of Jamia Hamdard .

detailed_review.Placements:
This college itself has a majeedia hospital, which selects nurse students after interviews, and the package is about 2.5 LPA. Beside Majeedia Hospital, it has other hospital settings such as Max, Fortis, NHAI, etc., which select the students only after interview. 
Student can pursue for M.Sc.  nursing after their bachelor's degree to enter the teaching field.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities include Wi-Fi, labs, AC, classrooms, a library, a demonstration lab with dummies, canteens, and a huge campus with beautiful views of sports fields and sports week, which enables the students to compete at the national and state level. This college also provide scholarships for 1st year students only and fee concessions for 2nd, 3rd, and 4th year students.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Teachers are well experienced and try their best to solve their problems.
Semester exams are not so hard, though it's important to go through PYQ to pass.
And students need to score 50 percent to pass exams. They have to separately pass their theoretical and practical exams .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best budget friendly college which is excellent in education.

detailed_review.Placements: Jamia Hamdard University is well known for it's medical departments and it is number 1 all over India in pharmacy. If we talk about the engineering department, more than 60% of students get placed from TCS and other well-known companies. The highest package was 35 LPA, and the average package that students get was always around 5-8 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Jamia Hamdard is known for it's amazing infrastructure and its amazing architects. Jamia Hamdard was in the leading universities in installing the 5G connection in their labs for the students and other purposes. The classrooms and buildings have an impressive ventilation system. All the classrooms have sufficient fans and light resources, while the classrooms on the ground floor have air conditioning installed in them. Jamia Hamdard also has lift systems in buildings to avoid staircases.
detailed_review.Faculty: Jamia Hamdard is very strict while taking admissions in different courses through JEE, NEET, CUET, CLAT, etc. They focus a lot on the cutoff and 12th marks. While taking the exams, the faculty is very strict, even the flying squad. Otherwise, the faculty is very friendly to each and every student. Jamia Hamdard is a very friendly and diverse university.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: It is not that good college neither bad too; it needs a lot of reforms, especially in DEPT of CSE.

detailed_review.Placements: The companies that came for recruiting are WIPRO, HCL, and INFOSYS. Teachers guide us on how to avail internships through the Internshala portal. The average package, as per my knowledge, is nearly 3 LPA. Most students got roles as backend developers, technical analysts, front-end workers, and testers. Nearly 50 percent of students get placed in BCA, but if I talk about B.Tech, the numbers are quite better.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms are clean, though other facilities like the systems and lab classes are not that accessible to students. Whenever we have a practical class, then only we can use them; otherwise, not. It offers a Wi-Fi facility within the campus. A spacious library is available where one can study, and there are separate corners where systems are installed. Book issuing is done digitally by computers.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching style of teachers is the best part; they follow the curriculum thoroughly and take timely updates on projects. The difficulty factor is not there in any exam; it all depends on the student. If they study, they will clear it easily. Usually, the pass percentage is more than 90%.
detailed_review.Other: The connectivity is not a problem to reach here as it is near the metro station. It also offers a big playground facility with cricket, basketball, badminton, football, and volleyball as sports.

college_info.college_name: Jamia Hamdard Course Admissions 2026: Eligibility, Selection Process, Fees & Last Date

admission.title: Jamia Hamdard University Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text:
Jamia Hamdard admissions are both merit and entrance-based. The institute accepts various national-level entrance exam scores, such as JEE Main, NEET UG, CAT, etc. for specific courses. Jamia university conducts Written Tests and Interviews for M.Phil and PhD programmes . JHU offers over 100 courses at the UG, PG, Diploma and doctoral level. The courses are offered in various streams such as Management, Science, Engineering, etc.

In addition to the regular courses, the university also has a distance learning vertical called Jamia Hamdard Centre for Distance and Online Education (CDOE) that offers courses at the UG, PG, Diploma and certificate level.

Below is the overview of Jamia Hamdard admission process :

1. Aspirants must fulfil the academic requirements as specified by the course. The minimum qualification for UG courses is Class 12.

2. The selection to courses such as MBBS is based on candidate's NEET-UG score and university's cutoff. The university shortlists aspirants for some of the courses such as BA, BBA, BSc, etc. based on their CUET-UG scores and performance in the interview round.

faqs.question: Does Jamia Hamdard require CUET?
faqs.answer: The requirement of CUET score varies course-wise at Jamia Hamdard. The university considers CUET scores for admission to BSc, BSc (Hons), BA (Hons), BA, BJMC, BCom, BBA and BMS programmes. Besides passing CUET, aspirants must also fulfill the eligibility requirements specific to the preferred programme. The final selection is done considering both CUET and qualifying exam scores of the aspirants.

faqs.question: Can I get admission in Jamia Hamdard without JEE?
faqs.answer: Candidates who are applying for BTech at Jamia Hamdard do require JEE Main score for admission. Along with JEE Main, aspirants must also have passed Class 12 examination with Mathematics and Physics as compulsory subjects and one of the following: Computer Science, Chemistry, Electronics from CBSE or any other Board with at least 50% aggregate or equivalent CGPA in aggregate for admission to BTech programme.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission in Jamia Hamdard for BA LLB?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard provides admission to BA LLB course based on a valid CLAT score. Candidates having CLAT scores are given preference in the selection process. However, as per the admission process, candidates are also given direct admission to BA LLB without CLAT score, if the seats remain vacant for the CLAT applicants or there is a delay in declaration of CLAT result . The university selects Non-CLAT candidates based on their merit in the first five subjects in the last qualifying examination. However, CLAT qualifiers will be given preference over Non-CLAT candidates.

faqs.question: Is there reservation in seats at Jamia Hamdard for BA LLB course?
faqs.answer: Yes, Jamia Hamdard has a seat reservation policy for students of BA LLB. The total seat intake for this course is 120. The university has a 50-50 reservation quota for Indian Muslims and other candidates. Tabulated below are the category-wise seat intake for Jamia Hamdard BA LLB course:

faqs.question: Who is eligible for BPT at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have passed Class 12 with Physics, Chemistry and Biology or any other examination with a minimum of 50% aggregate and also in PCB are eligible to apply for BPT at Jamia Hamdard University. The selection is also based on NEET-UG scores of the candidates.

faqs.question: Which are the MPharm specialisations offered at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard University offers MPharm for two-years at the PG level. The programme is spread across four semesters. Those who have passed BPharm with a minimum of 55% aggregate can apply for any of the below-mentioned MPharm specialisations:

faqs.question: How can I get admission to Jamia Hamdard University BA programme?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard University offers admission to its BA courses on a merit-basis. Hence, the applicants scores in the last qualifying exam are considered. During selection, the university may give preference to the students with a CUET score or CLAT for BA LLB course. To be eligible for course, aspirants should have passed Class 12 or equivalent exam from a recognised board with required minimum aggregate. The eligible students can apply for admission by filling out the application on the official website. Applications are then shortlisted and merit lists are released. Shortlisted students need to participate in the counselling for seat allotment.

faqs.question: Is Jamia Hamdard University under CUET?
faqs.answer: Yes, Jamia Hamdard offers admission to students on the basis of CUET entrance exam. The college will release the final merit list of the basis of scores obtained by the students in this exam. Candidates can check the official website for more information.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard releases its recent admission guidelines or prospectus on the official website a the start of the admission for each academic year. Students must check the course-wise eligibility and selection criteria and follow the process. Admission to all the courses is either merit or entrance based. For instance, admission to the BTech and MBBS courses are subject to JEE Main and NEET UG exams, However, for courses, such as BCA, admission is subject to merit in Class 12 in the best of five subjects. Additionally,  the deemed-to-be University accepts CUET UG conducted by NTA for a few of its UG courses, namely BA, BA (Hons), BSc (Hons), BBA, BJMC and BCom.

faqs.question: What is the NEET score required for admission to the Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard NEET cutoff for the year 2024 concluded after the release of Round 3. As per Jamia Hamdard cutoff for the year 2024, the last round closing rank stood at 59571 for Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) , while in the year 2022, the last round closing rank was 27485 .

faqs.question: Is there any seat reservation in B.Pharm at Jamia Hamdard University?
faqs.answer: Yes, Jamia Hamdard University has seats reserved for candidates who are Indian muslims. Out of the total seat intake, 50% of the seats are reserved for candidates belonging to the aforementioned category. The other 50% seats lie under the open merit category. Candidates applying for BPharm course of Jamia Hamdard can apply for the applicable category. However, students applying for reserved seats may have to present the relevant documents as well.

faqs.question: What is the fees of BPharm at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: There are multiple components included in the total course fee, such as hostel fee, tuition fee, security deposit, and more. The total tuition fee for BPharm at Jamia Hamdard ranges between INR 5.8 lakh and INR 8.8 lakh . Inclusive of both regular BPharma and lateral entry programmes. Some of the fee components are one-time chargeable. While the tuition fee component has to be paid annually/semesterly. Students must note that the given fee amount is taken from the official website/sanctioning body. It is still subject to changes and hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: Is Jamia Hamdard good for BTech?
faqs.answer: BTech is one of the top courses of Jamia Hamdard University. NIRF ranked Jamia Hamdard at 79 under 'Overall' Category and 49 under 'University' Category. After completing the degree from Jamia Hamdard, BTech students can participate in the on-campus placement drive. Jamia Hamdard placement report 2023 is not released. However, according to Jamia Hamdard course-wise NIRF reports 2023, the median package offered during Jamia Hamdard BTech placements 2022 stood at INR 4.25 LPA . A rise of over 21% was witnessed in the BTech median package offered in 2022 as compared with 2021.

faqs.question: Which is better for a BTech between IPU and Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Both Jamia Hamdard and IPU offers four-year BTech course. Below is a comparsion between the BTech course offered by the two universities based on fee and intake parameters: Note: This information is sourced from official website/ sanctioning body and is subject to change.

faqs.question: Does Jamia Hamdard offers BTech? What is the criteria of admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, Jamia Hamdard University offers four-year BTech programme spread across eight semesters. The university offers BTech in three specialisations, namely Computer Science Engineering , Electronics and Communication and CSE Artificial Intelligence. The admission criteria for JHU BTech is entrance-based. The university considers the JEE Main score to offer admission to any of the BTech specialisation. Apart from fulfiling the admission criteria, candidates need to meet the eligibility requirements. Candidates need to complete Class 12 with at least 50% aggregate in relevant subjects for BTech.

faqs.question: What is the fees of BTech in Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee for BTech at Jamia Hamdard ranges between INR 7 Lacs and INR 8.8 lakh . Inclusive of both regular BTech and lateral entry programmes, this fee, however, is sourced from unofficial sources. Hence, is indicative. Students can check the official website of the college to know the exact fee of courses.

faqs.question: I want to take admission to BBA in Jamia Hamdard so is there any entrance exam for it?
faqs.answer: Yes, Jamia Hamdard considers CUET score for admission to BBA programme. Besides CUET, candidates also need to complete Class 12 with at least 50%-55% aggregate for admission. CUET UG is a national-level entrance exam conducted by NTA once in a year in computer-based mode.

faqs.question: Is BBA available in Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard University (Deemed-to-be) offers a BBA programme of four-year duration to the students. Offered via the Department of Management, the deemed university started offering this course in the year 2014. A total of 180 seats are allotted for BBA and admission is subject to the CUET-UG exam conducted by NTA. However, if seats are vacant, admission might be offered on the basis of merit in the first five subjects in the qualifying examination. Apart from regular BBA, CDOE and Jamia Kannur Campus also offers BBA in distance education and regular mode, respectively for a duration of three-years each.

faqs.question: What is BBA eligibility at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to qualify a minimum of Class 12 for Jamia Hamdard BBA programme. Aspirants must also hold the documents proving their eligibility for verification at later stages of admission. Below is the detailed eligibility:

faqs.question: What is the NEET score for Jamia Hamdard for MBBS?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard accepts NEET score for admission to MBBS programme. NTA releases NEET cutoff for admission to MBBS programme. NTA determines the NEET cut off based on the factors such as difficulty level of the exam, total number of test-takers, total number of seats, candidate category and programme. In 2023, the NEET cutoff for Jamia Hamdard MBBS was 59,571 for General Category. Candidates with a decent score in NEET, can get a seat in MBBS programme of Jamia Hamdard University. As per unofficial sources, the marks required for General category is between 600 and 620 .

faqs.question: Can I get admission in HIMSR MBBS via donation?
faqs.answer: No, Hamdard Institute of Medical Science and Research under Jamia Hamdard University does not accepts donation. As per the official website, HIMSR don’t take admission through any counselor/s, agent or any other third party. All the admission to MBBS programme is allotted by Medical Counseling Committee of DGHS under MoHFW, Government of India, through NEET-UG Counseling only. If in case anyone pay any amount to third party,  agent or counselor HIMSR, JHU will not be responsible for any refund or admission.

faqs.question: Is it worth taking 35+ Lacs loan for MBBS in Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard is one of the recognised deemed-to-be universities in Delhi offering MBBS course. Is it worth to take a loan for getting in MBBS programme? Candidates can decide the same based on below parameters: Ranking Jamia Hamdard University is recognised all across the world. It is ranked by NIRF from past three-years under the 'Medical' Category. Placement Placement is an important factor for any student selecting a college. JHU placement report 2023 is not released. However, as per the Jamia Hamdard Medical NIRF report 2023, the median package offered during Jamia Hamdard MBBS placements 2021 stood at INR 13 LPA. The package is increasing every year from INR 12 LPA in 2020, it has seen a slight increase in the year 2021. Out of 148 students, 109 got placed. MBBS Fee Yes, the fee for Jamia Hamdard MBBS is on a higher side. The total tuition fee for MBBS at JHU is INR 72 lakh. However, if the goal is to get a good start in the Medical career, it can be considered. Not all students can get into AIMS, hence Jamia Hamdard is a recognised university offering MBBS course.

faqs.question: What minimum marks are required to get admission in Jamia Hamdard through the NEET in MBBS?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard NEET cut off has been released up to Round 3 Seat Allotment results for the MBBS course. As per the Jamia Hamdard NEET cut off 2023, the closing rank for General category candidates for Round 1 was 56658, for Round 2 and 3 it was 59571 for the General category All India Quota. Only candidates with a NEET score are allowed to participate in Jamia Hamdard's admissions to the MBBS course.

faqs.question: How many seats does Jamia Hamdard have for its BSc course?
faqs.answer: The university has a total seat intake of 390 for the BSc programme. There ae 330 seats at the main campus and 60 at the Kannur campus. The seat allotment is done based on merit in the last qualifying exam or scores in entrance test for BSc Nursing. It must be noted that the mentioned seat intake is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is still subject to change. Hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: How can I apply at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Candidates can apply online for Jamia Hamdard. Aspirants must meet eligibility for the form. Candidates must fill out the form to get login details. Aspirants have to login to fill out the form, upload documents and pay the application fees.

faqs.question: Are Jamia Hamdard BPharm 2024 registrations open?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard University applications for all courses (Except BPharm) were released on Mar 15 . As per an official notice, the last date of form submission was Jun 20 . It must be noted that the mentioned dates are as per a tentative schedule. The dates are thus subject to revision. Hence, it is indicative.

faqs.question: Does Jamia Hamdard offer direct admission to BBA?
faqs.answer: No, Jamia Hamdard University does not offer direct admission to BBA programme. Jamia Hamdard selects candidates for BBA programme based on CUET-UG score. Once the CUET-UG results are out, aspirants need to provide their scorecard. If seats are vacant, the selection may be done based on merit of the first five subjects in the qualifying examination. For admission to BBA distance education and Kannur Campus, merit in the last qualifying exam is considered. The university releases a selection list with the names of the selected candidates.

faqs.question: Does Jamia Hamdard University offer scholarships to students?
faqs.answer: Yes, Jamia Hamdard deemed-to-be University offers a wide range of scholarships/ fellowships to the students. All these are besides the various scholarships and fellowship schemes of the Government of India and the Delhi Government. The list of a few popular scholarships is as follows: Other than the scholarships mentioned above, the deemed-to-be University offers a wide range of school-specific scholarships to the students. The details of the same can be obtained from the official brochure of Jamia Hamdard.

faqs.question: Is there fee concession at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard provides fee concession to students pursuing a course from the university. The tuition fee concession is offered to the students of weaker sections of societies whose parents income is below INR 4.5 Lacs per annum. The students are granted fee concession from 25% to 50% based on Merit-cum-Means and on case to case basis.

faqs.question: What are the electives in BTech CSE at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Students pursuing BTech CSE from Jamia Hamdard have to choose an elective during the course. Professional Electives are introduced in four threads besides the Open Elective. There are 6 slots for Professional Electives and 4 slots for Open Electives. The department may permit students to take 50% of these (Professional electives + open electives) from other disciplines, based on the choices of the students and Consent of Course advisors. faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard accepts NEET score for admission to MBBS programme. NTA releases NEET cutoff for admission to MBBS programme. NTA determines the NEET cut off based on the factors such as difficulty level of the exam, total number of test-takers, total number of seats, candidate category and programme. In 2023, the NEET cutoff for Jamia Hamdard MBBS was 59,571 for General Category. Candidates with a decent score in NEET, can get a seat in MBBS programme of Jamia Hamdard University. As per unofficial sources, the marks required for General category is between 600 and 620 .

faqs.question: Can I get admission in HIMSR MBBS via donation?
faqs.answer: No, Hamdard Institute of Medical Science and Research under Jamia Hamdard University does not accepts donation. As per the official website, HIMSR don’t take admission through any counselor/s, agent or any other third party. All the admission to MBBS programme is allotted by Medical Counseling Committee of DGHS under MoHFW, Government of India, through NEET-UG Counseling only. If in case anyone pay any amount to third party,  agent or counselor HIMSR, JHU will not be responsible for any refund or admission.

faqs.question: Is it worth taking 35+ Lacs loan for MBBS in Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard is one of the recognised deemed-to-be universities in Delhi offering MBBS course. Is it worth to take a loan for getting in MBBS programme? Candidates can decide the same based on below parameters: Ranking Jamia Hamdard University is recognised all across the world. It is ranked by NIRF from past three-years under the 'Medical' Category. Placement Placement is an important factor for any student selecting a college. JHU placement report 2023 is not released. However, as per the Jamia Hamdard Medical NIRF report 2023, the median package offered during Jamia Hamdard MBBS placements 2021 stood at INR 13 LPA. The package is increasing every year from INR 12 LPA in 2020, it has seen a slight increase in the year 2021. Out of 148 students, 109 got placed. MBBS Fee Yes, the fee for Jamia Hamdard MBBS is on a higher side. The total tuition fee for MBBS at JHU is INR 72 lakh. However, if the goal is to get a good start in the Medical career, it can be considered. Not all students can get into AIMS, hence Jamia Hamdard is a recognised university offering MBBS course.

faqs.question: What minimum marks are required to get admission in Jamia Hamdard through the NEET in MBBS?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard NEET cut off has been released up to Round 3 Seat Allotment results for the MBBS course. As per the Jamia Hamdard NEET cut off 2023, the closing rank for General category candidates for Round 1 was 56658, for Round 2 and 3 it was 59571 for the General category All India Quota. Only candidates with a NEET score are allowed to participate in Jamia Hamdard's admissions to the MBBS course.

faqs.question: How many seats does Jamia Hamdard have for its BSc course?
faqs.answer: The university has a total seat intake of 390 for the BSc programme. There ae 330 seats at the main campus and 60 at the Kannur campus. The seat allotment is done based on merit in the last qualifying exam or scores in entrance test for BSc Nursing. It must be noted that the mentioned seat intake is as per the official website/sanctioning body. It is still subject to change. Hence, is indicative. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How can I apply at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Candidates can apply online for Jamia Hamdard. Aspirants must meet eligibility for the form. Candidates must fill out the form to get login details. Aspirants have to login to fill out the form, upload documents and pay the application fees. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Are Jamia Hamdard BPharm 2024 registrations open?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard University applications for all courses (Except BPharm) were released on Mar 15 . As per an official notice, the last date of form submission was Jun 20 . It must be noted that the mentioned dates are as per a tentative schedule. The dates are thus subject to revision. Hence, it is indicative. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Does Jamia Hamdard offer direct admission to BBA?
faqs.answer: No, Jamia Hamdard University does not offer direct admission to BBA programme. Jamia Hamdard selects candidates for BBA programme based on CUET-UG score. Once the CUET-UG results are out, aspirants need to provide their scorecard. If seats are vacant, the selection may be done based on merit of the first five subjects in the qualifying examination. For admission to BBA distance education and Kannur Campus, merit in the last qualifying exam is considered. The university releases a selection list with the names of the selected candidates. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Does Jamia Hamdard University offer scholarships to students?
faqs.answer: Yes, Jamia Hamdard deemed-to-be University offers a wide range of scholarships/ fellowships to the students. All these are besides the various scholarships and fellowship schemes of the Government of India and the Delhi Government. The list of a few popular scholarships is as follows: Hamdard National Foundation (HNF) Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti Ajmeri (Gharib Nawaz) merit-cum-means scholarship Dr. LM Singhvi Gold Medallion (or Silver Shield) of accolade Rabia STEM Scholarship for Girls Sayeeda Memorial Scholarship for Girls Other than the scholarships mentioned above, the deemed-to-be University offers a wide range of school-specific scholarships to the students. The details of the same can be obtained from the official brochure of Jamia Hamdard. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Is there fee concession at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Jamia Hamdard provides fee concession to students pursuing a course from the university. The tuition fee concession is offered to the students of weaker sections of societies whose parents income is below INR 4.5 Lacs per annum. The students are granted fee concession from 25% to 50% based on Merit-cum-Means and on case to case basis. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What are the electives in BTech CSE at Jamia Hamdard?
faqs.answer: Students pursuing BTech CSE from Jamia Hamdard have to choose an elective during the course. Professional Electives are introduced in four threads besides the Open Elective. There are 6 slots for Professional Electives and 4 slots for Open Electives. The department may permit students to take 50% of these (Professional electives + open electives) from other disciplines, based on the choices of the students and Consent of Course advisors. Some of the electives available are: Quantum Computing Advanced Algorithms Parallel and Distributed Algorithms Computational Complexity Queuing Thoery and Modeling, etc. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the syllabus of Jamia Hamdard BA LLB course?
faqs.answer: The integrated course is of five-year duration and is divided into semester pattern. Jamia Hamdard BA LLB curriculum includes semester-wise subjects. Each of the courseg has a credit attached to it. Some of the subjects included in the course curriculum are enlisted below: Law of Torts History Mercantile Law Criminal Law Family Law Jurisprudence Intellectual Property Law, etc. Not satisfied with answer? sections.heading: Introduction
text: Jamia Hamdard University has a big campus and provides various facilities for students. The deemed to be university offers hostel facilities to postgraduate and undergraduate students. Hamdard University has a basketball court, a badminton court, a football ground, and others. Jamia Hamdard University has two attached hospitals, a 150-bedded Unani Medicine Hospital and another 550-bedded Modern Medicine Hospital. Jamia Hamdard University also has a central library.

sections.heading: Jamia Hamdard University Library
text: Jamia Hamdard Library system consists of the Central Library and six faculty libraries. The Central Library of the JAMIA Hamdard was named as Hakim Mohammed Said Central Library in 1992 after the name of the younger brother of the founder, Late Hakeem Abdul Hameed Saheb. Since then, the library has been acquiring quite a large number of resources in conventional and non-conventional forms. The Library is fully automated and extensively covers modern technologies in delivering its services. The collection is searchable through the online catalogue. The library is very rich in oriental collections on different languages, including Urdu, Arabic, Persian, etc. Computerisation of all the Urdu, Arabic and Persian books has been completed by using the UNICODE interface module of LIBSYS Software.

sections.heading: Jamia Hamdard University Sports Facilities
text: A Gymnasium has been constructed with the assistance of the University Grants Commission and Hamdard National Foundation. Besides, playgrounds for cricket/football, volleyball and badminton (both for girls and boys) are available. A cemented ground for basketball is under construction.
Check out more on Jamia Hamdard University's Infrastructure in the videos below:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The Hamdard University has more than 1.75 lakhs items including 30,000 rare books,18,500 back sets of journals. Library subscribes to foreign and Indian journals. It has acquired quite a large number of CDs, microfilms, microfiche and more than 4000 manuscripts in Urdu, Arabic and Persian languages. This library is very rich in oriental collections in different languages including Urdu, Arabic, Persian, etc. Computerization of all the Urdu, Arabic and Persian books has been completed by using UNICODE interface module of LIBSYS package and linked with the English Book database, Journal database, Thesis/Dissertation database and database of CDs on many subjects of interests.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Jamia Hamdard University has total of seven hostels for boys and girls with a separate hostel for foreign/ NRI candidates providing adequate infrastructural provisions, mess facilities, mechanical laundry facility etc

data.description: Hamdard University Delhi consists of experienced and highly qualified faculty members. Hamdard University also invites various popular guest faculty and frequently arranges conferences, and several workshops to provide training and for enhancing the knowledge of the students. Jamia Hamdard University faculty are PhD, diploma, and degree holders.

highlights.summary:
Jaypee University of Information Technology (JUIT) was established by Act No 14 of 2002 vide Extraordinary Gazette Notification of the Govt of Himachal Pradesh in 2002. The University Grants Commission (UGC) accorded its approval under Section 2(f) of the UGC Act. JUIT is also a member of the Association of Indian Universities (AIU). The University has been twice accredited by NAAC (2011 and 2017), and the bulk of its programs are NBA-accredited.
Jaypee University Solan offers UG, PG, and PhD programmes through 7 departments. The flagship courses offered at JUIT are BTech and MTech across various specialisations. The institute appoints well-experienced and trained faculty members.
The Jaypee University of Information Technology offers a scholarship to deserving students under various schemes. Jaypee University of Information Technology admission is based on merit and entrance exams. The university accepts national entrance exams such as JEE Main, CUET, and others. The key highlights of JP University Solan has been tabulated below:
