reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: ROI is not what you expect, so you have to step up and take your own responsibility.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement percentage is around 80%. There are around 200-250 eligible students, and out of those, only 10 get packages over 10 LPA. So you have to work hard on your skills. Companies that come are Ion, Darwin Box, Toddle, C2C, etc. I don't think that package offering above 20 LPA visits our campus very often, but still, you have to see the slightest of the brighter side.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is no doubt top-notch. The only issue is they are taking bulk student intake, which affects the mess being jammed-packed some days. The library during exam times is crowded, you won't find seats there, but on exam days it is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is well-structured, but the execution is not so good. Our institute lacks very well-qualified faculty members, but there are a few (2-3) very good facilities too. Semester exams are easy, you don't have to worry about them. The extracurricular activities are 2/5 as well.
detailed_review.Other: If you get into this college, it's not too bad, but you have to earn skills and get a job. Because there is not so much well-structured placement support, the management does try to give you whatever is the best of their knowledge, but sometimes they fail to understand what a student needs. There are some unusual restrictions that you might have to deal with. Overall, I would rate my college 2.5/5.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Moderately satisfied with the university.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80% of students get placed every year. This year, the highest package is 21.5 LPA, and the average package is 6.5 LPA. Top recruiters are Amazon, Zscaler, Infosys, etc. Around 70% of students get internships every year. Top roles offered are Software Developer, Software Engineer, and Data Analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Generally, for the Computer Science department, there are many facilities, like Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, a library, etc. Hostel facilities are okay. The quality of food is very good compared to other colleges. College also has a dispensary and various sports facilities are provided.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are well-qualified, knowledgeable, and easily approachable. Most courses are good, but some are irrelevant, but they need to be taught as per government guidelines, so no choice on that. Semester exams are a bit tough, and the pass percentage is about 80%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Well-equipped infrastructure, supportive teachers, and industry-relevant curriculum with scope.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students got placed in my course. The highest package is 50 LPA, and the average salary is 12 LPA. Companies like Facebook, Google, and Microsoft visit our college for recruitment. 50% of students got internships in companies like Paytm and PayPal. Tops roles offered in my course are software engineer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available in my department are well-equipped to support both academic and practical learning. Classrooms are spacious, well-lit, and equipped with projectors and audio-visual aids, making lectures more engaging. Wi-Fi connectivity is available throughout the department, enabling students to conduct research and access study materials online.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified, knowledgeable, and supportive. Most of them hold advanced degrees and have significant industry or research experience. They are approachable and willing to help students with doubts, projects, and career guidance. The teaching quality is good, with a mixture of theoretical and practical approaches, including case studies, lab sessions, and interactive discussions.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my strong interest in the subject and its career prospects. The curriculum aligned with my passion and provided opportunities for skill development, research, and industry exposure. Additionally, the course offered practical learning, internships, and a pathway to diverse career options.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Jaypee University of Information Technology: The college is only good due to it's location.

detailed_review.Placements: The conversation rate of students here is barely 5%. Many companies came back without taking any students even though around 200 students applied for the job. Many seniors are unplaced and even the pass outs are unplaced. The promotions of 100% placement are totally fake. The average package is about 3.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The food in the mess hall is terrible. Sometimes we find cooked insects in our food. The facilities aren't that good, and for every small issue we're sent to the hospital from our dispensary because we don't have proper resources to solve the problem. On the plus side, the college does have a few sports facilities, including basketball, badminton, football (only for boys), and cricket (only for boys).
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here don't generally care about the well-being of the students. Some teachers are really good, but they leave the college early for better jobs, so we're stuck with the bad ones. When I was a fresher, we were told that it's difficult to fail in this college, but here teachers announce beforehand that they'll bring about 200 supplies in this particular subject.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I wanted to become an engineer and came to JUIT because of the location. The festivals here are really small and not good. The crowd is too local and mixed and not that good for the social life in general. Too many suppliers of drugs nearby the campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Jaypee University Of Information Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 50% of students have been placed. Top roles offered were Software Engineer, Sales, Business Development Associate, Frontend Engineer, Graduate Engineer Trainee, System Engineer, and Special Programs were the top roles companies came for at our university.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel facilities available here are really good. The room availability is single, two, and three occupancy rooms with spacious rooms and clean washrooms. Wi-Fi for each floor works okayish. Coed mess. One girls' hostel and 13 boys' hostels with separate buildings for first year.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty at JUIT is really good and knowledgeable. Every one of them helps the students with any doubts or queries. The coding culture is not much here; everyone has to do coding and be an expert in their interests on their own. The semester exams' difficulty is medium.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Empowering Minds: A Comprehensive Review.

detailed_review.Placements: Current batch placement is ongoing, and close to every student will get placed with top recruiting companies like Aspire, Zscaler, Infosys, Accenture, LTMindtree, ION Group. The top package is around 20 Lacs, with the lowest being 3.60 Lacs. Companies like Coderix, PlaySimple, and RT Camps came for internships. Overall, the average placement range is around 5 Lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure for hostel and course is overall very good with 24/7 Wi-Fi, library with reading space, clean drinking water, up-to-date computer and science labs, smart classrooms. Hostel rooms are also good with blowers for winters, and the mess food is really good compared to other universities. There is also a dispensary that is open all the time for medicine, and two doctors are there till 5 PM.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty for all the departments are adequate and experienced. The course and curriculum are designed on a GATE basis, and questions in the exam are also of GATE level. There are three exams in a semester: T1, T2, and T3, which are of 15, 25, and 35 marks respectively. The remaining 25 marks are internal marks given by the subject teacher. Faculty here are lenient and helpful.
detailed_review.Other: CSE at JUIT offers overall knowledge, be it the basics of computer sciences or for many events that happen on the JUIT campus, like the annual cultural fest LF, where performers come to perform different activities like singers, bands, etc. A tech fest called Murious is also organized, along with a literary fest called Alfaaz, youth parliament, and a sports fest called Parakaram, where different colleges come to compete.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Amazing location of the university .

detailed_review.Placements: 85–90% of students were placed in my course. The highest package offered was 19.5 LPA on campus and 50 LPA off campus. The lowest was 3.5 LPA, and the average was 8.5 LPA. The top companies that did mass recruitment were LTI Mindtree, Infosys, Wipro, and Cognizant. Roles offered were SDE, developers, sales jobs, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
The facilities like Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and libraries are all good.
Hostel facilities are also great. The best part is the food. The food tastes amazing. It is difficult to find good food away from home in hostels. 
Everything is hygienic, and canteen food is also great.
Sports and outdoor games are wonderfully organised and set up. Dispensary is available 24/7, and doctors are so calm and nice.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Faculty is great to deal with, helpful, cheering, and motivating all the students of their class in each semester. The semester exams happen three times per semester: 1st is of 15 marks, 2nd is of 25 marks, 3rd is of 35 marks, and the rest are internal marks. 
And the course curriculum is relevant to the course, and they make you industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: The location of the college is wonderful and so quiet and peaceful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Jaypee University of information technology CSE (B.Tech).

detailed_review.Placements: 78% of students are placed in our course. The highest package is 9 lakh and the lowest package in my course is 7 lakh. The top recruiting companies are Wipro, Amazon, Infosys, TCS, HCL, Google, etc. 88 percent of students got internships in the course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facility of my college is very good and the class is also clean. There is Wi-Fi facility. And the library there is very big and we have good books there. The quality of the hostel there is very good. We get proper food in the hostel. The quality of food is also good. Medical facilities are also good. Sports are also good, be it cricket or kabaddi.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college teachers have full qualifications, they have a lot of knowledge and they help me a lot in our studies. In my college, there is a Moksha test every week. And there are two semesters in a year. Yes, this course is relevant to students and makes them ready for the industry.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College life at JUIT is amazing.

detailed_review.Placements:
Around 90%+ students get placed from our university.
Our university has a placement average of 7 LPA and goes up to 50 LPA, and the lowest is around 5 LPA.
Google is the top recruiter, and many of other tech companies like Goldman Sachs, Ion Group, etc.
Our university as such doesn't provide internship opportunities we have sought by ourselves, and around 95%+ students got internships from different mar-tech, tech, and fintech companies.
Top roles offered are software developer, business analyst, and data engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
There are several labs in our college, including physics labs, and 3 floors full of computer labs with moderate-to-high-end PC's for everyone. There is wifi at university in every corner of the campus.there are 2 libraries: one is called dhyan Kaksh, which is small and just for peace reading  and one is LRC, which is 4-story library full of books. We have several classroom's and lecture halls for academic lectures and tech hackathons, etc.
There are 4 hostels in our campus: 1 is for 1st year boys , one for girls and 2 for senior boys. Wifi is provided in hostels, along with LAN facility too. Mess food is very tasty and hygienic. We have a dispensary too, with 2 doctors and enough staff for first aids. 
Sports facilities are also very good, as there are 2 badminton courts , 1 volleyball court, 1 cricket ground and 1 basketball court and every hostel has its own gym too.
detailed_review.Faculty:
The faculty is well educated and has numerous degrees, but some of them don't know how to teach. Some are on contractual basis and do not come in the mood to teach us. They just came to deliver the lecture and take attendance.
The course curriculum is somewhat relevant, but many of the filler subjects are also added, which is a waste of time for someone who is targeting placements.
Semester exams are not difficult at all. We have 3 exams: T1 for 15 marks, T2 for 25, and T3 for 35, which total 75 marks, and 25 is teacher assessment, and we just have to struggle for 30 marks in total from 100 to pass the exams, which is not difficult at all.
detailed_review.Other:
As we all know, CSE is booming in the market, and everyone wants to be a good CSE engineer, so I chose CSE with data science assignment proficiency. I am keen to learn statistics and technology, so this course goes well for my interest.
Filler subjects must be removed, and students must be taught the subjects that are really important for placements and industry.
There are numerous events occurring every month in the university, like tech, culture, sports, and many more.
Campus is surrounded by lush green forest, which makes it more motivating to study.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Not recommended for B.Tech; placement cell is not good.

detailed_review.Placements: Scored 89.2 in 12th, got into CSE. The placements here are not that much good. The lowest package goes around 4.5-5 LPA. The highest this year is 50 LPA, which is also off-campus. Subjects taught are good, and the curriculum is also up to date.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The labs are Wi-Fi enabled, with the latest PCs which were set up this year only. The classrooms are good too, with whiteboards and classboards. The library has three floors and is highly recommended for studying there. It's a very quiet place and is open up to midnight. The hostel rooms are quite good with a nice view, but there is no place for midnight cravings, although there are coffee and snacks vending machines and the cafeteria is open up to 11 PM.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers have left the college, the ones who are here from the beginning. The faculty is not that much good. They have good knowledge, but they don't teach well. The course curriculum is up to date and exams are of moderate level. To pass the exam, 30/100 is required.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is quite a good college .

detailed_review.Placements:
Placements are okay. 
Many large companies do approach this college.
Maximum students did get internships. 
The highest package was 80 LPA. 
I will say that it is a very good private college with not many requirements as marks.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Food is good for mess. 
There is a Wi-Fi limit of 5 GB per day per student. 
And the infrastructure is good as well.
I will say that it is quite a good college with beautiful buildings and views as it is located in mountains and is just an hour away from Shimla .
detailed_review.Faculty:
The faculty is well educated and mostly comes from IIT. 
The teachers are very helpful and motivating. 
The exams are quite okay in terms of difficulty. 
The teachers are very supportive, are very inspiring and teach until each and every student understands the concepts .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 86  percent of students in my course got placed. The highest salary package offered is 15 LPA, and the lowest is 4 LPA. Recruiting companies include Microsoft, Google, and IBM. The top roles offered are Web Developer and Software Developer. Around 70 percent of students secured internships in companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available in the department are good. Wi-Fi is available throughout the college, and the classrooms are well-maintained. The labs are equipped with good equipment, and the library is well-stocked with all necessary books. The food quality is acceptable.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is well-experienced and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good and easy for students to understand. The course curriculum is relevant and supports practical understanding. Semester exams are challenging, with a pass percentage of 78%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college in Solan for B.Tech.

detailed_review.Placements: The college provides the best placement; the highest placement is around 44 LPA, with an average of 10 LPA and the lowest was 4 LPA. Major companies like TCS, Wipro, etc., came to college for placement last year. Top roles offered by the companies are SDE 1 and Engineer Trainee.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is very good. The college is in Solan, which is in the mountains region, so we get a very good area and weather here. The classes are equipped with Wi-Fi and AC all over the campus. The hostels are big and good with a mess that offers very good food.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are really good and supportive in nature. The exams are of moderate level with all the portions coming from what has been taught in the class. The curriculum mainly focuses on practical learning rather than theoretical knowledge. Students mostly pass in the exam, but in past trends, some students get back in Maths.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Infrastructure is excellent in our college.

detailed_review.Placements: In the recent batches,  90 percent placement was observed in the biotechnology department, whereas in the Computer Science department, it is no doubt one of the best engineering colleges in Delhi-NCR. Many students were placed in Biocon, Dabur, Microsoft, Amazon, IBM, etc. In the Computer Science department, the placement rate is 100 percent, starting from a package of 3 LPA to 50 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is very good, as most of the indoor spaces inside the college are centrally air-conditioned. The seats in the classrooms are well taken care of, and our library has open Wi-Fi for the use of students and teachers. The food in the mess and cafe is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and experienced in teaching, with most of them having postgraduate degrees in their area of interest. The curriculum in the first year is not relevant, as we were made to study math and electrical science, which we do not use in the biotechnology department. It was very difficult for us to learn, as most of the students come from a non-medical background. The passing ratio is 95 percent for students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Jaypee University of Information Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement opportunities are good. There are several companies, like Accenture, Microsoft, Amazon, Zopsmart, etc. The average package is around 4 lakh, and the highest package is 40 lakh. Placement training is also given. But at last, it is your responsibility to take the placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is great so many facilities are available inside the campus; you don't have to run outside. The hostel also provides so many facilities, like a 3-course meal in the mess with great taste and the gym is open full-time for your good. Water coolers and 24*7 Wi-Fi are also available .
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-versed in recent technologies and domains, which they will teach you. The course curriculum is updated according to UGC guidelines. Exams are conducted in three phases every semester: t1, t2, and t3. Practicals are also conducted in three phases.
detailed_review.Other: Please, if you are joining this campus, make sure to visit at least once before applying for admission to this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review about the college situated in hills: Jaypee University of Information Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The top recruiters here are Microsoft, Amazon, ZS Associate, Zopsmart, Accenture, etc. The average package is around 4 lakh, and the highest package is 40 lakh. You will get training to sit in placement from the college itself, which is a great part. But at the end, it is in your hand to get a good offer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good as it is located in the hills and mountains region, and the course curriculum is updated according to the UGC guidelines. Hostel facilities include room with a bed, study table, chair, almirah, etc. The food is very good as compared to other colleges.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty are great and very experienced; they will teach you the latest technologies and domains. Although there is an 80% attendance requirement, they will clear you at 70% sometimes, which is fair. Exams are conducted in three phases (t1, t2, t3) and practical in 3 phases (p1, p2, p3).
detailed_review.Other: Please, if you are choosing this college, you should visit at least once for your own sake and ask the students of this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Average good private college.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students are placed in mass recruiting companies like TCS. There are not many high-end companies that come for on-campus placements. Most of the students get their placements on their own (off-campus). The highest package offered is around 45 lacs per annum which was off-campus bagged by the students’ efforts. The average package is around 4-5 lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this college is quite decent. The labs and the classrooms are average. There are approximately 28 students in one batch. The hostel has all the basic amenities like water and power supply. Girls' hostels have in-time of 9:30 pm. The quality of food is fine, it is hygienic and healthy.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is nice and helpful, they help you outside the classroom as well. Most of CSE faculty is knowledgeable about their course. The curriculum is as that of the other colleges of India which is more of theoretical knowledge than practical use. The difficulty level of the semester exams is average, they are not very difficult to pass.
detailed_review.Other:
My course is Computer Science and Engineering, I have chosen this course because I wanted to pursue software 
engineering. This college is in a secluded area so apart from the basic requirements, for everything you have to go to
either Shimla or Solan. But there is something always happening in the campus to keep the students busy.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: All about Jaypee University of Information Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: In this programme, there are fewer students compared to other courses, resulting in a high job placement rate for its graduates. Nearly all students seeking employment in this field secure a job. Last year, Amazon offered the highest salary package of 30 lacs to students in this programme, with Nescafe being a top recruiter.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The students enjoy excellent facilities and infrastructure, although there are recurring problems with the Wi-Fi speed, which has a daily limit of 4 GB. The hostel rooms are well-maintained, but occasionally the quality of food in the mess is subpar. However, despite these occasional issues, the food in the mess is generally better than in other places. Sports receive the least focus from the college administration.
detailed_review.Faculty: The majority of teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable, delivering high-quality instruction. However, there are a few exceptions who struggle with teaching and lack sufficient knowledge. Since I haven't completed half of my course yet, I cannot determine if it adequately prepares students for the industry. The difficulty of exams varies based on the teacher's effectiveness in teaching the material.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college environment is very good.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement scenario is very good. Almost 90 percent of students were placed in different MNC companies from our college. Nearly 100+ companies arrived at our college. Top recruiting firms include Google, Infosys, Wipro, Microsoft, and others. The highest package in our college is 40 lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is very good infrastructure in our college. Facilities are at a decent level in our college. College management provided many facilities to our department, like good classrooms with ventilation, a good library and good wi-fi connectivity for labs. There is a college hostel facility for the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our course curriculum was updated daily as per college management decisions. Teachers are very talented and are working at our college. Their quality of teaching is clearly understandable to all. Semester exams are a little hard but all books are available in the library.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Faculty is excellent in the college.

detailed_review.Placements: 60% of the students were placed in some companies like World, Accenture, and Tesla, and 70% of the students got internships in different companies. The highest package offered in our course is 10 LPA and the lowest package offered in our course is 2 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All courses are available in the college and infrastructure and facilities are provided by the college for the students like Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, library and canteens. Many facilities are available in the college for the students and food quality is good in hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: Compared to infrastructure and placements, our college has good faculty and teaching quality is excellent. The college course curriculum is regularly updated, and semester exams are not hard; we can pass easily in all exams in the college.

college_info.college_name: Jaypee University of Information Technology Admission 2026: Eligibility, Process, Fee, Dates, Selections

admission.title: Jaypee University of Information Technology Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text: Jaypee University of Information Technology admission are based on both merit and entrance examination scores. The university provides programmes at undergraduate, postgraduate, and diploma programmes in fields, like Engineering, Science, Management, etc. in various specialisations. The entire process is held online on the university's official website. Check the information below for the Jaypee University of Information Technology admission process:

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission in Jaypee University of Information Technology?
faqs.answer: No, you can not get direct admission in Jaypee University of Information Technology since the university accepts students on an entrance basis followed by counselling. However, the university may accept direct admissions against the vacant seats for some of the courses.

faqs.question: What are the courses offered at Jaypee University of Information Technology?
faqs.answer: At Jaypee University of Information Technology, students can pursue several courses at UG, PG, and PhD levels. The offered courses are as below:

faqs.question: What is JEE Mains 2024 registration date session 1?
faqs.answer: NTA has not announce the JEE Main 2024 form fill up date. However, it is expected that the application forms will be released in December. The tentative JEE Main 2024 application form date session 1 is December first week. JEE Main application form 2024 will be available online on the website jeemain.nta.nic.in 2024. Interested candidates will be able to apply from the official website. JEE Main 2024 registration last date will be last week of December or January first week. As the exam will be conducted in two sessions, NTA will release separate application forms for both the sessions.

faqs.question: What entrance exam scores does JUIT Solan accept for admission to B.Tech?
faqs.answer: JUIT Solan accepts JEE Main scores for admission to B.Tech. For Biotechnology and Bioinformatics,  50% of seats are filled through JEE Main and the remaining 50% through merit in the qualifying examination.

faqs.question: What are the entrance exams accepted by Jaypee University of Information Technology?
faqs.answer: Jaypee University of Information Technology accepts several entrance exams for admission to its courses. JUIT accepts national-level exams such as GATE, CUET, JEE Mains, NET, SLET, UGC, CSIR (JRF) , etc.

faqs.question: What is the latest cutoff information for B.Tech at JUIT Solan?
faqs.answer: The latest cutoff information for B.Tech at JUIT Solan is as follows: For more details contact the official website of JUIT. Hope its helpful to you.

faqs.question: What is the M.Tech course fee at JUIT Solan?
faqs.answer: As per the official source, the M.Tech course fee at Jaypee University of Information Technology is INR 2.9 lakh. The total fee includes Meal Plan is included in mentioned fee. The fees might include components other than hostel fees, One Time Payment includes Caution money. For more details, students can visit the course fee page here.

faqs.question: How many MSc seats are available for at JUIT Solan?
faqs.answer: A total of 50 seats are available for MSc at Jaypee University of Information Technology. For more details students can check the table presented below:

faqs.question: Is JUIT Solan hard to get?
faqs.answer: JUIT Solan admission is done on the basis of fulfilment of the course-specific admission criteria. The university offers a limited number of seats for its programmes. With the ever-increasing competition and limited number of seats, it is quite difficult to get into the university. However, with the right mindset and preparation students can certainly get into the course of choice at the university. Students can look at the following links to prepare for some of the entrance exams accepted by the university:

faqs.question: How many seats are available for the B.Tech programme at Jaypee University of Information Technology - JUIT?
faqs.answer: A variety of specialisations are available for BTech, MTech, MSc, and PhD studies at Jaypee University of Information Technology (JUIT). In terms of placements in 2023, the top and average packages offered to B.Tech students were INR 44.14 LPA and INR 7.01 LPA, respectively.  The total intake for the B.Tech/BE programme (4 years) is 270 students. The course is offered in offered in a full-time mode. Students must score a good rank in JEE Main exam results in order to be admitted to this curriculum.  The total tuition fees for the course is 10.4 Lakhs.

faqs.question: Can I get admission to Jaypee University of Information Technology - JUIT with 60% in Class 12?
faqs.answer: Admission criteria at Jaypee University of Information Technology (JUIT) may vary depending on the specific programme and the year's admission policies. Generally, a minimum of 60% in Class 12 is considered a decent academic record. However, it's important to note that admission decisions are influenced by various factors, including the number of applicants and the competitiveness of the program. Meeting the minimum percentage requirement does not guarantee admission, as other aspects like entrance exams, interviews, and possibly additional criteria play a role in the selection process. It is recommended to check the official JUIT website or contact the university's admission office for the most accurate and up-to-date information on admission requirements.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for admission to BSc at JUIT Solan?
faqs.answer: All applicants for the BSc are encouraged to make sure that they meet these criteria to enhance their chances. Eligibility criteria for admission to BSc programme at Jaypee University of Information Technology, Solan is as follows:

faqs.question: Is JEE required for B.Tech at JUIT Solan?
faqs.answer: Jaypee University of Information & Technology, Solan was established in the year 2002. It offers 7 specializations under the B.Tech program,  4 under M.Tech, and 8 under the Ph.D. program. B.Tech is a full-time undergraduate programme of four years with a total of 510 seats. According to the official website of JUIT Solan, admission to B.Tech programme is through two modes: So, yes, JEE is required for B.Tech at JUIT Solan, except for non-JEE candidates applying for Biotechnology and Bioinformatics. I hope this answers your question.

faqs.question: Can I get admission in Jaypee Solan without JEE?
faqs.answer: No, the selection criteria for full-time course is through JEE Main score. Candidates should have minimum of 50% marks (45% for SC/ST) in aggregate in Class 12 or its equivalent examination. Aspirants with gap year (if any) between their Class 12 will be required to submit Gap Period Affidavit  (available at university website).

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for JUIT Solan BTech admission?
faqs.answer: Jaypee University of Information Technology provides BTech course across several specialisations. To be eligible for getting into this course, students must fulfil the admission criteria as prescribed by the university. The basic eligibility requirement is to pass Class 12 or equivalent with a minimum aggregate of 60% from a recognised board. Further,  50% of the total seats are offered based on valid JEE Main score and the remaining 50% through merit basis. Eligible students can visit the university's official website to apply for the programme.

faqs.question: Can I get into JUIT Solan B.Tech with 70% in class 12th?
faqs.answer: Admission to the B.Tech course in JUIT Solan is based on merit in the entrance examinations or merit in the qualifying examination. Entrance-based admission to B.Tech depends on the All India Rank of the candidates in JEE Main. Merit-based admission depends on the candidates’ performance in their qualifying examination. For merit-based admission, the university will conduct counseling in the month of July. Candidates shall be informed prior and they will be allowed a choice of a maximum of three programs. The minimum eligibility for B.Tech is 10+2 with Mathematics and Physics as compulsory subjects. Therefore, it is not clear whether a candidate with 70% in class 12th can get admission to JUIT Solan B.Tech program.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in Jaypee University for MSc?
faqs.answer: For admission to MSc at Jaypee University of Information Technology , candidates must visit the official website of the University . Admission to the two-year PG-level course is based on candidates' performance in the counselling round, conducted by the University. college_info.college_name: JIS College of Engineering: Placements, Fees, Cutoff, Courses, Admissions 2025

highlights.summary:
JIS College of Engineering is an autonomous institute affiliated to MAKAUT established in 2000 and is located at Kalyani, West Bengal. JIS College of Engineering is recognised by the UGC and the approvals & accreditations of the college are – The All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), The National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF), The National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC), The National Board of Accreditation (NBA), The QS STARS, The West Bengal State Council of Technical & Vocational Education and Skill Development (WBSCTVESD). JIS College provides undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programmes and offers total 26 courses which includes BTech, BCA, BBA, MTech, MCA, MBA. The college has departments like Engineering, Science and Humanities, Business Administration and Computer Application. Below are the majir highlights of JIS College of Engineering:
JEE MAIN/ WBJEE/ CEE-AMPAI/ GATE/ PGET/ MAT

college_info.college_name: JIS College of Engineering Fees 2026
JIS College of Engineering Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: About great campus life and supportive faculty, with decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are decent, especially for CSE and IT branches. Many companies like TCS, Wipro, Cognizant, and Tech Mahindra visit the campus. Average package ranges from 3 LPA to 4 LPA, with some students getting higher offers through off-campus drives. Placement cell is supportive but can bring more core companies for non-CS branches.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is modern and well-maintained. Labs and classrooms are well-equipped. Wi-Fi is available across the campus. Hostel is clean and safe with good food. The Wi-Fi speed and room maintenance can be improved. Library is large and helpful during exams.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are knowledgeable and approachable. They help students with projects and research work. The curriculum follows MAKAUT guidelines and is updated with industry trends. Exams are fair, and internal assessments help maintain good grades if you study regularly.
detailed_review.Other: College has good connectivity from Kalyani station, and the green campus makes it peaceful. There are also scholarship facilities for meritorious and economically weak students.

reviews.course: BBA in Digital Marketing
reviews.review_title: The brightest future.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently pursuing, but our previous year's batch also got 70 to 80% placed. The highest package is 6-7 LPA, the medium is 3-4 LPA, and the lowest is 2-2.5 LPA. Top recruiters are TCS, Wipro, and Infosys. Internship is 60-70%. Top roles are social media executive, SEO analyst, etc. There are brighter professions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and a library. Here, we have maintained a well-facilitated environment. The hostel food is average good, hygiene is maintained, and medical facilities, sports, and games are fine. The overall hostel is very nice and peaceful. This provides a non-ragging campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: They provide notes. Teachers are qualified and knowledgeable. This course curriculum is good, and obviously, this course makes students industry-ready, goal-oriented, and focused on a brighter future. Semester exams are not too difficult. Our pass percentage is only 40%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest, and I also want to build an entrepreneurial career with this course. I think our course is more than practical, so increasing the practical lab facility is a necessary part to improve.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: I am dissatisfied with my college due to the language barrier.

detailed_review.Placements: At least 10% of students are placed at this college. The highest package is 4.5 LPA in this course. Top recruiting companies are Capgemini and TCS. 5% of students get internships. Top roles offered are web developer and cyber security, but the highest package is very low, like 4.5 LPA is so low.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are very low, no Wi-Fi on the college campus, and they have tiny rooms. They have a library, but the food quality is very low. They have a mess hall or canteen, but the food quality is very low. They have a big ground for sports. They participate in sports or tournaments, and they also have medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are so good and helpful. The quality of teaching is good. They mainly teach in Bengali, and they don't know Hindi, they only know 2 languages, Bengali or English. This course is good, and the semester exam is of a normal average. It makes students ready for the industry with this course.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I wanted to go into the sector. This course is like a shortcut, and they can make a course in four years. Colleges do events, and they call big celebrities like Sonu Sood.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Technology
reviews.review_title: Supportive environment with active campus life and solid placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students got placed in my course. The highest package is 10 LPA, the average package is 5 LPA, and the lowest package is 2.5 LPA. In my course, the top recruiting companies are TCS, Capgemini, etc. 60% of students secured internships from this course at IBM, TCS, Infosys, etc. The top roles in this course are software developer, data analyst, and technical support.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are smart-class enabled, with projectors and good seating. It has NG arrangements also. Wi-Fi is available across campus, though like most colleges, sometimes the speed can dip. Hostel facilities are fairly comfortable. Rooms are decent-and are usually shared. They come with the basics: a bed, study tables, and proper ventilation. Hostel food is average; it's not home-style cooking, but it's hygienic and filling. Many students rely on the canteen when they want variety. There is a medical room on campus with a doctor available at certain hours. Sports and extracurricular activities are encouraged. The college has grounds for cricket, football, and volleyball.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and approachable. They are qualified, many with M.Tech or Ph.D., and have good subject knowledge. The teaching quality is good and supportive if you take the initiative. The curriculum is AICTE-approved and covers core computer subjects. The college does arrange workshops, hackathons, and industry talks. Semester exams are not too difficult if you attend classes and study regularly.
detailed_review.Other: The course content is highly relevant, covering all the important computer science subjects along with newer technologies. What I liked best is that the course gives you both theoretical knowledge and chances to practice it, which is important in CST. Some subjects still feel too theory-oriented and could be updated with more industry-level case studies. The teaching quality is good overall, but if every professor included more hands-on coding sessions, it would make the learning process more engaging. The college organizes both technical and cultural fests. The crowd is friendly and supportive; you will find people from different states, and it's easy to make connections.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Excellent campus life, average academics, affordable fees, but outdated teaching methods.

detailed_review.Placements: At JIS Kalyani, most of the students got placed from the CSE department but ECE and mechanical department students also got placed at top companies. Companies like Accenture, Wipro, TCS, Capgemini, L&T, and many more non-multinational companies. Internship is totally dependent on student's skill and way of approach.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: JIS is the first college of JIS Group so the infrastructure is good and well. College architecture is also good regarding the stars lift, stationary shop, and student counseling office. Hostel is also good. But there are many more messes near college so options are available. Food is a bit good in the canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: I am not much familiar with other department faculty members. But in my department, teachers are friendly and make a secure touch with the students regarding the course, notes, modules, and many other queries. Semester exam pattern is set by the MAKAUT board but the college is autonomous.
detailed_review.Other: College is pretty cool for people who want more space, and enjoy the greenery. Connectivity is also well established because the college is not very far from the railway station.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: I'm dissatisfied with my college infrastructure. The college has good facilities and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 20% of students from my batch have been placed. The highest package is 5 LPA in a college campus, or the average is 2.5 LPA. The top recruiting companies are TCS, Capgemini, and Wipro. 10% of students got an internship from a company like Amazon. Top roles are offered for software engineers, data analysts, and cybersecurity jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College campuses have Wi-Fi for their use, not for students. They provide Wi-Fi for their own. They have computer labs, smart classrooms, and a library. They provide books to students. Professors of my batch are friendly and helpful. They teach us in a very good way. In the hostel, they provide 3 meals for students they give breakfast, lunch, dinner, and evening snacks with one glass of milk at night. But the quality of food is very low, like we just eat for surviving, they have a gym and sports room for playing, and a medical facility also.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is average. The course curriculum is relevant. If students study, it makes them ready for the industry. The average difficulty is that almost 80% students pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because my sister did the same course. I want to study computer languages, that's why I chose this course. In this course, they can change the management subjects in it. In college, they do events, teach fest, college fest, and scholarships.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, supportive faculty, moderate placements, and average hostel food.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60% of students in my course were placed. Lowest package offered was 1.98 LPA, and highest package was 4 LPA. Major recruiters included TCS, Wipro, and Cognizant, mostly through off-campus drives. No internships were provided through the college. The most common role offered was Data Analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Infrastructure is impressive, with well-equipped classrooms and modern labs that enhance the learning experience. Hostel facilities are good, providing a comfortable stay, though the food quality is average.
Faculty members are knowledgeable and supportive. Curriculum is relevant, and the exam structure is manageable, allowing students to balance academics and skill development.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are helpful, approachable, and have good subject knowledge. They explain concepts clearly and provide guidance beyond the syllabus when needed. Curriculum is relevant and aligns with current industry requirements, helping students become job-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult, but with proper preparation, most students are able to pass comfortably. Overall pass percentage is quite high, reflecting the supportive academic environment.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: I know myself because of our faculty and what I want to do in my life. Thank you.

detailed_review.Placements: This is a good college for placements because they have a good placement cell department and provide you with good resources to get a good job and placement in any company. They also provide us with a lot of top service-based companies, like TCS, Wipro, Cognizant, Infosys, and so on. In my BCA department, more than 60% of students get placement, with multiple jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college classrooms are good, and the lab classes are also good. I don't know about the hostel because I used to delay traveling.
detailed_review.Faculty: The department provides us with lots of tips and extra classes for exams, even making us industry-ready. There are great teachers in our college. Some intelligent teachers provide good suggestions in the 1st year to last year on how to skill up yourself in front of a recruiter.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Great campus life, strong placements, and practical learning experience.

detailed_review.Placements: In B.Tech computer science and engineering course, around 92% of eligible students were successfully placed during the most recent campus recruitment season. The highest package offered reached 45 LPA (by an international tech company), while the lowest package stood at approximately 4.5 LPA. The average package for the course was 12.3 LPA, indicating a strong industry demand for CSE graduates. Top recruiting companies included Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Adobe, Atlassian, Oracle, Deloitte, TCS Digital, Capgemini, Infosys, and others. Several product-based and fintech startups like CRED, Zomato, and Grow also participated in the placement drive.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Computer science and engineering department was well-equipped with modern Wi-Fi-enabled classrooms, advanced computer labs, and dedicated AI/ML and cybersecurity labs with high-performance systems. Smart boards, projectors, and audio systems were available in most classrooms for interactive learning. The central library was fully digitized and stocked with thousands of technical books, research journals, and access to online databases like IEEE, Springer, and JSTOR. Campus offered 24X7 Wi-Fi connectivity, even in hostels. Hostels were spacious and secure, with dual or single occupancy rooms, study desks, and common areas.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members were experienced, approachable, and ensured conceptual clarity. Teaching involved real-world examples, live projects, and interactive sessions. The course was aligned with industry demands like AI, ML, and cloud computing, ensuring students were well-prepared for placements. They conducted assignments, internal tests, and labs to enhance learning. Exams were moderately challenging with a balanced mixture of theory and application-based questions. With proper preparation, most students perform well. The average pass percentage ranges from 85% to 90%, and toppers score above 9 CGPA. Continuous assessment, supportive mentors, and peer learning make the academic environment motivating and career-focused.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for tech interest. Best parts were practical learning, good faculty members, and placements. It needed more projects and soft skills. Fests, crowd, clubs, and scholarships make campus life vibrant.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements of batch 2021-2025.

detailed_review.Placements: According to the placement year of 2024, a total of 89% students were placed in good companies, including MNCs. If I discuss the lowest package, it was 3-4 LPA, and the highest was 12-14 LPA. Companies that visit the college are JUSPAY, TCS, Capgemini, Cognizant, Accenture, HCL, SAP H/4 Hana, DeltaX, etc. Mainly, students used to complete their internships in the 2nd or 3rd year of the course and get hired as SDE, Product associate manager, etc., in the companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities for the hostel are just awesome, students can live with comfort.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very helpful, for sure, and they help if you get stuck in any topic or part of the respective subjects. Even if you want extra classes for a better understanding, you will be provided by the respective teachers. They are well qualified and also knowledgeable. The curriculum of the course makes it very relevant and makes the student industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the B.Tech course as it is in huge demand, so that became a strong point to choose B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering. Course should be more core informative to the updated environment and technologies developed till now. It also includes events, fests like in our college, there is an event that is held every year, e.g, Majistic 2k25, which happened this year, and not only this, there are many clubs and extracurricular activities in the college that make a student more active and participating.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: JISCE CSE - supportive teachers, solid curriculum, and decent placements with scope for self-growth.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in CSE at JIS College of Engineering are solid for students with good technical and soft skills. While mass recruiters dominate. There are opportunities for better packages if you focus on coding, projects, and internships. College provides a decent platform, but individual effort makes the real difference.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel life at JIS College of Engineering is safe, decent, and comfortable for students, especially for those from outside Kalyani. While food and Wi-Fi could be improved, the security, study environment, and proximity to campus make it a good choice for students focused on academics and placements.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members at JISCE CSE are supportive and academically sound, with a decent balance of experience and enthusiasm. The curriculum is structured and industry-relevant. But students need to put in extra effort for upskilling and staying current with fast-changing technologies.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Decent placements, but your success depends on you.

detailed_review.Placements: Hi, from a CSE student here at JIS College in Kalyani. Our placement scene is pretty solid. You can expect around an 85-90 percent placement rate mostly with big IT companies like TCS, Cognizant and Wipro. The average salary package is a decent start typically between 4.5 LPA and 5.5 LPA. While a few top coders manage to bag high offers around 14 LPA that requires serious personal effort. Most of us start as software engineers. Honesty, the college gets you the opportunities, it's up to you to build your skills and crack them.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: As a CSE student at JIS, I would say our facilities get the job done. The labs are pretty good and our library is well-stocked. It's where everyone is heading now that classes are over for the day. Wi-Fi can be a bit unreliable outside of those spots, though. Life after class is what you would expect, hostel rooms are basic and the mess food gets repetitive fast, which is why the canteen is always busy.
detailed_review.Faculty: Honestly, the academics here are what you make of them. Most of our teachers are qualified and knowledgeable, but the teaching quality is a mixed bag. Some are fantastic while others just stick to the slides. They are helpful if you approach them, though. The curriculum follows the standard MAKAUT syllabus, so it covers the fundamentals well but it's not always up to date. You definitely have to learn new technologies on your own to be truly industry ready. Semester exams aren't too difficult, if you study the notes and previous year's questions, you will be fine. The pass percentage is pretty high, probably over 90 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE for jobs. Best part is the labs where coding feels real. Wish the curriculum were less theoretical and more modern with topics like AI/cloud. It follows the old university syllabus, so self-study is a must for getting industry-ready. Campus life is fun, our fests are the highlight. The crowd is cool, you will find your people. Kalyani is quiet but well-connected by train. There are scholarships and student-run clubs for coding, photography, etc., which is how most of us unwind after class.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Reliable placements, great infrastructure, and supportive faculty at JIS college.

detailed_review.Placements: 86% of students secured jobs through campus drives. The highest package offered is 12 LPA, the lowest package offered is 2 LPA approximately, and the average package offered is 4.5 LPA. Top recruiters are TCS, Cognizant, Capgemini, IBM, Wipro, Amazon, HCL, Deloitte, Emphasis, and MNC startups. 60% of students received internships at three Companies, TCS iON, Internshala partners, and LinkedIn-source startups are recruiters. Top roles are software developer, web developer, Data Analyst, QA Tester, and technical support engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Lecture halls and smart Classrooms are there. 80+ ICT-enabled rooms with projectors and smart boards. 72 specialized labs, Electronics, Mechanical, Language, CAD, STAAD, etc. Central library with 88,000+ books, 121 print journals, RFID system, e-resources (IEEE, NDL, NPTEL). Hostel facility for both Boys & Girls. Hostels have a total of 700+ beds; 24/7 security, power backup, Wi-Fi, indoor games, and a canteen. Mess & Canteen are not Hygienic, and the menu can be repetitive; night canteen available. Playground, table tennis, carrom, chess, and festival grounds are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most faculty hold M.Tech/Ph.D. many with industry or research experience. Mentorship is accessible through regular guest lectures and industry workshops. Outcome-based curriculum aligned with AICTE/NBA includes Industry 4.0 labs, IoT, AI, robotics modules, Flipped-classroom pedagogy, and Google Classroom integration. Semester exams are moderately difficult, with an emphasis on application-based questions. Final year pass percentage across departments ranges from 94 to 100% (CSE 99.2%, IT 98.4%, EE/CE/BME 100%).

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biomedical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college campus and placements are very good. I would recommend this college who are interested.

detailed_review.Placements: 98 percent of students got placed. The highest package is 8 LPA; the average is 5 LPA and the lowest is 3 LPA. I love this college for everything. The campus placements are very good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are good and Wi-Fi in the college is also very good. The labs, classrooms and library are very nice. Wi-Fi connection is good enough for reading. The food is also very good and clean.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very good and well organized.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: A little bit satisfied with this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Average number of students got placed. Not everyone is getting equal exposure due to some circumstances. Highest package is 16 LPA, lowest package is 2 LPA, average package is 3.6 LPA. TCS, Cognizant, Accenture, Wipro, and many more companies are recruiting. Software Developer and System Engineer are the roles offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All are average, not as good as tier 1 colleges. Wi-Fi is kind of good, and lab facilities are also well maintained. I don't know about hostel food, but canteen and sports are pretty good. You will get a ground where students use to play cricket, football, volleyball, etc. Apart from this, indoor games facilities are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and well qualified, but not for the specified courses. Course is relevant, but not for today's AI era. Semester exams are easy to crack, just study 1 week before the exams. Students used to study for 7 days for exam and clear it very easily.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course just to explore B.Tech course. Course material, AI, and Machine Learning should be prioritised. Events, fests, all things are mid-level, not so great as IIT, NIT, but pretty good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is one of the best in Kolkata.

detailed_review.Placements: Percentage of students placed was 92%. Highest package was 27 LPA (on campus) and 47 LPA (Off campus), lowest package was 2.4 LPA, average package was 5-6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Wipro, Infosys, etc. Percent of students who got an internship is 20%,  I think. Top role offered in my course is Software Developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are good in my department. Wi-Fi is available. Labs are well-equipped. Some labs have AC. Some classroom is A.C. classroom. Library is good and has a good number of books. Hostel is good. Mess and canteen are also good. Medical facility is good, and sports facilities are also among the best.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty of my department is good and very helpful to us. Every time solve our problems. They are qualified and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is good. Course curriculum is relevant for us. It makes students industry-ready. Semester exams in this college are a little bit easier. Pass percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: I love to develop software, so I chose the course. Best things about my course are that we can go to other technologies. Here, I think there should be an internship opportunity. This improvement is needed. Events and fests are held regularly by every department. Campus crowd is Good. Connectivity is good. Extracurricular activities are done regularly.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: Overall, it is an average college. The faculty needs to be upgraded.

detailed_review.Placements: Above 70% of students get placed. The maximum package offered is 10 LPA, and the average package ranges from 2-3 LPA. The top recruiting companies for our course are Tata and Amazon. 20% of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is very bad internet. The hostel food is also very bad. Hostel cleaning is also not good. Warden is also not responsible for the discipline. There is a shortage of equipment in college. Sports condition is very bad.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: It has good infrastructure and good faculty, but the placement rate is average.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are average. About 65-70% of students get placed. The average package is 2.8 LPA. Top companies like BT, Wipro, and TCS visit our college to hire students. The placement cell helps students to prepare well. This college is average for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has good infrastructure with well-equipped labs, smart classrooms, a modern library, Wi-Fi campus, sports facilities, and an average hostel. The environment is student-friendly and supports both academic and extracurricular activities effectively.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college has experienced and helpful faculty members who explain concepts clearly and support students. The exam system is well-organised with regular class tests, mid-terms, and finals that follow a clear and fair pattern, helping students prepare effectively.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, good campus with placement, reading environment, and library, with canteen and good culture

detailed_review.Placements: They provide you internships with PPO here. There are startup and service-based companies. Most you have to grow according, also product-based, some with hackathons. Lots of effort is needed; you will definitely grow if you work hard. All good according to me, so you can visit.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I didn’t stay in the hostel, but some of my friends live there. They said good quality of food, room, and water are provided by the college. Wi-Fi is also there. Good classrooms with AC, filtered water, clean canteen, library with a variety of books, labs with computers, and different kinds of departments.
detailed_review.Faculty: Good but not the best. All teachers are good, with good behavior and teaching as well. They provide good support. Overall, I have gained a good experience. You must visit the campus. The semester exam is not very tough, you can clear it early if you have good knowledge of CS subjects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A balanced journey through engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement at my college is quite average. The highest package is 10 LPA and the lowest is 4 LPA. The top recruiting companies are TCS, Capgemini, Wipro, JSW, etc. Top roles offered are software developer, web developer, data analyst, test engineer, etc. Some students also did virtual internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is available in our college including Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and library. Hostel facilities are also good, but the food quality is average. The menu is rotated weekly, and hygiene is maintained. Carrom and badminton are available in the common room of the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and cooperative with the students. They are very friendly with the students. The qualifications of the teachers are at a higher level. The semester examination questions are tough; students must study well. The passing marks are 33 in the written exam.
detailed_review.Other: I have to pursue my education in Computer Science and Engineering, some more faculty members are needed. Every year, 2 fests are organised by the college: a cultural fest and a tech fest.

college_info.college_name: JIS College of Engineering Admission 2025: Application, Eligibility, Process, Dates

faqs.question: How can I join JIS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: To join JIS College of Engineering, students are first required to fulfil the course-wise admission criteria as prescribed by the college. Those fulfiling the criteria can visit the official website of the college and apply for the course of choice online. At the time of application, students must provide a valid score of the accepted entrance exam (WBJEE/ GATE/ JEE Main, etc.). MAKAUT releases the list of shortlisted students for counselling. Selected candidates must participate in the counselling process for seat allotment. To confirm the admission, students must pay the admission fee and go through document verification.

faqs.question: What is the weightage of each section of JEMAT exam?
faqs.answer: JEMAT exam has three sections - English, Mathematics, and Logical Reasoning. Each section carries different marks. The English and Mathematics section with 20 marks, Logical Reasoning section has 10 marks.

faqs.question: How many rounds of WBJEE Counselling 2025?
faqs.answer: WBJEE Counselling 2025 was conducted in two rounds, namely Round 1 and Round 2, followed by the Defence quota counselling.

faqs.question: What is JEE Mains 2026 exam date session 2?
faqs.answer: JEE Main is conducted in two sessions each year, with session 2 usually held in April. For the current cycle, NTA had announced the JEE Main Session 2 exam dates, and the exams for Paper 1 (BTech) were conducted on April 2, 3, 4, 7, and 8. The registration for session 2 is now closed. Now, prospective candidates should wait for the announcement of JEE Mains dates for the academic batch of 2026.

faqs.question: What all BTech specialisations does JIS College of Engineering offer?
faqs.answer: JIS College of Engineering offers BTech course across multiple specialisations. The eligibility requires students to pass Class 12 with relevant subjects from a recognised board. Check out the list below to know about some of the popular BTech specialisations offered at JISCE :

faqs.question: Does JIS College of Engineering accept JEE for BTech?
faqs.answer: Yes, JIS College of Engineering accepts Joint Entrance Examination for Bachelor of Technology admission. In addition to Joint Entrance Examination, students can also qualify for admission with a valid score in WB-JEE or CEE AMPAI exams. To be eligible for admission, students must secure 45 percent in 10+2 in Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. The merit list is prepared by MAKAUT for admission to the Bachelor of Technology program.

faqs.question: Does JIS College of Engineering offer lateral entry for BTech?
faqs.answer: Yes, JIS College of Engineering offers lateral entry for its BTech programme. The college accepts students through WBJEE JELET. The state governement conducts the exam to provide eligible candidates admission into the second year (third semester) of Bachelor's Degree courses in Engineering/Technology/Pharmacy in the government and private colleges of West Bengal. Interested students can visit the official website of the college to apply for the programme by providing the required documents.

faqs.question: What is the fee structure for B.Tech Mechanical Engineering at JIS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: The fee structure for B. Tech in Mechanical Engineering is 4.7 Lacs for 4 years of the course period. This will include all the expenses of the college except exam fees and hostel fees. This will include bus services, library services, uniforms, and a welcome kit.

faqs.question: Can I pursue BCA from JIS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can pursue BCA programme from JIS College of Engineering provided you fulfil the admission criteria stated by the college. The college accepts students for the course based on entrance exam scores. JISCE provides the BCA programme through its Department of Computer Applications. Students who have passed Class 12 with relevant subjects from a recognised board and have a valid CET score may apply for the course.

faqs.question: What all M.Tech courses does JISCE offer?
faqs.answer: JIS College of Engineering provides four M.Tech specialisations. The seat intake for each specialisations is 18. Students fulfiling the admission criteria can apply for the programme by visiting the official website of the college. faqs.question: Is BTech available at JIS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Yes, JIS College of Engineering offers a full-time Bachelor of Technology (BTech) programme in various specialisations/streams. The duration of the UG-level course is four years. Some BTech specialisations available at the college include Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc. The university also provides BTech (Lateral Entry) courses in these specialisations. Admission to BTech courses at the university is primarily entrance-based. For more information, interested candidates are advised to visit the university's official website.

faqs.question: What is best course at JIS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: In JISCE every course is best in their domain but as far as the innovation, research and holistic studies are concerned ECE (Electronics and Communication Engineering) is the best engineering course. CSE and CST are also equally best as the demand is very high for these course.

placement_faqs.question: How are MBA placements at JIS College of Engineering?
placement_faqs.answer: Decent placements are provided to students at JIS College of Engineering. After 3rd-semester students become eligible for the placement and several companies like Bandhan Bank, Axis Bank, Primal Finance, etc. visit the college for hiring. Almost 80% of the students get placed. The average package provided was INR 400000/year. So many companies are visited such as Flipkart, TCS, Justdial, and IBM.

placement_faqs.question: What is the placement rate for M.Tech course at JIS College of Engineering?
placement_faqs.answer: The latest information of JIS College of Engineering M.Tech placement rate is not yet available. According to JIS College of Engineering NIRF report 2023, the placement rate recorded during JIS College of Engineering M.Tech placements in 2022 was 86%. placement_faqs.question: Does JIS College of Engineering offer better placements than other Amity University?
placement_faqs.answer: JIS College of Engineering Placements: JIS College of Engineering has a good placement record, with almost 85-90% of students getting placed every year. According to the JIS College of Engineering NIRF report 2023, the placement rate recorded during JIS College of Engineering M.Tech placements 2022 was 86%. The highest package offered at JIS College of Engineering is 12 LPA (lakhs per annum). Some of the top recruiters that visited the campus in the past include TCS, Cognizant, Capgemini, IBM, Wipro, Amazon, HCL, Deloitte, Mphasis, Pinnacle Infotech, Youngman, Axis Bank, Ayant Software, Bandhan Bank, Chegg India, Dabur, Nestle, Pantaloon, Tech Mahindra, Ultratech Cements, Zensar Technology, and many more. The average package offered is around 3-5 LPA. Amity University Placements: The highest package offered during Amity University Noida placements 2023 stood at INR 61.75 LPA. Some of the top recruiters that participate in the Amity University placements include IBM, EY, Microsoft, Yamaha, TCS, Accenture, Amazon, Genpact, Cognizant, and Dell. During the placement drive of 2021,  51 Global Fortune companies and 41 best IT companies and 6 consulting companies participated in the placement drive, whereas 26 new recruiters also participated. The highest CTC stood at INR 21.5 LPA, and the average CTC stood at INR 5 LPA.

college_info.college_name: JSS Noida: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: JSS Academy of Technical Education, JSS Mahavidyapeetha, Noida, also known as JSS Noida, was established in 1998 in Noida, Uttar Pradesh. It is a private institute approved by AICTE and NBA. The institute offers Degree and Diploma programmes in Full Time mode. It offers a total of 36 courses in 13 specializations including Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering and Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning. Some of the courses offered at JSS Noida include B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM, MCA and B.Pharma. The fee for these courses ranges between INR 1,00,200 and 2,90,970. The total seat intake for the available courses is 1434. JSS Noida offers courses across multiple streams such as Engineering, IT & Software, Business & Management Studies and Medicine & Health Sciences. The average median salary offered at JSS Academy of Technical Education, JSS Mahavidyapeetha, Noida is around INR 4,50,000. The institute offers all the necessary facilities to the students.

college_info_program.intro: JSS Academy of Technical Education offers a variety of courses at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. The academy offers these courses in the streams of Engineering, Computer Applications, and Management. The popular programmes at JSS Noida include BTech and MTech, among others.
