college_info.college_name: JSS Noida Fees 2026
JSS Noida Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure with a green campus and decent hostels, supportive faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed is average. The highest package offered in CSE core is 45 to 50 LPA and the lowest package offered is 4 to 8 LPA. Top recruiting companies like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, IBM, HCL, Tech Mahindra, Samsung, and Amazon. The internship ratio is 100 percent but it depends on students skills and interests.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are like a green campus and decent hostel including Wi-Fi, a classroom with projectors and a library. The quality of hostel food is moderate not too bad contains four meals and hostels also have medical support 24/7, including outdoor and indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are too helpful and knowledgeable and supportive teaching is also well and good. The course curriculum is relevant and students are ready for industrial and corporate jobs and other upcoming opportunities. Semester exams are a little bit difficult and you have to score 21 out of 70 in the semester exam to pass the exam.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Hoping for a better placement rate in JSS, good infrastructure, and focus on skills.

detailed_review.Placements: I recently enrolled in this college, and as I have heard before, 2022, its placement was so good, even in 2020, the highest package was 60 LPA at Google. But as of now, the placement condition is too bad. Big companies are not coming to recruit, the average is only 4 LPA-6 LPA. But I am hoping that in the Next 3-4 years, the placement ratio will improve, and even big companies can also recruit.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: For infrastructure, I would say neither is too good like IIT, NIT, IIMs infra, nor too bad like other tier-2 colleges. Hostel infrastructure is better both for boys and girls. Even though the capacity is low and the buildings are old, it is a better place for B.Tech students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is good, some coaches are from the Bengaluru campus. Curriculum is outdated, as it is according to the AKTU affiliation. There is no proper coding subject for CSE students in the 1st year due to AKTU. If I talk about exams, it reverts to AKTU as if I talk about mine, my first semester exams were postponed 2-3 times.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the AIML course as I have an interest in it, and also, currently, it is the best course according to my current tech background. I wish to be more focused on skill-based subjects than the old academic curriculum, as there should be more Java, Python, DSA subjects, and workshops. But the crowd and campus life are not so good as there are very few fests, events, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering(Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Harsh reality of JSSATE Noida.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 20 to 30 percent of students are placed. As of now, the highest package is around 15 LPA and the lowest around 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Accenture, Wipro, Deloitte, etc. There is no exact information about how many got internships from the course, but I guess very few, around 5 to 6, will be able to get paid internships, otherwise, most of them got unpaid internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are not well equipped like a typical government college. Hostels are decent; you will get both AC and non-AC rooms. Mess food is very bad, but I prefer the college hostel at least in the first year. This college is not for you if you love sports and games, no proper facilities are there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is same as all other colleges. First-year college faculty is a little serious, but from the second year, it's very chill. It's AKTU affiliated, so the curriculum is outdated. Semester exams are not difficult, but again, it's AKTU, you can never be sure about your performance. Even if you attempt all the questions, you might get the subject back, so it’s very common in all AKTU-affiliated colleges, and it happens very often.
detailed_review.Other: My course is CSEDS of 2028 batch. Currently in the second year of college. I chose this course because I want to pursue my career in the IT field. Zealicon is our 3-day cultural fest. It’s decent; sometimes they call artists from outside, sometimes not. AKTU scholarship is there if you are eligible.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because of the faculty, good placement and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement record in college is 87 percent of students gets placed in 2024-25. The highest package is 48 LPA and lowest package is 4 LPA, and the median package is 6 LPA-8 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Infosys and Wipro. Top roles offered by companies are data development and software development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is overall good. The labs are well. The library has AC, with good environment for studying. The hostel facility is okay. The bathrooms are not well furnished and mostly have construction issues. The food quality is okay, like other mess. The hygiene is properly maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well-educated and helpful. For placement, you have to study on your own. The semester exams are okay. The checking depends on which teacher is checking your answer sheet. They have to add some CSE-related subject in very 1st semester.
detailed_review.Other: Only one cultural fest happens here, that is Zelicon a 3-day function.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good if you can work hard, it can bring you a good amount of opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are average, not very good, but you can get enough opportunities if you can skill up yourself. According to the college placement cell, the recent batch has the highest package offer, which is 21 LPA, and the average package is approximately 6.5 LPA, which is quite average. But you can get opportunities to grab.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are above average. The infrastructure for CSE depth of 1st year is not good since there are no AC in classrooms, but some labs are air-conditioned. Wi-Fi speed is average, not up to the mark. The hostel is good, and the mess food is edible till now. The library is top class with good infrastructure, fully air-conditioned, and a wide range of books and newspapers are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Since college is under AKTU, the curriculum is very old and outdated, and also the end semester exams are also conducted by the AKTU, so the exam centres are allocated other than your college, and the schedule is very bad, and for exam results you have to wait till the middle of the next sem.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Ample facilities but infrastructure from inside is much desired.

detailed_review.Placements: I joined this college in September 2023. I came to know one student who managed to get a 53 LPA placement on campus from the IT branch, and there was a board with a list of 15 students from different branches who got above 15 LPA jobs. The other average goes for 4 LPA-6 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: From outside, it looks good, but inside, classes are a little shabby, and roads are well paved, with an abundance of parking spaces. You also get Wi-Fi for all students, great library access, and well-built labs. There are hostels with AC and without AC. The choice is yours and also depends on availability.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are knowledgeable and help a lot when students have doubts. Most of the content they teach is relevant and acts as the basis of the fields you are interested in. Semester exams are very tough. As a result, they follow 30 internal and 70 external marks criteria for theory exams and 50-50 for practicals. You need to score 21/70 to pass and in internals 19/30 and in total, your score must be 40/100 to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in cybersecurity and cloud-related fields. However, the syllabus in IT and CSE are like 70% same, so you won't get branch-related subjects much later in college duration. Tons of events take place that you can be part of, be it sports, hackathon, or volunteering for crew members.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, facilities, teachers, and everything.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% students are placed, with the highest package being 18 LPA and the lowest 5 LPA. TCS, Tech Mahindra, and big startups come for recruitment. They have the best TPO and good placement offers. Top roles are software engineer, software trainee, software tester, and associate.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Very good facilities of Wi-Fi, library, classrooms, and labs are available. There are the best hostels ever, with bigger rooms, Wi-Fi connection, and good food. They have 3 shared rooms and a single room, and have AC and non-AC rooms. They provide vegetarian food and snacks. They have a water cooler and a filter also.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are Ph.D. qualified and the best. They teach well. The course curriculum is the best, as it helps the students to be ready for the industry. There are 4 semesters of exams conducted by the university, and there are some internal exams and practical exams also.
detailed_review.Other: A technical course is best for software engineer jobs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A complete review of my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are good. The average package offered in CS allied branches ranges from 7-8 LPA with a good atmosphere for coding and competitive exams. Many good-level companies visit our campus to hire students. The placement cell is very supportive of its students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is what makes it stand above the rest. It has top-notch hostel facilities and good and spacious classrooms. The infrastructure stands at the top of the list. In our hostels, we have both AC hostel (ISH) and non-AC hostel (BH). Both the hostels have quality rooms.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are supportive and regular in terms of education and extracurricular activities. Exams are held every month (internals) and semester exams are conducted every 3 months. The exam atmosphere and competition are good for personal development and overall growth.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has a great infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: About 85% of the students got placed. The highest package is about 18 LPA, and the lowest is around 1.5 LPA. Students often opt for off-campus placements rather than on-campus. You have to do internships on your own. The college does not provide any internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: On campus, hostels are available, including both air-conditioned and non-air-conditioned options. Veg foods are served in the mess, while non-veg foods are not on the menu. Sports facilities are also available on campus, providing great opportunities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college teachers are very helpful and supportive. They are well-qualified and experienced. As this college is affiliated with AKTU, semester exams are conducted accordingly. Overall, the college experience is very good, with a green campus and good facilities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Average college with a good location advantage.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm currently enrolled in B.Tech computer science and engineering and my year of passing out is 2027. The placements of JSS average out around 5 LPA to 6 LPA with the highest on-campus package being 18 LPA. The placement percentage is around 64%. If you are hoping for MAANG then you would have to go for off-campus placements only as they wouldn't visit the college. It's an overall average college with a great location advantage when compared to other AKTU colleges of the NCR region.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms do not have ACs or even smart boards. Teachers are using old-style blackboards The labs are fine and you can get Wi-Fi access for your laptop. The hostels are good with all the facilities, the mess food is also eatable and on some days, it could be great too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are somewhat helpful and qualified but as they have to follow the AKTU curriculum the relevancy of the syllabus is not much. The semester exams are moderate to pass. The students need to work on themselves to be industry-ready as the college won't help them to get any internships.
detailed_review.Other: The college hosts a three day techno cultural fests.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of JSS Academy of Technical Education.

detailed_review.Placements: If you want a good placement then you have to score above 7.5 CGPA in all semesters. The highest salary is 60 LPA. The lowest salary is 6 LPA. The average salary is 15 LPA to 18 LPA. Recruiting companies are TCS, Infosys, Mahindra Tech, Microsoft, IBM, etc. At least you have to score above 7.5 CGPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a separate building for every course or department. Every department has its own library, labs, Wi-Fi, halls, and many classrooms. Hostel is good because you have a choice of rooms. You can choose a deluxe hostel room or a simple hostel room. But the food is average. There are many sports. You can play in your hostel as well as in college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, understanding, and knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is the best. They made you perfect for your industry because they mainly focus on your skills and practicals. The internals are quite average but the end-semester exams are hard because of AKTU.
detailed_review.Other: I chose mechanical engineering because of your business of manufacturing and they say the best things. I want to improve their attendance system.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharma.)
reviews.review_title: College is very good and no disappointments.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% of students got placed. The average package for B. Pharma which is bachelor of pharmacy is 8 LPA, and students get jobs in many big companies like Niaper, Sunpharma, and Cipla. After completion of 3rd year, students get internship proposals from the companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are very nice infrastructure in the college and good libraries are present where we get the articles to read nice books for pharmacy are provided. Sports events are done per year. The food canteen is very good with good hostel facilities and good mess food.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of JSS University, College of Pharmacy is very impressive and helpful they help you till the end. They are very supportive and they provide good practical knowledge to the students. Now masters in pharmacy is also introduced by the university.
detailed_review.Other: Very nice money and campus area.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is overall good if you are a brilliant, but not for below-average students

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students placed, an average package of 6 LPA and the lowest package of 3 LPA. Accenture, HCL, Cadence, Appleute, Infosys, TCS, Blinkit, Wipro, Cisco, etc. 30% of students got internships. Software engineer and web developer. Over 25 official societies and clubs offer students avenues to explore their interests.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything was good, but classrooms are not fully equipped as AC is not provided by the college. The library is good, and there is a motivating environment for study. Sports and canteen facilities are available, but medical facilities are not. The campus is Wi-Fi enabled, and there is an auditorium and transport services available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Pass percentage is above 85%. There is no difficulty during exam times. The exams are challenging but manageable. Even the semester exams were difficult because they were conducted very rapidly. With a good strategy, time management, and consistency, you can easily crack the exams with high grades.
detailed_review.Other: Various society events are amazing.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: JSS’s honest truth with all its upsides and downsides, so don’t miss it.

detailed_review.Placements: Honestly, if students are willing to put in their energy and hard work, they’ll find their way to the companies they want to work with. Talking about placement statistics, the average package is around 5-6 lacs per annum, but it really depends on your hard work, and the highest can go up to 40 lacs per annum or more. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Accenture, Wipro, etc. Don’t hope for Google, Microsoft, etc. These are big giants and don’t visit my college. Top roles include product manager, DevOps, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms aren’t air-conditioned and are really suffocating in the summer. But the library is fully air-conditioned and Wi-Fi is okay. The girls’ hostel is really good; it has both AC and non-AC rooms, the food is good and hygienic, and there are sports facilities. The labs have AC and are well-equipped.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really supportive and well-qualified at least most of them and the teaching quality is very good. Talking about the curriculum, it’s more than relevant. Students are prepared for the industry through various projects and programs conducted in the college. Semester exams are well-managed and conducted by AKTU, but they are held in another college, ABES, not in our own. The percentage of passing students is also really good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I had no other option, but looking at the brighter side, my course is really worth it. The best thing about my course is that it’s mostly tech-based and helps in developing problem-solving skills. I just wish it could be more practical, with industrial visits and all. There is only one fest hosted every year called Zealicon, and that’s it. The fest is not very exciting because it’s a tech fest.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: JSS, Noida is still relevant in 2025.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement rate is about 60%-80% overall but it is higher in CSE CSE-related branches. The highest package is about 17.5 LPA and the median package is about 4 LPA-4.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies are ION, Wipro, and HCL. Internships are offered starting from 2nd year provided you have the caliber to lift an intern.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel food is below average and quality degrades in night food. Hostel life is good, with sufficient campus area for any sports. There are school-like classrooms with no AC and coolers, classes become bad in the summers, and decent infrastructure still needs improvement.
detailed_review.Faculty: Course curriculum is outdated for the initial years and you have to study on your own, it is better for university students but for AKTU students no relevant subjects are taught. Semester exams need at least 2-3 weeks of preparation and are moderate to tough in category but everyone passes at the end.
detailed_review.Other: College is value for money and good at its current rank near 80,000 to 1,00,000. One main annual techno-cultural fest named Zealicon is there and the rest of society events are conducted in college life.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Decent college with good crowd and average placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 30 students got placed in IT companies, and at least 10–15 students are placed in core VLSI and embedded service-based companies. Core companies include ZIA Semiconductors, Emerson, etc., while IT companies include HCL, Josh Technologies, and Accenture. The average package is around 3.5 to 4.5 LPA. The roles include Simulation Engineer and PCB Testing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college campus is around 28 acres with 5 academic blocks, 1 canteen, and a multipurpose hall. There is 1 air-conditioned and Wi-Fi-enabled library, with an ample number of books. There are 2 hostels for boys and girls each. Some classrooms are air-conditioned, but all have Wi-Fi. Labs are quite average. We have one ATM and an amenity center near Gate no-2. Sports facilities like basketball, volleyball, cricket, badminton, table tennis, and chess are available. The hostels are of two types -regular and ISH. Regulars have triple-sharing rooms with good infrastructure but no AC, average mess food, and table tennis, while ISH are costly and have AC and decent food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are not well-qualified in my department. They are unable to deliver knowledge except for some of them. They only focus on assignments and attendance. The courses are outdated, except for some labs like MATLAB, Cadence, and Virtuoso, and a few subjects that are relevant according to the industry.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to do M.Tech after GATE in VLSI, which will be in high demand in the near future. Subjects could be added according to the needs of market and more hands-on experience. Various events are organized like JPL, Zonal for sports, and workshops on robotics, Arduino, etc. The annual fest named Zealicom is conducted for 3 days in May. There is good connectivity by metro and auto, and the campus is surrounded by tech park. Scholarship is provided by UP government.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: All you have to know about JSS, Noida.

detailed_review.Placements: Talking about my branch, i.e., electrical engineering, there are placements In this college, there are all branches but very few. However, they are trying to improve. Companies like Wipro, Genpact, and Infoedge such companies come for placement drives. The packages are low, with the highest package of 10 LPA and the lowest, around 3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: However, campus is good, clean, and green with all the facilities available for students from labs, workshops, multipurpose hall, and a big library with AC and Wi-Fi available. Hostel is also pretty well with both AC and non-AC rooms, with food, and is not very expensive, though the food provided is not good. The campus is good and beautiful.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members teach with all effectiveness and devotion. There are labs conducted with all well-qualified facilities. Sessional and assignments are taken very seriously and strictly. There are many faculty members available for all the branches.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great facilities, wonderful infrastructure, professional teachers, and 95% placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Percentage of students placed is 92%. The highest package offered is 45 LPA, offered by Google. The lowest package offered is 4 LPA, and the average package offered is 11.5 LPA. The percentage of students who got internships is 85%. Roles offered are software development engineer (SDE), data analyst, DevOps engineer, cloud engineer, product manager, business analyst, and AI/ML engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is excellent, all the facilities we are getting from here. Food in the mess is average, like normal but at least very clean. There are great medical facilities and nice sanitation.
detailed_review.Faculty: The professors here are very nice, professional, and highly qualified. Course curriculum is relevant, and they make students ready for industry. The semester exams have a standard exam paper that is neither too easy also not too hard. We have to score at least 75% in exams to get pass.
detailed_review.Other: I want to become a software engineer, so it was the best place to do so. My course teaches me to love engineering. Maybe we have extra classes to get more flourished. Every Wednesday, we have extra-curricular classes to enhance confidence and more than just studies.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Poor infrastructure with low placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Top recruiting companies for our course are Deloitte, Cadence, and EY. Most students got internships after the 6 semester. The highest package is 8 LPA, the lowest package is 3 LPA, and the average package is 4 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The quality of the facility in the hostel is very poor and the quality of the food is also very poor. Medical facilities are quite good, but game facilities are zero. The facility and the infrastructure are very outdated, and poor Wi-Fi is present on all floors of the college but not accessible but labs are very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is also very good. Course curriculum is not relevant, it also doesn't make the student industry-ready. The semester exams are easy and can be passed by studying a week before the exam.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Poor sports facility with no exposure.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 50% of students got placed from the course. The highest package is 8 LPA and the lowest package is 2 LPA. I was offered a package of 3 LPA. Most students got internships from the course after the 6th semester.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very old and updated. Wi-Fi is present on the campus but not accessible. Labs are highly equipped with updated equipment, and library is fully stocked. The quality of the food available in the mess is very poor, and the canteen is also very poor. Medical facilities are quite good and sports and game facilities are again very poor.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable, except for one or two teachers. The teaching quality is also very good. Course curriculum is not relevant. The curriculum is very old and updated it does not make the student industry-ready.

admission.title: JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text:
JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida admissions 2025 are entrance-based. The institute offers a variety of courses ranging from UG and PG levels, such as BTech, MTech, MBA, and MCA.

JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida is affiliated to Dr APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University, Uttar Pradesh, Lucknow. It accepts scores of certain entrance exams. These include JEE, CUET, etc. Interested candidates can apply online or offline as per their preference.

faqs.question: Is it worth joining JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida?
faqs.answer: JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida offers various courses in multiple specialisations. Candidates have a variety of fields to choose from. Though, it’s important to consider other factors like infrastructure, faculty, curriculum, fees structure, etc. while taking admission. Candidates can visit the campus or check alumni/student reviews.

faqs.question: Are JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida admission open?
faqs.answer: JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida are not open and candidates can apply for admission in the next academic year. Fulfilling the eligibility criteria is mandatory to take admission in the academy. Admissions to the academy are entrance-based and scores of various entrance exams such as CUET PG, JEE Mains, GATE, etc. are accepted for admission.

faqs.question: Are JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida admissions entrance-based?
faqs.answer: Yes, JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida admissions are entrance-based. Candidates must appear for the entrance exams accepted by the academy such as- JEE Mains, CUET, etc. Candidates must also fulfil the eligibility criteria before applying for admission in the academy.

faqs.question: Can I get into JSS Noida with 70% in class 12 via JEE Main?
faqs.answer: Yes, with 70% in JEE Main, you can get into JSS Noida. Candidates must score 70% or more marks in the aggregate of the best of five subjects, including Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, and have a JEE Main 2024 Rank (Paper – 1) to be eligible for admission to JSS Noida. Additionally, there are relaxations in minimum marks requirements for different categories like OBC-NCL, SC, ST, differently-abled persons, and defense candidates.

faqs.question: Am I eligible for admission in JSS Noida with 80% in Class 12?
faqs.answer: Yes, you are eligilble for admission in JSS Noida with 80% in Class 12. Candidates must submit the marksheet and certificate of Class 12 to apply for and confirm admission in the academy. Additionally, they must also fulfil the eligibility criteria befire applying for admission.

faqs.question: How can I get selected for MBA at JSS Noida?
faqs.answer: Candidates are selected for MBA course at JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida on the basis of the CUET PG exam. Candidates must appear for this exam and achieve a valid aggregate in the same. They must also submit the scorecard for the same and appear for the couselling process.

faqs.question: Can I get into JSS Noida with 70000 rank in JEE Main?
faqs.answer: Surely, candidates can get admission for the BTech courses at JSS Noida with 70k rank. The JSS Noida JEE Main cutoff 2024 stood between 71817 and 466364 for the General AI category candidates. With 70k , it is possible to get any BTech course available at JSS Noida.

faqs.question: What is the fees of studying M.Tech at JSS Noida?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fees of studying M.Tech at JSS Noida is INR 1.3 lakh. However, the overall fee includes other components like exam fees, security deposits, hostel fees, etc. Candidates must pay the tuition fee for confirming admission in the academy once they are selected.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for B.Tech at JSS Academy of Technical Education Noida?
faqs.answer: The admission for B.Tech in JSS Academy of Technical Education Noida has the following procedures. The candidate should have appeared for an entrance exam, JEE Main/ UPCET which is conducted annually for admission into JSS. Then he has to get a valid score and participate in UPTAC counseling for seat allotment before the rank, category, and branch preference (e.g. - 180 seats under Computer Science). Eligibility in this context means there should be at least 45% marks through valid 10+2 in Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry (40% in case of reserved categories). However, there is also an option for direct admission through management quota depending on availability and higher fee structure.

faqs.question: What all courses are offered by JSS Academy of Technical Education Noida?
faqs.answer: JSS Academy of Technical Education Noida, enjoys the privilege of a large variety of courses offered. Undergraduates are offered BTech in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics and Communication, Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, and AI & ML. Postgraduate programs include MTech in Manufacturing Systems, MCA, and MBA. Aspiring researchers may also consider PhD programs offered. These fields cover universities in engineering, IT, management, and pharmaceutical sciences, which means they have various career prospects. Although offered by the institute, the courses relating to AKTU guarantee that a cohesive curriculum is attached to the different disciplines making it a diverse and flexible center of education.

faqs.question: Can I participate in JoSAA counselling if I don't have 75% marks in class 12?
faqs.answer: It is mandatory to have minimum 75% marks (65% for reserved category) in class 12 to take admission in IITs, NITs, IIITs and GFTIs. Students should apply for JoSAA conselling only if they fulfill all conditions of eligibility. However many institutes admit students on basis of JEE Main where there is no requirement of minimum marks in class 12.

faqs.question: Should I join BTech at JSS Noida?
faqs.answer: Joining JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida for BTech course is generally considered a decent option. Candidates must consider factors like infrastructure, faculty experience, hostel and mess facilities, curriculum, etc. while taking admission. They can apply online or offline for admission at JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida.

faqs.answer: The seat intake for BTech course at JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida is 750. Candidates must pay the tuition fees after getting selected for admission to confirm and secure their seat in the academy. There are also certain seat reservation policies in the academy that candidates can check before applying for admission.

faqs.answer: The applicant needs to have received at least 45% in the Science stream on their 10+2 test. Following their JEE Main success, candidates must apply for and take part in the Dr. A.P.J. faqs.answer: The duration of MBA course at JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida is of two years. Admissions to this course are based on the entrance scores of the CUET PG exam. Candidates must achieve a valid aggregate in the exam and submit the scorecard for the same. Interested candidates can apply on the official website of the academy.

faqs.answer: Yes, a candidate can apply for admission in MBA course at JSS Academy of Technical Education, Noida if graduation result is pending. When evaluated against the ranking of the past years, it has been noticed that in the 'Engineering' category, the institute's ranks have shown stability in trend. In 2025, JSS Noida's rank is #201 , the same as last year's rank in the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF ranking. Explore the most recent rankings from other ranking bodies and their respective categories below. JSS Noida secured #201-300 rank in the 'Engineering' category of NIRF 2025 rankings. Its status is comparable to top institutions such as Aditya University and Ajeenkya DY Patil University. Check out how JSS Noida compares to other top-ranked universities year by year. college_info.college_name: JSS Science and Technology University: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Rankings

highlights.summary:
JSS Science and Technology University is a private university located in Mysuru, Karnataka, well known for its Science and Engineering courses. JSS STU has national and international collaborations with institutes such as Southern Illinois University Edwardsville - USA, JSS Aher - Mysuru, Tata Consultancy Services Ltd., Jeonbuk National University – Jeonbuk, Republic of Korea, etc.
JSS STU offers BTech, MSc, BCA, and MBA in various specialisations. The University also has a training and placement cell that brings top companies to the campus. The University has topnotch infrastructure with a central library, an examination cell, a bank, separate hostels for both boys and girls, a cafeteria, a sports club, a medical and yoga centre, seminar halls, auditoriums, etc. There are more than 20 departments with well-qualified faculty.
Find below the major highlights of JSS Science and Technology University, Mysore:
JSS Science and Technology University Highlights 2025
28 National and 6 International
For more information about JSS Science and Technology University check out the below video:

college_info_program.intro:
JSS Science and Technology University is popular for its Engineering and Science courses such as BTech and MBA. BTech students are placed in top companies. Also, the course is approved by the AICTE and the Government of Karnataka. BTech specialisations include Civil Engineering, Computer Science and Engineering, Biotechnology, Environmental Engineering, etc.
JSS Science and Technology University Mysore MBA is offered for a duration of two years in full-time mode. MBA students can become Management Consultant, Investment Bankers, or can enter fields such as Marketing, Healthcare, Human Resources, and others. JSS Science and Technology University MBA is taught by well-qualified and experienced faculty members.

JSS Science and Technology University Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great placement, average infrastructure, and a peaceful campus.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rates of our college are pretty great, 80 to 90 percent of students got placed last year. This year the highest package offered is 40LPA. Among IT related Branch CSE, AIML, ISE, CSBS, the average package offered is around 13 to 14 LPA, and the median package is above 12LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure and facilities provided by our college are below average. The main CSE building, Golden Jubilee Bhavan, and the admin block are great, but the rest of the buildings are pretty average. For freshers, they conduct classes in the Polymer Science building, whose classrooms are pretty bad. They really need to improve it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members of our college are very friendly and interactive with students and are always ready to address our doubts. All professors are highly skilled, and almost all of them have degrees. We have a total of 3 exams, including 2 Internals and one Semester end exam, so the curriculum is so hill.
detailed_review.Other: If you want pace and greenery, this is the best engineering college you can get from COMEDK / KCET.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of JSS Science and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: I am not in my final year, so I cannot talk about my placements, but the placements of my seniors are going on right now, and 210 students have been placed and about 190 companies have visited. Although this number will grow because the placement season is still going on. The median package you can expect from this college if you are in the CSE branch is about 8 LPA but if you work a little hard, then you can get 13 LPA to 20 LPA, it all depends on you.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is Wi-Fi, a library, big playgrounds, multiple canteens, labs, and the area of the whole campus is 104 acres. There is a lot of greenery as well, so I would say the infrastructure is good. There is a gym that is free, and there is a big cricket ground, a football ground, and a basketball court. There are a lot of places where you can hang out with your friends, and the classrooms have projectors.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is nice, cooperative, and well-educated. The curriculum is the same as that of any other college and unchanged from the old one. The teachers do tend to say some important things in Kannada otherwise, the whole lecture is in English. There are multiple clubs in which you can participate. There is one thing that I don't like about this college, and that is its strictness regarding attendance. You don't get a lot of days off here, but this is a subjective flaw.
detailed_review.Other: There is a shortage of hostel rooms inside the campus, so there is an outside campus hostel called the Shivratri hostel, and even after that, some students don't get a room there, also showing they have to live in PG outside campus. This only happens in 1st year because all the students of 2nd year and higher get a hostel room. Since they have increased the intake this year, this is happening. If you take admission early, you don't have to worry about any of this.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Good to go. Need to concentrate more on placements than the attendance and just the book knowledge.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a student of batch 2024-2025. In my batch, the placement numbers are decent. Out of 120 students, around 35 students got placed, where the average package is 5-6 LPA and the lowest package is 3 LPA. Top recruiters include TCS, Infosys, and others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is above average. Each class had projectors and all labs had fast internet connection. Coming to the hostel, I'll rate it 3.5. The food is sometimes good and sometimes bad. Gymnasium is good. Importance is given to sports and physical education.
detailed_review.Faculty: Lecturers are friendly and knowledgeable. Many are pursuing Ph.D. and teaching quality is good. Some part of the course curriculum need to be changed, apart from that, the curriculum will make students industry ready. The difficulty level of the exams is medium, but the exams and evaluation process are very strict.
detailed_review.Other: After completing my Bachelors, I chose this course to gain more knowledge about my field and secure a good and high-paying job. One thing, there will be only a major project during the last semester, no theory subjects, so it kind of became lengthy and boring, like not going to college and attending the classes, just do the project and get it reviewed whenever the guide will call us.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: One of the best colleges in Mysore, if you are willing to do MCA.

detailed_review.Placements: According to my knowledge, in our MCA batch, around 80-85% of students were placed through campus placements. The highest package offered was around 12.4 LPA, while the lowest was 3.5 LPA, and the average package stayed around 5-6 LPA. Top recruiting companies included TCS, Infosys, Wipro, LTIMindtree, Accenture, Capgemini, Cognizant, and Bosch. Nearly 60% of the students also got internships in companies like TCS, Infosys, startups, and analytics-based organizations, mostly in roles like software development, web development, and testing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: SJCE provides a very good infrastructure for MCA students. Our department had Wi-Fi-enabled labs, updated computer systems, spacious classrooms, a digital library, and access to the main library with thousands of books and journals. Hostel facilities were decent with clean rooms, study areas, indoor games, and 24/7 security. The mess food was manageable, and the canteen options were better with snacks and meals available throughout the day. The campus also has sports grounds, a health center, gyms, and plenty of greenery, which makes student life comfortable.
detailed_review.Faculty:
The faculty members in the MCA department were very supportive, highly qualified, and explained concepts clearly. Most teachers were approachable and helped with projects, coding doubts, and placements.
The curriculum is updated and relevant to industry needs, especially with subjects in programming, databases, machine learning, web tech, and project development.
Semester exams were of moderate difficulty, and as long as students attended classes and prepared regularly, passing was not very hard. The pass percentage was consistently good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose MCA at SJCE because of its strong reputation, experienced faculty, and placement record. The best part of the course was the hands-on labs, coding-based learning, and helpful teachers. I wish there were more industry-driven workshops, but overall, the learning experience was great. The campus environment, greenery, events, and student community made my time here memorable. It is a very student-friendly college with plenty of extracurricular opportunities.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Business System
reviews.review_title: JSS Science and Technology Mysuru review and 2026 placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements of this college are decent. The average package you can expect in this college is around 10 to 11 LPA, and the median is around 9 to 9.5 LPA. The overall placement percentage is around 80 percent, including all branches. Around 90 percent of students in CSE-related branches are placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this college is good. Since this is an old established college, the infrastructure is outdated compared to other colleges through CET or COMEDK. It is an old-styled college. But the hostel facilities are very good, as the hostels are newly built.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course and curriculum are outstanding, and the professors and teaching faculty members are well-qualified, knowledgeable, and outstanding. The teaching quality is also very good. It makes the students industry-ready, and almost all students get placed at the end.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is lush green and beautiful, and you get full campus Wi-Fi coverage.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college for engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college placements are pretty fine, with more than 60 percent of students getting placed in their final year. A huge number of companies come for recruitment and offer a good package for students. The minimum package offered is 3 LPA, and the maximum package offered is 55 LPA. TCS is the major recruiter.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is excellent here, and the students have a good environment for studying. A good number of playgrounds are present for sports. I am not a hosteller, so I do not have a good idea about hostels, but its good. Wi-Fi is accessible throughout the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: I am doing mechanical engineering, which I am doing with passion. The management curriculum is excellent, providing an industrial exposure and experience. The exams are easy to score if you concentrate well enough. The lecturers are well qualified and experienced.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Well-maintained campus and a smart, ready campus for engineers.

detailed_review.Placements: 85% of eligible students are placed in our course. Among them, 56 LPA is the highest package, 7-8 LPA is the average, and 4-5 LPA is the lowest. About 90 percent of students got the opportunity for internships at Cisco, Bosch, etc. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Infosys, Snider Electric, Bosch, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure, green and clean smart campus, Wi-Fi available. Good and large library with digitalised and modern computers. A large and silent reference hall for studying. Hostel rooms are large and spacious with 24-hour electricity and water supply, and food in the mess is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well qualified, with most of them having completed their PhD, some with M.Tech and a few assistant professors and are well knowledgeable. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes one industry-ready. The semester and the exams are not so tough, and almost all the students have passed and been promoted.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am really satisfied with my college.

detailed_review.Placements: The college placement of the total number of students at a place was about 70%. The company that recruits the highest number of students is TCS. Internship offers were made by Lams Industries and Quest Global. Many other students who have gone for paid internships have been absorbed in the same companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I also live in a hostel that is inside the college, and the food provided is okay, kind of average and the rooms are pretty clean. The Wi-Fi provided here is pretty fast, and there is also a garden, and playgrounds are provided for students to play. And all the labs are well-equipped with new equipment and study materials.
detailed_review.Faculty: In terms of education, our colleges are pretty good. The marks structure is excellent when it comes to the paper evaluation, and the examination will go according to the plan. Teachers are very supportive, and they're ready to give their 100% to the students. Providing excellent resources and things that are helpful for the future. Teachers are very interactive as well as practical and theoretical, giving us better explanations through the demonstration of prototypes.
detailed_review.Other: My course is mechanical engineering, and why I chose is because one of the best colleges in my city and as well as they provide a good practical and theoretical knowledge and having the best college clubs that are completing around all over India. The improvement would be that the study's structure could be even better when it comes to like student subjects and management according to the time period. College fest is excellent in our college, the book international artists so that it can get more student interest and advertisement. They have separate club activities for each department.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's a good college in Mysore for engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: My college has good placements in Mysore, and around 60 to 70% of the students get placed every year. Decent packages are offered for all students, ranging from 4.5 to around 55 LPA. Many good companies visit the campus for recruitment, and I am really satisfied with the placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college is spread over in one or two acres, which is a massive area for our infrastructure. The new buildings have amazing throat. This year, it is one of the best campuses in Mysore with all types of facilities, including well-equipped libraries, playground and labs with the latest equipment.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the faculty members in our department are well-trained to teach the students, and also have experience. They also provide personal attention to the students who are lagging behind in the syllabus. The exams held here are in a very strict manner, and the course is pretty good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best college for engineering in Mysuru with modern, huge and green campus.

detailed_review.Placements: As of now, when I asked seniors who are currently in 4th year, half of them are already placed who are eligible, with the highest package of around 30 LPA. According to seniors, if you are eligible, the college would help its best for students to get placed with proper training and practice.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good with all basic facilities and services available like Wi-Fi enabled campus, digital library, sport grounds, gym, prayer hall with greenery and cleanliness maintained all around campus. Hostel is good at the price they offer with decent food, as everyone’s taste differs.
detailed_review.Faculty: As a fresher I don't have much experience of semester exams, but internals and lab marks depend on the faculty, and almost every faculty is highly qualified and they give maximum marks, but still few strict teachers give very less. Attendance is 85 percent from college side. It lacks only in digital, like it doesn't have its own app, but it’s not a big problem.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of JSS Science and Technology University, Mysore.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements of this college are good. The average package of this college is around 10 to 11 LPA, and the median package of this college is around 9 LPA. If you are in CSE-related branches, you can expect around 11 to 12 LPA. The major recruiting companies are JustPay, Wipro and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel and college infrastructure are good, but the building is now outdated because it is an old-established college. This college was established around the 1970s. The campus is well-maintained, and it's a lush green campus, and you get full campus Wi-Fi coverage.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are all very helpful and well-qualified. They always make themselves available to address your problems. Most of them are PhD holders and are well-knowledgeable. The teaching quality is also good. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. Most of the students pass the semester exams.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is lush green, and the college organises a fest called Jaicyana.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you are on the right path, the college helps you a lot by giving many opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently in the Information Science and Engineering branch. So far, I see that both Computer Science and Information Science are almost similar in subjects, as informed by seniors. Regarding placements, if a student works hard and improves skills, they can definitely get placed here, as many companies visit our college. The highest package is 52 LPA, and the average is 10 LPA. The placement rate on the website is more than 90% in our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities in our campus are good. The only problem is that there are no charging ports in classroom benches. Labs and libraries are well-equipped. We have three types of libraries in our college. First is the normal library, where we can find many books. Second is the digital library, where we can access soft copies of books. Third is the reference library, where we can also find books.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in college are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They guide well and are always available to help students. Except for a few teachers, the remaining are all good. The 1st-year curriculum is not very useful because all subjects are from class 12, and in further years, they are not actually useful. In the 1st year, all branch subjects are included. Obviously, all colleges are like this, and one needs to think that one year will be spent here.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the Information Science and Engineering branch. I am actually interested in computers, so I chose to join Information Science and Engineering. There are many clubs to join as part of extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Business System
reviews.review_title: JSS Science and Technology University, Mysuru 2026 placement. SJCE placements review.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement of this college is good. Around 80 to 90 percent of students secure placement. Around 10 LPA is the average and 9 LPA is the median package of this college. If you are in a CSE-related branch, the average is around 11 LPA to 13 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for this college is good, but this college was established in 1970, so the infrastructure is outdated. The condition of the hostel for both boys and girls is good. The campus is full of lush greenery, and the crowd is also good, and the campus is surrounded by Wi-Fi.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helping in nature. Most of the teachers are helpful. All the teachers are well qualified and knowledgeable, and most of the teachers are PhD holders. The course curriculum is relevant and makes the students industry-ready. Overall it's good.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is lush green, and the college organizes a fest called Jayciana.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best college in our city.

detailed_review.Placements: There is a dedicated placement and training department in our college which takes care of our placements. The placement for students starts in the 5th semester, and many reputed companies come to our college for recruitment. More than 65 percent of the final-year students get placed every year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has facilitated two hostels for students, our hostel has good facilities and Wi-Fi. The course here is academically excellent, providing good technical domain knowledge to students. Our college has the best infrastructure in the city, it has several playgrounds, labs with the latest instruments etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of our department are very friendly and helpful, they assist us in all matters. The exams here are held in a very strict manner, and students are to adhere to strict rules, else the students will be fined and punished if they are proven guilty.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A good college with a lot of potential.

detailed_review.Placements: The median placement for the 2025 batch is above 10 LPA. The highest is 56 LPA. Most students who are placed receive offers after their internships. The percentage of students placed is more than 25%. Even companies like Google and Microsoft recruit from this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for the Computer Science and ISE departments is good. The college lacks a good auditorium and swimming pool, but overall the campus gives a kind of NIT vibe. The classrooms in the CS department are good. The cricket and football grounds are great. There are many canteens on the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is good, better than most private colleges in Bangalore. The curriculum for CSE is outdated. If you want a good curriculum, then the best course is CSBS. I have still not given any semester-end exams, but the CIEs are easy. Overall, the first year is not hectic.
detailed_review.Other: In COMEDK, this college is fourth after the top three (RV, MSRIT, BMS). In terms of college life, it is the best among the top COMEDK colleges.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The learning environment is good, with supportive faculty members and growing opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate for the CSE branch is approximately 80–85 percent. Several reputed companies offer niche and specialized software development roles. For the 2025 batch, the highest package is 48 LPA. The average and median packages are 12-9 LPA, respectively. Overall, the seniors are satisfied with placements. They are polite and helpful.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are well-equipped, but the Wi-Fi connectivity could be improved. It is often buggy and has limited coverage. As some areas of the campus have poor mobile connectivity. Students are not provided with a college email ID. While the campus is not very tech-advanced, it is still better than most colleges in Karnataka. The library is decent. Hostel accommodation is very limited, and despite applying, we are not allotted any. The administration does not show much concern, so we have to find PG accommodations ourselves. Sports and games are enjoyable, the campus is spacious, and the canteens are good. I have no information about the hostel food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. Most hold PhDs. The teaching quality is good overall, with only a few exceptions. In my opinion, the CSBS curriculum is excellent, and unlike CSE, it does not include subjects like Chemistry and EGD. Had I known earlier, I would have chosen CSBS.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my strong interest in coding and computer science. Faculty members are knowledgeable, and our HOD is very supportive. There are many technical clubs, which make learning enjoyable. If the CSBS curriculum is implemented, it will be perfect. The campus is improving and now admits students through COMEDK, attracting a diverse and competitive crowd. Scholarships are not available for male general category students under COMEDK. There are plenty of extracurricular activities if you take the initiative. Mysore, being peaceful and academically focused, is a great place to study.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is not very lively, but it is very disciplined and strict with 85% attendance.

detailed_review.Placements: So far, placements are good. Every year, top companies such as Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Bosch, Accenture, Cisco, Deloitte, SAP Labs, and Mercedes-Benz visit the campus for recruitment. In recent years, the university has also attracted major product-based and core engineering firms like Robert Bosch, HP, IBM, and L&T, which offer competitive salary packages. The average package for engineering branches generally ranges between 5 LPA-6 LPA, while the highest package has crossed 40 LPA in some cases.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is outdated. The infrastructure in the college is much less compared to other private colleges. The quality of living in the hostel is poor, and the food quality is also very low, especially in the PS block, where the 1st student's class must be renovated, as in a few classes on the 2nd floor, water drops from the roof, for which the whole 1 bench remains empty. AC doesn't work in most of the labs.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty for 1st year is okay, not very outstanding, daily routine is hectic. Most of the faculty members are friendly, but a few faculty members are really strict, and if you are joining this college with the CSE branch, then please take graphic and design classes seriously in 1st year.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's the top college with a peaceful environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 94-100% of ISE students secure placements each year, with the highest placement being around 50 LPA, and the lowest is 25 LPA. 50% of students get an internship in companies. ISE students are frequently recruited by industry leaders, including Amazon, McKinsey, Deloitte, Intel, Bosch, and SAP.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is fine, the library, Wi-Fi, labs, and a classroom are available with good infrastructure. Everything is fine at JSS Science and Technology University. The campus has a good environment with clean classrooms, well-equipped computer labs, and high-speed Wi-Fi. The library is spacious and has a great collection of books. Hostel facilities are comfortable, and the food in the mess is hygienic. Sports and extracurricular facilities are also provided for overall student development. The infrastructure and management are well-maintained, making it a good place for learning.
detailed_review.Faculty: Helpful teachers. Very easy semester exam. The faculty members are very helpful, qualified, and experienced. They explain concepts clearly and are always ready to solve students' doubts. The curriculum of the Information Science and Engineering branch is updated regularly to match current industry requirements. It includes practical learning, coding, and project-based subjects that help students become job-ready. Semester exams are moderate and easy to pass if you study well. Overall, the teaching quality and guidance from the faculty are excellent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose it because it is most in demand. Improve in everything.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: SJCE and JSS STU placements 2026. The average package 10 LPA.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, placements are good. The highest package is 35-40 LPA. The average package is 8-10 LPA. The college has tie-ups with many top companies, including TCS, Infosys, Mathco, Juspay, Wipro, and Mercedes. The top roles from our college are software engineers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has many facilities that meet all our needs. Rooms are clean. There is a variety of food. They also have a ground for sports, a gym, and indoor games. Many events are conducted. Students are encouraged to participate. The canteen provides good food at affordable prices.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and knowledgeable. Most of them are PhD holders. The course curriculum is also good compared to other colleges. It prepares students to be industry-ready. The difficulty level of the semester exams is moderate. Most students pass the exams easily.
detailed_review.Other: The campus crowd is good, with students from a variety of different states. The placements and fests are also better compared to other colleges.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely good, things are going well, everything is fine.

detailed_review.Placements: Nice placements are going on. In my college, recently Mercedes-Benz company came to our college. Everything was going fine, totally good. Placements are good, the companies tied up are Cisco, TCS, MathCo, Juspay, Infosys, Mercedes, Wipro, etc. Good companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Not bad, the hostel fee was 78,000 per year. Everything was good, but the food hasn't been good recently. They provided Wi-Fi to us and a locker still, some things have to be provided on Sunday, they won't keep nice food, so we have to go out and we have to eat.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty was good, they are teaching everything well except for 1 to 2 subjects. But everything was good, it's ok, fine. The curriculum is also good. Exams will be conducted from November 24th. Well, we have to see how they will conduct exams and all.

highlights.summary:
K Ramakrishnan College of Engineering is ranked 75th by Times 2023 under the Engineering (Private) category, 78th by Times 2023 under the Engineering category, and 156 by India Today 2023 under the Engineering (Private) category. K Ramakrishnan College of Engineering is an autonomous institution that is affiliated with Anna University, Chennai. The college is approved by AICTE and is ISO-certified. The college is accredited by the NBA and with A Grade by NAAC. K Ramakrishnan College of Engineering, through various departments, offers UG, PG, PhD, and other courses to students. These courses are provided across the Engineering, Management, and various other streams. K Ramakrishnan College of Engineering offers BTech and MBA as flagship courses to students. A few of the highlights regarding K Ramakrishnan College of Engineering are mentioned in the table below:
